story:
Happy International Women's Day!

To celebrate you and all the other bad ass women out there, we're releasing a LIMITED EDITION Bogi's Garage T-Shirt for only $25 that you can only get here!

 

 

Welcome to the Chevy Montage! 

 

We need your help to get this truck on the road, and headed to one of the automotive industry’s leading shows, for its big reveal in November.

But this truck is not just a show vehicle. If you’ve ever been interested in how your car works, in how any of the technical details in car restoration work, if you’ve wondered how automotive specialists do what they do best… this is a project you want to support.

Together we will be rebuilding a vehicle, as unique as the women working on it, and making a series of instructional videos, sharing expertise and skills in the process.

Here, Montage refers to the mash-up of a vintage domestic truck, which will be installed with a modern engine. And it’s also about being built by women from all over the country, with experts to enthusiasts all working together to contribute to the build.

This build will have experts mentoring and guiding enthusiasts in a women-centred garage space. Throughout the year, these experts will be teaching workshops on topics such as welding, upholstery, pin-striping, metal working, detailing, and more. They’ll be answering questions, sharing their depth of knowledge, and co-creating an online archive of learning tools to encourage all enthusiasts from the armchair viewer to the technically-minded.

And it’s the first of its kind! Never before has such a collaborative space been launched, to welcome the open sharing of knowledge and technical expertise in a space that breaks down barriers. We can’t wait to get started, and we’re hoping you can help to expand the reach of this project, to inspire women across the globe to consider picking up a wrench, body hammer or paint gun.   

Goals:

*Celebrate and shine a light on the many women actively ‘rockin it’ in the automotive industry, and highlight all the opportunities for women that the industry offers.

*Create opportunities for women to try their hand at a large variety of the skill sets involved in a full vehicle build.

*Encourage more women to consider the trade as a hobby, or potentially as a career.

*Build a complete and running ‘57 Chevy Truck that is as unique as the women who worked on it.

*Attract both industry and mainstream attention in hopes of shining a positive light on the automotive industry which will help to attract new talent (both male and female) to an industry that is having a major labor shortage.  

*Document the build on YouTube to educate and inspire the next generation of technicians, body workers, painters, enthusiasts and more.

*Create a supportive community of women who are passionate about the automotive industry. Foster friendships, mentorships and collaboration that will create opportunities for these women to be successful in their lives and careers.

Join in with a donation, to be a part of a project which will celebrate and welcome all women - past, present and future - working within the automotive industry, alongside the Chevy Montage build.

story:
The Project (Pitch/Plea):

Help us make our first YouTube live-action series! (If you don't, who will?)

THE VOID: REBOOTED

6 half hour-ish episodes which re-boot (up the backside) a series we made for community television in 2012, when times were simpler. The show is a narrative "skit-com" style, filled to the Pacific Rim with geek-culture references (see? We even superfluously crammed one into that sentence!)

SERIES SYNOPSIS:

The Void is a “skit-com” about a small group of independent Australian filmmakers who, for the past 18 years, have been trapped by contract on a never-ending feature film production appropriately titled “The Void”. The reason the production never ends (and why they’ve so far only completed shooting 4% of it) is because their fascist, egomaniacal director, Gustaf, is constantly changing his concept for the film. The story and sometimes even the genre of each episode is determined by whatever new and insane idea has caught Gustaf’s fancy.

The world of The Void is also a flexible reality. Each episode contains tangential, self-contained skits that branch off from the main action, often incited by a line of dialogue or reference to whatever film or text is about to be parodied. 

Did we mention shooting starts in April?

What We Need & What You Get

We need an absolute minimum of $8000 to cover the costs of the shoot (only $40 a minute - WHAT!?). Anything we raise in addition to this will go towards paying our hard working, incredibly talented (and evidently brainwashed) cast and crew.  Funds raised will go towards:

  • Studio and location hire
  • Costumes
  • Props
  • Equipment
  • Make-up/ Prosthetics 
  • Accomodation at location shoots
  • Catering 
  • Catering!!
  • Catering!!!
  • Travel expenses

What You Get

  • Check out our PERKS section for a selection of terrible prizes.
 

"Sorry, who are you?" (We're still trying to work it out too)

Our TOON SANDWICH animated series is our first direct-to-YouTube project but we have also made live-action feature films and longer-form episodic content for TV.

Our feature films - THE KILLAGE (2012 horror/comedy) and AUSTRALIENS (2016 sci-fi/comedy) - were both made on a super-low, shoestring budget and have been released worldwide (The Killage on DVD and VOD in AUS/NZ/UK/Eire and Australiens on Blu-ray/DVD & VOD in US/AUS/NZ/UK/Eire and Japan). 

The Deep Impact

This project will shake the Earth to its core, and then a team of scientists will have to be sent to The Core in a gigantic metal dildo to reignite it. No, not really. But we do really hope it entertains people, and secondarily, we hope it helps our production company drag itself out of the bubbling quagmire of anonymity and into the verdant jungle of quasi-renown. To be honest, the Earth's core scenario has a higher chance of happening.
If you choose to support our campaign you will have our neverending thanks! You know the movie Neverending Story? Well imagine that, only with gratitude in place of giant tortoises and rock people. We absolutely hate asking for money, but... pleeeease won't you give us $ome money? 

Other Ways You Can Help

We really appreciate your help and support:

  • Share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Subscribe to our YouTube Channel - ArtSpear2010
  • Follow us on Twitter/Facebook/Instagram
  • Additional merchandise available at our shopify store - facebook.com/pg/ArtSpearEntertainment/shop

story:
The Project

The Shallow Valley TV Telethon is a short form comedic web series conceived by Owen Weir and Erica Giunta. The series follows a television station in the small, fictional town of Shallow Valley as they raise money to save their dying public television station. Shallow Valley is an “eclectic” town filled with weird and over the top characters who visit the station to provide demonstrations and participate in interviews. The SVTV Telethon 2017 is meant to be a hilarious satirical look into small town, local television news. We want to create an immersive and hysterical show that will make you laugh and smile!

What We Need & What You Get

This is where you come in!

We need your help getting the SVTV Telethon off the ground! With your help we can create this high concept show the way it is meant to be seen. If you donate, you will also be a part of the show! Every donor becomes a character in the show! The SVTV Telethon features a rolling ticker showing who has donated, to get your name on there all you need to do is donate to any of our tiers!

Your donations will go towards set design, costumes, props, equipment, transportation costs, and much more. Productions of this size become very expensive very quickly but with your help we can create an immersive and funny show without short changing any aspects due to budget limitations.

The Impact

We are a large group of 3rd Year Sheridan College Bachelor of Film and Television students with a long track record of successful productions and award winning films. Your donations will be going to proven filmmakers who can utilize a budget to its maximum potential.

Other Ways You Can Help                           

Thank you for looking at our page! If you’re unable to contribute at this time, please stay tuned for the final product. Like our Facebook page and check out shallowvalley.info to be kept in the know with the Shallow Valley TV Telethon 2017!

story:
Bound: The Series

Co-Written by Alex Hughes and Colin J Murphy

 

Featuring:

Jack Ball, Goldie Flavelle, Alex Hughes, Julia Schlaepfer, Rob Morean, Heather Oakley, Adam Rodriguez , Kari Seward, Jen Parkhill, Ben Rosenthal, Joe Murphy, Toni Marie Gallardo, Spencer Wawak, Olivia Blue, Andrea Abello, Cassidy Edwards, Sydni Beaudoin, Brian Swinney and Cynthia Silver 

 

Director of Photography: 

Peter Pascucci and Josh Herzog

Directed by:

Colin J Murphy

 

Premise:

Focusing on a Narcotics Enforcement Agency that works to target specific drug dealers and manufacturers, with the intent of reducing street level drug activity, the series follows Jacob Hart, an out gay agent. Dealing with the notion of what it means to take care of someone else, Jacob tries to find a balance in his feelings between allegiance to his job, a codependent friendship and a new man in his life. In a place where the "good guys" get to identify how someone defines themselves, Jacob tries to find out if it is even possible to be a hero.

A Letter from the Director

Bound came into being as a sort of accident. Over a year ago, a joke between friends became the kernel that began this entire project. A conversation about the lack of representation and variation in the action genre began the process of looking at what became available when something that seems so extreme was to be humanized. My father is a cop who has frequently had his life put at risk based on jobs he was working. We wanted to set out to tell the story about the complexities of life that often are negated in the pressure cooker that is an action movie. I wanted to tell the story of what it means to love someone who you may fear won't return from work every day. This began the exploration of how to create fully realized human beings in a heightened world of drug culture, physical danger and psychosis. 

The characters in Bound are messy and often unapologetically so. Alex and I have had many conversations about if any of them are "bad guys" and we continuously reach the same conclusion. Life is not as simple as an action movie. Everyone has their demons and everyone makes choices that may hurt those around them but they must validate these choices for themselves. We think to simply define anyone as just good or bad, you're ignoring the spectrum of human experience that is entirely in the gray area of behavior.

This has become such an important project for me and those involved because it is a story that asks how far love can be pushed before it fails, can someone cause so much destruction and still be a good person, and what does it mean to be a hero? We would love the opportunity to share this very personal and special series with you all and let you fall in love and out of love with these people just as we have!

Sincerely,

Colin J Murphy (Co-Writer/ Director)

 

What we need you for

The incredibly hard working artists that are a part of this project are so committed but it takes a village to create something as ambitious as this project. The money raised from this will go towards payment for:

  • Cast and Crew
  • Location Costs
  • Equipment
  • Transportation
  • Lodging, Food
  • Insurance
  • Festival submission costs

 

How else to help

If you cannot give right now that is perfectly okay! There are so many other ways to help spread the word about the project.

Follow us on:

Instagram @boundseries

Twitter @bound_series

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/boundseries/

or  Bound: The Series Official Website

and watch our first four episodes here!

story:
What are we doing?

  • The idea for "Hustle Street", the musical web series, was originally developed by Chrissy Mae Valentine and Rhyss Lee. Chrissy then took to the idea to personal friend and now, co-writer, Ian Escandor and the script developed beyond their original dreams, of just an idea, but to a short web series, with the intention to pitch the idea to several film production companies.
  • Chrissy Mae Valentine, Rhyss Lee and Ian Escandor, all of Filipino backgrounds, having grown up in Sydney's western suburbs, have a goal to challenge stereotypes surrounding the area and create a web series to promote the talent secretly hidden in Sydney's western suburb of Mount Druitt. 
  • It has always been one of Chrissy Mae’s aspirations to create a body of work that reflected her life growing up in Mount Druitt. With her extensive experience on the screen and on stage, it seemed evident that taking the approach of a musical would be the most viable way of  expression. Ian is also personally invested in the project. As a resident and youth worker of the area, Ian believes that a project like this has the opportunity to excite and engage other local Blacktown artists, tell a unique story in an original way, and challenge the artists involved to be experimental all whilst developing their screenwriting, song writing, production skills - thus boosting the cultural value of Blacktown.
    • The idea has been in the works since November 2016 and has expanded greatly. Hustle Street currently has a crew of over 17 and a cast greater than 30 people (including professional dancers and actors), all of which are unpaid. Hustle Street has the potential to become something bigger than a web series - a break away from the stigma of an area handed a bad name.

What we need from our donators and what we're giving back!

  • Because our team consists of young local artists and students, a lot of the current funds that have been getting us by have been as an input out of cast and crew's pockets ($2,400 generously input by some crew members). We are passionate about this project and see it, not as a way to make money, but as a means to create a positive vibe around Sydney's western suburbs and showcase the talent that can sometimes get overlooked in this area - therefore, the money, isn't what is important, although unfortunately, it is essential for us to continue to be able to go ahead and make this a bigger project with a greater production value behind it. We believe in this project, which is why we've tried to input as much of our money as possible, but we need help!

 

  • The most costly "items" have been obtaining filming licenses for public areas: 
    • Applying for permission is the easy part, but as each location has a fee, sometimes of $200-$300, and currently there are 10 areas (approximately $2,000 needed just for locations alone), where our team is looking to film, that requires this fee paid up front, this can prove challenging for a group of young people trying to make something that appears, on screen, to it's highest potential.
  • We have some actors (currently 2 in Melbourne and one in the United Kingdom), that are playing some lead roles in this web series. This proves difficult in terms of, not only writing together and rehearsing, but more so in obtaining assistance for payment of flights. Our pre-production team is trying to cover as much costs for our actors as possible, but your donations will help to not only assist us in paying our actors, even something small, but potentially housing them and help us to get them here, ahead of time and ready for filming!

 

  • Let's talk about equipment hire! Right now, we have been working with the equipment we have (mainly just cameras borrowed from friends and family), but for the most part, we need to consider hiring out equipment, which means, equipment fees:
    • Jib: $70 p/day
    • Cineslider motor kit: $100 p/day
    • Audio equipment (lapels, recorders, zooms, boom mics, XLR cables, Wind shield): All of these total to $160 p/day, and that's just one of each item. Realistically, we would need 2-3 each, bringing the total needed to at least $480 and that's just for one day of filming.

 

  • In terms of set design and costume, this is another area where your funds will help greatly! For a great production, we need better looking costume and set design than we currently have. Realistically, a goal of $1,000 just for set design and costume is our current goal as we will try to source as much as we can from our own homes/borrow from friends and family so that with the excess of what we save, we can input this into things like equipment hire and potential wages for talent. We are young students, so we're thrifty and we try to be as cost effective as possible,  which is great, but with any great production, the more funds we have to pay for better costume, makeup/hair artists, then the better a chance we have of making something that is a cut above the rest!

All donations will be used wisely. The most important areas for funds to go into will be everything mentioned above (mainly location fees first as these need to be up front before we can film). 

  • Because we believe that a team needs a uniform, we have created shirts for our cast and crew to wear on our filming days! Which brings us to our next point:
    • PERKS! We have been fortunate enough to work with a Graphic Designer who has developed a unique logo for us! Our designer has done a fantastic job at giving us our own individual look, which means:
    • When you donate $1000.00 or more, you will receive a customised Hustle Street t-shirt as a thank you! You will also receive an Executive producer mention in our credits, a live streaming of rehearsals, a Hustle street lanyard AND footage of our promo video we'll be filming on the 21st of July 2017, that nobody else will get to see until it's actual release date! 
    • When you donate $100 or more, you will receive a Hustle Street t-shirt and lanyard!
    • When you donate $50 or more, you will receive a Hustle Street lanyard and  personal thank you from our cast and crew
    • When you donate, anything, because anything helps, we will provide you with access to exclusive Behind The Scenes footage, separate to what is available on our social media platforms. Great right?!

The Impact

Why does this matter to us? Why should it matter to you?

To put this bluntly, we really give a damn about this project. Not just because we've been working on it for so long, not just because we have a team of over 8 writers currently working on ways to make the script better, not just because we like to sing and dance, but because Sydney's western suburbs have always been hit hard with hurtful, and most of the time, untrue and unfair labels. We're not going to name names, but films and documentaries made about this area have often depicted us all in a bad light and the fact of the matter is, a lot of it was created on stereotypes, because unfortunately, stereotypes sell. We're here to change stereotypes. More than half of our cast and crew grew up in Mount Druitt and we don't feel that it has hindered us in any way and we don't think it makes us less important than the next suburb.

There's a hugely gifted community in this area and it's time for everyone to see it.

 

Our personal challenges

This industry is not only difficult to make a dent in, but it is fickle. The hardest part for us has been finding people as committed to us because the fact of the matter is, we don't have the funds to really pay people so a lot of the work has come from a genuine desire to make something great. So our biggest challenge has been solidifying a team and trying to wrangle budgets for locations, equipment hire, costume, set design and air fares. We've been combating this by investing out of our own pockets, which has been working well, but as our project expands, this means we can't do it alone anymore.

This means we need your help. Hustle Street is currently in the works to creating a promo video for our audiences. We've managed to get all this way through team work, some serious commitment and lots of man-hours. We're keen to release this promo video so that we can prove our worth and start showing everyone where their funds will be going. Any donation helps, big or small, it doesn't matter, any helping hand is appreciated. 

 

Can't donate? Don't sweat it!

We understand that not everyone who wants to donate, can do this. And that is absolutely fine, because theres other ways you can help!

Share this page with anyone and everyone that will listen! Share it on your Facebook, your Instagram, your twitter, anything!

  • Follow us on instagram: @hustle.street
  • Follow us on Facebook: @HustleStreetTeam

Give us a like, a thumbs up and share this over and over because that helps us just as much as any dollar does. Thank you for taking time to read this. Keep an eye on us, we've got big plans!

The idea for "Hustle Street", the musical web series, was originally developed by Chrissy Mae Valentine and Rhyss Lee. Chrissy then took to the idea to personal friend and now, co-writer, Ian Escandor and the script developed beyond their original dreams, of just an idea, but to a short web series, with the intention to pitch the idea to several film production companies.
Chrissy Mae Valentine, Rhyss Lee and Ian Escandor, all of Filipino backgrounds, having grown up in Sydney's western suburbs, have a goal to challenge stereotypes surrounding the area and create a web series to promote the talent secretly hidden in Sydney's western suburb of Mount Druitt. 
It has always been one of Chrissy Mae’s aspirations to create a body of work that reflected her life growing up in Mount Druitt. With her extensive experience on the screen and on stage, it seemed evident that taking the approach of a musical would be the most viable way of  expression. Ian is also personally invested in the project. As a resident and youth worker of the area, Ian believes that a project like this has the opportunity to excite and engage other local Blacktown artists, tell a unique story in an original way, and challenge the artists involved to be experimental all whilst developing their screenwriting, song writing, production skills - thus boosting the cultural value of Blacktown.The idea has been in the works since November 2016 and has expanded greatly. Hustle Street currently has a crew of over 17 and a cast greater than 30 people (including professional dancers and actors), all of which are unpaid. Hustle Street has the potential to become something bigger than a web series - a break away from the stigma of an area handed a bad name.



What we need from our donators and what we're giving back!
Because our team consists of young local artists and students, a lot of the current funds that have been getting us by have been as an input out of cast and crew's pockets ($2,400 generously input by some crew members). We are passionate about this project and see it, not as a way to make money, but as a means to create a positive vibe around Sydney's western suburbs and showcase the talent that can sometimes get overlooked in this area - therefore, the money, isn't what is important, although unfortunately, it is essential for us to continue to be able to go ahead and make this a bigger project with a greater production value behind it. We believe in this project, which is why we've tried to input as much of our money as possible, but we need help!

 

The most costly "items" have been obtaining filming licenses for public areas: Applying for permission is the easy part, but as each location has a fee, sometimes of $200-$300, and currently there are 10 areas (approximately $2,000 needed just for locations alone), where our team is looking to film, that requires this fee paid up front, this can prove challenging for a group of young people trying to make something that appears, on screen, to it's highest potential.

We have some actors (currently 2 in Melbourne and one in the United Kingdom), that are playing some lead roles in this web series. This proves difficult in terms of, not only writing together and rehearsing, but more so in obtaining assistance for payment of flights. Our pre-production team is trying to cover as much costs for our actors as possible, but your donations will help to not only assist us in paying our actors, even something small, but potentially housing them and help us to get them here, ahead of time and ready for filming!

 
Let's talk about equipment hire! Right now, we have been working with the equipment we have (mainly just cameras borrowed from friends and family), but for the most part, we need to consider hiring out equipment, which means, equipment fees:

Jib: $70 p/day

Cineslider motor kit: $100 p/day

Audio equipment (lapels, recorders, zooms, boom mics, XLR cables, Wind shield): All of these total to $160 p/day, and that's just one of each item. Realistically, we would need 2-3 each, bringing the total needed to at least $480 and that's just for one day of filming.


 
In terms of set design and costume, this is another area where your funds will help greatly! For a great production, we need better looking costume and set design than we currently have. Realistically, a goal of $1,000 just for set design and costume is our current goal as we will try to source as much as we can from our own homes/borrow from friends and family so that with the excess of what we save, we can input this into things like equipment hire and potential wages for talent. We are young students, so we're thrifty and we try to be as cost effective as possible,  which is great, but with any great production, the more funds we have to pay for better costume, makeup/hair artists, then the better a chance we have of making something that is a cut above the rest!
All donations will be used wisely. The most important areas for funds to go into will be everything mentioned above (mainly location fees first as these need to be up front before we can film). 
Because we believe that a team needs a uniform, we have created shirts for our cast and crew to wear on our filming days! Which brings us to our next point:

PERKS! We have been fortunate enough to work with a Graphic Designer who has developed a unique logo for us! Our designer has done a fantastic job at giving us our own individual look, which means:
When you donate $1000.00 or more, you will receive a customised Hustle Street t-shirt as a thank you! You will also receive an Executive producer mention in our credits, a live streaming of rehearsals, a Hustle street lanyard AND footage of our promo video we'll be filming on the 21st of July 2017, that nobody else will get to see until it's actual release date! 
When you donate $100 or more, you will receive a Hustle Street t-shirt and lanyard!
When you donate $50 or more, you will receive a Hustle Street lanyard and  personal thank you from our cast and crew
When you donate, anything, because anything helps, we will provide you with access to exclusive Behind The Scenes footage, separate to what is available on our social media platforms. Great right?!



The Impact
Why does this matter to us? Why should it matter to you?
To put this bluntly, we really give a damn about this project. Not just because we've been working on it for so long, not just because we have a team of over 8 writers currently working on ways to make the script better, not just because we like to sing and dance, but because Sydney's western suburbs have always been hit hard with hurtful, and most of the time, untrue and unfair labels. We're not going to name names, but films and documentaries made about this area have often depicted us all in a bad light and the fact of the matter is, a lot of it was created on stereotypes, because unfortunately, stereotypes sell. We're here to change stereotypes. More than half of our cast and crew grew up in Mount Druitt and we don't feel that it has hindered us in any way and we don't think it makes us less important than the next suburb.
There's a hugely gifted community in this area and it's time for everyone to see it.
 

Our personal challenges
This industry is not only difficult to make a dent in, but it is fickle. The hardest part for us has been finding people as committed to us because the fact of the matter is, we don't have the funds to really pay people so a lot of the work has come from a genuine desire to make something great. So our biggest challenge has been solidifying a team and trying to wrangle budgets for locations, equipment hire, costume, set design and air fares. We've been combating this by investing out of our own pockets, which has been working well, but as our project expands, this means we can't do it alone anymore.
This means we need your help. Hustle Street is currently in the works to creating a promo video for our audiences. We've managed to get all this way through team work, some serious commitment and lots of man-hours. We're keen to release this promo video so that we can prove our worth and start showing everyone where their funds will be going. Any donation helps, big or small, it doesn't matter, any helping hand is appreciated. 
 

Can't donate? Don't sweat it!
We understand that not everyone who wants to donate, can do this. And that is absolutely fine, because theres other ways you can help!
Share this page with anyone and everyone that will listen! Share it on your Facebook, your Instagram, your twitter, anything!

Follow us on instagram: @hustle.street
Follow us on Facebook: @HustleStreetTeam
Give us a like, a thumbs up and share this over and over because that helps us just as much as any dollar does. Thank you for taking time to read this. Keep an eye on us, we've got big plans!

story:
I’m Mike Bradnam, the creator of The Waddling Dead.

I've written five film scripts but funding any of them has always been a challenge for obvious reasons. Apart from film, my passion is story telling. All I want in life is to tell a compelling story, have you laugh along the way and if I can make you giggle, I feel accomplished. 

An influx of American Zombies have overtaken Canada! Canadians have either been mauled and conformed into one of them, or looking to survive... one cup of Jim Norton's coffee at a time.

The Waddling Dead is a direct satire of The Walking Dead. We've hijacked all the characters' names, except for Rick Grimes, who is now Dick Grimes. All of the characters and locations have been altered to give that Canadian flair!

Instead of the show taking place in Georgia, it will be in Southern Ontario.

This production is happening and you can help make it better. We are aiming to produce 16 episodes, all within 4-7 min long each.

Contributions will allow us to produce more episodes, at a higher quality. If we have the desired budget, you'll laugh your pants off, and do so for quite a while. 

The show will center around Dick Grimes, a trigger happy RCMP Officer of the Law. After a roadside shootout, he awakes cold and alone in a hospital. Unknowing to the events of world outside. A world where the dead have risen as The Waddling Dead.

He is in a race against time to reunite with his son Carl, and his wife Lauri... Before his best friend Shane bangs his wife... Well... He kind of was too late for that...

What We Need

We are looking to raise $10,000 to complete the 16 Webisodes in 12 Days of Shooting!

Here’s how the money is being broken down:

This is over $10,000 of what we need,  and are very conservative numbers. This  show will have a production value of $25,000-$35,000.

We have about $15,000 worth of film equipment at our disposal, and help with SFX / Make-Up, which is why we are able to ask for so little in terms of how many episodes we are going to produce.

However, much of the cost will come from personnel. We have great actors and crew members on board who are doing the project for next to nothing. We need to help to transport them around, as well as nourish everyone. Or else we'll have a bunch of Waddlers roaming around on set..

Our goal is to complete all 16 episodes of Season 1 with 12 straight days of filming, and a couple weekends immediately preceding.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute in terms of funding. However, if you like / love / are interest / or even hate the idea… Spread the word! Every voice counts!

 

If we don't reach the goal

We will still produce a very high quality show of 6 episodes and continue this endeavor next year.  Either way, we are making sure The Waddling Dead is made this year!

 

Our Most Recent Projects

Take a look at some of our most recent endeavors. As a crew, we have always aimed high with our production values to create products which strike the audience visually, and emotionally. 

 

 

Creating entertaining content isn't stressful for any of us. We magnetized together based on common interests, goals, work ethic and attitude. What better of a team can you ask for than that to bring a high quality comedic Canadian show to fruition? 

For every problem, there is a solution. What an incorrect figure of speech. For every problem there is more than one solution. You just need people like us to see those solutions and execute them, all for your own personal shits and giggles!

story:
ABOUT US

Pole Star Productions is a new independent production company founded by Bronwyn Bishop in 2016 and dedicated to telling unusual stories about overlooked people, places, and time periods. Filthydelphia is our first major project, and we couldn't be more excited about it. 

Bronwyn Bishop is the founder and President of Pole Star Productions and the creator/writer/director of Filthydelphia. Bronwyn is a writer, director, and DJ from Philadelphia, now based in Brooklyn, New York. She is the writer, director, and producer of two original musicals: Plan 9: The Musical from Outer Space (based on Ed Wood's infamous B-movie Plan 9 from Outer Space) and Last Call (based on the songs of Jacques Brel). She is also the host of the fill-in program "Love Is Only Sleeping" on WFMU, the oldest and most renowned freeform radio station in the United States. Bronwyn graduated from Ithaca College with a degree in television-radio in 2016.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION

Your contribution will help us recreate the world of 1980 with the equipment, locations, props, and costumes we need to deliver a truly entertaining viewing experience. We intend to pitch this series to television networks and streaming services, and your generosity will help make that possible!

If you're looking for content with strong, funny, complex female characters- if you want a series that's unafraid to take on the social, racial, and economic issues of the past that still have widespread ramifications today- and if you're a Philadelphian who remembers the city as it was in that gritty but fascinating time, then you have to see this! But we can't make it happen without your help. 

Everyone who donates, no matter the amount, will be thanked in the credits. Best of all, you'll be able to watch a funny, unique new webseries with the knowledge that YOU made it happen!

It costs an average of $25 to see a movie. That $25 will help us create one. Thank you so much for your help!

story:
{ENGLISH}

Alleyways have always seemed to us enigmatic, to say the least.

They are like the city’s supporting actors, where highways and big boulevards take the front role, and where driving seems more appreciated than walking. We, nonetheless, like to go slow. Taking it step by step, observing and listening to the unexpected.

There’s so much to be told about these often dark, hidden places. Alleys are like the unofficial story, the footnotes of the city’s daily life, and there is a lack of stories being told about them.

 

Have you ever wonder how many stories are written and painted in these narrow passages?

A couple of years ago, we decided to take a closer look inside alleyways. We began the production of our first season in the San Francisco Bay Area, the place some of us call home. Right in front of us there was so much to show and so much to tell. They were not only stories that took place in San Francisco, Oakland, or Richmond, but a rich convergence of art, music and struggles from around the globe that captivated us even more.

Have you ever wonder how an Alley really Sounds?

Imagine a door closing from afar. Squeaking sounds of sewers and pipes beating against each other and amplifying like hands drumming. Imagine walking through an alleyway in any city around the world. Engines, sirens, barking, and honking populate the background while you walk, but you can still hear your footsteps echoing back to you. The confined shape of alleyways makes them ideal for listening. That’s why we think the sound of music here makes a lot of sense.

Music in alleyways has an extra layer of amplification and sound quality which intensifies the experience for both the audience and the musicians. We want to turn this often ignored space into a global stage for local emerging bands to share their work and to help amplify stories being told in and about public space.

 

Alley Sounds needs your help to make these season come to life. We have shot the majority of the first 6-episode season, but we still need to cover the final production, post production, and promotion costs, which are essential parts of a project of this kind.


Here’s exactly what this Kickstarter campaign will go to support…


The Impact

By supporting Alley Sounds, you are not just supporting another creative project. You are helping an independent group of artists open up new platforms to show their work and change the way we perceive alleyways, urban spaces and urban art around the globe.

We want to embrace alleyways and highlight the vital role they play in providing engaging and intimate public art spaces.  Come join us to redefine these unique places, and help us build an alley sounds community to transform them into a global stage.
 

As we mentioned, we’ve put together a crew that has shot the majority of our first season. World class musicians have collaborated in this adventure, and we are ready and excited to show their work.

With no budget, bringing this project to life so far has required a lot of effort and collaboration. We know that our goal is challenging, but we have laid a firm foundation and are committed to carrying out this project to completion, so that local stories and musicians have the chance to be heard and recognized.

 

 

 

{ESPAÑOL}

 

Los callejones siempre nos han parecido muy enigmáticos. Así, tal cual.

Son como los actores secundarios de la ciudad, donde las autopistas y grandes avenidas tratan de robarse el protagonismo y en donde andar en auto parece ser más apreciado que andar a pie. Nosotros, por el contrario, preferimos tomarla más suave. Paso a paso, observando y escuchando lo inesperado.

Hay mucho que contar sobre estos lugares un tanto oscuros y escondidos. Los callejones son la historia no oficial, el pie de página del día a día de la ciudad.

 

¿Te has preguntado cuántas historias son escritas y pintadas en estas angostas paredes?

Hace un par de años decidimos echar un vistazo más profundo dentro de los callejones. Empezamos la producción de la primera temporada de nuestro documental web, Alley Sounds, en el área de la bahía de San Francisco.

¿Te has preguntado cómo suena realmente un callejón?

Imagina una puerta cerrándose a lo lejos, el chillido del alcantarillado y el roce de las tuberías  amplificándose como el sonido de las palmas golpeando el cuero de un tambor. Imagínate caminando a través de un callejón en cualquier ciudad del mundo. Motores, sirenas, ladridos y pitos suenan incesantemente en el fondo mientras caminas, pero aún puedes escuchar el eco de los pasos detrás tuyo. El espacio confinado del callejón es ideal para resaltar todos estos sonidos. Por esto pensamos que escuchar el sonido de la música ahí tiene mucho sentido.

La música en los callejones tiene una capa extra de amplificación y la calidad del sonido intensifica la experiencia tanto para los músicos como para la audiencia. Queremos resignificar estos espacios comúnmente ignorados y convertirlos en escenarios globales para que bandas emergentes y personajes comunes y corrientes puedan compartir su música y sus historias.

 

Alley Sounds necesita tu ayuda para que esta temporada salga a la luz. Ya hemos grabado gran parte de la primera temporada que consta de 6 capítulos pero necesitamos cubrir los últimos costos de producción, post producción y promoción, indispensables para proyectos de este tipo.

Así es como vamos a distribuir lo recolectado por la campaña de Indiegogo...

El Impacto

Al contribuir con Alley Sounds, no estás ayudando a un proyecto creativo cualquiera. Estás colaborando con un grupo de artistas independientes. Estás ayudando a abrir nuevas plataformas de arte y expresión. Estás cambiando la forma en que vemos los espacios de nuestra ciudad.

Queremos aprovechar los callejones y resaltar su función vital al darnos un espacio de arte callejero, íntimo y acogedor.  Únanse a nosotros para redefinir el espacio público y construir una comunidad para transformarlos en un escenario global y sin límites.

Como mencionamos anteriormente, hemos forjado un equipo de trabajo que con compromiso ha producido la mayoría de nuestra primera temporada. Músicos de talla mundial han colaborado con nosotros en esta aventura, ya estamos listos y ansiosos para mostrar sus trabajos.

Sin financiamiento y autogestionándolo desde el principio, este proyecto ha requerido de mucha colaboración, esfuerzo y sacrificio. Sabemos que nuestra meta es desafiante pero hemos construido una fundación sólida. Con compromiso queremos llevar a cabo y lograr que la música y las historias locales sean escuchadas y reconocidas.

Al contribuir con Alley Sounds, no estás ayudando a un proyecto creativo cualquiera. Estás colaborando con un grupo de artistas independientes. Estás ayudando a abrir nuevas plataformas de arte y expresión. Estás cambiando la forma en que vemos los espacios de nuestra ciudad.
Queremos aprovechar los callejones y resaltar su función vital al darnos un espacio de arte callejero, íntimo y acogedor.  Únanse a nosotros para redefinir el espacio público y construir una comunidad para transformarlos en un escenario global y sin límites.
Como mencionamos anteriormente, hemos forjado un equipo de trabajo que con compromiso ha producido la mayoría de nuestra primera temporada. Músicos de talla mundial han colaborado con nosotros en esta aventura, ya estamos listos y ansiosos para mostrar sus trabajos.
Sin financiamiento y autogestionándolo desde el principio, este proyecto ha requerido de mucha colaboración, esfuerzo y sacrificio. Sabemos que nuestra meta es desafiante pero hemos construido una fundación sólida. Con compromiso queremos llevar a cabo y lograr que la música y las historias locales sean escuchadas y reconocidas.

story:
Welcome to the CRAVE  Family!

Big Announcement! We are producing a new web series called CRAVE, and we are launching our fundraising campaign on Indiegogo !

Developing community is key in our life's work, which is why we are asking for your support! We are looking for donations to support the filming of our pilot (first) episode of this series, with a fundraising goal of $36, 500 in 45 days.

CRAVE  is a dramatic-comedy, or 'dramedy', that follows this story:

From a millennial perspective, three close girlfriends, Chanel, Naomi, and Zuri, living in Los Angeles, struggle through uncanny scenarios to escape their unfulfilled reality and expand their creativity.

 

 

Why Is CRAVE  Different from Other Series?

CRAVE  pays homage to 90's Black television shows (i.e., Living Single, A Different World, Moesha, The Parkers, etc.) -- content that revealed the diversity of the lifestyles in the African-American community, from the successful black person to someone living in the struggle, and also expressed the richness and depth of our culture and humor.

Also, similar to more recent shows like Insecure and Girlfriends, CRAVE  portrays the every day life of a young, black, woman, professional, living in a major U.S. city. It is important to expose the life of modern women working and living in the male-dominated entertainment industry. Most importantly, our goal for this show is to bring more black voices and stories to the screen. We want to entertain you!

In CRAVE, we want to touch on all of these issues, in addition to relevant subjects, such as sisterhood, the Black mother-daughter relationship, Black fatherhood, and Black love. And, even better, CRAVE  is a story specifically told from a millennial perspective!

What is a Millennial Perspective?

In our show, we want to debunk the assumption that older generations have about millennials -- the assumptions that millennials are capricious, lazy, disorganized, unfocused, unrealistically entrepreneurial, and unsure of their career paths. CRAVE  shows that trekking through the struggle of working for oneself, with dedication, will ultimately prove to be successful.

A millennial perspective is the experience of living with new technology and methods of communication, and the behavior that stems from this experience -- online dating culture and lack in interpersonal skills, social media, freedom of the everyday work schedule, the façade of success through brand exposure, 'couch surfing', and more!

Why Should I Contribute?

This project would not be a reality without your generous support! CRAVE is an independent web series with a limited budget, and your donations will directly cover costs to film the pilot episode, including renting locations, paying cast and crew for their time, supplies, meals on set, and much more. As dedicated filmmakers, we are committed to making your contributions meaningful throughout the progression of this web series.

With your help, we will be able to reach a large audience and hopefully distribute our story to a major digital platform, such as Netflix, HULU, Amazon, etc., where you can access content from the comfort of your own home.

How Can I Donate?

Here on Indiegogo!

Nirine S. Brown: Actress (Plays Chanel)

 

 

NIRINE S. BROWN is an American actress, dancer, and singer born and raised in Queens, New York. As a triple threat, Nirine has enjoyed success on both stage and screen, which has allowed her to travel the world and relocate her residency to Los Angeles, CA. In pursuit of being a bicoastal entertainer, her recent accomplishments include: the feature film Sprinter, the first national tour of Wicked the Musical, Code Black TV series, performing a Radio City Rockette, various music videos with renowned artists, and other commercial/print work. During her leisure time, Nirine enjoys watching films, reading books, outdoor, adventure activities, and cooking, as a self-proclaimed, esteemed 'foodie'.

 

Tina Shakiyah Powell: Actress (Plays Naomi)

 

TINA SHAKIYAH is a San Francisco native with a strong, creative spirit. While obtaining her degree at Clark Atlanta University (CAU) in Mass Media Arts, Tina created and starred in a hit  web series, called College Boyfriends, starred in multiple independent productions, and performed with the CAU theater group. Beginning with her acting career throughout grade school, followed by music, and then falling in love with filmmaking, Tina Shakiyah is now a 27-year old actress, screenwriter, director and producer.

Simoné Loudd: Actress (Plays Zuri) 

 

*See Bio Below

 

 

Simoné Loudd: Executive Producer/Creator/Writer/Actress

SIMONE LOUDD is a writer, director and entrepreneur born and raised in Oakland, CA. During her undergrad years at Clark Atlanta University, where she majored in Mass Media Arts, she created her first short film, LoveSick, and earned her first award for Best Film in the Campus Movie Fest. This accomplishment became a stepping stone for her to desire to be a filmmaker.

During her graduate studies, at the New York Film Academy in Burbank, CA,  she created iamLOUDD Films and Production to display her craft as a producer, director and writer. With iamLOUDD, she aims to create honest and reliable visual content that displays her views of the world around her. She wants her passion and integrity to influence and inspire others while providing opportunities to her community, gender, culture, and race. Simoné also co-wrote the poetry book LoveLoudd with Yanique Love.

Vita Esperança Amore: Producer

VITA ESPERANCA AMORE is a storyteller, film/event producer, and overall creative visionary, who seeks to change the world through spreading love and vitality. As a proud graduate of the University of Southern California, her life and career goal is to curate and create projects that empower and evoke positive change with individual and collective force. Vita has produced numerous short films, including USC Thesis film Masks, directed by Mahaliyah Ayla O, and Vita looks forward to expanding her breadth of knowledge and experience in producing and directing throughout 2018 and beyond. She is most passionate about thriller and comedy, and the spirit of CRAVE matches Vita's personality and creative vision.

Jhoe Virago: Series Contributing Writer

Jhamana Creer (JHOE VIRAGO) is a published author, blogger, poet and screenwriter. She graduated from University of Phoenix with a Bachelors in Human Services, ready to change the world as a therapist. After deciding that the office was no place for her, she began to use her love of writing and life story to inspire others. She published her own poetry book titled D.C.F.S Delicately Caring for Savages, which consists of heart-wrenching poetry that she wrote at just 13 years old. Jhoe is motivated by the thought of bringing laughter, love and positivity into the world, as we can never have too much of it!

Prince Domonick: Director

 

Prince Domonick, is an award winning Music Video/Film Director best known for directing the musical film House Slave. Prince placed 1st in the 2010 SonScreen Film Festival in Atlanta, GA for his music video "One Nation At A Time", dedicated to the victims of the earthquake in Haiti. Since 2009, Prince has been the head of Prince Domonick Pictures a subdivision of Spirit Reign Communication & Publishing. Prince graduated from the historic Oakwood University (Huntsville, AL) in 2013 with a Bachelor of Arts in Communication and graduated with a Masters of Fine Art in Filmmaking from The New York Film Academy (Los Angeles, CA) in 2015. In 2017 Prince's film Thick Water was nominated for Best Social Justice Film at the International Black Film Festival.

Stephanie Howard: Social Media Marketing Manager

STEPHANIE HOWARD is the Founder and Chief Executive Officer of ComfortArm Cosmetic, LLC. Prior to ComfortArm, Stephanie graduated from Florida State University with a Bachelors of Science in Social Science and Public Policy with a concentration Applied Economics. She also recently obtained her Masters of Science from Full Sail University in Entertainment Business. With aspirations of turning television ideas into profitable entertainment, Stephanie sought opportunities in television development and has worked with companies, such as Walt Disney World Resorts, MTV Network, and OWN network, where she was able to witness a tv show from its birth to marketing and consumer product development. 

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Follow & Share Our Campaign!

#WhatDoYouCRAVE

#CRAVESomethingNew

#CRAVEWebSeries

Facebook

Twitter

Instagram

Website

Youtube

Thank you for your time and consideration of our campaign.

We look forward to you following us on our journey of discovering:

What Do You CRAVE?

story:
Our Story

           Hounds Wake is a completely original episodic script written by Zach & Dace McNally. It's a four part series combining different Irish and British folktales to weave together a completely new whiskey-soaked narrative; filled to the brim with mischief, love, and murder!

          In the style of the classic bards of old, each story will be told not only through text but with music; Including celtic, folk, sea shanties, and murder ballads. Our goal is to recreate the experience of sitting in a dimly lit tavern while a traveling bard regales the patrons with songs and tall tales over a few pints!

 

Join The Pack?

With our backgrounds in traditional/experimental/immersive theater we hope to bring you a truly unique experience. First we plan to film each episode using a 4k 360 degree camera, which you'll be able to use any standard smart-phone, laptop, or tablet to view; putting you in the action! Further down the line we then hope to re-tailor the script so we can perform the experience live, and have a real pint with you!

 However, in order to make Hounds Wake a reality, we need your help. We are looking for funds to cover the costs of

  • Camera Rental
  • Location Rental
  • Promotional material
  • Actor Fees
  • Transportation 
  • Props

           EVERY dollar helps! And if perks are more your style, we've got some of those for you to check out too!

     We've worked incredibly hard on this project and hope you're as excited as we are to see it come to fruition!  You can follow our progress on instagram at @HoundsWakeOfficial and check back here as we will update our backers regularly!

Join The Pack

story:
We are ready to make this show.
Now we just need your help.

Who are we?

We are a group of creators that care so passionately about sharing our art that we banded together to create a new comedic series.  Unfortunately, we are young emerging artists who work multiple jobs and we simply cannot fund the entire thing ourselves so we need your support. We are friendly strangers just hustling to make our dreams a reality. It would mean the world to us if you would join us!

How did this Project Start?

The core of our team all met in college where we studied acting for film, television and voice over at Seneca College. After graduation we all went off on our own and hustled trying to get our acting careers started. A couple years go by and just like that, we found ourselves back in each others lives and wanting to collaborate - all with an eagerness to create our own work, tell our own stories, and further our careers. Having spent those couple years being on our own in the industry we all realized something very important - you need family. Seneca is a family. We spent endless hours in class together. We've seen each others most vulnerable moments and each others triumphs. It is extremely hard to go through this industry alone and deal with constant rejection. We were all tired of being told no, so instead we gave ourselves a yes and created our own work. We want to show you what we can do! 

With your help and generosity you will be giving us the tools to shoot a web series that means something. This project is very important for everyone to watch and enjoy! Our show includes a family consisting of a multitude of sexualities and ethnicities. Our focus isn't on that however our focus is to bring awareness to the fact that these are normal circumstances in today's world. We don't put the spotlight on the "different characters", instead, we shine a light on a family with quirks just like any other while still talking about issues that matter to the LGBTQ community.

Where the Money Will Go

We need a minimum of $6000 to film 'So That Happened', That's A LOT of loonies! If we go over our goal, not only will we be ecstatic but it of course means we can afford to do more exciting things with the show! We have budgeted everything from craft services to equipment and location rentals. We've cut costs in every way we could think of and it came down to five grand for a 13-day shoot.

Here is the breakdown of how the money is going to be budgeted - in no particular order: 

1 - A STRONG CREW - minimum of $4000

  • Director of Photography (the person responsible for what the movie LOOKS like)
  • Sound Mixer (the person responsible for what the show SOUNDS like)
  • Production Manager & Production Assistants
  • Assistant Director, 2nd Camera
  • Makeup, Hair, Props, Set Decoration & Location Necessities

2 - EQUIPMENT, PROPS, SET DEC - minimum of $2000

  • Cameras, Lenses & Sound Recording Equipment
  • Lighting Equipment & Special Effects
  • Props & Items to Decorate our Location

3 - CRAFT SERVICES - minimum of $1500

Although we have all of our wonderful parents & friends donating a dinner or two, we still have many mouths to feed especially since we will be working ten days straight, at least 12 hours a day, with 2 extra days on the side. My offer of Mr.Noodles for ten days was quickly shot down.

4 - LOTS OF OTHER STUFF

  • Insurance, Payment Processing & Other Administrative Fees.
  • Distribution and Marketing
  • Post-Production, i.e editing all of the footage, colour correction, sound and much more!
  • These small but extremely important things really add up when it comes to money!

As you can see these 4 priorities already put us needing more than our goal but we are all contributing as much of our own money that we can afford and this will hopefully counteract the deficit. If we do not meet our goal, the series might not be able to be produced and we would have no series to shoot.  This is why we really need your support!

What Happens if we Raise More than our $6k Goal?

Truthfully, that would be ideal.  This series is going to cost considerably more than our goal amount as we plan to source additional funds from our own pockets as well as by getting some business sponsors on board to partner with us.  If we raise more than our goal, we can have the flexibility to use better equipment, have additional on-set support, and to pay our actors a modest fee - all of whom are working on this project pro-bono.  Furthermore, it would allow us to ramp-up our marketing efforts to ensure that even more people see this series.

What About the Perks?

We want you all to be involved in some way with the show which is why we created perks that are interactive and allow you to take part in the development of the series. 

Some perks include:

  • Name in the credits (available for any donation)
  • Making choices about how the Secret Episode plays out and then getting to watch it too!
  • Choosing a costume that a character will wear in an episode or being the voice of the So That Happened outro.
  • Getting a bunch of swag with The Ultimate Fan Club perk.
  • Co-hosting an episode of the Behind the Scenes show with Tyler James.
  • and lost more...check out the sidebar to see them all.

Your Impact

Even though this series is a comedy, it is still dealing with subject matter that can impact many.  The series creator, Matkai Burmaster, is a member of the LGBTQ community himself and he has seen the impact that ignorance can have on LGBTQ people. Many don't understand, for example, the intricacies of what it means to be trans, and people aren't exposed to gay characters that don't fit into the standard stereotypes presented by the media today. Our series presents a trans character, a gay character, and a character that doesn't define her sexuality in ways where the characters lives are the focus.  We know that our series can be a beacon of hope for those who are LGBTQ and can provide some new education to those who may not yet understand the variety of people that exist within our community.

Risks & Challenges

Although we have already mitigated many of the risks, we want to be upfront and honest with our supporters about challenges that may potentially exist.  These include: accidents on set, crew or actors unable to continue with the project, and not reaching our campaign goal here on IndieGoGo.  However, we are fierce and tenacious and we know that we can solve any issue that comes our way.  This project is important to us and we will not give up without a fight.

Other Ways You Can Help

Trust us, money is always tight with us so we understand if you can't contribute financially, but you can still be equally a part of the series helping in other ways like:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family.
  • Follow the show on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram @sothatseries
  • Introduce us to companies that may want to sponsor us with cash or in-kind services.
  • Get the word out and make some noise about what we are doing.

Either way, you have given us more than we can ask for by reading all of this info and we honestly, and truly appreciate your generosity. 

Thank you,
Ally, Deanna, Matkai, Remi, and Brian

 

 


 

ACTRA is the Association for Canadian Television and Radio Artists and is the organization that protects the rights and safety of professional actors.  All actors in this production are members of the association and are bound to work only on projects that follow the rules and guidelines set forth by ACTRA.  This is important because it means that actors can earn a fair wage for their work and can gain respect and dignity within the communities they serve.  When you watch a big name movie in the cinema, most or all of the actors you see are part of ACTRA, SAG-AFTRA (the US equivalent), or another similar organization.

Core Team (Creators & Actors)

  • MATKAI BURMASTER - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8409294
    Creator & Director, Head of Marketing (also plays role of Joe)
  • DEANNA WIDMEYER - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6917095
    Co-Producer, Head of Finances (also plays role of Wanda)
  • ALLY MCLEAN - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7007531
    Co-Producer, Head of Sponsorships (also plays role of Jess)
  • REMI ADEYINKA - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4928233
    Art Director, Head of Logistics (also plays role of Alice)
  • TOMMY JAMES MURPHY - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5867034/
    Various Production Roles (also plays role of Chris)
  • MARK INGRAM - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1831284
    Actor (plays role of Frank)

Recurring & Guest Star Roles

  • SAMY OSMAN - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3399947/
    Actor (plays role of Mailman)
  • WAYNE BURNS - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4517763/
    Actor (plays role of Flynn, the Pizza Guy)
  • ANITA LA SELVA - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0489500
    Actor (plays role of Janet)
  • ISABEL KANAAN - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6440170/
    Actor (plays role of Bree)
  • EVE HUTT
    Actor (plays role of Brooke)

Key Crew on Board

  • RANDY RESH - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3128416
    Sound Mixer
  • AUSTIN MCCARLEY - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7315242
    Production Manager
  • KARYN LIN - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8735596/
    First Assistant Director
  • CAITLYN CAUSEY
    Hair & Makeup and Script Supervisor
  • ERIC LAPALME
    Composer
  • KRIS BABCOCK - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8969122/
    Production Assistant
  • COLLIN BUTCHER
    Craft Services
  • additional crew to be listed once confirmed.

After graduation we all went off on our own and hustled trying to get our acting careers started. A couple years go by and just like that, we found ourselves back in each others lives and wanting to collaborate - all with an eagerness to create our own work, tell our own stories, and further our careers. Having spent those couple years being on our own in the industry we all realized something very important - you need family. Seneca is a family. We spent endless hours in class together. We've seen each others most vulnerable moments and each others triumphs. It is extremely hard to go through this industry alone and deal with constant rejection. We were all tired of being told no, so instead we gave ourselves a yes and created our own work. We want to show you what we can do! 
With your help and generosity you will be giving us the tools to shoot a web series that means something. This project is very important for everyone to watch and enjoy! Our show includes a family consisting of a multitude of sexualities and ethnicities. Our focus isn't on that however our focus is to bring awareness to the fact that these are normal circumstances in today's world. We don't put the spotlight on the "different characters", instead, we shine a light on a family with quirks just like any other while still talking about issues that matter to the LGBTQ community.
Where the Money Will Go
We need a minimum of $6000 to film 'So That Happened', That's A LOT of loonies! If we go over our goal, not only will we be ecstatic but it of course means we can afford to do more exciting things with the show! We have budgeted everything from craft services to equipment and location rentals. We've cut costs in every way we could think of and it came down to five grand for a 13-day shoot.
Here is the breakdown of how the money is going to be budgeted - in no particular order: 

1 - A STRONG CREW - minimum of $4000

Director of Photography (the person responsible for what the movie LOOKS like)
Sound Mixer (the person responsible for what the show SOUNDS like)
Production Manager & Production Assistants
Assistant Director, 2nd Camera
Makeup, Hair, Props, Set Decoration & Location Necessities

2 - EQUIPMENT, PROPS, SET DEC - minimum of $2000

Cameras, Lenses & Sound Recording Equipment
Lighting Equipment & Special Effects
Props & Items to Decorate our Location

3 - CRAFT SERVICES - minimum of $1500
Although we have all of our wonderful parents & friends donating a dinner or two, we still have many mouths to feed especially since we will be working ten days straight, at least 12 hours a day, with 2 extra days on the side. My offer of Mr.Noodles for ten days was quickly shot down.
4 - LOTS OF OTHER STUFF

Insurance, Payment Processing & Other Administrative Fees.
Distribution and Marketing
Post-Production, i.e editing all of the footage, colour correction, sound and much more!
These small but extremely important things really add up when it comes to money!

As you can see these 4 priorities already put us needing more than our goal but we are all contributing as much of our own money that we can afford and this will hopefully counteract the deficit. If we do not meet our goal, the series might not be able to be produced and we would have no series to shoot.  This is why we really need your support!
What Happens if we Raise More than our $6k Goal?
Truthfully, that would be ideal.  This series is going to cost considerably more than our goal amount as we plan to source additional funds from our own pockets as well as by getting some business sponsors on board to partner with us.  If we raise more than our goal, we can have the flexibility to use better equipment, have additional on-set support, and to pay our actors a modest fee - all of whom are working on this project pro-bono.  Furthermore, it would allow us to ramp-up our marketing efforts to ensure that even more people see this series.
What About the Perks?
We want you all to be involved in some way with the show which is why we created perks that are interactive and allow you to take part in the development of the series. 
Some perks include:

Name in the credits (available for any donation)
Making choices about how the Secret Episode plays out and then getting to watch it too!
Choosing a costume that a character will wear in an episode or being the voice of the So That Happened outro.
Getting a bunch of swag with The Ultimate Fan Club perk.
Co-hosting an episode of the Behind the Scenes show with Tyler James.
and lost more...check out the sidebar to see them all.

Your Impact
Even though this series is a comedy, it is still dealing with subject matter that can impact many.  The series creator, Matkai Burmaster, is a member of the LGBTQ community himself and he has seen the impact that ignorance can have on LGBTQ people. Many don't understand, for example, the intricacies of what it means to be trans, and people aren't exposed to gay characters that don't fit into the standard stereotypes presented by the media today. Our series presents a trans character, a gay character, and a character that doesn't define her sexuality in ways where the characters lives are the focus.  We know that our series can be a beacon of hope for those who are LGBTQ and can provide some new education to those who may not yet understand the variety of people that exist within our community.
Risks & Challenges
Although we have already mitigated many of the risks, we want to be upfront and honest with our supporters about challenges that may potentially exist.  These include: accidents on set, crew or actors unable to continue with the project, and not reaching our campaign goal here on IndieGoGo.  However, we are fierce and tenacious and we know that we can solve any issue that comes our way.  This project is important to us and we will not give up without a fight.

Other Ways You Can Help
Trust us, money is always tight with us so we understand if you can't contribute financially, but you can still be equally a part of the series helping in other ways like:

Share this campaign with your friends and family.
Follow the show on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram @sothatseries
Introduce us to companies that may want to sponsor us with cash or in-kind services.
Get the word out and make some noise about what we are doing.

Either way, you have given us more than we can ask for by reading all of this info and we honestly, and truly appreciate your generosity. 
Thank you,Ally, Deanna, Matkai, Remi, and Brian
 
 
 

ACTRA is the Association for Canadian Television and Radio Artists and is the organization that protects the rights and safety of professional actors.  All actors in this production are members of the association and are bound to work only on projects that follow the rules and guidelines set forth by ACTRA.  This is important because it means that actors can earn a fair wage for their work and can gain respect and dignity within the communities they serve.  When you watch a big name movie in the cinema, most or all of the actors you see are part of ACTRA, SAG-AFTRA (the US equivalent), or another similar organization.

Core Team (Creators & Actors)


MATKAI BURMASTER - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8409294Creator & Director, Head of Marketing (also plays role of Joe)


DEANNA WIDMEYER - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6917095Co-Producer, Head of Finances (also plays role of Wanda)


ALLY MCLEAN - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7007531 Co-Producer, Head of Sponsorships (also plays role of Jess)


REMI ADEYINKA - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4928233Art Director, Head of Logistics (also plays role of Alice)


TOMMY JAMES MURPHY - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5867034/Various Production Roles (also plays role of Chris)


MARK INGRAM - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1831284Actor (plays role of Frank) 


Recurring & Guest Star Roles


SAMY OSMAN - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3399947/Actor (plays role of Mailman)


WAYNE BURNS - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4517763/Actor (plays role of Flynn, the Pizza Guy)


ANITA LA SELVA - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0489500Actor (plays role of Janet)


ISABEL KANAAN - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6440170/Actor (plays role of Bree)


EVE HUTTActor (plays role of Brooke)


Key Crew on Board


RANDY RESH - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3128416 Sound Mixer


AUSTIN MCCARLEY - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7315242Production Manager


KARYN LIN - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8735596/First Assistant Director


CAITLYN CAUSEYHair & Makeup and Script Supervisor


ERIC LAPALMEComposer


KRIS BABCOCK - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8969122/Production Assistant

additional crew to be listed once confirmed.

story:
Short Summary

This project is run by myself (T.J. Grof), and my two Co-Writers, Samantha Sawicki, and Callie Gill. We are all students and alum of Studio School LA and this project is my thesis project; we want it to go much further than just a grade, we want it to be a potential series on a major network. We want to portray the journey and effort required to survive summer break. 

Summer break is here! ...But god damn it summer break is here and kids live with you. What are you to do? 

What We Need & What You Get

We all know they're not just handing out free llama rentals. That's where the money's going! Well, long term, that's where the future of the project is headed. Llama rental. It's a Fortnite thing. The kids love the Fortnite.

But first, we need to make the pilot and prove the concept is as damn-near-all-out hilarious as we think it is. 

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • B-B-B-Break it down *record scratch*
  • $5200. That's what we need. Do you have an additional $5200? We do not. Do you have an additional $25? We already put all our money in. We're broke:-(
  • Perks? You betcha! We got shirts with a logo on 'em. You can have one if you donate. Then you can wear it. We might also have koozies to mail out with the shirts. Beer!
  • We're making Summer Broke whether we raise the full $5200 or not. If not we'll just shoot it in a sketchy back alley with child labor. It's an important story for us to tell and we will find a way to tell it. That said, if we raise more than our requested amount we might digitally add lasers! Lasers, son! How fun is that?!

The Impact

  • Value to the world? Infinite. 
  • This is the first time I've crowdfunded. You get to be my first. You always remember your first...5200.
  • Yay! You're doing it, you're doing it. You're donating money and getting chuckles and possibly a t-shirt in return! Great work!

Risks & Challenges

Oh the risks! Oh the challenges! Let. Me. Tell. You! Not having $5200 is a BIG risk. Spooky. I would like to feed my crew without having to sell my wife's car. If I sell her car I will be left with only a TV pilot and my family will move to Boca Raton. Nobody wants that.

  • Can we overcome these risks? *Alaskan accent* Oh you betcha! 
  • We will overcome these harrowing risks through prayer and laughter. That's a lie. We will use all laughter. And possibly chuckles. Laughter cures all that ails. Also $5200 cures what ails this production.

Other Ways You Can Help

How can you help if funds are tight? You can share this campaign. And then tell your friends, family, co-workers, and pets to share it as well. The more pockets...errrrr... hearts and minds we reach the better chance we have of putting unnecessary lasers into the background... and foreground.

  • Seriously, thank you for making it through this page and considering throwing $5 at our collective faces. If you can share that is just as helpful. 
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools?....Use the share tools.

Use them share buttons and also them donate buttons. Or mail me a check with the memo as LASERS. Thanks for looking at my campaign and have a very good day.

Llamas & Lasers!
