story:
Perfectly Serious Productions is a fandom parody channel and has been creating content on YouTube for the past 3 years. Its library includes music video parodies, sketches, reaction videos, vlogs, & challenges.  The channel is run by us 3 women. We've known each other since high school and we're thrilled to still be producing videos over 10 years later on a much bigger scale and with a newer platform! This will be our 8th project campaign and you guys have been the ones making it happen. We hope you can join us in the magic on this next one!

Caitlin Halliburton - Director

Katey Fittingoff - Producer

Julia Markas - Producer

This campaign will launch a new chapter of content that is produced on Perfectly Serious Production's channel. We are excited for this new venture and can't wait to share what we have in store. This will be our first mini series and we hope you can help us make it happen!

6 mini episodes will be funded after raising this campaign's goal. This includes equipment, locations, wardrobe, makeup, hair/wigs, props, set dressing, meals for cast/crew, insurance, our intro for each episode, and composition for each episode in the series. 

The Bachelor: Princess Edition is a parody of the show “The Bachelor” featuring twelve princesses as the contestants and a prince as the bachelor. The princesses will compete for Prince Charming’s heart through the course of six short episodes through one-on-one dates and other activities while staying all together in a mansion. The prince will give roses at the end of each episode to those he wants to stay, and those who do not receive a rose will be asked to leave until there is only one left. Who will he choose?

Written by our talented friend Alastair James Murden, this series will leave you rolling on the floor laughing and wondering why no one ever thought of this idea sooner.

Alastair James Murden - Writer

Excerpt from The Bachelor: Princess Edition Scripts

 

******

We're very excited that our talented Director of Photography, Isaiah Shinn, will be joining us again for this project! He shot Westworld Parody and The Cloned Orphan for us and we could not have asked for better images! 

Isaiah Shinn - Director of Photography

Behind The Scenes Shooting Westworld Parody

******

We are also excited to announce another returning crew member to the team, please welcome back Joshua Hendricks, our composer! His original score for Westworld Parody captured the essence of Westworld's western vibe while staying true to Taylor Swift's style of 'Look What You Made Me Do'. He composed our Intro Theme Song and will be scoring each of the 6 episodes!

Joshua Hendricks - Composer

Still from our Westworld Parody

Enjoy this Sneak Peek of the lyrics for the intro title sequence of the show:

This will be our first ever web series and we cannot express how excited we are to jump into this new arena! We have always wanted to create a series with new episodes that people can look forward to each week, since it creates a sense of suspense and excitement as the tension in the story builds. We want our viewers to come on a journey with us to make predictions about what might happen and communicate their thoughts and feelings about the project as it goes along. Your feedback is extremely important to us and helps us grow our channel more and more every year.

******

THE CONTESTANTS

She’s sassy, will still kiss you if you get turned into a frog, and good with a frying pan – meet

Tiana!

Played by Francesca Taylor - @francheezy24_7

**************

Her hair is long, her life is ready to begin, and she'll knock you out with a frying pan – meet

Rapunzel!

Played by Briana Roecks - @brianamatopoeia

**************

She's cursed, has a bad case of narcolepsy, but she'll fall in love with you at once – meet

Aurora!

Played by Naomi Smentkowski - @thattallprincess

**************

She’s the youngest of seven sisters, willing to give up her voice for you, and ready to be part of your world – meet

Ariel!

Played by Dayna Coogan - @thedrpepperprincess

**************

She’s brave, full of honor, and can take on the entire Hun army on her own while also pretending to be a man – meet

Mulan!

Played by Josephine Chang - @slowjojojo

**************

She’s used to long winters, willing to sacrifice herself for her sister, and ready to marry the first nice guy she meets – meet

Anna!

Played by Areyna Schmidt - @areynaschmidt

**************

She’s good with a bow, friends with bears, and the only princess with a strong accent (we really can’t tell what she’s saying most of the time) – meet

Merida!

Played by Lauren - @snowmerida 

**************

She’s got a tiger, enjoys dressing in disguise as a commoner, and loves magic carpet rides - meet

Jasmine!

Played by Jessica Rizer - @jessirizer

**************

She’s wishing for her one true love, hates apples, and is used to cooking and cleaning for seven men – meet

Snow White!

Played by Lauren Sperling - @_misspixie_

**************

She’s ready to leave her poor provincial town, loves to read, and doesn’t question talking enchanted objects – meet

Belle!

Played by Mikayla Silverstein - @mikidisneybounds

**************

She’s from a tropical island, not sure how far she’ll go, and good friends with the sea itself – meet

Moana!

Played by Lahela Garner - @lahelamusic

**************

She’s courageous, she’s kind, and always sticks to that midnight curfew – meet

Cinderella!

Played by Katie Kotulak - @kkotulak                                                                                      

**************

THE BACHELOR

He’s….well...um...handsome? And rich? – meet

Prince Charming!

Played by Garrett Schweighauser - @gschwei

**************

YOUR HOST

He’s spunky, he’s generous with wishes, and he’s free (both from the lamp and to host this show) –meet 

The Genie!

Played by Isaac Robinson-Smith - @disnerd1955

**************

The location is the most important part of our budget. It is also the largest part, taking up 3/5th of our entire budget. By shooting at a giant mansion located in the hills of Calabasas, we will capture the essence of “The Bachelor” and the magic of fairy tales. Join us as we escape to a new reality where modern princesses compete for the heart of their one true love, Prince Charming.

The home is 10,000 square feet and includes a boastful driveway where princesses will exit the carriage (limo) to meet the Prince Bachelor and be escorted through the enormous entryway. The house is staged perfectly with furniture, table settings, fireplaces, and a beautifully lush backyard that will create the ideal setting for this series.

Every single dollar we receive goes straight to making the production better looking, better sounding, and all around just more epic to watch. With your help we’re able to bring the worlds of The Bachelor and Disney Princesses to life in a 6 part mini series.

We'll be real - most of the money is going to the location. We're able to save a lot of money on costumes by casting cosplayers who already own them. We're able to shoot with a camera that a friend owns for an extremely discounted rate. We can produce high quality original music with real singers and a composer for 1/5 of the price it should cost. All of our cast and most of our crew are donating their time to work at no cost for us because they believe in the project. The location (even though deeply discounted) is our highest expense. Insurance and meals for the cast/crew are next and those are things we cannot avoid. Whatever we do not raise of our goal will come out of our pockets and production will be paused until we have what we need. 

So every donation, no matter how big or small, really does help! It involves the backer in the project itself, separating you from being just another viewer. We appreciate you and can't express enough how much we need you for this project to succeed. Let's make the magic happen! 

The Impact

Upon completion, this mini series will be released on YouTube and will be free to watch, like every single one of our productions. Men, women, girls, and boys will have access to 6 episodes of high quality, funny, and family friendly material. The essence of both The Bachelor and Disney Princesses will be portrayed and the potential audience will reach to all ages and places of the world. Did you know that our second highest watching country after the USA is India? That means that we're making someone smile across the world. And by providing free content, everyone has access to it. Our purpose with this mini series is to bring The Bachelor: Princess Edition to life to brighten the days of Disney Princess fans and Bachelor Nation lovers everywhere.

We've had thousands of comments on previous videos from people of all walks of life. Seeing their joy, even if it was just for the 5 minutes while watching a video, makes this all worth it. Spreading positivity and putting something driven by passion and not a paycheck into the world is the ultimate reward. 

We've been fortunate enough to even have the real actors we're making parodies of watch and comment about our projects! The impact and reach is endless with social media. 

We are raising the minimum amount of money needed to shoot at the location, purchase props, feed our cast & crew for 2 shooting days, secure insurance, record music, and supply the equipment needed to create the highest production value you're used to seeing from us on a minimal budget. The pie chart below explains how the money will be broken down between departments. 

What do you get out of it? We have pretty unique and exciting perks. If you've ever wanted your name listed in the credits of a video, these perks were made for you! Different leveled tiers include receiving Associate Producer, Co-Producer, and Executive Producer credit. And for just $1, your name automatically makes it in the credits alongside the cast and crew. Other rewards include a Set Visit, access to each episode before they are released, exclusive access to our behind the scenes feed, sneak peeks, and more!

Risks & Challenges

After our project is funded, we'll still run into risks and challenges with the actual logistics of running a film shoot and seeing it through post production. Something can always go wrong - and it usually does! Sometimes permits take longer than expected, an actor can drop out last minute, weather can affect outdoor shooting days, and so much more can happen to anyone shooting any kind of project, no matter how big or small. On our last big production-- Westworld Parody-- we actually had to reschedule our shooting date at Paramount Ranch (that we had planned on for 3 months) just a few days before due to a huge rainstorm that came through southern California. It was very stressful having to figure out all over again the availability of about 50 people at the last minute, but we managed to find a new date that worked with the majority of our cast and crew as well as the location without costing us much more than some re-booking fees.

Since this is our fourth large-scale production with Perfectly Serious, we believe we are ready to tackle problems we have run into in the past as well as any new ones that may arise. We face snags together as a team when they come and we always manage to pull through, one task at a time.

We get it. Sometimes there just isn't enough left over at the end of the day spare. We've been there. But that doesn't mean you can't help out in other ways free of charge! 

  • Help us spread the word and make some noise about this campaign! Send to as many people as you can and post on as many platforms as possible! 
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! It makes sharing much, much easier.
  • Give what you can. If you want to donate more but can't, do the lower value tier. $1 goes further than you think. 

THANK YOU -

FROM THE BOTTOM OF OUR HEARTS

Played by Lauren - @snowmerida

She’s got a tiger, enjoys dressing in disguise as a commoner, and loves magic carpet rides - meet
Jasmine!

Played by Jessica Rizer - @jessirizer
**************
She’s wishing for her one true love, hates apples, and is used to cooking and cleaning for seven men – meet
Snow White!

Played by Lauren Sperling - @_misspixie_
**************
She’s ready to leave her poor provincial town, loves to read, and doesn’t question talking enchanted objects – meet
Belle!

Played by Mikayla Silverstein - @mikidisneybounds
**************
She’s from a tropical island, not sure how far she’ll go, and good friends with the sea itself – meet
Moana!

Played by Lahela Garner - @lahelamusic
**************
She’s courageous, she’s kind, and always sticks to that midnight curfew – meet
Cinderella!

Played by Katie Kotulak - @kkotulak                                                                                      
**************
THE BACHELOR
He’s….well...um...handsome? And rich? – meet
Prince Charming!

Played by Garrett Schweighauser - @gschwei
**************
YOUR HOST
He’s spunky, he’s generous with wishes, and he’s free (both from the lamp and to host this show) –meet 
The Genie!

Played by Isaac Robinson-Smith - @disnerd1955
**************


The location is the most important part of our budget. It is also the largest part, taking up 3/5th of our entire budget. By shooting at a giant mansion located in the hills of Calabasas, we will capture the essence of “The Bachelor” and the magic of fairy tales. Join us as we escape to a new reality where modern princesses compete for the heart of their one true love, Prince Charming.



The home is 10,000 square feet and includes a boastful driveway where princesses will exit the carriage (limo) to meet the Prince Bachelor and be escorted through the enormous entryway. The house is staged perfectly with furniture, table settings, fireplaces, and a beautifully lush backyard that will create the ideal setting for this series.

Every single dollar we receive goes straight to making the production better looking, better sounding, and all around just more epic to watch. With your help we’re able to bring the worlds of The Bachelor and Disney Princesses to life in a 6 part mini series.
We'll be real - most of the money is going to the location. We're able to save a lot of money on costumes by casting cosplayers who already own them. We're able to shoot with a camera that a friend owns for an extremely discounted rate. We can produce high quality original music with real singers and a composer for 1/5 of the price it should cost. All of our cast and most of our crew are donating their time to work at no cost for us because they believe in the project. The location (even though deeply discounted) is our highest expense. Insurance and meals for the cast/crew are next and those are things we cannot avoid. Whatever we do not raise of our goal will come out of our pockets and production will be paused until we have what we need. 
So every donation, no matter how big or small, really does help! It involves the backer in the project itself, separating you from being just another viewer. We appreciate you and can't express enough how much we need you for this project to succeed. Let's make the magic happen! 

The Impact
Upon completion, this mini series will be released on YouTube and will be free to watch, like every single one of our productions. Men, women, girls, and boys will have access to 6 episodes of high quality, funny, and family friendly material. The essence of both The Bachelor and Disney Princesses will be portrayed and the potential audience will reach to all ages and places of the world. Did you know that our second highest watching country after the USA is India? That means that we're making someone smile across the world. And by providing free content, everyone has access to it. Our purpose with this mini series is to bring The Bachelor: Princess Edition to life to brighten the days of Disney Princess fans and Bachelor Nation lovers everywhere.
We've had thousands of comments on previous videos from people of all walks of life. Seeing their joy, even if it was just for the 5 minutes while watching a video, makes this all worth it. Spreading positivity and putting something driven by passion and not a paycheck into the world is the ultimate reward. 









We've been fortunate enough to even have the real actors we're making parodies of watch and comment about our projects! The impact and reach is endless with social media. 





We are raising the minimum amount of money needed to shoot at the location, purchase props, feed our cast & crew for 2 shooting days, secure insurance, record music, and supply the equipment needed to create the highest production value you're used to seeing from us on a minimal budget. The pie chart below explains how the money will be broken down between departments. 

What do you get out of it? We have pretty unique and exciting perks. If you've ever wanted your name listed in the credits of a video, these perks were made for you! Different leveled tiers include receiving Associate Producer, Co-Producer, and Executive Producer credit. And for just $1, your name automatically makes it in the credits alongside the cast and crew. Other rewards include a Set Visit, access to each episode before they are released, exclusive access to our behind the scenes feed, sneak peeks, and more!

Risks & Challenges
After our project is funded, we'll still run into risks and challenges with the actual logistics of running a film shoot and seeing it through post production. Something can always go wrong - and it usually does! Sometimes permits take longer than expected, an actor can drop out last minute, weather can affect outdoor shooting days, and so much more can happen to anyone shooting any kind of project, no matter how big or small. On our last big production-- Westworld Parody-- we actually had to reschedule our shooting date at Paramount Ranch (that we had planned on for 3 months) just a few days before due to a huge rainstorm that came through southern California. It was very stressful having to figure out all over again the availability of about 50 people at the last minute, but we managed to find a new date that worked with the majority of our cast and crew as well as the location without costing us much more than some re-booking fees.
Since this is our fourth large-scale production with Perfectly Serious, we believe we are ready to tackle problems we have run into in the past as well as any new ones that may arise. We face snags together as a team when they come and we always manage to pull through, one task at a time.


We get it. Sometimes there just isn't enough left over at the end of the day spare. We've been there. But that doesn't mean you can't help out in other ways free of charge! 

Help us spread the word and make some noise about this campaign! Send to as many people as you can and post on as many platforms as possible! 
Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! It makes sharing much, much easier.
Give what you can. If you want to donate more but can't, do the lower value tier. $1 goes further than you think. 

THANK YOU -FROM THE BOTTOM OF OUR HEARTS

story:
Project Summary

"The Change" is a docu-reality series being produced by Chris Circeo and me, Steven Crocker. The show will be shot by Victor Collins.  We are all recent graduates of Old Dominion University's Film and Television program and have worked together on multiple projects.  We are very excited to work together on "The Change!" 

The purpose of this docu-reality show is to enlighten viewers on volunteer opportunities in their area and inspire them to help.  We will do this by introducing viewers to volunteers with inspiring stories and deep roots in the organizations.  From these people, viewers will learn about both the organizations and the issues they are combatting. We have been blessed with the help of Susan Pleasants and Volunteer Hampton Roads to find non-profits to work with.

We will use a "Dirty Jobs" approach to volunteerism by putting a host in the field working with the aforementioned volunteers to act as the liaison between the audience and the organization. We want to have a call to action that permeates into our viewership and gets people interested in helping their community.

Every day we’re bombarded with the doom and gloom of the world around us, all the while ignoring the good that we, as a society, have to offer.  We would like to shine a light on the extraordinary things that people are doing to help their communities.  We believe there’s a story to tell and we believe this show will be a platform to tell it.   Everyone has a cause they believe in.  They just might not know it yet.

What We Need

We are seeking funding in the amount of $4,000 to cover the costs of shooting a series of pilot episodes of "The Change."  These pilot episodes will cover non-profits with areas of impact in homelessness, animal welfare, and health and wellness.  Chris and I are covering a lot of the pre-production costs out of our own pockets, however, we are not able to fund the entire production. The $4,000 DOES NOT include payment for us; we are so passionate about this that we are okay with volunteering our time to produce it. We are just going to be a skeleton crew to keep our costs as low as possible.

  • Host - We want the best from our host, so in order to ensure they are in it to win it, we need to compensate for their time. If the host we cast is from out of town, we will also need to pay to put her in a hotel for the duration of shooting.
  • Music - Obtaining licensing rights for music can sometimes be costly.  While royalty-free music does exist, sometimes there is a subscription fee to a database or a one-time fee to download music.
  • Storage - We need to buy a hard drive dedicated to backing up footage for The Change to ensure we don't lose everything we have.
  • Catering - 10-12 hour shooting days mean that our crew will have to be fed. We want to be able to provide a bountiful meal that will keep the crew's morale up.
  • Contingency - The fundraising goal is extremely low compared to what a network would pay to have the same thing produced. We have included a 10% contingency to cover any costs that may arise that we are not already anticipating. Indiegogo also takes a small percentage of the funds raised, so we want to  be sure that after that is deducted, we still have enough to shoot.

The Impact

The impact of contributing to "The Change" is huge.  By helping fund this show, you are helping increase volunteerism in the Hampton Roads area in a unique way.  I was an intern on the Hampton Roads based reality show "I Got This" (2015) and I can say from experience, there is something special about seeing your community on television in a different light than strictly on the news.

Risks and Challenges

A challenge we face is that even $4,000 isn't a lot of money to produce a show on the level that we want to produce "The Change," yet it is also a large amount of money to attempt to crowdfund. If we do not reach our goal, hopefully we will be significantly closer to it than we are now so that we can work to supplement ourselves. We will do the best with what we have.

Other Ways You Can Help

A final element that we would love to have in "The Change" are per-episode sponsorships.  If you or someone you know is a business owner and would like to make a tax-deductible donation to one of the non-profits we work with you can use this show as a medium to do so.  

It is understood that financial contributions cannot always be made.  We also value support given by spreading this campaign by sharing our Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and IMDB pages.

Thank you so much for your time and we hope you are able to be a part of "The Change!"

Sincerely,

Steven Crocker

Producer

story:
Welcome Back to WeHo...

When we last saw Nathan, Brad, Ross and Muscles on Amazon Prime Video, marriage-equality had just become the law of the land, and the atmosphere was filled with hope and excitement.

My, how things have changed! Where would our boys be now, five years later? Whatever happened to bitchy Nelson, loyal Lydia & steadfast Neal?

Lots of you want to know. There's only one catch:

$1,000 a Minute?!

That's right.  That's what our final 2016 special Where Were YOU When the Rights Went ON? cost. And we don't want to bring the show back without its trademark quality & production values!

Creator/writer Leon Acord has lots of top-secret ideas -- but how many we can incorporate is up to you!

If we reach our goal, we'll bring you 4-5 new episodes that will wrap our stories up. If we fall short, we'll still produce the proper finale our show -- and, more importantly, you, our loyal viewers -- deserve!

Won't you please help? And remember -- if you can't help financially please spread the word!  Sharing the news of our plans to come back is very helpful!   Thank you!

story:
Who are we?

  We are Weebl's Stuff, an animation company that makes silly cartoons and songs for both your ears and eyes. It's recently become extremely difficult for small companies like ours to distribute top quality content, because the usual outlets for this no longer reward smaller companies for the time and effort to get this work done. Increasingly we rely on our fanbase and reputation to help us make this content. Luckily for us, you guys have always been incredibly supportive, something we really appreciate.

 

Why BAD Advice?

  We get fan requests for content on a regular basis and BAD Advice has become the most requested. We have the ideas for a new set of five episodes, but unfortunately not the resources. With your help we can get these made and get the writers and animators paid for doing it. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need the funds to pay for the creation of the videos. That means initial writing and editing, the basic animation, voice work and finishing. The contribution we get will hopefully lead to all five episodes being made. Less might mean we can only make one or two. For your contribution you can see the final pieces when they're made. We will run all names of contributors in the end credits, because we think you deserve it. 

The Impact

Put very simply, without you there is no second series of BAD Advice. We don't have the funds to make it and make sure everyone involved is paid for their part. So your contribution means everything to us.

Risks & Challenges

The main risk as mentioned would be to not get full funding. Then we'd have to decide how best to allocate the funds to make sure we can get something made. We have an amazing, trusted team, so we know once the funds are in we can crack on and get these made. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Obviously telling people about our campaign would be a great help. Thank you

story:
Short Summary:

Greetings! My name is Khalil Perry and I'm the owner of Persist Print. We are an independent media source on lifestyle and culture amongst the 5 boroughs of NYC. Since 2015, we have been producing a non profit documentary series that entails all of the gems and authentic content that surrounds the five boroughs. So far, we have built up a strong and organic following behind releasing the first 3 chapters of this series by: word of mouth around NYC, event marketing and a solid social media presence. Please see the links above to view our various episodes and social media content below if you have not. 

As our followers know, the first three chapters of our series were 8 videos, each being very detailed and pertaining to: the pros and cons of NYC living, lifestyles and cultures within and amongst the 5 boroughs, and the diverse world of NYC artistry. Our content serves as both entertaining and educational. 

Chapters 4-9 will include approximately 12+ more videos that will focus on even more specific topics including: sex, gender and relationships, the melting pot culture, the economy that drives NYC, nightlife, social and political issues from around the 5 boroughs, the various holiday seasons and an interview by the creators behind this docu-series. (You can see more information about our docu web-series and its nine chapters at our website here: www.persistprint.com). 

Being that we have 100% self-funded the production fees up to this point, we need YOUR help in order to finish the rest of our docu-series and magnetize this content to the world... This is where you come in! Becoming a Sponsor for this project will not only include you in NYC digital arts history for years to come, but also includes you in a community focused on positive growth  and conversation through the use of digital media.

Sponsor contributors will help with: the remaining 5-10 % of filming, the remaining 30% of editing, audio mixing for chapters 4-9, PR / Marketing Needs, Screening Events, and our overall growth as a brand aimed to give back sociological entertainment to a diversity of communities. 

 

What We Need & What You Get:

We are asking for $20,000 in order to:

  • complete the remaining 5-10 % of filming. - this includes fees for the remaining: restaurants, venues, museums, events, and other interesting locations up for filming consideration.
  • complete the remaining 30% of editing.- this includes the fees for final cuts and editing assistance for the remaining chapters.
  • complete audio mixing for chapters 4-9. - this allows us to finish getting our audio mixed and mastered at the Brewery Studio in Brooklyn, NY. 
  • fund a marketing and/or screening event(s) in NYC.- this will assists us in having a personal and fun event (or 2) at a venue in the NYC area. Some of these funds will also be contributed to public relations and digital marketing outreach.
  • any remaining funds will be used to jumpstart our overall growth as a brand, aimed to give back sociological entertainment to a diversity of communities. 

By helping us, you can receive a variety of perks that will forever make you apart of our digital arts movement in New York City.  We are looking for a fresh way to grow a successful community of the next generations creatives, that are interested in exploring various environments and being creative while doing so. Being apart of this as a sponsor at a minimum gives you the exposure to do so and a personal connection to us!

You can also receive some cool merchandise from our budding merch brand including but not limited to: Dad Hats, Mugs, and more!

If we are unsuccessful in reaching our goal, all funds collected will contribute to the production fees and the final audio mastering of our docu-series.

 

The Impact

Persist Print has come a LONG way since our initial launch in 2015. We have learned so much through various trials and eras, and couldn't be more excited to say that we are growing in the correct direction! When we first started this brand, we wanted to show the world how diverse and captivating our home environment is. Eventually, it grew to be even bigger than that, as it began serving as an educative and sociological project on life in the big city. 

At the end of the day, WE NEED YOU to get across the finish line. Being a small team of a handful of friends from NYC who have gathered this much independent success around our project, it should show how serious we are about being positive contributors to the world.  We have already made connections in the world of media linking up with the following since the launch of PP: Showtime Networks, Disney , MLB.com , OvationTV, BronxNet,  Martin Luther School - Maspeth, Queens Central Library, legendary NYC artists, FlipdaScript Podcast, and other influencers and publications from around the world. 

We are hoping that the completion of #NYCVisDoc will set the tone for us to do even better and more interesting productions in the near future as we continue to grow our media brand! The value in creative media and a connection to the people of the world will forever be our goal here at Persist Print!

 

Risks & Challenges

Luckily for us, we have completed most of the projects filming and editing. Therefore, our biggest challenge is the completion of our project in a timely matter, while using the most efficient tools possible. Regardless if we reach our goal or not, we still plan to release the remaining docu-episodes. However, it will just be at a slower rate and a lower production quality. In a society where constant content and high production is a must in the world of interactive media, we don't want to fall behind the standards of our following. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If for some reason you can't or don't want to contribute to our funding campaign, you can always help us by interacting with any of our content and/or social media pages. We are always looking for feedback and new viewership! You can also share this campaign with those that you feel would be interested.  Please see the following links below for what we have already released on Youtube, Instagram, and our other various media sources:

Instagram Page - www.instagram.com/persistprint

Youtube Channel - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpwr-rm4rB87F5s-aqIrPgw

Facebook Page - www.facebook.com/persistprint

Twitter Page - www.twitter.com/persistprint

Our Website - www.persistprint.com

At the end of the day, WE NEED YOU to get across the finish line. Being a small team of a handful of friends from NYC who have gathered this much independent success around our project, it should show how serious we are about being positive contributors to the world.  We have already made connections in the world of media linking up with the following since the launch of PP: Showtime Networks, Disney , MLB.com , OvationTV, BronxNet,  Martin Luther School - Maspeth, Queens Central Library, legendary NYC artists, FlipdaScript Podcast, and other influencers and publications from around the world. 
We are hoping that the completion of #NYCVisDoc will set the tone for us to do even better and more interesting productions in the near future as we continue to grow our media brand! The value in creative media and a connection to the people of the world will forever be our goal here at Persist Print!
 

Risks & Challenges
Luckily for us, we have completed most of the projects filming and editing. Therefore, our biggest challenge is the completion of our project in a timely matter, while using the most efficient tools possible. Regardless if we reach our goal or not, we still plan to release the remaining docu-episodes. However, it will just be at a slower rate and a lower production quality. In a society where constant content and high production is a must in the world of interactive media, we don't want to fall behind the standards of our following. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If for some reason you can't or don't want to contribute to our funding campaign, you can always help us by interacting with any of our content and/or social media pages. We are always looking for feedback and new viewership! You can also share this campaign with those that you feel would be interested.  Please see the following links below for what we have already released on Youtube, Instagram, and our other various media sources:
Instagram Page - www.instagram.com/persistprint
Youtube Channel - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpwr-rm4rB87F5s-aqIrPgw
Facebook Page - www.facebook.com/persistprint
Twitter Page - www.twitter.com/persistprint
Our Website - www.persistprint.com

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm J. Nance retired Deputy Sheriff turn Writer/Director.  After 13 years of law enforcement and two degrees I walked away and relocated to Atlanta to pursue my true passion of writing and producing tv shows. 

30331 is an American drama series set in Atlanta, GA and created by J. Nance.  The show centers on two very different uniformed police officers as they pursue the perpetrators of the Atlanta streets in the 30331 zip code. This character-driven drama will keep you on the edge of your seats while you cheer for your favorite characters and curse some others.

Think Power meets New Jack City.

This campaign is imperative to the completion of this series. I am asking those that can afford it to help support our project.  I promise to treat every donation with my deepest gratitude and accountability. I've thought very carefully about the perks

What We Need & What You Get

The magic number is $5000 yep that's our goal. With these funds we can finish filming season one of 30331. We have been given a distribution deal pending the we can produce 6 episodes. We can't do it without you. So join the team and let's live the dream!!

  • Pre-Production
  • Production
  • Craft Services
  • Post Production
  • Covid19 Safety Precautions 

This campaign is imperative to the completion of this series. We are asking those that can afford it to help support our project.  We promise to treat every donation with our deepest gratitude and accountability. We've thought very carefully about the perk and we didn't want it to feel like a quid pro quo but like an experience. Here are some of the experiences you can look forward to:     

Perks:

 Thank you

Autographed Cast Poster

Digital Download of Soundtrack

Director's video thank you

Limited Designed 30331 T-Shirt

Director's Working Script

Product Placement

LIGHTS, CAMERA, ACTION! 

ASSOCIATE PRODUCER CREDIT

PRODUCER CREDIT

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER

 

Risks & Challenges

  • Working during the pandemic (SAFETY FIRST)
  • If you know anything about Atlanta, GA you know our weather is very unpredictable and we film both indoors and outdoors

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that there are people who want to support but can't financially

  • Please help us by getting word out SHARE SHARE AND SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN
  • Follow the show on IG @30331tvseries

story:
Desconocidxs, es un equipo de estudiantes que se dedica actualmente a la grabación de una web serie. Es nuestro primer proyecto a lo grande, por ello, queremos hacerlo lo más profesional posible. De esta manera, sois vosotros los que podéis hacerlo realidad.

 

El presupuesto que queremos recaudar no es demasiado elevado (alrededor de 500-600€), sin embargo es lo que necesitamos por capítulo para la debida grabación. Esto significa que queremos traeros lo mejor de lo mejor.

 

Ahora mismo no podemos compensaros con nada de valor, pero a partir del sexto capítulo estamos dispuestos a abonar ciertos productos de la serie a todas aquellas personas que nos ayuden con sus donaciones. Nadie se va a quedar sin nada, porque todos y todas ganamos.

 

El impacto que intentamos dar con nuestro proyecto no se queda en la ficción, queremos llevar un mensaje de protesta, y revolucionarlo todo. Aunque... tampoco vamos a dejar el spoiler por aquí...

 

Entendemos que muchas personas no son capaces de ayudar económicamente. Por eso mismo, puedes participar en la campaña compartiendo con toda la gente posible, tanto el mensaje, como nuestro proyecto. Queremos llegar al máximo número de personas, y eso, te incluye a ti.

story:
Since the beginning of COVID-19 restrictions in mid-March, my wife, Vasthy, and I have live streamed literally hundreds of Zoom shows out of our LA apartment. Now we're looking towards the entire future, not just these quarantine times, to build an ongoing equitable business model that gives work to those who need it, rewards the creativity of those who deserve it, and spreads joy to kids & parents who love it.

So that's exactly what we're doing with Vasthy's Friends

Vasthy's Friends is a video platform featuring Broadway performers who write, choreograph, and compose original kid-friendly programming. Singers singing, Dancers dancing, Storytellers storyteller'ing-- all while employing out-of-work theater folks to provide engaging & educational entertainment for families everywhere.

It's Mr. Rogers meets Broadway!

It's Reading Rainbow with pride flags!

It's Sesame Street with eight counts & quick changes!

Vasthy is a first-generation Haitian-American who grew up in Alabama and went on to be in eight Broadway shows having never seen herself represented on film, TV, or stage. I am a black man from the Northeast who spent 15+ years writing & performing spoken word poetry for school kids. Vasthy's Friends is dedicated to normalizing blackness and authentic representation across the board. It is important for all kids to be able to see themselves reflected back with a smile.

Like everyone on Earth, we've had to adapt to this new world the best we can using only the tools that happened to be at arm's reach. Lucky for us, that included my video equipment and extensive live streaming experience, so we were able to pull off what we've done so far. In order to bring Vasthy's Friends to the next level, however, we need help to:

1) Provide great quality video & audio equipment to our remote guest artists

2) Get our ducks in a row, business-wise (incorporating, copyrighting, setting the books, etc)

3) Pay the artists

To pull text directly from the Vasthy's Friends website:

"It's no secret that necessary fundamental changes to 'business as usual' in the world of Broadway and live theater as a whole are upon us. Part of this new standard should be that all Broadway performers receive royalties from projects they help create. Proceeds from Vasthy's Friends are split equitably among the artists whose creative contributions are the lifeblood of not only this platform, but every original show ever staged."

In other words, Vasthy's Friends is a subscription-based video platform with a profit-sharing model built in. The artists are paid upfront AND receive an ongoing percentage share of revenue.

For this GoFundMe, we do need to raise a base amount to launch, but every dollar beyond our goal will go towards paying more artists to create more content for the platform.

Financial stability for more creators = More singing, dancing, and smiles for kids!

Thanks for believing in what we do!

-Mason & Vasthy

story:
We're moving to Amazon Prime!

After two crowd-funded episodes, Cavendish is now a distributor for Prime. That means after we fundraise and shoot the next installment, we will remove episodes 1-2 from YouTube and put all three on the Amazon Prime platform. We want to provide longevity of career for our cast and crew with the possibility of a return on investment for future episodes or a full Season 1, and this is the best way for us to move in that direction.

Budget for Episode 3:   £2,500

Our biggest cast (with new recurring characters) and double the crew members required on set, moving furniture and props in, feeding and caffeinating this crowd will cost £2,500

  • Location x2 days: £400.00

  • Cast: £180.00 // 6 actors @ £30 each, flat rate for both days
  • Supporting artists/background: £75 // 5 SAs @ £15 for one dayCrew: £420.00 // 14 crew @ £30 each, flat rate for both days.
  • Catering: £200 to feed all cast and crew for both days
  • Van hire for moving props and furniture to set: £100.00
  • Travel reimbursement for all cast and crew: £285.00
  • Rehearsal and callback audition space during pre-production: £55.00
  • Wardrobe for 8 girls that need to be custom made: £400.00
  • Relevant licenses for Cavendish theme song and some stock footage for credits to be used on Amazon Prime from ep3: £225
  • Episode 3 relevant printing requirements: £60.00
  • Buffer: £100.00

We are a different kind of show

  • Cavendish is about the transformation and redemption of the cast of characters rather than creating drama for drama's sake with no realistic positive outcome. 
  • Anti-mean girl and anti-bullying storyline with family-friendly language.
  • 3,500 views on YouTube between ep1-2, and it's time to offer the show to a wider audience.
  • Ensemble cast: whilst the central character is Gracie Bennett, the show will regularly introduce and tell the stories of the people who make up Cavendish - which means we can offer many opportunities for actors to audition and be part of the cast or guest-starring roles.

Other Ways You Can Help

Be an alumnus of Cavendish in several ways

  • Join as a backer, which means you also get perks in exchange for the level of financial support you give. Perks range from signed scripts, photos from the set on a postcard sent to your front door, official portraits taken by our photographer on location of actors in character, social media shoutouts and more.
  • If the 'fuss' or the perks aren't for you, you can support Cavendish through Indiegogo via the 'contribution' button and give any amount, OR go to our website and use the DONATE button to give through PayPal
  • Watch our show, or behind the scenes videos on YouTube?
  • Share our links via email, text, or social media?
  • Tell a friend about Cavendish?
  • Speak up to someone you think might want to invest in the show?

story:
My Story

Hi everyone! My name is Nicole O. Johnson, I am better known as Harriyanna Hook on YouTube. I am a an actor, writer, blogger, and model. I am a theatre major at Clayton State University. I have been in numerous short films and have featured on The CW shows, Black Lightning, and Legacies. I have been a big fan of Disney's Descendants since they announced that they would be making it. Descendants is a very important part of my life as it has helped me during my hardships. Because of these I have made amazing friends and have gotten wonderful opportunities. 

One thing about Descendants is that I loved the characters. Everyone was so interesting and I began to write about them in my free time. I put my stories up for people to read, and many have enjoyed them. I've been wanting to bring my stories to life for about a year now; I finally have built up the courage to do so. I am currently developing a fan series called, The Progenies.

This show is not only for me, but for the fans. Descendants has a large 18 and up fan base and they were so excited when I announced I was going to be making a more realistic a mature version of the franchise. I love acting and writing so much it would mean the world for me to be able to do that with something I adore.

What We Need

Any donation will help. We need funds for props, water, snacks, transportation, locations, costumes, and materials we need to keep everyone safe because of Covid-19; such as face masks, soaps, individually packaged meals, hand sanitizer, wipes. We pulled the money together ourselves to film the pilot, and it cost us over $2,500. We have twelve more episodes of season one to film. It is going to cost us more throughout the season as more characters will be introduced.  It's looking like we will need around $30,000. I can put $5,000 of my own money towards it to get it down to $25,000. But even it we don't meet out goal, I have grateful for whatever we get. We will find a way for this show to still happen. 

 

The Impact

I've expressed numerous times on my channel and blog that Descendants represents many of their characters of color poorly. We are adding the much need diversity to this show along with other social issues that need to be talked about from childhood trauma, toxic friendships, being a caregiver for your siblings, mental illness, and making terrible mistakes that hurt those you love the most. We are making this show as a giveback to the fans who have felt as if this franchise portrayed them in a negative light, and to see their favorite character in a different perspective. 

 

Risks & Challenges

We are taking the chance on numerous actors of color to contribute to this fictional world. We know that many people will have an issue with the things discussed in the show, but that's life. There will be no nudity or sexual content, but their will be scenes that are very emotional. Descendants never went too deep with it came to feelings and we are taking that next step to make it powerful. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, I completely understand. Sharing out project with the public is great. We aren't making this show for the money, we are making it for the fans. Getting the word out to other people means the world to us. The Progenies is a gift to Descendants fans. The fanbase may be small, but we just want to let them know that we see them, and we care.

story:
GOAL

Current Goal: $1000

We started our goal at $500 week one and smashed our goal!

Short Summary

Produced by Mya Stengel and Julia Stitely, Fathoms Below is a coming-of-age ICTV series that follows the adventures of Syd and Kai, freshman roommates as they navigate college life, and the ambitious biology professor Harris Hawthorne, all the while keeping the secret that one of them is a mermaid.

  • Mya Stengel is a freshman attending Ithaca college in order to learn more about Writing in Hollywood and audio production. Fathoms Below became important to her when her friend Julia Stitely proposed the idea of a mermaid show. A month passed before the pilot was written and submitted and another month before they heard the news of their acceptance. Since then Mya has spent every week putting hours and work into creating this project. Building a team, creating a cast, and writing scripts. She could not be more excited to see how the show turns out!
  • Julia Stitely is a Writing for Film, TV, and Emerging Media major at Ithaca College, hoping to learn more and write scripts that will tell important stories. Fathoms Below started because of her and her friend, Mya’s, passion for wanting to do a mermaid show. When the opportunity came, they jumped at the chance. Every day has been dedicated to writing and making the show come to life and that help couldn’t be done without the hard work from the team. 
  • Though without help from our contributors we cannot mirror the excitement and thrill of this fantasy world quite as much. With only a few contributions we will be able to fly higher than we ever expected to before and build an immersive world of college, magic, and mermaids! She can't wait to see the magic happen!

What We Need & What You Get

So to break it down--

  • Currently, we have a starting budget of $100 dollars provided to us by our school, but our goal is to reach a budget of $500 dollars by September.
  • Some things that we have already begun to list as a production necessity include a somewhat realistic mermaids tail fitted to our main actor, a medium-sized outdoor pool, and some cheap lab equipment. Though we do also know we will need multiple outfits for our cast along with props to fill the scene and college decor to decorate our sets.
  • Once the show completes the post-production stage we will be able to release episodes for anyone to watch. Meaning that you will be able to see what your contributions did for us on-screen while also enjoying a delightful and thrilling story along the way!

The Impact

Fathoms Below has been a passion project for months now, starting out as a shared joke and what has now become a reality! We cannot wait to present the struggles and triumphs of Syd and Kai on-screen next semester

Risks & Challenges

This is an Ithaca College-supported television production so there are little to no risks involved. One way or another this series will be made! However, because this is a student film we rely on donations and other fundraising opportunities to fund our project so as to promise the quality of film to our viewers

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the funds then that is entirely okay! We are all just trying to get by in this world with what we have. There are other ways to get involved!

  • Share our campaign with your friends!
  • Comment on our promo videos to generate buzz!

And that's all there is to it. I hope you found our pitch to be intriguing and worthwhile! We love what we're doing here and can't wait to share it with you!

With only a few contributions we will be able to fly higher than we ever expected to before and build an immersive world of college, magic, and mermaids! She can't wait to see the magic happen!


What We Need & What You Get
So to break it down--

Currently, we have a starting budget of $100 dollars provided to us by our school, but our goal is to reach a budget of $500 dollars by September.
Some things that we have already begun to list as a production necessity include a somewhat realistic mermaids tail fitted to our main actor, a medium-sized outdoor pool, and some cheap lab equipment. Though we do also know we will need multiple outfits for our cast along with props to fill the scene and college decor to decorate our sets.
Once the show completes the post-production stage we will be able to release episodes for anyone to watch. Meaning that you will be able to see what your contributions did for us on-screen while also enjoying a delightful and thrilling story along the way!


The Impact
Fathoms Below has been a passion project for months now, starting out as a shared joke and what has now become a reality! We cannot wait to present the struggles and triumphs of Syd and Kai on-screen next semester

Risks & Challenges
This is an Ithaca College-supported television production so there are little to no risks involved. One way or another this series will be made! However, because this is a student film we rely on donations and other fundraising opportunities to fund our project so as to promise the quality of film to our viewers

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute to the funds then that is entirely okay! We are all just trying to get by in this world with what we have. There are other ways to get involved!

Share our campaign with your friends!
Comment on our promo videos to generate buzz!

And that's all there is to it. I hope you found our pitch to be intriguing and worthwhile! We love what we're doing here and can't wait to share it with you!

story:
Who are we?

JA & M Productions Inc,  is a television production company based in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  We are dedicated  to producing socially relevant, edgy and energetic content, primarily for dramatic television.  J A & M proudly presents Geography Club - The Television Series.

Based on the acclaimed novel by Brent Hartinger,  this series is an adaptation of the feature film, released in 2013.  Set in the mountainous backdrop and high plains of Goodkind, Idaho,  the series  follows the lives of Russell Middlebrook, and his friends,  as they journey through adolescence and young adulthood, and encounter triumph and tragedy, and love and loss along the way.

Geography Club talks about the importance of community, friendship and finding strength in a scary, and difficult point in one's life, most notably high school.  The universal theme  that we can all relate to is no matter what you're going through in life,  be true to yourself  and let who you are shine through.

The team behind this production, includes the executive producers of the feature film,  Frederick Levy & Bryan Leder.   Edmund Entin  and Gary Entin have penned  a script that  is emotional, dramatic, sexy and shocking.

A number of actors from the feature film, will be reprising their roles.  You will also see a new class of students at Goodkind High, each bringing their own story to the series.

Contributors will help us produce the premiere episode of Geography Club. It will help us fund this project so we can continue the story, which fans have been waiting for, for so long.

What We Need:

All the funds will be used in the creation of Geography Club-The Television Series, episode #1.

Why Donate?

Join us on our journey back to  Goodkind, Idaho.  You'll see familiar faces, new beginnings and  stories that will motivate, inspire, and tug at the heart strings!!

You will be eligible to receive rewards exclusive to those pledging through this Indiegogo page. Have a look at the rewards column -  getting a perk is like placing a pre-order for the project once it's done.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that's okay, but here are some other ways you can help:

Spread the word about the series by sharing our Official Instagram/Facebook/Twitter pages to get it ready for it's release. (@GeographyClubTV).  You can also visit us on IMDb, or on our website, www.jaandmproductions.com.

story:
What is Shot Reverse Shot?

We are a student-run organization based out of the University of Missouri - Columbia with the sole goal with giving students the experience of creating serialized content in the form of a web series. More simply put, we try to make a web series every single year! Earlier in 2018 we released our first show, Grand Theft Autumn, and now we're excited to bring you Down The Rabbit Hole in April 2019! 

One issue though...we're poor college students. That's where you come in! SRS wants to give you the chance to help us create a memorable and fun experience that everyone can enjoy. Our cast and crew has put in a lot of hard work and countless hours to make Down The Rabbit Hole a reality and your assistance can help improve our quality while also allowing you to become an essential part of our team.

What We Need

Our goal is simple. We need to fund the production of each of our episodes. Until this point each director has been paying for props, catering, and materials for their episodes and often spending hundreds of dollars in the process. 

If our goal is met we can help reduce the amount of money straight from our pockets and hopefully allow SRS to focus on our continual growth. Here's where we hope to be spending the money we raise.

Of the $2000 dollars we hope to raise:

$600 is going towards Props and Costumes.

$400 is going towards Craft Services and Food.

$200 dollars is going towards Equipment Necessities. (batteries, mole skins, etc.).

$200 is going towards creating and delivering YOUR rewards!

$100 is going towards Website Management.

$100 is going towards Promotional Fees.

$100 is going towards Indie GoGo Fees.

Which leaves us with $300 dollars worth of Safety Net Funds just in case things go wrong.

Even if we don't make it to our goal we will allocate the money where it needs to go so that we can make the best show possible. 

Now let's talk REWARDS

We know that you don't have to donate money to us, so that fact that you're even considering it means so much to us. We thought long and hard about what we could offer you to make it worth your while, and we think they're pretty good. A lot of the rewards are designed to be personal and interesting gifts that will hopefully make this process positive and memorable for you! 

This includes:

  • Shout Out Videos
  • Character Portraits
  • Postcard Poems
  • DVDs
  • T-Shirts
  • And more!

The Impact

Shot Reverse Shot's primary focus is to give authentic and educational training for future filmmakers at the University of Missouri. It's an incredibly valuable and rewarding experience for all those involved and we hope to continue this tradition in the future. It's our goal to bring together a creative community that can work together to make something that they can truly be proud of. YOUR donation helps us make this possible, and for that we truly thank you. 

The Cast of Down The Rabbit Hole

Joseph "Joe"  Granat: Matt Sullivan

Born August 27, 1999 in Plainfield, Illinois, USA, Joe made his theatrical debut at the age of 12 and has acted ever since. Joseph Granat attends the University of Missouri at Columbia where he studies journalism.

He plays the role of "Matt" - A naive freshmen just looking to make friends in the terrifying world of college and in doing so allows himself to be dragged into a series of events he never could have anticipated.

Clotilda "Chloe" DeMauro: Alice Holly

Chloe is from New Canaan, Connecticut. She is a junior majoring in documentary journalism and minoring in film and theater at the University of Missouri. Clotilda aspires to be an actress, singer and documentary filmmaker.

She plays the role of "Alice" - A talented troubled writer and poet who's work has recently turned from inquisitive and optimistic to macabre and remorseful, and no one is sure why.

Ramsey Wise: Professor John Elrits

Ramsay is an educator, musician, actor, and painter from Columbia, Missouri. As an instructor in the Film Studies department at the University of Missouri he specializes in film history, theory and analysis. Ramsay has appeared in numerous short films including Chamomile, in which he co-starred with his daughter, The Promised Land, Daddy and By Bad Days End. He hopes one day to die an interesting death so that his paintings might increase in value.

He plays the role of "Professor Elrits" -  A cold, and  analytical professor of an advanced poetry construction class at Clavis University.  He and Alice were once extremely close, and he oftentimes would help her with her writing in whatever free time he had.

Moira Johnson: Jordyn Everette

Moira  is from Washington D.C. This is her first TV role, although she has supported friends by being in many on campus short films. One day she hopes to direct her own TV show. She also enjoys comedy, singing, running, animals and pageants.

She plays the role of "Jordyn" - An incredibly laid back and informal student at Clavis, and the only person who has ever seemed to be genuinely close with Alice. She has an almost unbreakable bond with her best friend Chester and the two often find themselves getting into loads of trouble.

Charlie Durham: Chester Cage

Charlie Durham is from Los Angeles, California. He played the illustrious role of “Box Guy” in Shot Reverse Shot’s Grand Theft Autumn has been in multiple plays at the University of Missouri. Charlie hopes that one day he’ll be able to move back to LA and get his career started in acting and stand up comedy.

He plays the role of "Chester" - An excitable and fun guy, that fails to take nearly anything seriously. He can be somewhat antagonistic in his actions, always stirring up chaos for the fun of it, thus becoming known as the life of the party everywhere he goes.

Serena Stoddard: Rachel

Serena  was born and raised in Louisville, KY. She is an actor and model within the entertainment/film industry. She has worked as extras/model in several commercials for Procter & Gamble, Great Wolf Lodge, Hershey World, Hampton Inn and Hudson Learning Center. She also has worked in some short films and music videos for Healthy Beginnings, The Parent Project and Standard Publishing. Serena hopes to be a professional actor/ veterinarian in the future, and possibly have a wildlife show and work in movies.

She plays the role of "Rachel" - A mysterious entity that only Alice can see, often reminding her of things she'd rather forget.

Risks & Challenges

It's the movie business baby, there are risks and challenges abound. One of our biggest issues is, and always has been, scheduling. College life just isn't meant for the rigorous production schedule we'd like it to be, but we've always found a way. We work tirelessly to make sure we are able to produce our content in a timely manner so that we can release ON TIME!

Other Ways You Can Help

Trust us when we say, we understand if you can't donate. We're college students. We get it. You can still help in other ways though:

  • Share our crowdfunding page on social media!
  • Follow @ShotRevShot on Social Media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram)
  • Tell your family and friends.
  • Subscribe to us on Youtube! Maybe give Grand Theft Autumn a watch.
  • Be a cool and loving person

story:
Short Summary                                                                             When Dre Robinson & Rebecca Jackson-Artis created the web series TOTALLY BECKY they envisioned a show that would speak to the often forgotten voices not heard on Network TV and most streaming platforms. They wanted a show that spoke to Black and Brown people, especially Black women. This vision extended beyond what was on screen but behind the scenes as well. The TOTALLY BECKY production consists of 80% Women and 80% Black & Brown People. These are numbers that you won't find in Hollywood and Network TV.  The TOTALLY BECKY production is a beautiful representation of the world around us. 

But in order for us to continue to bring you more of this beautiful representation we need your financial help. We need financial help to continue the great work we have already started on our Award Winning Webseries TOTALLY BECKY. 

What We Need & What You Get

Projects like ours are usually funded right out of the filmmakers own pockets. Because of technology, digital content is far cheaper than it has ever been, but it still takes a lot of money to bring to the screen.  

Our campaign to raise $5000 in 5 weeks will help us finish 2 episodes that have already been shot as well as produce the 4th and final episode of the season entitled "I LOVE BLACK MEN" A musical about the struggle of our black men in todays society.  We then will release the full season of TOTALLY BECKY this spring on our YouTube Channel. 

Our I Got 5 On It Campaign is only asking for $5 donations.(you can definitely donate more if you like) We know times are hard and we also know that all of your friends and family members have already hit you up for donations to their campaigns. So whether you donate $5 or just a $1 a week we are blessed either way because your donation shows that you believe in what we are doing and what we are trying to accomplish. 

If you donate $50 or more you get to see The Pilot Episode of TOTALLY BECKY that was the Winner of The Best Web series Award at The Middle Coast Film Festival. It was accepted to 8 film festivals across the country and Canada as well as 2 Best Actress Nominations for our Star & Co Creator Rebecca Jackson-Artis. 

If, by some reason, we do not reach our goal of $5000, we will take whatever money is raised and put it towards finishing the episodes that have already been shot. 

The Creators

Dre Robinson  The Director/Co-Creator/Producer

Dre Robinson is a writer, director, producer, and editor who was born and raised in Chicago. He started his career in theatre, working with some of the top theatre companies in the world including The Goodman Theatre,The Second City, and Congo Square Theatre Company. With

over 20 years of experience, Dre has produced a number of film and theatrical productions. He has worked with Nike, Wells Fargo, and Fisk University. Dre’s passion for film started when he was a child. He studied theatre at USC and film at Columbia College Chicago. “Ever since my mom took me out of school to go see Raiders of the Lost Ark, I knew that I wanted to be a part of this magical world”.

Rebecca Jackson-Artis The Writer/Co-Creator/Producer/Star

Rebecca Jackson-Artis is an actor, writer, and comedian from Chicago. She has almost 20 years of experience in the performing arts business. She performed in numerous theatrical productions at world-renowned theatre companies including The Second City and MPAACT Theatre Company. She is the creator and producer of another web series called In The Midst of Morons. Rebecca earned a bachelor of arts degree from Hampton University in theatre arts-performance and a

master of fine arts from the University of Georgia in screenwriting. She is also a graduate of The Second City Conservatory. Ever since she was a child, she has known she was meant to be an actor and wanted to inspire the world with her stories. Rebecca lives with her family in Raleigh, North Carolina.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We know times are hard and not everyone can help us financially. Thats ok(we're artist, we TOTALLY understand) you can support us by sharing our campaign.  Share it on all your social media outlets. Talk us up in casual conversations. Spread, spread, spread the word by any means necessary. The more people that know, the more we grow. 
  • Like us on Facebook: facebook.com/totallybecky
  • Follow Us on Instagram: @totallybeckywebseries
  • Follow Us on Twitter: @totallybecky
  • Subscribe to our Youtube Channel: Youtube.com/TotallyBecky

Other Ways You Can Help

We know times are hard and not everyone can help us financially. Thats ok(we're artist, we TOTALLY understand) you can support us by sharing our campaign.  Share it on all your social media outlets. Talk us up in casual conversations. Spread, spread, spread the word by any means necessary. The more people that know, the more we grow. 
Like us on Facebook: facebook.com/totallybecky
Follow Us on Instagram: @totallybeckywebseries
Follow Us on Twitter: @totallybecky
Subscribe to our Youtube Channel: Youtube.com/TotallyBecky

story:
This project started almost a year ago when we launched a screenwriting contest at DePaul University with the aim of connecting writers with production students by asking them to write an original series . The prize? Getting their series produced. This is the execution of that promise.

This opportunity is unique in that it gives us as students the opportunity to produce something very close to that of a TV show at least in style, structure and story if not in length. This is the best way for a lot of students to experience something simply not available to them if not for this opportunity since most TV shows would only allow them to intern or be an assistant, this allows us to gain experience in real roles doing the work film professionals really do.

The show is about Amy Laurel, a small town florist who was mistreated by her ex husband, Jasper Teller who she used to run the her flower shop with. This begins her quest to rid the world of cheaters and abusers. To do it she uses her unique knowledge of plants and their many poisons in an attempt to hide her trail. As tension mounts and the police close in, Amy's criteria for killing become broader and broader.  What will happen if the police find out who the killer really is?

Crystal Antonio, Creator

Crystal Antonio is the writer/creator of The Florist. She is currently finishing up her MFA at DePaul in screenwriting. 

Jeffrey Podany, Exec. Producer/ Show Runner

Jeffrey Podany is a Junior at DePaul studying production. He created the screenwriting contest which this script came out of and wrote this page.... He's also directing part of the series and is in charge of most of the creative decisions related to it as show runner....

Leah Thomas,  Producer

Leah Thomas is a Junior at DePaul University. She's studying screenwriting. She originally thought that she would be doing costumes on this show but is now learning the ins and outs of producing... Someday she hopes to create and run her own television show.  

Marcus Aubin, Director

Marcus Aubin is a Sophomore at DePaul. He's studying production as well and his main focus is directing. He just premiered his short film Medicine (which had a very successful indiegogo) recently and is excited to work on a new and interesting project. He will be directing part of the series.

Julio Padilla, Director

Julio Padilla is a grad student at DePaul who is very interested in production. He will be directing a portion of the series. 

Brandon Hoeg, Supervising Cinematographer

Brandon currently studies cinematography at DePaul University. He's loved making movies from a young age. He thoroughly enjoys the collaboration process that goes into filmmaking, more than anything. 

Angela Mcllvain, Art Director

Angela Mcllvain is a fourth year scenic design student at DePaul's Theatre school. She's designing all of the sets and environments for this show.

Madison Briede, Costume Designer 

Madison is a fourth year costume design student at DePaul's theatre school.  She loves retro and vintage designs so she's especially excited to work on this show in particular!

But wait... There's more! This is a big project that needs a bunch of crew to make it possible so here they are:

Andrew Ochwat 1st AD William Ackerman 2nd AD

Julianna Hartke Script supervisor 

Max Rood DP  Jaxi Alegria Gaffer 

Robert Pate Art Hand/Indiegogo video maker Michael Koenig Props  

Zoe Krueger Makeup Allison Millar Costume Assistant

Manuel Rodriguez Sound Anna Henderson Sound

Bryce Broadrick Sound/Indiegogo video Chloe Erb Editor

Patrick Hoffacker Assist Editor   Phoebe Bostwick DIT

Ben Bruskin Music Supervisor   Keith Sutton  Storyboard artist  

Maggie Armendariz Production Artist/Art for this page

* This represents the crew at the time this page was written, more people are being added on a daily basis.*

 

$8000 may seem like a lot of money, but for a production this size thats a very boot strap budget. We are getting our equipment for free from DePaul which saves us a significant portion of money. However, producing a  five episode series that totals around 35 minutes costs quite a bit of money across food/transportation for our 20+ person crew,  the cast, location fees, costumes,  dressing our amazing sets and props.  Point is, all money donated goes directly to support production of the show and to do such a great script justice requires a lot of resources. You can see a breakdown of our budget below.

As with any film production there are always going to be a number of challenges, but we will do our best to overcome any obstacles in our way.  We have a great team in place so those issues shouldn't be too hard to overcome. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time it would really help us out if you could share our campaign on whatever platforms you use so that those who can contribute can hear about our campaign that would be swell!

No questions yet. Will be updated as they come in.
story_txt:
This project started almost a year ago when we launched a screenwriting contest at DePaul University with the aim of connecting writers with production students by asking them to write an original series . The prize? Getting their series produced. This is the execution of that promise.
This opportunity is unique in that it gives us as students the opportunity to produce something very close to that of a TV show at least in style, structure and story if not in length. This is the best way for a lot of students to experience something simply not available to them if not for this opportunity since most TV shows would only allow them to intern or be an assistant, this allows us to gain experience in real roles doing the work film professionals really do.

The show is about Amy Laurel, a small town florist who was mistreated by her ex husband, Jasper Teller who she used to run the her flower shop with. This begins her quest to rid the world of cheaters and abusers. To do it she uses her unique knowledge of plants and their many poisons in an attempt to hide her trail. As tension mounts and the police close in, Amy's criteria for killing become broader and broader.  What will happen if the police find out who the killer really is?

Crystal Antonio, Creator

Crystal Antonio is the writer/creator of The Florist. She is currently finishing up her MFA at DePaul in screenwriting. 
Jeffrey Podany, Exec. Producer/ Show Runner

Jeffrey Podany is a Junior at DePaul studying production. He created the screenwriting contest which this script came out of and wrote this page.... He's also directing part of the series and is in charge of most of the creative decisions related to it as show runner....
Leah Thomas,  Producer

Leah Thomas is a Junior at DePaul University. She's studying screenwriting. She originally thought that she would be doing costumes on this show but is now learning the ins and outs of producing... Someday she hopes to create and run her own television show.  
Marcus Aubin, Director

Marcus Aubin is a Sophomore at DePaul. He's studying production as well and his main focus is directing. He just premiered his short film Medicine (which had a very successful indiegogo) recently and is excited to work on a new and interesting project. He will be directing part of the series.
Julio Padilla, Director

Julio Padilla is a grad student at DePaul who is very interested in production. He will be directing a portion of the series. 
Brandon Hoeg, Supervising Cinematographer

Brandon currently studies cinematography at DePaul University. He's loved making movies from a young age. He thoroughly enjoys the collaboration process that goes into filmmaking, more than anything. 
Angela Mcllvain, Art Director

Angela Mcllvain is a fourth year scenic design student at DePaul's Theatre school. She's designing all of the sets and environments for this show.
Madison Briede, Costume Designer 

Madison is a fourth year costume design student at DePaul's theatre school.  She loves retro and vintage designs so she's especially excited to work on this show in particular!
