story:
Show Synopsis

Where small-town gym meets big personalities. This is a comedy short about the quirks and qualities of gym life. Taking place at the locally owned (and sort of gay) U Ran Us (Pronounced Uranus) Fitness, we discover a world where Chad, the well-meaning but clueless "bro" trainer meets Kevin, a new member trudging his way through his mid-life crisis. (think "Odd Couple" but in a gym) Along the way we meet Gina, Logan, Cheryl, Wesley and Sam. We learn that their desires and unchecked personality quirks have lead this colorful blend of characters to bond together through a deep and meaningful life of pure superficiality, and relatable comedy!

We know this is the next big comedy! Watch for our promo bits and get to know the characters!

 

What We Need & What You Get

So, here's what we need at this point, and what you get for your contribution:

  • We are asking for $7,000. This includes:
    •  5  film days 
    •  Cast, Crew and Location
    •  Craft services for cast and crew each day as required by SAG. 
    • Minimal prop and wardrobe purchases.
  • For funding you get perks! 
    • $25.00 contribution gets you good karma and a social media thank-you shout-out!
    • $50.00 contributions get ALL of the above, PLUS an exclusive Gym Shorts cast photo signed by the whole cast!
    • $75.00 contribution gets all of the above, PLUS exclusive access to the pre-release of Gym Shorts!
    • $100.00 contributions get you ALL of the above perks, PLUS an exclusive You Ran Us (Uranus) Fitness T-shirt exclusively made for these contributors!
    • $250.00 contributions gets you ALL of the above perks, PLUS... Associate Producer Credit.
    • $500.00 contributions get you ALL of the above perks, PLUS... Executive Producer credit! Welcome to the world of Hollywood bragging rights! You can tell all of your friends and family you're helping producing a comedy series! Your name will be in the credits!
    • $1000.00 contributions get you ALL of the above perks (including Executive Producer credit!), PLUS... we will write YOU a walk-on roll! YOU will be part of the series! Dust off those high-school acting classes because you're going to be a star!

The Impact

With your contributions, we will put together the first 2 comedic shorts of a 13-episode series which we will first submit to festivals, then pitch to networks and other distributors such as LOGO, Comedy Central, and Netflix. 

The world is filled with a lot of trauma and sickening news and information. The world needs to be flooded with joy and laughter now more than ever before. We need to unite with each other by enjoying entertaining and relatable stories, and your contributions will allow us to do that.

We have a track record of success. Erick Szot and John Duffy, the Creators of Gym Shorts, have worked on many successful projects together, and we have written countless sketches and comedies. The last major project produced and campaigned through Indiegogo, called Finding Life, was a success and is now available on Amazon, and we are sure the success of this project will follow. All of our actors are extremely talented and totally HOT, and our crew is top notch with a proven track record of filming amazing projects.

Your contribution now matter how big or small, is making a HUGE impact on our lives, and we are so appreciative for your contribution!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Share, Like, Follow, and tweet Gym Shorts and watch out for our Promo Videos! Help You-Ran-Us (Uranus) be seen, and we will love you forever.

story:
Short Summary

DragonGem Productions has been producing short and feature films for years, and we're excited to finally have an opportunity to produce a show for Bell Media.  Lyndon Horsfall and Duncan Finnigan have been working on the initial concept of "Kitchener Sync" since 2015, and we think we have a hilarious, poignant and entertaining show to bring to your TV via FibeTV1 in 2018!

Your support means that - when all is said and done - we'll be putting forward a great, broadcast quality show; with the amazingly talented original cast, incredibly talented film professionals on our crew, shot on the best production equipment, and in great locations across Kitchener.  This kind of quality is expensive, and your contributions will help us support the production of the show - and you'll get to share in the journey along the way.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're hoping with your help, we can hit our $30,000 goal. There are a tonne of expenses on a production, but we're keeping it pretty lean. But here's where you come in as a supporter of our campaign:

  • Major expenses are the industry standard cameras, gear, and lighting equipment needed to shoot a television show, and the incidentals that go with using said equipment. We've been lucky enough to get a lot of help from William F. Whites International Inc. to offset the costs, and we're continuing to work on partnerships to help keep the production costs manageable.
  • Many of these funds will go to paying our cast and crew fair, industry standard rates for their long, hard days.  Camera operators, sound techs, gaffers, grips, production managers and designers, and a whole group of professional people will be putting in 10+ hour days to make the best show possible for your enjoyment!
  • Some of these funds will go to cover the cost of food to keep that cast and crew fueled and happy during the shooting days!
  • You'll see some pretty cool perks in the various perk packages. We're very much about the experience. It's great to share the final product with you, but as a supporter, we want you to be able to experience the journey with us! And of course, get some awesome stuff along the way!
  • Every bit helps! As such, even if we don't hit our goal of $30,000, the show will go on with the funds that have been raised. (We're hoping we reach the $30,000 though!)

 

The Impact

Everyone knows about the main Silicon Valley over in California. But do they know about Canada's Tech Capital - Kitchener?

We, Duncan and I, got together in 2015 after our successful “12 Angry Filmmakers” project, which produced 14 highly acclaimed short films from around the Waterloo Region, to decide what our next project would be.

It was during a roundtable meeting at the centre of Kitchener's tech capital, Communitech, we discussed how Kitchener was then starting to be called the “Silicon Valley of the North” and the “Tech Capital of Canada.”  Realizing there was great potential in telling a fictional story in those surroundings, “Kitchener Sync” was born.

We quickly produced three spec episodes of the show, with an incredibly talented cast and highly skilled and professional film crew, and were supported by William F. Whites International Inc., AJA Video Systems, The Commons Studio & Lighthouse Equipment Ltd., and Guelph’s Ed Video Media Arts Centre, among others. It was highly encouraging that these leaders in the industry saw the potential in our show. Even more encouraging knowing that Bell Media's FibeTV1  also saw it, believed in it, and will now be making the completed first season available for streaming!

 

Risks & Challenges

We've put together a team that has years of experience in the entertainment production field.  This means we have people on our team who have experience staying on budget with a production. We have people on our team who have experience keeping a production on schedule. And we have people on our team who have the experience to take great things from script to screen.

Some obstacles we could face are additional shooting days, or having to shoot on a much leaner budget. We are hoping with your help, we can get a little breathing room. To also help off set costs, we have a team that is actively working on in-kind sponsorship. Every little bit helps. And the dedication of this team to all aspects of this production is what will get the job done!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know the economy has its ups and downs. We get it. We're doing a show about navigating ups and downs of a rapidly changing industry! So, how else can you help our campaign? By helping us spread the word!

  • Find us on Twitter! Tweet about us. Tweet at us.
  • Find us on Facebook! Like us. Share our cool stuff/news.
  • Indiegogo's made it super simple to help get the word out by using the built-in Indiegogo share tools found on our campaign page!

We hope you'll join us on this journey. We hope you'll grab yourself an awesome perk. We hope you'll help us share this campaign so we can reach our goal and get you that awesome first season of Kitchener Sync. Most of all, we hope you'll have fun with us and the show!

- Lyndon Horsfall

story:
Hi everybody!

We are taking it as a good sign from the universe that you have chosen to visit our Indiegogo page. So let’s make it worth your while!

So, who are we? We are a team of three: Robin Cleland, Zoe Cleland and Carly Sztern. We are all actors who have been living and working in Toronto for the past decade. Robin and Zoe are a father-daughter team and Carly is an honorary member of the family. All three of us have always been interested in all things spooky, and for many years Robin has also been a well-known tarot reader. A few months ago, the idea for Ace of Rods popped into our heads, and ever since then we have been striving to turn it into a reality that everyone can enjoy.

Ace of Rods is a story about James Castleton, an eccentric psychic, who one day is visited by a woman named Sally who claims to be his long-lost daughter. He lets her into his home, having no idea that she brings with her a storm of chaos and danger. 

We are writing ten ten-minute episodes that will lead you through this twisted tale of mischief and magic. It will be a unique experience for the viewer—think Breaking Bad meets Ghost—mixing comedy, suspense and the supernatural. With your help, we want to raise the money to shoot our pilot episode. We want our first episode to be a kick-ass introduction to our show, with a high production value that will maximize the entertainment for the viewer. There is no limit to what we can achieve with this, and the better our first episode is, the more chance we have of drawing the support that will help us bring the rest of our season to life.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $22,000. We have carefully compiled our budget so that we can pay everyone involved with Ace of Rods. This includes expenses for cast, crew, equipment, location, set design, costumes, catering, stunt coordination and editing.  

We want to set a high bar for our pilot in order to give Ace of Rods the best shot at becoming a full season of magic. We feel it’s important to pay a fair wage to everyone involved for their skills and talent. We have been economical where possible, but have given ourselves a higher budget in some areas (such as camera equipment) so that we aren’t making any artistic sacrifices.

You won’t regret helping us out! As well as getting to see our exciting final product, donors will be treated to a selection of very special perks. These include everything from a personalized message from the universe to our team hosting you and your friends to a delicious dinner followed by individual readings from our very own Robin Cleland.

Stretch Goals

As we said, we need $22,000 to shoot our pilot. However, with even more funding, the sky is the limit as to what we can achieve! Here’s a sneak peek at what we could do if your support takes us to the next level.

$30,000

For $30,000, we could not only shoot our pilot, but also hire someone to help us publicize it to the fullest, and launch a marketing campaign to reach the widest possible audience. Not only this, but we would have extra money to increase our spending on things like set dressing, costumes and special effects. Help us make the experience of Ace of Rods even more magical!

$60,000

For $60,000, we could shoot our first three episodes. This would help us launch our show with a much bigger impact, and of course it would also provide even more entertainment for you, the viewer!

$200,000

For $200,000, we could shoot our entire first season. We would be able to give you ten episodes of Ace of Rods to binge on. Then you could follow James, Sally and Annie through all the twists and turns of their thrilling and hilarious adventures without having to press the pause button. Hang on for a wild ride!

Where will your money go if we don’t reach our goal?

We are going to make Ace of Rods happen no matter what! Even if we don’t reach our goal here on Indiegogo, we will continue crowdfunding until we raise the necessary funds. 

There are two worst-case scenarios.​ O​ne would be that we would have to delay production by a few months. The other would come into play if we are ​only able to raise $18,000.​ In this second case, we could still shoot our pilot,​ but it​ would mean using much lower-quality cameras and paying some of our team members a lot less than their time is worth. We want to avoid this​ at all costs! (N​o pun intended!​) 

Either way, we will keep all our backers informed of our shooting schedule and progress. Rest assured that any money you donate will go to the production of our spooky,​ funny and completely original web series—Ace of Rods.

What’s Our Track Record?

It comes down to this, why should you trust us with your money? As psychic as we are, not all aspects of the future can be divined completely! However, we can tell you what we have accomplished in the past, and you can decide for yourself. All of our core team members have extensive experience in the industry, with many different specialties between us.

Although much of his life has been devoted to his psychic work, Robin Cleland has made his mark in the acting world in a very short period of time. Most notably, he has appeared in acclaimed shows Taken and Alias Grace. Robin also single–handedly wrote, produced and starred in his original one-man show Don’t Look Down at the Berkeley Street Theatre in 2011.

Our co-director and director of photography, Trish Young, is an award-winning DP. After receiving the CSC Award For Best Cinematography in a student film category, she has been sponsored by numerous companies and has had the opportunity of working on a vast array of projects. She has boundless energy that she brings with her everywhere she goes!

Zoe Cleland is a classically trained actress who has been working in the industry for most of her life. She has been featured in many well-known shows, including Murdoch Mysteries, Reign, and Saving Hope, as well as the award-winning indie comedy How to Plan an Orgy in a Small Town. Zoe also produced and starred in her own adaptation of Chekhov’s Uncle Vanya in a site-specific production in 2013.

Last but not least, Carly Sztern has had a particularly unique view of the industry. She recently appeared in Karla, a romantic comedy that premiered earlier this year. She has also entered the world of casting, where she has worked for Forrest & Forrest Casting as well as Larissa Mair Casting & Associates. 

Risks & Challenges

Ace of Rods is a passion project, so of course it comes with a unique set of challenges. We have a very clear artistic vision that has a lot of momentum behind it, but we need the financial backing to go hand-in-hand with the energy of our ideas.  We believe our show deserves the highest production quality we can possibly give it, and that means hiring the best team. In order to do that we need your support so that we can make the experience of working on Ace of Rods worth their while.

We believe in the strength of our story. We have landed on a very special idea and we are determined to make it a reality no matter what. Every single person involved in our project feels just as strongly as we do, and we feel confident that that kind of artistic passion will carry us through to our final goal.

The Impact

Ace of Rods will be a show that will surprise and delight the viewer. It will be unique in its combination of wildly imaginative and magical storylines right alongside topical themes of crime and corruption. Our bottom line is entertainment: we want to make a show that you can’t wait to binge on: a distraction from your day-to-day life that will give you a shot of adrenaline and make you laugh at the same time.

Please give today and help us bring the SPIRIT of our eerie show into the light!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please contribute to our campaign! We are grateful for all donations, big or small.

We do understand that not everyone is in a position to give money. If that’s the case for you, that’s ok! Anything you can do to help would be greatly appreciated. Please consider sharing our campaign, following us on social media, and of course watching Ace of Rods when it’s released. 

Thank you!
