story:
Synopsis de la série     (english version below)

«Monty Python rencontre Le Dôme»

Des extra-terrestres dans le village de Ste-Cravache ? Les relations amicales entre les villageois et les extra-terrestres font craindre au gouvernement la possibilité d’une invasion. Pour cette raison, la région est mise en quarantaine et les habitants sont surveillés de près par des scientifiques et des militaires depuis les années 80. Aucune communication extérieure n’est autorisée. Pour prévenir une insurrection, l’état créa une chaîne de propagande gouvernementale pour divertir et hypnotiser la population: Télévision Ste-Cravache (TVSC). 

La campagne de  financement

En 2005, le réalisateur Nicolas Proulx invente Ste-Cravache. Le village est un terrain de jeu fertile pour les idées absurdes du cinéaste. De 2005 et 2014, ces lieux fictifs ont été élaborés à travers une quinzaine de courts métrages. En 2018, Nicolas se lance avec une équipe croyant à fond au scénario de la première saison. Parmi ces gens talentueux, les acteurs Dino Tavarone (Omerta, Le Piège américain, Minuit le soir) et Daniel Grenier (Les beaux malaises, Chick’n Swell, Un Gars, une fille) se sont joints à l’équipe pour jouer les rôles principaux de la série.  

En tournant le pilote de l'émission, une vingtaine de professionnels ont mis tous les efforts afin de produire un pilote de qualité pour le public. L'épisode No.1 de TVSC sera disponible en projection privée pour certains contributeurs du projet (voir Perks). Ce sera VOUS les premiers à choisir si TVSC continue ou s'arrête au premier épisode (ouf !). Est-ce que la quarantaine va se poursuivre ? Est-ce que Jean-Jules (Dino Tavarone) découvrira la vérité sur les extra terrestres ? Que dire de Joe (Daniel Grenier) et son band «Les Salauds Aquatiks» ? Vont-ils retrouver la gloire de leur premier album ? 

Son contenu 

La série « TVSC » raconte l'histoire d'un peuple inconnu du monde entier en raison d'une quarantaine interminable. Le lien entre la réalité du village et ses habitants se fait par le contenu de la chaîne de télévision de Ste-Cravache. De prime abord, la structure des épisodes ressemble à celle d'un canal standard. En revanche, elle s'inscrit dans un contexte marginal. Du point de vue des habitants, l'enchaînement des émissions participe à leur identité propre. En adoptant la perspective des téléspectateurs, ceux-ci jugent les péripéties hilarantes, sans queue ni tête et tout à fait excentriques. D'un autre côté, certaines facettes, dans les coutumes du village, évoquent la réalité québécoise. Ainsi, par les moyens d'une satire sociétale ; la Télé-Cravanaise propose une grille horaire représentative des comportements aberrants et imprévisibles des villageois.

En présence d’une programmation aux circonstances inhabituelles, la formule de TVSC est un croisement entre «Key and Peele» et «Le Dôme». La série se démarque du fait que les sketches à la télévision de Ste-Cravache font le lien entre la réalité du village et les enjeux profonds des personnages principaux.

C'est ici que votre contribution prend toute son importance. Vous avez regardé notre présentation et vous aimeriez voir la saison au complet ? Eh bien, c'est vous qui êtes les maîtres de la situation ! Vous avez le pouvoir de donner vie à Ste-Cravache. Les contributions ne sont pas des dons, au contraire, ce sont des récompenses vraiment tripantes ! Venez faire partie de Ste-Cravache et devenir un Cravanais et une Cravanaise !!

 

 

Synopsis   

«Monty Python meet The Dôme»

Aliens in the village of Ste-Cravache? The friendly relations between the villagers and the aliens make the government fear the possibility of an invasion. For this reason, the area is quarantined and residents have been closely monitored by scientists and military personnel since the 1980s. No outside communication is permitted. To prevent an uprising, the state created a chain of government propaganda to entertain and hypnotize the population: Television Ste-Cravache (TVSC).

  

The campaign

In 2005, director Nicolas Proulx invents Ste-Cravache. The village is a fertile playground for the absurd ideas of the filmmaker. From 2005 and 2014, these fictional places were developed through fifteen short films. In 2018, Nicolas took his own money for the production of the pilot. Actors Dino Tavarone (Omerta) and Daniel Grenier (Chick'n Swell) joined the team to play the main roles of the serie.

About twenty professionals have made the sacrifice to work for free to produce the first episode. The first episode will be available in private projection for contributors (see Perks). It will be YOU the first to choose if TVSC continues or stops at the first episode (please no!). Will quarantine continue in Ste-Cravache ? Will Jean-Jules (Dino Tavarone) discover the truth about aliens? What about Joe (Daniel Grenier) and his band " The Aquatiks S.O.B.'s "? Will they regain the glory of their first album ?

This is where your contribution becomes important. Have you watched our presentation ? Would you like to see the entire season ? Well, you are the masters of the situation! You have the power to give life to Ste-Cravache. Come and be part of Ste-Cravache and become a Cravanese and a Cravanaise !!

story:
Join Us

The cannabis cooking channel is here to make cooking with cannabis simple and easy for everyone.  You’ll be introduced to the best recipes, chefs, techniques, and products to help you create great tasting, clean and healthy cannabis-infused edibles. It will also serve as a platform to share everything cannabis and culinary from ingredients and equipment to edible brands and cannabis chefs showcasing their various creations. Our goal is to be The Food Network of Cannabis!

 

Everything Culinary & Cannabis In One Place

No longer will you need to search through thousands of videos of cooking with cannabis online. Our team is out there creating and curating the best culinary content, just for you.  The Cannabis Cooking Channel will feature the most up to date content about cooking with cannabis and alleviate the overwhelming feeling you get trying to search for the right video. All of our videos will feature top cannabis chefs and experts. Get to cooking faster with fun and easy to follow content.  

What We Need 

We need you! We need a force of subscribers to join and help fund us!  We have a great team, the right equipment, Chefs, and knowledge, to make The Cannabis Cooking Channel a reality, but we need one more thing, Money! We need funding for:

  • A Studio Kitchen 
  • Production expenses
  • Editing & Production
  • Music Royalties
  • Streaming App Development

As a supporter, you will get access to the #1 place to find accurate and valuable knowledge on cooking with cannabis. We are offering amazing packages to join us that include hats and t-shirts, exclusive recipes, free classes, and opportunities to be a guest on the Cannabis Cooking Channel!

What You Get!

A New Era 

The Cannabis Cooking Channel will disrupt the culinary world by adding a new clean, green ingredient, CANNABIS. The channel will provide all the tools you need to help you cook with cannabis all in one place. These tools will help you learn the art and science of cooking with cannabis through videos, recipes and unique content!

 

 

Meet The Team 

 

 

Press

Media Inquiries: Please Contact Jared@jeffthe420chef.com

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Want to help the Cannabis Cooking Channel in other ways?

  • Tell your friends!
  • Show Off your New Skills with Friends!
  • Share us on Social Media through the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Wear our T-shirts and Hats!

story:
Here's the pitch!

Carrie, a budding actress on the brink of stardom, discovers she has a haunting soul tie to an erratic ex lover. Upon his unexpected return,  obstacles arise that threaten both her dreams and liberation. Meanwhile, her opinionated besties, Shawna and Bridget,  uncover shocking Soul Ties of their own.

 

My name is Jenae' Hope and boy do I have a story for you..

First, How’d I get Here?

A year ago, I quit auditioning. Yep. After 5 years of hitting the pavement and waiting for that "life altering role", I did it. I Quit! This wasn’t me waving the white flag or denying myself the opportunity to flourish as an artist. Instead, it was the first step in taking control of my destiny as a creative. I've auditioned for every role you can imagine, recited lines I didn't believe in, and put my vision on the back burner longer than I’d care to admit. Although this was all done with great intent… enough of that.

Soul Ties marks my debut as an Executive Producer and Writer in my first original TV series. I’m so freakin’ excited! And I’m scared AF, but I’m forging ahead anyway. I’ve learned that there are certain stories that I need to be a part of telling from start to finish. 

In order to do that, I am embracing my role as a filmmaker where I can learn, grow, fail, and challenge myself. I’ve spent the last year or so taking classes, being mentored by incredible producers, workshopping material, and most recently, joining forces with three Black boss babes that happen to be amazing storytellers! Victoria Sharpe, India McGee, and Jamese Young are incredible at what they do and I’m excited to shine a light on their work!

A little background as to why I'm telling this story: Soul Ties is a deeply intimate story close to my heart about the bonds that linger between both present and former lovers. Initially, I started this series after discovering a Soul Tie of my own. It was difficult to accept that what I thought was passion and love was instead a spiritual entanglement that lasted almost a decade.

I set out on a mission to break that bond indefinitely. Talk about a reckoning? SHEESH. This type of attachment typically happens when you've achieved a heightened level of intimacy beyond the physical.  I found that Soul Ties is a universal theme amongst both men and woman. Some call it a twin flame, others recognize it as a karmic connection, but everyone's had someone they've struggled to let go. The problem is, we have trouble identifying something so subtle, yet so cosmic. It’s true, millennials love hard, but we’re also spearheading the breaking of generational curses, and unlearning patterns that don’t serve us.

I am excited to take you on a journey of three, layered women, who discover their individual Soul Ties and face the responsibility of breaking them. We're talking love addicts and trauma bonds but don’t worry fellas, we’ve got some amazing things in this series for you too!  Not to mention, a ton of laughs for everyone to look forward to.

HERE'S THE NEED

The Goal is to raise $10,000. Simple, right? Truth is, we need a little more than that, but this will put us on the right track! This amount will be divided up to pay for the categories below. 

As you can see, it takes a lot to get this thing up and running! But with the support of our community, I’m confident we can do it! If you’re not into delayed gratification, no worries! I’ve got some things for you to look forward too.

 

THE IMPACT

I know so many talented individuals who are waiting in the wings for their time to shine but we can be the change we want to see! No more waiting on Tyler Perry to do it all (haha) or giving to missions and projects that magically disappear.  We can give to the campaigns of people we actually know and trust.  That means this is an opportunity to support what it means to build together.  Every penny will be properly allocated to the series.  In fact, I created a film called “Not Another DAY” with a micro budget that screened all the way in France at Cannes Film Festival.  That film did great but I often wonder how much further we could’ve gone if I was willing to ask my village for help. How many more people could I have reached or employed? So today, I am asking! 

Risks & Challenges

We’re in the midst of pre-production! That means identifying the rest of crew, locations, and going out to cast. All of that! We plan to start shooting at the end of May 2021 (whoa!) and employ a predominately POC crew. It is my privilege to provide opportunities for POC's to show the world what we’ve got! However, that comes with great responsibility. I have to make sure all production participants are well taken care of. I’ll also need to take additional precautions to ensure the safety of everyone involved due to COVID-19. This is why I’m asking for your help! Even with a production friendly story like ours, costs add up!

Other Ways to get Involved

I completely understand if you can’t donate. Many of us are simply trying to stay afloat but what I will ask, is that you share this. If you made it to this paragraph, it’s likely that you are a supporter! So, if you believe in this project or if you believe in me, SHARE, SHARE, and SHARE some more!  A repost with a little caption can get us further than you think! I believe anything can be done when it’s a collaborative effort, so I want to thank you in advance! I understand I'm only as great as the contributions and support of my village so please know, that I am beyond grateful for the seed you’ve sown. God Bless You!

*We are excited to partner with Youtube for the distribution on this project.

*Follow us on IG @SoulTiesTheSeries for all the goodies and updates!

story:
The Plot

Omar, an artist from Dalston, moves into a rented flatshare in Peckham, South East London bringing along his best friend Kemi, and old flame Tom. But when they meet the estate agent to move into the new flat they are hastily informed that a fourth housemate called Seb will be moving into the loft which has been unexpectedly converted into an extra room. However this is the least of their worries – the flat is falling apart, it’s unfurnished, there’s mould on the wall, mice droppings, and a leaking roof, inevitably creating chaos and conflict between the flatmates.   

James Barber

Writer and Creator of Flatshare

As someone who was born and bred in London, I have witnessed much of it change to the point of it being completely unrecognisable to me. I grew up between East Dulwich, Brixton and Peckham where my family still live and have watched its transformation from being predominately urban working class areas into thriving cultural hotspots. But this sudden change has resulted in soaring house prices, unaffordable rent, the closing of local businesses, and the displacement of communities.
Even though I make a decent living as a writer I struggle to keep up with the rising costs of living in London. Like many people of my generation I’ve spent most of my young adult life renting, not because I wanted to but because it was the only option.

I felt inspired to write the series after seeing the hashtag #VentYourRent, which involved mostly young working professionals expressing their frustrations of having to pay huge fees in return for terrible living conditions.

In Flatshare, I explore this growing issue through the four leading characters, Omar, Kemi, Tom, and Seb.

The diversity of the characters in relation to ethnicity, sexuality, class, and political beliefs is very important to me because it reflects my intention of creating an intersectional web series that gives a voice to groups in society who have been underrepresented by mainstream media.

Why support us?

Creating Flatshare will not be the end of the road for us, it will be the beginning of a campaign to involve the voices of young people most affected by London’s housing crisis and to call for more diversity in front and behind the camera through screenings and panel discussions.

In addition to highlighting London’s housing crisis, further episodes of Flatshare boldly takes on taboo themes such as Chemsex and social issues such as gentrification and racism, which we believe will resonate and have a big impact on audiences.

We don’t just want your money, we want you to join our growing community of supporters and help us in whatever way you can.

Budget

We think that creating a web series about London’s housing crisis is a worthwhile cause, but we need your help raising the money to make it. Just like living in London, shooting in the capital is extremely expensive. Unfortunately there are currently no funding schemes specifically for web series being made in the UK, which is why we need your support.

As a team we are determined to make the best web series possible, so the more you pledge, the more likely it is that we can achieve this aim. The funds that we raise will go towards:

  • Hiring locations
  • Equipment hire
  • Catering
  • Transportation
  • Expenses for cast and crew
  • Post-production

We are all independent filmmakers so we are reliant on small-scale donations from backers who believe in our vision and what we’re trying to achieve.

In total there are six episodes of Flatshare, so if we exceed our funding goal of £2,000 to make two pilot episodes we will attempt to make all six episodes which will enable us to give you a full body of work.

To say thank you for your support we have put together some fantastic gifts. If you help us to fund our campaign you can look forward to receiving exclusive perks such as being accredited as one of the executive producers of Flatshare, you can join us on set, or get an exclusive first look at the pilot before it's released as a reward for your contribution.

 

Risks and Challenges

Every production has its challenges but we aim to overcome them all! We are shooting this pilot with a low budget but it will be filmed whether we achieve the goal or not, though it would certainly help to raise the full amount.

After shooting we will move onto post production, screenings, festival entry and distribution – which we are sure will present a whole new set of challenges. Despite this, collectively as a team, we are determined to make Flatshare happen and to create an outstanding body of work.

Other ways you can help

We understand not everyone can donate money but even a simple 'Like' or 'Follow' can help us achieve our goal! Here are some ways you can help:

  • Follow us on social media! We’re on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.
  • Share, retweet our posts. By doing this you increase the reach of our campaign.
  • Share this campaign! You might not be able to donate but perhaps someone else is.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I'm Jalysa Harris and me and my partner Amber Guidry are the creators and stars of the series "7 minutes in Heaven". This story is about 4 sisters(Gia,Lexi,Vanity, & Bambi) dealing with a broken home, maneuvering through everyday life as their secrets and betrayals from an innocent game of 7 minutes in Heaven slowly began to uncover, their sisterhood begins to unravel.

WE all know that we did not choose our family and unlike friends "cutting them off" is easier said than done. We all have somebody in our family that makes you look at them in a different light, be it bad or good. That path is something me and Amber knew we needed to talk about. There is a new wave of young talented writers who are creating their own content while telling a story that is not unlike many others. The way you can relate and when you have a script that is so honest is what makes shows like we see today(Insecure, Curious, #Adulting, Atlanta) so fresh and addictive. With your help we would not only be able bring our words and ideas to life but also create the environment needed to make this show a success! Giving this show the aesthetic it needs and the quality in which the audience deserves it. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are only asking for 3000 dollars to make sure 7 minutes in heaven becomes the show that everybody talks about this money will be applied to not just a camera but a better camera, lights, stand, assistance, and the hardest part of any production securing key important locations, permits needed etc.

*Locations will preferably be used through Airbnb. The goal is to allow the viewers to fully invest in the characters and their surroundings so that we keep the authenticity of it.

*We would apply the fund to our appreciation to any vendors, sponsors, producers, editors, crew and cast

*Crafts services & Lunches are a must

(12 or more hour days of shooting, people will need to eat!

*Miscellaneous items needed such as merchandise, wardrobe, makeup, props, even promoting!

& don't think this is just charity!

You supporters, and backers have an added bonus as well! Big or small everything you give counts, and no mater what you will receive a a small token of gratitude. We have perks that range from t-shirts with unique characters quotes to opportunities to come on set meet the cast and crew and see your name in the credits!The goal of 3000 is important but whether we meet it or not the funds will be going to all the necessities of our show 100%

The Impact

This show is important because right now there is nothing like it, this story is lived a million times in a million lives but never really told. It is something so powerful to know you are not alone, in the world, per experience, thought or what have you. I too have been working as background and a production assistant on so many different projects, films, and movies that I can confidently say I know what it takes to give great quality TV. I've seen how you-tube has changed so many lives and opened up a platform for us all. I think the world loves when a show comes and can be "game-changer" and I'm confident that is what 7 minutes in Heaven will be.

 

Risks & Challenges

I'm aware that this story (which is almost an autobiography of the many difference facets of myself and my partner) can and will receive backlash. Some might find it to cliche' because the characters motives or feelings are human and transparent. Some may not like the light the characters are put in particularly because they are African-American. I say to that, it doesn't make their life lived any less TRUE and what better way to tell somebody else's story because it is authentic and raw. Every stranger is a person, and they too are living lives separate from our own. I hope it allows the people who may be to scared to say they feel like a walking cliche or statistic(me and my partner struggle with coming to terms with this ourselves) to recognize they too have a voice and they are seen. 

Other ways you can help?

Don't Worry! If you can't donate, PLEASE just get the word out! Tell people everywhere friends, family, co-workers etc that there is a show with a plan to break barriers and really create a conversation, not just with others but with ourselves! Let everyone know 7 minutes in Heaven needs your support in any way! Indiegogo Share Tools are here to help!

Thank you so much for your time, attention, and reading my rambling. I cant wait to see where this show can go, because of you!

Some might find it to cliche' because the characters motives or feelings are human and transparent. Some may not like the light the characters are put in particularly because they are African-American. I say to that, it doesn't make their life lived any less TRUE and what better way to tell somebody else's story because it is authentic and raw. Every stranger is a person, and they too are living lives separate from our own. I hope it allows the people who may be to scared to say they feel like a walking cliche or statistic(me and my partner struggle with coming to terms with this ourselves) to recognize they too have a voice and they are seen. 
Other ways you can help?
Don't Worry! If you can't donate, PLEASE just get the word out! Tell people everywhere friends, family, co-workers etc that there is a show with a plan to break barriers and really create a conversation, not just with others but with ourselves! Let everyone know 7 minutes in Heaven needs your support in any way! Indiegogo Share Tools are here to help!
Thank you so much for your time, attention, and reading my rambling. I cant wait to see where this show can go, because of you!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ron Rossmann and I am the writer, director, and producer of a groundbreaking new web series called Dusk.

What makes it groundbreaking?

It will be the first web series filmed entirely on Facebook LIVE.

That’s right Facebook LIVE…what you will see will be happening in real time.

A 14 episode horror/action/dark comedy series debuting in February 2017.

It’s the story of a cynical witch who works for a clandestine agency charged with protecting the world from supernatural forces.  While investigating a murder, she is forced to make some dangerous allies to uncover a sinister agenda and battle an evil which appears to have no equal, all the while she begins to discover a past that has been hidden from her and, for good reason.

As you can imagine, this is a highly ambitious and incredibly challenging project, but we have the amazing cast and crew to make it happen!

Filmed entirely in Charlotte, NC and professionally choreographed by Devil May Care Cosplay and Productions...this will set a new standard in web broadcasts!

If you enjoy anime, the supernatural, vampires, werewolves, magic, betrayal, and a deep, rich story...you will LOVE the Dusk Series!

And this is only Season One...if we are successful, Season Two will debut in January of 2018!

In August we will release a polished version of the completed Season One on DVD with added and bonus scenes, gag reel, commentaries, in-depth cast and crew interviews, and a sneak peak at Season Two.

Now… you too can be part of something revolutionary!

We are raising the remaining funds to satisfy the last components of our production costs.   We need $2500 and the finances break down as follows...

We are offering some remarkable perks to our supporters.

Pledge today!

And make sure you Like, Follow, and SHARE our page...www.facebook.com/duskseries to keep updated on all of our progress and to view the LIVE broadcasts when they debut.

The series trailer will be released on 2/12/17 with first pre-recorded episode debuting 2/19/17, and our first LIVE episode on 3/12/17.

You can also follow us on Twitter @theduskseries and on Instagram @duskseries.

Come this February…Darkness will fall…

#Dusk #DuskSeries #Darknesswillfall

story:
"When Fact Met Fiction" is a present day, sitcom style, web-series that takes place in the fictional southern Appalachian town of Walterville, NC. The setting is the office of Celeste Frank's up-and-coming foodie, lifestyle and feel-good magazine Southern Sunset. In true rom-com fashion, it's about the guy getting the girl, the antics of Walterville natives, plus a few newcomers. All in all, it always comes around to family and friends being there for each other.

However, "When Fact Met Fiction" is more than a web-series. It's more than great scripts. It's more than great talent delivering their lines. It's a whole world of production where independent filmmakers, cast and crew from Western North Carolina can build their body of work and get paid to do it! Partner with us today in developing both of these amazing stories!

 

Olivia Smith is played by the always happy Rebekah Babelay (sometimes we call her "the Babe," but only when she's not around). "When Fact Met Fiction" was Rebekah's first time in front of the camera although she had been doing stage since she was a child. In Season 1 of WFMF, Olivia Smith has just started as Southern Sunset's new editor. This is Olivia's first real job since graduating college and she's determined to help take Southern Sunset's articles to the next level, but then Jon shows up... 

 

Jon Frank is played by the exuberant Jeff Ryan Alexander, always a character on and off the set. Stefan Liner (Director of WFMF) and Jeff met back in 2014 when Stefan cast him in a music video. Stefan has been a fan of Jeff's ever since, and when casting time came for Season 1 of WFMF, Stefan was delighted to be able to give the role of Jon to Jeff. In Season 1, we learn that Jon Frank is secretly the successful romance writer, Nathaniel Embers. He is just back from meeting with his publicist when his sister in-law, Celeste Frank, calls in a favor. Upon dropping by Southern Sunset to meet with Celeste, he notices Olivia. Considering Celeste's predicament, he decides that writing for his sister-in-law's lifestyle magazine might be a good change of pace, especially if he gets the vacant desk across from the new editor.

 

Celeste Frank is played by the award-winning Carol Anderson who is both a joy and an absolute professional on set. Carol, and her husband Jim Shores, are the founders and directors of Acts of Renewal, a live act that performs all over the world. When she's not performing with her husband, she's teaching at Asbury University in Wilmore, Kentucky. Carol is originally from Boston, MA, but in WFMF she puts on a high-society, Georgia-style southern accent.  Celeste is Jon's sister-in-law, a single mother to Sunny Frank, and the owner of Southern Sunset magazine. She juggles all that and is also the encourager-in-chief to those around her along the way.

 

Mel Tenant is played by the master of improv, Mondy Carter. Mondy always has a quip ready to go. Many times during the filming of Season 1, Stefan would have Mondy freestyle a scene just to see what he would come up with. Mel Tenant is a longtime friend of the Franks, and is in charge of layout design and photography for Southern Sunset magazine. Many think Celeste just hired him out of pity, because his photos really aren't that great. 

 

Sunny Frank is played by the multi-talented Madison Garris. Not only is Madison an awesome actor, singer and cos player, she's also one of the sweetest, most enthusiastic people you'll ever meet! Sunny Frank is Celeste's 16-year-old daughter who often helps out around the office at Southern Sunset. In Season 1, she unwittingly spills the beans to Olivia about Jon's troubled love life and starts a romance of her own with the neighborhood pizza delivery guy Owen Phelps, but more on that in Season 2. =)

 

Vic Freeman is played by the very smooth king of attitude Drez Ryan. Drez is actually one of the nicest, most agreeable guys you'll meet, but he sure can play an awesome jerk. That's why whe're bringing him back for Season 2 to be part of the core cast... and because we just like having him on set. In Season 1, Vic left Southern Sunset in Episode 1 for greener pastures. Things didn't quite work out, so he's come back to Southern Sunset and Celeste has decided to give him a second chance.

 

This year our goal is to raise $120,000 to produce Season 2 of "When Fact Met Fiction." The main thing that amount does for us is gives us more time in production. Last year, we shot Season 1 (105 pages) in just over 54 hours. It truly was amazing that we were able to pull that off, but it wasn't ideal. $120,000 will allow us to shoot for 16 days, and give us 4 days of rehearsals. Also, last year Stefan Liner (the Director) edited the show and he's not even an editor. $120,000 will allow us a line-item to hire an editor  that can really take the show to the next level! Below, is a simple chart showing how the $120,000 will be used.

CLICK HERE to view the Budget Top Sheet

The creators of "When Fact Met Fiction" are mother and son team, Stefan Liner and Robin Liner. Stefan had dreamed up the general concept of WFMF in 2013 as a feature length project, but when Stefan and Robin launched their production company East Stream Studio in 2016, they decided to adapt the work into a episodic format. In Season 1, Stefan functioned more like a showrunner, director, producer while Robin took charge of taking the concept and writing it as an 8-episode web-series. Stefan and Robin work really great together in these roles, and are gearing up to do it again!

Stefan Liner has worked in the video creative world since 2013 when he became a Producer at Bclip Productions (Asheville, NC). In 2016, he worked on his first two feature length projects, the first being "Full Disclosure" filmed in Asheville, and then David Wall's "Gold Dust" filmed in the Mojave Desert where he worked as the First Assistant Director. Earlier in 2016, he produced and directed Season 1 of "When Fact Met Fiction". Before working in the entertainment business, Stefan was a sales & logistics coordinator for a small commercial trucking company. Stefan's main strength is that he's a finisher. When he sets out to do something he doesn't stop until it's finished and finished right. That's what he's excited to bring to the table again for Season 2.

Robin Liner has worked in the entertainment industry on and off in some capacity since the mid-70's. Whether she's singing in front of thousands or writing screenplays, Robin knows how to connect with her audience. She began writing screenplays in 2008, and has a catalog of over 5, feature length screenplays ready for production. In 2016, Robin adapted "When Fact Met Fiction" into a web-friendly, 8-episode format. During production, she was also on set during the filming of Season 1 and did rewrites whenever a logistical or story challenge arose. Fans often comment that the reason they love "When Fact Met Fiction" is because the dialogue comes off so real: like the characters are really having a conversation. That's because Robin is a master of character development and dialogue is one of her favorite ways to accomplish that!

 

This is the part where we give back to you for all your awesome support! No matter what amount you give you will get something in return (plus a whole NEW season of WFMF). 

For more information on the Associate Producer, Co-Producer and Executive Producer Perks please see the FAQ section below. 

All our perks are listed on the right hand side of our IndieGOGO page or if you're viewing on mobile device the Perks will be listed at the bottom of the HOME page.

Thank you for supporting WFMF Season 2!

 

One of the main challenges will be that the release date of the series could be delayed due to unforeseen circumstances. Another challenge worth mentioning is that budgets tend to change. Fortunately, with Season 1 behind us, and a clear idea of Season 2 requirements, we have drafted a very realist production budget for the upcoming WFMF series. We do not foresee any big changes, although some allocation shifts between line items may occur, as required. If there are any significant changes in the plans, we will keep you updated!

 

If you wish to help us, but cannot support our project financially, there are a lot of things you can do! Here are just a few...

SUBSCRIBE to our YouTube channel so you never miss a new release!  

LIKE When Fact Met Fiction on Facebook

FOLLOW When Fact Met Fiction on Twitter and Instagram

REFER YOUR FRIENDS, FAMILY & FELLOW "WHEN FACT MET FICTION" FANS by sharing our campaign link by email or on Social Media by using the Indiegogo share tools or by sharing this short link: www.igg.me/at/wfmf

WRITE A BLOG from your own point-of-view a champion of the show or a cast member!

GET CREATIVE Do you have another idea? Go for it!

SIGN UP to WFMF newsletter for the latest news by visiting our official website at: www.whenfactmetfiction.com

The official hashtag for this campaign is #wfmfGOGO

 

Featured in...

CLICK HERE to view Press Release

For media inquiries please contact: info@whenfactmetfiction.com

Stefan Liner | Producer I East Stream Studio

 

What does a flex goal mean?
If the funding goal of $120,000 isn’t met, we still get to keep the amount we were able to raise. However, depending on how much we're able to raise will determine how many episodes we're able to film of Season 2. Right now, each episode costs about $15,000 to produce.

When will I get my perks (general)?
You will find the estimated shipping date attached to each perk. Some of the perks will be sent out before the premiere of the series. We will inform the backers if there are any changes to the shipping dates.

Am I going to be able to buy these perk items after the campaign has ended / anywhere else?
Apart from a few items, (release of the tv series and books mainly) the perks chosen and created for this campaign will NOT be available after the campaign is over, and they are not sold anywhere else.

Can I buy two or more perks at the same time?
Unfortunately, Indiegogo does not have a shopping cart to buy many items at the same time. This is why we have created some bundles, which is an easy way for you to get all the essential items at one go.

Where can I find information on the perks, campaign, the show etc. after the campaign? 
Make sure to bookmark our Indiegogo page as we will use it to keep posting updates about our campaign and perks. You can follow When Fact Met Fiction on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram and make sure to sign up for the official WhenFactMetFiction.com newsletter to ensure you will get the latest information on Season 2. ALSO, keep in contact by e-mailing us: info@whenfactmetfiction.com.

When will the series be released? What is the current state of the series?
Episodes are scheduled to begin being released at the end of 2017 and into 2018. Right now, we have 4 scripts of 8  ready ready for production.

$5,000 Associate Producer Perk
The Associate Producer Perk gives you the following:
- Our full content package
- Mug, Hoodie and signed Poster
- 2 Grande Finale Tickets
- Credit on IMDB as an official Associate Producer of “When Fact Met Fiction”
- Credit on our www.WhenFactMetFiction.com as an Associate Prodocer
- Fourth Wall Shout Out at the end of an Episode where we brag on you to our fans
- VIP Access to the set during production

$10,000 Co-Producer Perk
The Associate Producer Perk gives you the following:
- Our full content package
- Mug, Hoodie and signed Poster
- 2 Grande Finale Tickets
- Credit on IMDB as an official Co-Producer of “When Fact Met Fiction”
- Credit on our www.WhenFactMetFiction.com as an Associate Prodocer
- Fourth Wall Shout Out at the end of an Episode where we brag on you to our fans
- VIP Access to the set during production
- Product Placement: If you are contributing as a Business or Corporation we will collaborate with you on whether to write your product or service into the script of an episode or a mention / endorsement of your product or service at the end of an episode in the Fourth Wall. However if the creators of “When Fact Met Fiction” feel like your product and or services do not complement the story then we hold the right not to align our brand with yours and will refund the full amount of your contribution.

$15,000 Executive Producer Perk
The Associate Producer Perk gives you the following:
- Our full content package
- Mug, Hoodie and signed Poster
- 2 Grande Finale Tickets
- Credit on IMDB as an official Executive Producer of “When Fact Met Fiction”
- Credit on our www.WhenFactMetFiction.com as an Associate Prodocer
- Fourth Wall Shout Out at the end of an Episode where we brag on you to our fans
- Your name or the name of your company or organization in the opening credits of an episode listed as an Executive Producer
- VIP Access to the set during production
- Product Placement: If you are contributing as a Business or Corporation we will collaborate with you on whether to write your product or service into the script of an episode or a mention / endorsement of your product or service at the end of an episode in the Fourth Wall. However if the creators of “When Fact Met Fiction” feel like your product and or services do not complement the story then we hold the right not to align our brand with yours and will refund the full amount of your contribution.
- All Expenses Paid Trip to Asheville, NC: We will cover round trip airfare from anywhere in the continental United States, 2 night stay in Asheville, NC, all meals paid and you get to visit us on set and have lunch with the cast and crew!

NOTE: Producer Credits like the three mentioned above; the Associate Producer, Co-Producer and Executive Producer credits are all "Silent Partnerships" for the production of Season 2 of "When Fact Met Fiction". "Silent Partnerships" meaning that such partners have no creative control or influence over the creative or business process involved with producing Season 2 of When Fact Met Fiction.

Who is running the Indiegogo campaign?
The Indiegogo campaign is run by East Stream Studio, and the "When Fact Met Fiction" production team members.

 

Please contact this address if you have more questions: info@whenfactmetfiction.com

However if the creators of “When Fact Met Fiction” feel like your product and or services do not complement the story then we hold the right not to align our brand with yours and will refund the full amount of your contribution.$15,000 Executive Producer PerkThe Associate Producer Perk gives you the following:- Our full content package- Mug, Hoodie and signed Poster- 2 Grande Finale Tickets- Credit on IMDB as an official Executive Producer of “When Fact Met Fiction”- Credit on our www.WhenFactMetFiction.com as an Associate Prodocer- Fourth Wall Shout Out at the end of an Episode where we brag on you to our fans- Your name or the name of your company or organization in the opening credits of an episode listed as an Executive Producer- VIP Access to the set during production- Product Placement: If you are contributing as a Business or Corporation we will collaborate with you on whether to write your product or service into the script of an episode or a mention / endorsement of your product or service at the end of an episode in the Fourth Wall. However if the creators of “When Fact Met Fiction” feel like your product and or services do not complement the story then we hold the right not to align our brand with yours and will refund the full amount of your contribution.- All Expenses Paid Trip to Asheville, NC: We will cover round trip airfare from anywhere in the continental United States, 2 night stay in Asheville, NC, all meals paid and you get to visit us on set and have lunch with the cast and crew!NOTE: Producer Credits like the three mentioned above; the Associate Producer, Co-Producer and Executive Producer credits are all "Silent Partnerships" for the production of Season 2 of "When Fact Met Fiction". "Silent Partnerships" meaning that such partners have no creative control or influence over the creative or business process involved with producing Season 2 of When Fact Met Fiction.Who is running the Indiegogo campaign?The Indiegogo campaign is run by East Stream Studio, and the "When Fact Met Fiction" production team members. Please contact this address if you have more questions: info@whenfactmetfiction.com

story:
My name is Darryl Vickers and I am one of the creators of Private Investigations.

Private Investigations was a world I created based on my experiences growing up in my diverse neighborhood in San Diego during the 60's and 70's. Things were much different back then. People knew each other and families weren't limited to blood relatives. There was a sense of community and good will towards everyone no matter what their gender, race, skin color or ability.

Hollywood these days shows only a glimpse of what the real world is like; favoring the over-dramatic and super violent over the thought provoking and heart warming stories. Some of the characters are too far from reality and not anything we can relate to.

Private investigations is a show of a different breed. It concentrates on those human connections. It celebrates all our differences yet shows how including all of these different traits makes us a very powerful community.

 

Sam is an old detective who is very good at solving mysteries but sometimes requires a little help from his granddaughter Megan and her friends. He also enlists the help of the local police from Detective Holly Chambers.

 

Hollywood sometimes... or perhaps often... spits out high budget, generic stories. Often they are remakes and fresh ideas get shunned every day. We often leave the theater or watch television these days wanting something more satisfying... We want  more human experience that we can relate to... For more characters like us.

Also the audience has changed to global. Diverse audiences including different cultures, races, economic backgrounds and abilities are waiting. Private Investigations was written as a global series; taking into account all these factors to put out a great story that truly expresses the world we live in.

Independent film and television doesn't answer to the lowest common denominator, or the highest funding dangled in front of us. It supports diversity in style and story; innovation in filmmaking and storytelling; and unique visions and voices in cinema. In a word something NEW! With Independents there is a place for any filmmaker willing to look at ourselves, ask the hard questions, fan the flames of curiosity, and still consider humanity with empathy and compassion. We can relate to the stories of those who never had a chance to tell them and breathe life back into our film and television shows.

In Hollywood, filmmakers hear "No," a lot. We're asking you to change it up. Say "Yes!" to independent film and television  by picking one of our perks and donating to Private Investigations. Help support a community of bright and brilliant people as well as a local that has been untouched by the industry.

Your financial support, and your sharing of our story using social media, is invaluable to the making of this film.

Private Investigations cannot be made without your donation. The script is fantastic, our team is amazing and dedicated to this story, the cast is ultra-talented, but without your financial support, PI will not come to life.

Here is a few details of how your donations will be used.

A Cinema Camera - This top-of-the-line camera, a favorite of indie filmmakers, gives us a high-quality and surprisingly affordable digital alternative to 35 mm.

Cinema Lenses - These high-end lenses create the cinematic "look" we all want to see on the big screen, and one that will support the beautiful imagery of JILTED.

Camera/Dolly Equipment & Lights - These are the tools we need behind-the-scenes to make what's in front of the camera come to life for you!

Locations

Props

Wardrobe

Sound Equipment

Feeding as many as 20 people twice a day

Set Design and Decor

Travel Expenses for Production

Data Storage

Legal Fees which include contracts and legal coverage of the production.

Insurance: so many kinds -  Equipment, Rental, General Liability, We told you it added up quick!

 

Jonathan R. Enerva portrays Private Investigator Sam Aquino. Just like the character he plays in Private Investigations, Jonathan can talk to anyone; any age about any subject. Jonathan is a retired Navy veteran, has an extensive background in theater performing here in the U.S, as well as overseas in Bahrain and the Philippines. Jonathan is fluent in Tagalog and also studies the Philippine and Filipino-American cultural and historical fictions and facts, both in books and film which will be blended into his on-screen character Sam during the crime drama series.

Actress Stephanie Warren-Kigenyi plays private investigator Sam Aquino’s adopted granddaughter and the adopted daughter of character Christine Silva. Stephanie originally hails from Concord, CA, but now calls San Diego CA home. She has trained locally under the guidance of acting coaches Samuel Warren and Tom Logan and has worked in theater and on several local commercials and print projects.


Actress and model Flora Sofia portrays the character Christine Silva (Megan’s adopted mother) on the crime series drama Private Investigations. Originally from Brazil, now living in the U.S. . As an actor Flora has worked on independent movies, TV commercials, industrial films, as well as theater. Fluent in Portuguese, she also studied Spanish while attending college at Universidade Federal de Minas Gerals, in Brazil. Flora will be speaking both Portuguese and Spanish periodically during the Private Investigations series.
Actress Danni Michele plays Megan Aquino’s close friend Nicole Sanchez. Danni, originally from Madrid, Spain currently lives in San Diego, CA and attends Cal State Channel Islands pursuing a degree in animation. Danni’s love and passion for acting caused her to spend time training under Terry Ross of Acting Professionally and working on several theatre productions, film and 48 hour projects over the last few years.


Veronica "Roni"  Castillo portrays one of Megan Aquino’s other close friends, Samantha King in Private Investigations. Known as Sam in the series, Roni has been acting and modeling in the Southern California area for several years. Having caught the attention of PI producers early on, not only for her serious acting, but also by exhibiting her over the top comedic skills ranging from the flamboyant to the flirtatious which alerted the writers to add those personality traits to the Samantha King character,

Actress Megan Denise Hinesley plays the character Jennifer Lewis, Megan Aquino’s best friend since childhood. Megan is what Private Investigations strives for in character diversity. Under the ethnicity section on her IMBD page she lists: Latin/Hispanic, Mixed, Indian/South Asian, Asian, Pacific Islander and Mediterranean. Megan, has studied under Terry Ross’ of Acting Professionally, is also trained in long and short improvisation and the Meisner technique, which allowed her to be cast in several films and television series including Gray’s Anatomy.

Local San Diego actor Kristin Rush-Lejarde plays Melody Richards, an employee of a nearby company whom Sam Aquino has to interact with on one of his cases, who later becomes a very valuable asset to Sam. Kristin, a gifted actress who can speak in a multitude of accents and dialects will use her southern dialect to portray the Melody character who hails from Savannah, Georgia.

.
North Carolina model and actress Lakiesha Holley, portrays police detective Holly Chambers in the crime series, who sometimes works with and trades information with PI Sam Aquino when their cases overlap.  Lakiesha brings her southern cultural feel to PI, which meshes well with the shows goal to write characters who come from diverse cultural backgrounds.


 

Please Help Get The Word Out

Whether $5 or $5000, your donations are HUGELY appreciated and we thank you in advance for giving what you can afford to give. However, If you're not able to donate, we can still really use your help! Please TELL YOUR FRIENDS about this film! Post, update, tweet, and share this campaign with as many people as you're willing. You never know who might be in the position to bring life to this story. Indiegogo has some awesome sharing tools at the top of this page, and you can use the following social media sites to connect with us and spread the word:

Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and YouTube.

We also take donations for locations, props, craft services (food for the cast and crew), or equipment to cut our costs. If you can donate that way, you can reach me by the email below.

Darryl Vickers:  sunsetlimited5519@gmail.com

The more social media shares, likes, and tweets, the higher our Indiegogo "gogofactor" increases, leading to global exposure and even mentions in the press!!

100 bucks is great, and 100 shares can be just as powerful!

story:
THE DILEMMA

Repercussions are the unforeseen effects of our actions. The series begins with Millicent and Reina, long-time besties, who are confronted by people from their past. These ladies quickly realize that they are about to suffer the repercussions of their past actions. Is it possible to stand strong when our decisions are being held over our heads? How do we break free?

 

THE VISION

Creating female characters that are powerful in their own right is what this show is about. These ladies make their own decisions, are complex and unapologetically flawed. Their choices will infuriate you, make you laugh and even make you think.  Although their selections may not be your own, they are true to whom they are.

 

THE TEAM

Repercussions the Show is committed to inclusion of gender and ethnicity as it focuses on destroying stereotypes in front of and behind the camera. With a majority female cast as well as a female writer, executive producer, director, cinematographer, producers and editor, the feminine influence will be apparent in this show. In addition to strong storytelling, we are providing an opportunity to showcase local talent and businesses in this niche area. We aim to prove that great stories don't have to come from Hollywood--an interesting, raw and homegrown episodic series can be developed right here in Charlotte, NC.

 

THE LEADER

Executive Producer/Writer/Director Keema Mingo, is an African-American woman who is using her 20 years of TV and video production experience as a springboard to bring to life her first original series.  Coming from a multiracial, multicultural background, Keema has developed a series which reflects that inclusive mindset and heritage she possess. Her goal is to create imperfect yet relatable characters in a series that is both entertaining and addictive. 

 

THE FUTURE

Our hope is to exceed our financial goals so we can produce a top-notch, high-quality pilot episode. To continue the excitement around the show, we will do several private viewings of the pilot before its mid-March online release. Once the pilot is complete, we will use it to promote fundraising efforts for the rest of season one (episodes 2-8).  Our goal is to create such a frenzy around this series that VOD companies (video on demand), network and/or cable outlets seek to partner with us for seasons two and beyond.

 

THE VIEWER

We thank you in advance for supporting our homegrown campaign. We offer rewards to bring you closer to the heart of this journey when you donate! Feel free to share our message in your social media outlets to let them know you support our goal in providing a stereotype-breaking, inclusive, captivating, locally-made series.

story:
Short Summary

My name is PJ Leonard and I am the creator of "DPW". "DPW" came to me after admiring certain characters that crossed my path in life. We sometimes forget that life isn't all about materialistic needs but just the ability to get to the next day. Coming from a blue collar upbringing then crossing over to the white collar world I was always amazed how we forget that it is the blue collar work force that allows others to live there lives on a regular basis. Sometimes we need to acknowledge the people that truly make the world go around. That would be our friends at the  "DPW" in our Township of Rasberry.

       We are asking to help us cross the finish line. We need to raise $7000 for post-production. Post production is where the magic truly happens. We know with our talented cast and our team behind the camera and the individuals working on the post production we will deliver an award winning project. You will become part of an experience many never thought could be possible.

       Producing isn't easy but it truly is rewarding when your vision projects on the screen. 

       Sharing and making others aware of our project will be a great help also.

      So if you can help in any way possible please do,

Thanks 

PJ

story:
Short Summary

Season 1 of The C-Word was a huge success. You can watch here if you haven't. A season 2 is highly anticipated, but we need all the help we can get. We are an official selection for Black Web Fest. For season 2 we would like to release episodes weekly and would like to increase our budget.

What We Need & What You Get

We need over $5,000 to make season two, but if you donate you will receive wonderful perks,

  • $1-$49- Thank you note
  • $50-$100- Mention in episode credits, episodes a day early, thank you note.
  • $100+- Mention in episode credits, episodes a day early, episode outtakes, exclusive content.

The Impact

 

  • More money means longer episodes
  • We can build a writer's room and hire more actors 
  • Even better equipment like a drone

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Want to continuously donate? Visit our Patreon.
  • Share this campaign with your friends and family!

story:
Let's not quibble around... We need money.  "The Johns Bar" was a success.  With the sequel we want to go bigger.  We need to secure locations and we have a huge stunt involving gun play and explosions.  That takes hiring a stunt guy, that takes hiring a special effects guy.

If you're reading this, then that means you probably know us.  You know how we work and how we do it for the love and we do it on the cheap.  But in this instance, there are things we simply can't get for free and we need you.  We need you to pitch in and help us with this project.  You've seen the original.  You know we've got a good story here.  But now, we need just a little bit of cash to get this thing over the hump.  Please please PLEASE pitch it.  Call it a holiday gift, call it a grand gesture.  Anything you can spare to help make our dream come to life.

story:
TIDO Official Facebook Page 

The idea of TIDO was initiated in 2015 as our internal project, inspired by a real-life stray tuxedo cat that used to hang out in our studio, and our love of popular cultures like paranormal events and conspiracy fictions. Due to limited resources, it took us about a year and a half to develop the full concept of TIDO — the stories, characters, its world, and the 3 minutes full CGI animated short film version.

Now we would like to present TIDO to wider audiences around the world, which help bringing TIDO to next level as an unique animated horror comedy series. The series will be made using full CGI technology, each episodes duration is 11 minutes. We target to premiere the series in late 2018.

With this opportunity, we sincerely invite you to help support this campaign, to become part of the production process and to create this unique animated horror comedy series.  


 

TIDO is a cynical tuxedo cat who constantly tries to run away from his overly possessive little owner named Dina, but no matter how badly he tried, his owner will always managed to find him. Fortunately, TIDO can see and speak with a bunch of misfit supernatural beings and monsters that human can’t. Therefore, TIDO befriends with these supernatural monsters, and uses them to help his escape plans.

Our main hero, TIDO, he's like a rebellious teenager, a little 'macho' guy who doesn’t like being treated like a child. Can’t speak to human, but can see and speak with the supernatural beings and monsters... 

TIDO's owner. Dina's a 10 year old little girl. Talkative, hyperactive, a total control freak. Dina also likes to act like a mother at home. Her parents are workaholic who spend most of their time working outside, Tido is her only playmate at home, that's why she'll do whatever to make sure Tido is on her side!

LOVE and HATE relationships between TIDO and DINA
 

In order to get rid of his nasty little owner, TIDO needs help from his
SUPERNATURAL BUDDIES....

One of them, it's a hipster monster who can fly around. Obsessed with internet, especially his FB fan page... Freddy always think he knows more than others and likes to show off his knowledge, but his suggestions often proved to be pointless. 

Jason is a big fella monster who always busy with his bowling-liked head. One of his supernatural abilities is that he can detach his head and throws it everywhere to become like a surveillance camera. 

Lexter is just like a small kid with four legs and a creepy mask. Easily scared by almost anything. This guy always think that he has such supernatural power that he could run faster than others, but in reality maybe not.

Robert is an introvert, a very quiet personality. TIDO likes him a lot, because whatever Tido tries to tell him, Robert will always there to listen. One of his supernatural ability is that, no matter what happened, good or bad, Robert will always keep smiling....


Below are some of the conceptual arts for the world of TIDO...







 

We want to produce TIDO animated series with YOUR HELP! We came to Indiegogo to reach out fans of horror comedy and animation fanatics across the world, to invite you to be part of the production and get your hands on some exclusive rewards.

WHERE DO YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS GO?

All funds raised through our Indiegogo campaign will go towards the series production costs that consist of different sections such as modelling, rigging, animation, shading, lighting, rendering, voice recording, sound design and music composition. With your help, we will be able to expand the production team, to produce TIDO towards higher quality animation contents with more engaging stories and characters.

In addition to the cost of making the series, part of the funds will also be used to help us offer our backers high quality, limited edition Perks, so you get great value items when supporting us. 

We’ve calculated that we need a minimum of $150,000 for the production of 3 episodes. If we can go over the amount, we will be able to produce more episodes and introduce more exciting new characters. 

TIDO will be produced by theCommonist, a film and animation production company based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Founded by Darrel Chia (Film Director / Producer) and Tai Keck Yuen (Animation & VFX Supervisor), theCommonist provides one-stop services for TV commercials, music videos, internet contents and feature films for Malaysia and International markets since 2009.


Here are some rewards we would like to offer you for your kind support! 









Please note that some of the items shown are mockups and there might be slight modification or colour changes to the items. We will try our best to update actual item photos along the campaign. 

 

Episodes & Release Date:

Due to unforeseen circumstances and the final amount fund raised from this campaign, the release date of the series could be delayed, and the total episodes of the series may be affected. But we promise to keep our supporters updated at every stages possible!

 
TIDO Official Facebook Page
story_txt: TIDO Official Facebook Page The idea of TIDO was initiated in 2015 as our internal project, inspired by a real-life stray tuxedo cat that used to hang out in our studio, and our love of popular cultures like paranormal events and conspiracy fictions. Due to limited resources, it took us about a year and a half to develop the full concept of TIDO — the stories, characters, its world, and the 3 minutes full CGI animated short film version.Now we would like to present TIDO to wider audiences around the world, which help bringing TIDO to next level as an unique animated horror comedy series. The series will be made using full CGI technology, each episodes duration is 11 minutes. We target to premiere the series in late 2018.With this opportunity, we sincerely invite you to help support this campaign, to become part of the production process and to create this unique animated horror comedy series.   TIDO is a cynical tuxedo cat who constantly tries to run away from his overly possessive little owner named Dina, but no matter how badly he tried, his owner will always managed to find him. Fortunately, TIDO can see and speak with a bunch of misfit supernatural beings and monsters that human can’t. Therefore, TIDO befriends with these supernatural monsters, and uses them to help his escape plans.Our main hero, TIDO, he's like a rebellious teenager, a little 'macho' guy who doesn’t like being treated like a child. Can’t speak to human, but can see and speak with the supernatural beings and monsters... TIDO's owner. Dina's a 10 year old little girl. Talkative, hyperactive, a total control freak. story:
What Will the Old School Coach TV Show be About?

The Old School Coach unscripted TV show is an extension of what Coach does in his one-on-one training sessions. We follow the lives of several families, couples, or individuals, over the course of a season, as Coach uses every tool and trick in his book to bring these broken bodies and lives into restoration. We watch Coach: Train, Inspire, Cajole, Provoke, Tease, Taunt, whatever it takes to change their lives and health for the better.

The first show begins by introducing us to our season participants. We hear them tell their stories of severe health issues or how they got into shape they are currently in. We see pictures of “better days gone by”, or of a whole life of bad health choices. Each one tells us how they want to change, but why they can’t.

As the season progresses we follow the successes and failures of each participant. We watch Coach brings his special sense of humor and tough love to reshape their lives, health, and bodies. He trains each one differently to match their personality, but from his core philosophy: "Train Your Mind, Change Your Body!"

Of course, the segments of Coach working with his clients will be interspersed with his fun, entertaining, and off-kilter life.

 

Who is This Old School Coach?

After you watch the videos below you will know everything to need to know!

Emmy-Award winning actor Kim Estes explains "Who is this Old School Coach?"
 
 

Old School Coach takes Hollywood by storm!

 

Coach working a client, Ben Lowe.

 

Old School Coach martial arts montage.

 

Coach explains "Why Old School Coach?"

 

How Can Old School Coach Help the World?

The health of America is undergoing an alarming decline. For the first time: since the 1960s the average American lifespan has decreased 2 years in a row. Type 2 diabetes is at epidemic proportion and costs America $671 million per day. The fraction of the disease death rate from preventable diseases is estimated to be close to 40%. 70% of Americans are overweight and 1 in 3 are classified as obese.

In this era with an enormous amount of easily accessible health and fitness information and knowledge, why is the health of America in such a horrible state? It’s because the current health and fitness industry is shortsighted and focused on selling “get fit quick” products and ideas; it does not focus on permanently changing people’s behavior. This neglected concept is exactly the focus of Old School Coach. He strives to guide people to recognize their own faulty belief systems and replace them with healthy ones, thus changing their behavior now and for the future.

He has lived a lifetime of health and fitness and is proof that YOU can do it too! NO EXCUSES!

 

The extraordinarily talented and experienced team who have faulty belief systems and think Old School Coach should be on TV.

    

Rick Sordelet - Producer

Rick and his son, Christian Kelly-Sordelet, with author David Blixt, are the creators of Sordelet INK. Founded in 2012 as a platform for stories across multiple mediums, Sordelet INK was created to give authors, screenwriters, and playwrights a place to publish their work, their way. And all with a theatrical flourish. Although Rick is primarily know as this country’s leading fight director, he has a diverse background as a writer for film and television and he is a co-screenwriter of the upcoming film "20,000 Leagues Under The Sea" produced by Fox and directed by Bryan Singer. Rick serves as a co-artistic director for the American Theater Group. His work as a fight director has taken him all over the world with a 30 year career. 

He believes Old School Coach should be on TV.

 

   

Christian Kelly-Sordelet - Director

Christian has worked all over the world as a fight director. He partners with his father Rick they and they are increasing their profile with even more work in the theatrical venue. Christian has taught at Rutgers, NYU, Yale, The New School, and Wagner.

He believes Old School Coach should be on TV.

 

    

Lori Lewis - Creative Director

Lori is integral to creating and launching of the Old School Coach TV Show. Lori’s background as a radio DJ, professional Opera Singer, and an entrepreneur, made her an easy choice for Creative Director. Lori is often called a spark plug and is known for bringing people and ideas together.

She believes Old School Coach should be on TV.

 

    

Cliff Lewis - Executive Producer

Cliff is the brains behind the Old School Coach brand. A theoretical physicist with a PhD from UCSD, he is sometimes known as Dr. Rock ‘n Roll for his background as a member of the heavy metal hair band Femme Fatale on MCA records. Cliff is CEO and President of Think Tank Analytics, which specializes in utilizing data for improving and enriching lives.

He believes Old School Coach should be on TV.

 

Other People With Faulty Belief Systems Who Think Coach Should be on TV

Drew Gordon -

Five year old actress Drew Gordon ("Ice Cream in the Cupboard") gives her take on Old School Coach.

Lanny Joon -

Lanny Joon (Lost, Baby Driver) has some words for Old School Coach.

Marsh Shamburger -

An Old School success story! Coach talks with his client, Marsh Shamburger, about how some of his health issues (high blood pressure, enlarged aeortic valve) were greatly improved by getting healthy and fit with Coach.

 

Our Budget

We are planning to do a two-day shoot in Albuquerque, New Mexico in May 2018. The budget for the shoot is $20,500. This, in addition to $4,500 to produce the merchandise for the perks puts us right at the fundraiser goal of $25,000.

 

The Perks

 
 
We have a wide variety of perks for you to choose from, but for our "featured perk" we are excited to offer our high-quality, extremely comfortable Old School Coach hoodie that has never been available for purchase. We created the hoodie for Celebrity Gifting Suites and they have been a huge hit! Several celebrities have embraced the Old School Coach brand and have posted pictures of themselves wearing the hoodie on social media and this has created a large buzz about the brand!
 
 
While the hoodies are eye-catching, what's unique are the Old School Coach-isms on the back of the hoodie. These Coach-isms connect with people of all ages, male and female, as a way of celebrating their uniqueness. Now here is your chance to get the item exclusively through this fundraiser!
 
 

All images: Tasha Dwhaj - Model-Artist-Singer-Model

Other Ways You Can Help

Simple!

  • Spread the news about Old School Coach and this fundraiser!
  • Share this page on your favorite social media channels.
  • Follow and like Old School Coach on his social media:
    • Facebook: Old School Coach Facebook link
    • Twitter: Old School Coach Twitter link
    • Instagram: Old School Coach Instagram link
    • Website: https://www.oldschoolcoach.org

story:
About the Project:

Play The Fool is a comedic web series about a young actor, Manuel, who buries a stupid grudge with his ex-best friend and low-key social media celebrity, Raul, to get access to his followers and get on the fast track to fame himself. In the process, Manuel is unknowingly thrust into a love triangle with the two people he thought he could trust most. *wipes away tears* We've all been there, right? 

The clip above is a concept trailer to hopefully give you an idea of our vibe, an intro to the characters, and their stories for the show. With your contributions, you'll help bring the real deal to life when we shoot the two-part pilot of this web series in December 2017. 

This has been an absolute passion project for the last year, and I feel like it's finally ready to share with all of you lovely people. It's an absolute dream come true to have so many amazing people involved to help me bring this story to life.

A little more info about us:

 

Daniel Martinez - Creator, Writer, Executive Producer, STAH! (Manuel)

Daniel started in the industry as an actor living in San Francisco. With a BA from the University of San Francisco, he appeared in commercials for Hipchat, Skyy Vodka, and Yik Yak. As Daniel tried to break into short films and bigger roles, it became clear that he would be categorized and placed into stereotypes based on his brown skin and chubbier build. And as a 5th generation American, Daniel always felt like he was "too Mexican" to be American, and "too American" to be Mexican. This inspired him to take his career into his own hands and learn how to write and produce his own stories so that he could help diversify the representation of minorities in TV and Film. He firmly believes that we're more than our cultures, and it's okay to be a multi-faceted, multi-layered character who happens to have brown skin, and have no connection to your ethnicity if that's not your experience. Daniel also bases a lot of his stories off his own life, and really loves finding the comedy in everything, no matter how tragic. Now in his third year as a Writing and Producing for Television grad student at LMU, Daniel is ready to tackle the "real world" while bringing his unique shade of brown, and voice to the party. Daniel's a fool for hot men, cookies and cream milkshakes, and charcuterie plates. 

 

 

Brenna Malloy - Director

Brenna Malloy graduated from the University of San Francisco after earning a BA in Media Studies with a minor in theater. She cultivated her passion of storytelling through performance for two terms at The Drama Centre London. In London she trained under acclaimed Scottish theater director Lorne Campbell. At Chapman University, Brenna continued her education by earning an MFA in Film Production with an emphasis in Directing. She was closely mentored by directors David Ward, Martha Coolidge, and Nick Meyer. Brenna continued to work as an independent filmmaker, directing shorts, both before and during her time in her master's film program. As a director, Brenna prides herself on her attention to subtle storytelling detail, her focus on performance and passion for bringing female characters with depth to the big screen. She endeavors to tell stories close to the heart, while at the same time aiming to reach a wide audience with each film. Her thesis film, Rocket, has won a Student Academy Award, an Individual Merit Award for Best Director at the Richmond International Film Festival, awards in China, the UK, and has screened in over forty festivals in eight countries. Brenna's a fool for gin martinis...with a twist! 

 

Justin Alpern - Cinematographer and Producer

Justin Alpern was born in California and has lived and worked all over the west coast. He has been capturing the world on film ever since his Dad loaned him his first camera - a Contax RTS with Zeiss lenses - when he was 12 years old. He graduated from Linfield College with a degree in studio art and art history. After graduation, he created a fine art gallery in Portland and continued to work as a photographer and videographer. In Portland, he found his way onto a film set and hasn't looked back since. His passion for the craft and the desire to teach brought him to Chapman University where he earned an MFA in Cinematography. After graduation Justin started MEE LLC, a production company focused on corporate and commercial work. Currently, Justin lives in Culver City and works wherever the project takes him. Justin's a fool for gluten free baked goods! 

Eric Tate - Producer

Eric Tate is a fantasy-comedy writer and a third year Writing and Producing for Television graduate student at LMU. He lives to write, and works to live. He often finds himself in absurd situations that no one ever believes. But they happened, dammit! Eric's a fool for traveling, dogs, and Happy Hour deals.

 

Marion Arrou-Vignod - Script Supervisor

Marion hailed all the way from Antibes, France, almost six years ago. A second-year Writing and Producing for Television graduate student at LMU, she has worked as a script supervisor on several thesis films while working to build her own portfolio. An avid reader all her life, Marion first got into writing when she became hooked on shows like Buffy the Vampire Slayer. Marion's a fool for television shows, cheeseburgers, and being swarmed by puppies. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

In total, we are asking for $5,000 to help make this project the best that it can be. The majority of our budget will go towards ensuring we have the best possible team in all phases of production to help make sure the project looks and sounds as professional as possible. The rest of the money we raise will go towards production design for our sets, food for our cast and crew, stipends for our actors, location permits, and other general expenses that occur when shooting a project. 

We know this is a lot to ask, but no donation is too small! Really. Whether it be $1, or $1,000,000, we are immensely thankful to each of you for taking the time to support our project. To help entice you, we are more than willing to give you more bang for your buck with our fabulous perks! Particularly, you can make Daniel Martinez make a fool of himself any way you see fit for just $10. Go on! Have fun with it! 

Other perks include a personalized video from the cast, behind the scenes videos and photos, a chance to be IN the project, and a chance to visit the actual set! Check them out! 

The Impact

Your contribution will be profoundly beneficial and appreciated. There's a myriad of independent web series and films out there in the world, and it's easy to be drowned out by them. I firmly believe that my perspective as a storyteller is a unique one, and one that deserves a chance in the spotlight. Your contribution can help us get there and establish ourselves to continue to bring you unique, funny, tragic, and messy stories with compelling characters of color. I thank you in advance for your generosity, and for believing in us. We may be fools, but we'll hopefully make you proud! 

-Daniel Martinez

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand that not everybody has the privilege of donating. That's okay! Any form of support means the world to us! 

Please follow us on social media, and share with all your friends and family and help get the word out there! 

Facebook.com/playthefoolwebseries
Instagram: @playthefoolwebseries

He often finds himself in absurd situations that no one ever believes. But they happened, dammit! Eric's a fool for traveling, dogs, and Happy Hour deals.
