Marion hailed all the way from Antibes, France, almost six years ago. A second-year Writing and Producing for Television graduate student at LMU, she has worked as a script supervisor on several thesis films while working to build her own portfolio. An avid reader all her life, Marion first got into writing when she became hooked on shows like Buffy the Vampire Slayer. Marion's a fool for television shows, cheeseburgers, and being swarmed by puppies. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
In total, we are asking for $5,000 to help make this project the best that it can be. The majority of our budget will go towards ensuring we have the best possible team in all phases of production to help make sure the project looks and sounds as professional as possible. The rest of the money we raise will go towards production design for our sets, food for our cast and crew, stipends for our actors, location permits, and other general expenses that occur when shooting a project. 
We know this is a lot to ask, but no donation is too small! Really. Whether it be $1, or $1,000,000, we are immensely thankful to each of you for taking the time to support our project. To help entice you, we are more than willing to give you more bang for your buck with our fabulous perks! Particularly, you can make Daniel Martinez make a fool of himself any way you see fit for just $10. Go on! Have fun with it! 
Other perks include a personalized video from the cast, behind the scenes videos and photos, a chance to be IN the project, and a chance to visit the actual set! Check them out! 

The Impact
Your contribution will be profoundly beneficial and appreciated. There's a myriad of independent web series and films out there in the world, and it's easy to be drowned out by them. I firmly believe that my perspective as a storyteller is a unique one, and one that deserves a chance in the spotlight. Your contribution can help us get there and establish ourselves to continue to bring you unique, funny, tragic, and messy stories with compelling characters of color. I thank you in advance for your generosity, and for believing in us. We may be fools, but we'll hopefully make you proud! 
-Daniel Martinez

Other Ways You Can Help
We fully understand that not everybody has the privilege of donating. That's okay! Any form of support means the world to us! 
Please follow us on social media, and share with all your friends and family and help get the word out there! 
Facebook.com/playthefoolwebseriesInstagram: @playthefoolwebseries

story:
THE SHOW

Raise The Bar is a fresh and new show about the art of cocktail making.

There is nothing like this out there and we want to change that. Unlike other shows, we will not be baking cakes or cooking fancy dishes. Just making drinks, tasty ones at that. This show will have a cool and professional vibe as we focus on the skill and creativity needed to be the best behind the bar!

Renaissance Vodka are pleased to support and sponsor the project. Alongside providing our vodka, Renaissance mixologist Antonio Del Monte will proffer consultancy for the show.

We're a small group of Film Production students, hoping to get this show off it's feet and out there for you to see!

SO WHAT EXACTLY ARE WE ASKING FOR?

As you've seen in the video, we've secured a high quality Tv Studio to film in with 4K cameras and crew. We're also collaborating with interior designers to create a set for the show. We need your donation to help pay for:

  • Materials for the set
  • Cast - some top notch bartenders 
  • Presenter- someone who can keep the spirits up and conversation flowing from contestants
  • Travel- trains, planes,automobiles for cast and crew
  • Catering- food, glorious food
  • Props- Cocktail equipment isn't cheap. We need glasses, shakers, measures, everything needed to make a decent drink
  • Ingredients- mixers, spirits, garnishes. We have 2 contestants and 3 challenges, each one will need a table full of ingredients and don't forget rehearsals

But it's not like you won't get anything in return. Have a browse through the rewards, from badges to shot glasses. As a thank you for the donation we want to give you something for your generosity.

WHAT YOUR HELP CAN DO

Cocktail making is moving into the mainstream. People are becoming more interested in mixology than ever before and we want to be a part of the movement. There isn't anything like this out there and we want to be the first. By donating, you're helping us get that one step closer to making a high quality show that can possibly become something huge.

CHALLENGES WE FACE

As it's a Tv Studio, we will be editing live through a vision mixer. This means that on the day it has to be perfect without any hiccups. The show itself will be 30 minutes in the studio. In post we will trim it down to be 15 with VT inserts and transitions to keep it interesting. All the crew are highly trained in the studio. To make sure we'll be in best shape on the day, we'll be rehearsing regularly, filming practices and mini challenges. Each rehearsal will be posted on our social media so you can see how we're getting on with things.

WHAT IF YOU DON'T HAVE MONEY BUT STILL WANT TO HELP?

We've got pages on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. If you can't donate a simple share of the pages and post will help us reach more people and share our idea. Look out for regular videos and photography by our team to give an idea of what we're doing and the shows style.

story:
What The F*** Is This?

It all started one day in 2012... 

Lucy and Jeremy got in line for an audition...and a representative of the actor's union threatened to call the cops and have them arrested for loitering. A few hours later, at yet another audition, Lucy started to perform her monologue...and was interrupted by a small dog harassing her leg as Jeremy watched in horror. It was only noon. And from that point on, the stories just started writing themselves.

Way The F*** Off Broadway is the brainchild of best friends Lucy Zukaitis and Jeremy Sonkin. It's a web series that chronicles the experience of two actors struggling to make a living in the Chicago entertainment industry. It follows their journey as they endure scores of ridiculous auditions in hopes of getting work, all the while balancing their numerous survival jobs and trying to find happiness and fulfillment in their every day lives. Though some stories are embellished slightly for entertainment value, every episode is inspired by true events.

In order to make our series a reality, we need some support. Unless we book a couple of Broadway principal contracts, our actor salaries aren't quite sufficient to cover the cost of producing a show. Please consider donating to help us bring Way The F*** Off Broadway to life!

What We Need:

  • Our goal is to raise a total of $15,000 to shoot the first three episodes.
  • This money will cover the costs of:
    • Equipment costs: camera package, lighting and sound equipment
    • Location expenses
    • Kraft Services-on set catering
    • Our Production Team: director, assistant director, director of photography, camera operators, sound technicians, hair and makeup artist, actors
    • Post Production costs: editing, composers and musicians, web usage

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount can help us--BUT even if you're unable to contribute monetarily, we would still appreciate your help!

  • Exposure is everything! Please help us spread the word and generate interest.
  • Share our Indiegogo campaign with EVERYONE!
  • Tell your friends- or random people you meet on the street- to check out our website: www.waythefuckoffbroadway.com
  • Follow us on social media:
    • www.facebook.com/wtfobwebseries/
    • www.instagram.com/waythefuckoffbroadway/
    • https://twitter.com/waythefoffbway

Thank you for your support-it means the world to us. We couldn't be more excited to bring our vision to life, and we couldn't do it without you. We look forward to seeing you Way The F*** Off Broadway!

story:
The Sitar, the research of a magical instrument.

The legend is telling, that The Goddess Saraswati gave this stringed instrument to humans. 
This instrument has 2 sets of strings: one on top of the other. When the strings are played, the secondary strings resonate, creating a “sympathetic effect” results in the mystical sound, which the Sitar is known and loved for.

 

History of Resonando

After the new sunrise of the 13 Baktun (the beginning of the new era according to the Mayan cosmology), we felt the necessity of sharing what we felt passionate about and share it with other people. So my luthier brother (Chelelongius) proposed me (Carolingius) to conduct investigations, into the most unique musical instruments in the world and share it for free with all the people we feel connected to and that have the same passion for musical instruments. . This, to further understand their origin, cultural importance and specifically the unique process of their creation. But, which instruments qualifies to be part of such investigational project? Stringed, percussion, wind…

 

Chapter 1 - The Udu Drum, sounds from the hearth of the earth

In the Mayan Book, The Popol Vuh, the gods Kucumatz and Huracan, chose to create the first humans from mud… therefore we found it interesting to research such a basic instrument that can be made out of just mud - a pottery musical instrument, a ceramic drum, “The Udu”.

Chapter 1 is a documentation of the different technics of constructing the Udu, it´s secrets, the workshops and the variety of its different sounds.

Watch it here ( http://resonandogt.com/udu-drum.html).

 

Let’s make it possible

We financed Resonando Chapter 1 by our own resources, but to make reality Chapter 2: The Sitar, we need to:

• Complete our Recording Equipment (Video, Lighting and Audio),

• Develop all the pre production, and research.

• Travel to India for the production.

• Send all the Rewards.

• Create and record, The traveler Sitar.

• Editing, post production.

Therefore we are asking for your help to make this mission & vision happen.

This chapter will begin with a ceremony, in the heart of the ancient India - In the temple of the Goddess Saraswati during a sunrise, asking for her blessings, and feeling a special appreciation for giving the Sitar to humanity, the music, the art, the knowledge & the wisdom.

We intent to include blessings for the people that helped us accomplish this part of the research in the ceremony.

 

As part of our investigation, my luthier brother Chelelongius will be building a Traveler model of a Guitar Sitar, following the same resonance principles of the sympathetic strings

 

 

WHO WE ARE?

RESONANDO is the creation of musical research by two Guatemalan siblings

Chele:

​​

Guatemalan inventor, craftsman, researcher and luthier with more than ten years of experience, has his own shop of custom-made instruments called UNIQ (https://www.uniqinstruments.com). He’s a Electronic Engineer, especialized on Lutherie, Analog Effects, Acoustic and Photography.

Carol: 

Guatemalan environmentalist, bass player, and a tree-planter by heart. She’s a Forestry and Natural Conservation Engineer graduated from the Chinese Culture University, she’s also studied permaculture and contemporary music.

For our new research, Resonando chapter2 The Sitar, research of a magical instrument. We are happy and honored to have a friend adventuring with us this new journey.

Guisseppe Badalamenti:

Central American based Director. Dp specialized in narrative filmmaking and experimental formats, his most comfortable are of work are videoclips and publicity, where he´s been awarded with two cannes creativity lions and a clio award; Badalamenti has proven to be one of the most influential visual storytellers in the region with a unique stroke that is both elegant and symbolic in all his flavors and phases.

(https://www.youtube.com/user/peppebadala)

Timeline 

FINANCE

 

WHAT YOU´LL GET 

 

De todo corazón: Thanks, MALTIOX, Gacias, 謝謝, Merci, Danke...

Carol & Chele 

 

DONATE, SHARE; come to explore  wonderful musical instruments  adventures!!!

Thanks for suporting Resonando.

Timeline 

FINANCE


 

WHAT YOU´LL GET

Carol & Chele  DONATE, SHARE; come to explore  wonderful musical instruments  adventures!!!Thanks for suporting Resonando.

story:
Hello!

I'm Carolyn Yuen Marino, creator and writer of Sweet & Power. I'm a full-time high school English teacher and part-time fashion blogger at heyprettything.com. I was born in Hong Kong, and I moved to Seattle, WA when I was a kid.

I created Sweet & Power because I want to watch a show like this on Netflix! I believe that if we don’t see the representation that we want in media then we should be a part of that change.

About the Characters

Carolyn Yuen Marino -- Cici Yuen

Cici is a 1st year high school English teacher and aspiring social media influencer… or something. She doesn’t know what she wants, but she just knows she wants more out of life.

Yeji Kim Sakoda -- Yoona Kang

Yoona is Cici’s best friend from college at the University of Washington. Yoona’s parents are 1st generation Korean Americans immigrants who’ve “made it”. They put a ton of pressure on her to be successful, and she knows how to play the part -- at least in public.

Becca Cheung -- Robin Chan

Robin is Cici’s childhood best friend. She’s born to wealthy 2nd generation Chinese American parents, and she’s a free-spirited socialite who does whatever she wants on whim, which gets her into a whole lot of… interesting situations.

NoyNoy Inthaphanya -- Noy Inchareon

Noy is friends with Cici and Yoona from UW. She’s a hustler with three jobs, and she’s coming into her own sexuality while navigating a tricky secret crush.

We Need Your Help! 

Sweet & Power is a super small team. I'm the writer, director, producer, location scout, casting director, and more. Scott Ohashi is the videographer, and my friends/extended network are the actors.

  • Each episode costs nearly $2,000 to produce.

Currently, I'm paying out of pocket to cover all the costs.

  • We need to raise at least $10,000 to fully fund Season 1.

Ideally, we can exceed that goal so we can compensate the rest of the team. All the funds will go to Sweet & Power and pay for the videographer, production costs, marketing and promotions, and more.

The 1st episode is done, but we need your help to film the next 4 episodes!

If you want to see more Asian Americans in media or the shenanigans that Cici and her friends get into, then please support us!

Production Schedule

We all have full time jobs and are hustling to make this passion project come true. We'll be filming and releasing one episode a month. Below are the episodes, titles, and projected release dates.

Season 1

  • Episode 1 - "Proof" - September 17
  • Episode 2 - "Boys" - October 15
  • Episode 3 - "Girls" - November 12
  • Episode 4 - "Likes" - December 10
  • Episode 5 - "Sisyphus" - January 14

I personally promise you that I'm working tirelessly to ensure that we adhere to our production schedule.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please subscribe to Sweet & Power on YouTube!

Support us by spreading the word about Sweet & Power! Like and share our videos and posts on social media. Tell your friends, coworkers, family... anyone and everyone!

You can follow us on Instagram and Facebook for updates and behind-the-scenes footage.

We appreciate you!

-------

Vector illustrations Vecteezy.com

story:
Who am I?

My name is Greg Wicker. Since 1999 I've been producing and hosting Hollywood-style game show entertainment for fandom conventions across North America. I launched a Youtube channel ten years ago, featuring footage from hundreds of game shows that I've produced over the years.

After the most recent issues with Patreon, I've decided to forego using them as a fundraising platform and have instead chosen Indiegogo to continue to keep the Youtube channel going and growing. Utilizing this campaign, I'll be able to continue giving regular editing jobs to the people who've upped the quality of my game show videos!

What We Need & What You Get

In order to maintain the level of two videos per month (which the last months of Patreon were able to maintain), I am asking for a minimum of $100 per video for six videos, two for September, October and November.  

As the campaign crosses each $100 threshold, I will send payment and raw footage to one of my three editors. As soon as the video is completed and quality-checked, it will be uploaded to my Youtube channel.

If the campaign exceeds the goal, for every $100 increment in excess of the $600 goal, I will send footage and payment to an editor for a bonus video.

If we fail to cross the $100 threshold for the first video, I will attempt this campaign again in November for video uploads in winter.

There are incentives to contributing beyond helping get more Greggo's Game Shows on Youtube! First, for any contribution you get your name in the credits of the video you're funding.

If you contribute at least $15 (and are in the United States), you can choose any one of the buttons I've created that I sell at conventions. Either I can mail one to you or I can bring one to a convention you happen to be attending where I'm performing:

A contribution of $25 or more will get you a button (if you're in the US) and will get you guaranteed "frontest-row" seating at any game show at any convention where I'm performing. In other words, you can sit as far front as the convention will allow (some have reserved VIP seating) and can beat the lines so long as I know you're coming!

A contribution of $100 or more will give you the opportunity to choose any video you want, and provided we filmed it and its contents aren't duplicate of another convention's playing of that same show, I'll immediately send its footage and a payment to an editor, and it will get made and uploaded! You'll also get a button if you're in the US and "frontest-row" seating as before.

Finally, a contribution of $150 gets you all the aforementioned perks, all six buttons if you're in the US, and you can choose one of the pieces of software I use in my games, and I'll send it to you to host your own game shows at home! (If you'd like to use my software for other reasons you'll need to contact me outside this campaign.)

 

Risks & Challenges

This is a pretty straightforward campaign. Each $100 pays for a video. My editors have done a great job at turning out their videos by the deadlines I've asked for. Should this campaign fail to attract enough interest, I will still be able to edit my own videos from time to time; they will just take a while and the schedule will be quite erratic in order to maintain the quality you're used to seeing from me.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute via Indiegogo, you can still contribute in other ways! Share this campaign with folks who you think can help. If you see that I'm coming to a convention near you, make sure to hype your friends and get them excited to see my games! And if you staff for a convention that could use my brand of programming, make sure to let them know about me!

And to all of you, thank you so much for your support over these past twenty years.

My name is Greg Wicker. Since 1999 I've been producing and hosting Hollywood-style game show entertainment for fandom conventions across North America. I launched a Youtube channel ten years ago, featuring footage from hundreds of game shows that I've produced over the years.After the most recent issues with Patreon, I've decided to forego using them as a fundraising platform and have instead chosen Indiegogo to continue to keep the Youtube channel going and growing. Utilizing this campaign, I'll be able to continue giving regular editing jobs to the people who've upped the quality of my game show videos!

What We Need & What You Get
In order to maintain the level of two videos per month (which the last months of Patreon were able to maintain), I am asking for a minimum of $100 per video for six videos, two for September, October and November.  
As the campaign crosses each $100 threshold, I will send payment and raw footage to one of my three editors. As soon as the video is completed and quality-checked, it will be uploaded to my Youtube channel.
If the campaign exceeds the goal, for every $100 increment in excess of the $600 goal, I will send footage and payment to an editor for a bonus video.
If we fail to cross the $100 threshold for the first video, I will attempt this campaign again in November for video uploads in winter.
There are incentives to contributing beyond helping get more Greggo's Game Shows on Youtube! First, for any contribution you get your name in the credits of the video you're funding.
If you contribute at least $15 (and are in the United States), you can choose any one of the buttons I've created that I sell at conventions. Either I can mail one to you or I can bring one to a convention you happen to be attending where I'm performing:

A contribution of $25 or more will get you a button (if you're in the US) and will get you guaranteed "frontest-row" seating at any game show at any convention where I'm performing. In other words, you can sit as far front as the convention will allow (some have reserved VIP seating) and can beat the lines so long as I know you're coming!
A contribution of $100 or more will give you the opportunity to choose any video you want, and provided we filmed it and its contents aren't duplicate of another convention's playing of that same show, I'll immediately send its footage and a payment to an editor, and it will get made and uploaded! You'll also get a button if you're in the US and "frontest-row" seating as before.
Finally, a contribution of $150 gets you all the aforementioned perks, all six buttons if you're in the US, and you can choose one of the pieces of software I use in my games, and I'll send it to you to host your own game shows at home! (If you'd like to use my software for other reasons you'll need to contact me outside this campaign.)
 

Risks & Challenges
This is a pretty straightforward campaign. Each $100 pays for a video. My editors have done a great job at turning out their videos by the deadlines I've asked for. Should this campaign fail to attract enough interest, I will still be able to edit my own videos from time to time; they will just take a while and the schedule will be quite erratic in order to maintain the quality you're used to seeing from me.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you're unable to contribute via Indiegogo, you can still contribute in other ways! Share this campaign with folks who you think can help. If you see that I'm coming to a convention near you, make sure to hype your friends and get them excited to see my games! And if you staff for a convention that could use my brand of programming, make sure to let them know about me!
And to all of you, thank you so much for your support over these past twenty years.

story:
Why Donate to This Thing?

We're making this series because we wanted to create something that felt fun and exciting to us. We consider it an ode to friendship and we hope you will enjoy it. The money you contribute will go directly to the young artists working to make this series happen (the actors, producer, director, audio professional, etc.)! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share our promo video and Indiegogo link on social media!
  • Keep an eye on our Facebook page for calls for extras and other production help!

story:
About the Project 

[L to R: Regina Renée Russell (Rebecca Jackson); Anna Stacy (Harper Young); Daniel Cabrera (Leo Solano); Joe Raik (Mac); Leslie Field (Eleanor Evans); Nicole Martinez (Maisie Perez); and Laurel Andersen (Jodie Bates)]

Dead-Enders is a comedy web series that follows a forum of doomsday preppers on their weekly video calls at the start of the zombie apocalypse. The show's pilot season was written and produced by longtime friends and collaborators Nicole Martinez and Anna Stacy in the early days of the COVID-19 pandemic, and the creative team has since grown in preparation for season 2.

When conceptualizing Dead-Enders, Nicole and Anna (hello!) sought to create a series that loosely paralleled the global pandemic and its accompanying isolation while still capturing the cozy feeling of an ensemble sitcom. The first episode takes place one week into the zombie apocalypse and over the course of season 1, the audience sees the preppers develop closer friendships as they adapt to a quickly-changing world.

Our small but mighty cast and crew sees so much promise in the series, which is why we’re asking for your support during our fundraising campaign. We are endeavoring to raise $20,000 in order to create a collaborative, fulfilling, and COVID-safe environment in which to film a high-quality eight-episode second season. With your donation, we can continue creating art and providing work for indie filmmakers in a time when the role of the arts is more important than ever. 


 

What We Need & What You'll Get


Season 1 was created with nothing more than a passionate, enthusiastic team of actors and a premium Zoom account — which is to say, with $0.  As the plot for season 2 is more ambitious and involved, our budget is expanding accordingly.

The majority of our raised funds will be allocated to the following areas: 

  • Expanded team
    • Paying our incredible (and considerably larger) team is our top priority. Each member of the cast and crew will be paid the same stipend, and any surplus funds raised will be allocated equally to the team itself
  • Equipment & Props
    • Equipment & tech: renting video, lighting, and audio equipment will rack up some of our highest costs
    • Buying & creating props: with zombie content comes the zombie aesthetic! Since it turns out we're unable to hire actual undead actors, we're gonna need to use all kinds of makeup and prosthetics to create the preppers' world
  • Food & Transportation
    • Craft Services: we want to ensure our team is well-nourished and caffeinated throughout the entire process
    • Location scouting/transportation: We'll be using funds to scout for filming locations and book/reserve any spaces needed
  • COVID precautions
    • ​It is essential to us that our set adheres to the most current COVID regulations, and providing testing as well as additional PPE and disinfectant materials for members of our team adds to our overall expenses


 

About the Team

[Top to bottom, L to R: Mark DePasquale (Director); Avani Galande (Editor); Gracie Giffune (Director/Gaffer); Dani Hanks (Director); Nicole Martinez (Writer); Becca Musser (Fight Choreographer); Christina “Cha” Ramos (Intimacy Director); Kristin Sgarro (Production Manager); Anna Stacy (Writer); Charles Stacy (Composer & Audio Engineer); Reed Yurman (Director); Ellie Zarr (Editor)]

We (Anna and Nicole) have been collaborating for six years, and our artistic relationship has only strengthened our friendship. After graduating college, our first collaboration was a full-length play entitled And What Grew There, which opened in December 2019 with the help of a minimal budget. That was over a year and a whole virus outbreak ago—since then, the considerably more ambitious first season of Dead-Enders was brought to life with an even scarcer budget

During the release of its first season, Dead-Enders was praised by multiple media outlets: the series was reviewed by media site Geek Insider’s online publication and discussed on its podcast; The Nerdy Girl Express wrote, “What Martinez and Stacy have created is fun to watch and it will have you laughing and enjoying yourself…[the preppers] will feel like friends you have happened to come upon on the internet.” Across the domestic and international film festival field, Dead-Enders has taken home the gold in multiple Best Web Series/Television categories (Royal Wolf Film Awards, White Unicorn Int. Film Fest) and has been featured as an official selection in many others.
 

[Dead-Enders director Dani Hanks (left) on the set of "Pretty, Ugly, Complicated"]

Dead-Enders was created in the wake of theaters canceling performances and filmmakers halting productions. A year since the virus first came to the US, more and more artists have taken to the digital world to create if they’ve not lost the drive to do so. We are deeply honored to be able to create a space for our fellow creators to practice their art. 

Additionally, as artists of color ourselves, inclusion and diversity have always been at the heart of Dead-Enders, on both sides of the camera. Women of color and LGBTQ+ folks are rarely the leads in genre fiction if they're in them at all, and we aim to disrupt that paradigm in everything we create. Dead-Enders is an opportunity to create something rooted in genuine collaboration and community. With this in mind, we’re delighted to introduce our expanded production team of award-winning indie filmmakers and a not-insignificant number of NYU alums (bonus points if you can spot them all). All of us are so excited to bring our talents together to create the series. 


 

Potential Challenges

[Dead-Enders director Mark DePasquale (right) with his digitally rendered "Coronabot"]

With our shooting schedule tentatively planned for summer 2021, one of our main challenges will be dependent on the vaccine rollout. Along with allocating part of the budget to proper PPE and sanitation procedures for the set, production meetings and initial rehearsals will be held over Zoom. 

We also understand that it can be difficult or even impossible to put aside a day job or use vacation time to film an indie web series. We will be filming on weekends in an effort to not take anyone away from their work. 

Other challenges we definitely face include the possibility of scaling back certain aspects of the season if we can’t reach our goal. Everything else aside, we mainly care about these characters and the emotional journeys they’ve set out on. But we prefer to not have to skimp on the zombie guts.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

[The cast celebrating the premiere of season 1]

If you can't donate, that's okay! It's been a tough year, to say the least. If you want to continue supporting LGBTQ+/BIPOC filmmakers and indie projects—heck, if you think one of the actors is a dreamboat—then here are some ways you can support us:

  • Watch the show here!
  • Follow us on Instagram and Facebook
  • Read more about the series and characters on our website
  • Spread the word about the show and share the campaign


Thank you again for taking the time to read our story — we look forward to your support!

Follow us on Instagram and Facebook

Spread the word about the show and share the campaign

Thank you again for taking the time to read our story — we look forward to your support!

story:
Who we are & What we're gonna do

We're apartment G26-2, six hardworking and driven Ithaca College students who are ready to get back to working and being creative after nine long months away. We can't wait to finally be back on set, but we're not willing to sacrifice safety to get there.

So how do we make a show while in lockdown? By stretching the limits of what our six-person apartment can accomplish and transforming ourselves into an incredibly hard-working skeleton crew for a brand-new comedy series! Everyone's pulling double, triple, even quadruple duty! Not opening our set up to anyone from outside the apartment will certainly be a challenge, but it's one we're more than up to!

Designed around these restrictions, and created by Joel Liss and Joshua Stein, Wormhole is an irreverent, Twilight-Zone-inspired, take on the Covid lockdown experience.

Quarantined in an apartment that happens to be the center of the universe, best friends Joel and Josh (played, naturally, by Joel and Josh) find themselves in increasingly confounding scenarios that break the laws of the natural world and threaten their friendship.

Our goal is to produce six short-form episodes over the course of our spring semester to be distributed over various digital platforms including Youtube, Facebook, and Instagram TV. We have the cast, we have the crew, and we've got the scripts. Now all we need is a little support from you to get this show up and running!

To see some of our prior work, check out our page's video gallery!

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise $2000 over Indiegogo for our six-episode first season. After taxes and fees, this will give us a budget of approximately $300 an episode.  How will we spend that money to ensure it all translates into quality onscreen?​​​

What we will be spending money on:

  • The majority of each episode's budget will be spent on props and other production design considerations. The pilot, for example, sees Joel throw a sugar glass vase at Josh. 
  • Some money will go to ensure the cast and crew (us) receive hot meals while shooting, and assistant editors get food covered during post-production. These 14-hour days aren't going to power themselves.
  • The rest will be set aside for incidentals, on a per-case basis at our discretion.

What we will NOT be spending money on:

  • Paying ourselves a salary of any kind.
  • Pricey licensing fees for content made by a third party, such as music or FX packages.
  • New Camera/Lighting/Sound gear.
  • A presidential pardon for Gilbert, the extraterrestrial sock puppet.

What YOU get:

We know we're no one special, just a couple of kids trying to make something cool, so we're not going to waste anyone's time offering "meet and greets with the cast and crew" or "signed copies of such-and-such." What we are offering as our perks are various ways that we can say "thank you for supporting our student project" in a way that we think will make everyone feel warm and cozy.  Your support really will mean the world to us, and we hope these various perks will provide a fun way for us to show you that.

    The Risks

    What happens if we don't reach our goal?

    We're still student creators, and the honest truth is that we could do this show for less. But it'll look a heck of a lot better with a little bit of spending behind it. At $300 an episode, we're still firmly in the scrappy microbudget territory of filmmaking, but even that will give us a huge boost toward accomplishing this challenge we've set for ourselves. But rest assured, no matter how much money we raise, this show is getting made.

    What happens if Ithaca transitions to online learning?

    Because the show will be shot in an on-campus apartment, its production is at least semi-contingent on the college maintaining its plan for on-campus living in the spring. Though we feel it's unlikely, were Ithaca College to announce a transition to a fully online spring semester, we have a couple of different contingency plans in place.

    If the college announces the transitions before the return to campus:

    1. The members of apartment G26-2 will likely be searching for different living accommodations in Ithaca during the semester, and the show would be produced there instead.
    2. We may also apply for an exception allowing us to move in to the apartment anyway.
    3. Barring that, if we haven't started rolling, we'll likely be able to issue partial refunds to all of our donors.

    If the college transitions online during the semester:

    1. Our first step will be to apply for exceptions allowing us to remain on-campus.
    2.  We may attempt to secure alternate accommodations while remaining in Ithaca, producing the remaining episodes there.
    3. Barring that, we will invest the remaining budget into a reworked, remotely-produced version of the concept or a similar concept.

    Why Wormhole?

    • Wormhole is a unique solution to a very strange, new problem: how to create something collaborative during a global pandemic without sacrificing safety? Not only will the show provide a creative outlet for the six residents of apartment G26-2, we'll also be working with a wide variety of student writers, composers, voice actors, and post-production artists to make this dream a reality.
    • We also believe that the show taps into the oftentimes discomforting experience of lockdown, quarantine, and isolation in a fun, weird, and exciting way. With this next year still looking as murky as it does, this is the perfect time for this concept to come to fruition.

     

    Thank You! Remember: Separately we are but singular worms. Together we are a wormwhole.

The members of apartment G26-2 will likely be searching for different living accommodations in Ithaca during the semester, and the show would be produced there instead.
We may also apply for an exception allowing us to move in to the apartment anyway.

Our first step will be to apply for exceptions allowing us to remain on-campus.
 We may attempt to secure alternate accommodations while remaining in Ithaca, producing the remaining episodes there.

Why Wormhole?



Wormhole is a unique solution to a very strange, new problem: how to create something collaborative during a global pandemic without sacrificing safety? Not only will the show provide a creative outlet for the six residents of apartment G26-2, we'll also be working with a wide variety of student writers, composers, voice actors, and post-production artists to make this dream a reality.
We also believe that the show taps into the oftentimes discomforting experience of lockdown, quarantine, and isolation in a fun, weird, and exciting way. With this next year still looking as murky as it does, this is the perfect time for this concept to come to fruition.

 
Thank You! Remember: Separately we are but singular worms. Together we are a wormwhole.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

My name is Eric C. Jones, And My name is Lea M Jones. We are the CEO and COO of Morningstar Media Group, and we have an amazing series we want to share with you. Both me and Lea have a lot in common. We are both Siblings. We are both Creative Artists. And we both love holiday music. Our love goes back to our choir days when we were younger. We thought would not be cool to create a TV web series that spotlights the origins of your favorite Christmas songs come from? So, for the last 12 years, we have created the 25 Songs of Christmas.

WHAT ARE THE 25 SONGS OF CHRISTMAS?

The 25 Songs of Christmas is an annual holiday web series that spotlights one-holiday song every day from December 1st thru December 25. Think of it as a BEHIND THE MUSIC of your favorite Holiday Songs. Each episode will have color commentary, pop trivia, funny sketches, and amazing pre-recorded performances from local and national performing artists from the world of dance, drama, and music.

WHY DO THIS SHOW?

I love to see the smile on people's faces when they hear holiday songs because it brings back so many memories. Presenting this program is equally exciting to see young people hear this glorious music for the very first time. Holiday music, when it is presented the right way, can really bring people together. A Web Series can be entertaining as well as educational. 25 Songs of Christmas fulfills both goals.

WHAT ARE OUR GOALS?

We want to see our show expand to a much wider audience. We have a strong following on social media, and we have steady activity on our website at www.25songsofchristmas.com. We plan to create a podcast version of our series and have our episodes broadcast on Houston’s local digital channels. But we know we are s going to need more financial support to take our series to the next level. This is what we need.

WHAT DO WE NEED?

We need to hire and pay for actors. Musicians and singers We need to hire and pay for a video Crew. With talents such as DP, PA, SOUND TECH, and an editor, We are also planning to rent Lighting Equipment; Sound equipment, Pay for Insurance, Security, Crafts, and Services.  YOU GET THE PICTURE.

WHERE DO YOU COME IN?

We need your faithful financial support to help us create a successful season. We are asking our friends, family, and fans to support us through a generous donation. Each gift you give will help us with curbing the cost of our web series. Every penny will go into the production and postproduction of our show.

BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP!

 

PERKS OF BEING A CAROLER!

We love our fans because they love holiday music. We tenderly call them CAROLERS! There are many rewards to helping us with our goal. For many of our donors, you will receive free advertising at the end of each Broadcast for December. We will personally thank you on the air. You will have an exclusive access link to our VIP 25 Songs of Christmas Sing a Long ZOOM coming up in Mid-December. This party will have special live musical guests. WE will also send you a personalized Video Season’s Greeting Card from yours, truly thanking you for supporting the music. Hey, we will even help you mow your yard. OK! Not that! But every donor will be guaranteed to have their names posted in the credits of each episode. BUT YOU NEED TO GIVE!

HOW LONG IS OUR CAMPAIGN?

We need to raise $5000 to make 25 Songs of Christmas 2021. Each season our show has a theme. This year is called SEASON of Love. Would you mind spreading the love by helping season 12 of the 25 Songs of Christmas become a success?
 

Thank you for your time, and Happy Holidays.

My name is Eric C. Jones, And My name is Lea M Jones. We are the CEO and COO of Morningstar Media Group, and we have an amazing series we want to share with you. Both me and Lea have a lot in common. We are both Siblings. We are both Creative Artists. And we both love holiday music. Our love goes back to our choir days when we were younger. We thought would not be cool to create a TV web series that spotlights the origins of your favorite Christmas songs come from? So, for the last 12 years, we have created the 25 Songs of Christmas.
WHAT ARE THE 25 SONGS OF CHRISTMAS?
The 25 Songs of Christmas is an annual holiday web series that spotlights one-holiday song every day from December 1st thru December 25. Think of it as a BEHIND THE MUSIC of your favorite Holiday Songs. Each episode will have color commentary, pop trivia, funny sketches, and amazing pre-recorded performances from local and national performing artists from the world of dance, drama, and music.
WHY DO THIS SHOW?
I love to see the smile on people's faces when they hear holiday songs because it brings back so many memories. Presenting this program is equally exciting to see young people hear this glorious music for the very first time. Holiday music, when it is presented the right way, can really bring people together. A Web Series can be entertaining as well as educational. 25 Songs of Christmas fulfills both goals.
WHAT ARE OUR GOALS?
We want to see our show expand to a much wider audience. We have a strong following on social media, and we have steady activity on our website at www.25songsofchristmas.com. We plan to create a podcast version of our series and have our episodes broadcast on Houston’s local digital channels. But we know we are s going to need more financial support to take our series to the next level. This is what we need.
WHAT DO WE NEED?
We need to hire and pay for actors. Musicians and singers We need to hire and pay for a video Crew. With talents such as DP, PA, SOUND TECH, and an editor, We are also planning to rent Lighting Equipment; Sound equipment, Pay for Insurance, Security, Crafts, and Services.  YOU GET THE PICTURE.
WHERE DO YOU COME IN?
We need your faithful financial support to help us create a successful season. We are asking our friends, family, and fans to support us through a generous donation. Each gift you give will help us with curbing the cost of our web series. Every penny will go into the production and postproduction of our show.
BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP!
 
PERKS OF BEING A CAROLER!
We love our fans because they love holiday music. We tenderly call them CAROLERS! There are many rewards to helping us with our goal. For many of our donors, you will receive free advertising at the end of each Broadcast for December. We will personally thank you on the air. You will have an exclusive access link to our VIP 25 Songs of Christmas Sing a Long ZOOM coming up in Mid-December. This party will have special live musical guests. WE will also send you a personalized Video Season’s Greeting Card from yours, truly thanking you for supporting the music. Hey, we will even help you mow your yard. OK! Not that! But every donor will be guaranteed to have their names posted in the credits of each episode. BUT YOU NEED TO GIVE!
HOW LONG IS OUR CAMPAIGN?
We need to raise $5000 to make 25 Songs of Christmas 2021. Each season our show has a theme. This year is called SEASON of Love. Would you mind spreading the love by helping season 12 of the 25 Songs of Christmas become a success? 
Thank you for your time, and Happy Holidays.

story:
The Story

Two tiny  alien beings examine American Media to find the best humans to inhabit for infiltration of the species and determine “Potheads” the perfect cover because of existing perceptions as suspicious misfit ne'er do wells. Targeting a pair of notorious stoners, discovered through social media posts, the aliens insert themselves into tiny pods and take over the bodies of the men only to discover that their preconceptions are very wrong. The unsuspecting smokers also soon realize they are possessed by aliens and fight back in ways never imagined. The cannabis they constantly smoke gives the stoners control over the alien’s  controls and the tables are soon turned. But can the two men control their newfound abilities?

Why We Need The Money

Here is more detail as to why we need funding:

  • To pay actors for the 1 week shoot.
  • To hire camera crew and sound, lighting assistance.
  • To help build the sets and purchase costumes and props.
  • To help us rent studio space and equipment.
  • For special effects, green-screen and post-production.

The Reason It's Important To Us

It's very difficult to overcome stereotypes for many people for many reason. Cannabis smokers are one of the most falsely perceived people on the Earth due to the portrayal of characters such as Cheech and Chong, although we all love them dearly, who have done more harm to the reputation of pot smokers than may ever be overcome. That is unless we try.

The Story
Two tiny  alien beings examine American Media to find the best humans to inhabit for infiltration of the species and determine “Potheads” the perfect cover because of existing perceptions as suspicious misfit ne'er do wells. Targeting a pair of notorious stoners, discovered through social media posts, the aliens insert themselves into tiny pods and take over the bodies of the men only to discover that their preconceptions are very wrong. The unsuspecting smokers also soon realize they are possessed by aliens and fight back in ways never imagined. The cannabis they constantly smoke gives the stoners control over the alien’s  controls and the tables are soon turned. But can the two men control their newfound abilities?

Why We Need The Money
Here is more detail as to why we need funding:

To pay actors for the 1 week shoot.
To hire camera crew and sound, lighting assistance.
To help build the sets and purchase costumes and props.
To help us rent studio space and equipment.
For special effects, green-screen and post-production.


The Reason It's Important To Us
It's very difficult to overcome stereotypes for many people for many reason. Cannabis smokers are one of the most falsely perceived people on the Earth due to the portrayal of characters such as Cheech and Chong, although we all love them dearly, who have done more harm to the reputation of pot smokers than may ever be overcome. That is unless we try.

story:
The concept of the show came about when producer Jerald Garner met with producer William Constantine. Jerald heard William's life story about growing up with the ability to see beings unseen by his family and others. William also as an adult used his abilities as a Psychic Medium for law enforcement and also for others not quite in line with the authorities.  Jerald when right away with weaving an epic series and after meetings came up with the name, "3rd Eye".

Our cast includes stars such as: Alexandra Paul, Byron Cherry, Chris Yanke, Marty Klebaa, Jason Stuart, Jeremy Miller, Kelly Perine, Ken Davitian, Larry Thomas, Mel Novak, Marion Ramsey, Patrick Kilpatrick, Jose Perez

Supporting cast: Alexandra Keller, Anita Clay, Ashley Monroe, Brandon Duracher, Danny Arroyo, Jerald Garner, Joycelyn Lew, Monica Smith, Sandra Hinojosa, Spencer Conner

 

Jerald Garner met William Constantine through William's manager. William's discussed his abilities with Jerald and a true case of a missing child that William was able to pin-point where the body was via his medium abilities. The case was a sad one but proved again that some mediums are actually able to help with cases. Jerald told William of his encounters with the paranormal in his life then wove a story that could be a series based loosely on William's life. The next day Jerald called a meeting with William and his manager and pitched a 4 season long TV Series. The team they began to add to the series and help weave an intricate, exciting, scary, provocative universe. We meet with Jeremy Miller whom everyone remembers as one of America's most lovable child/teen stars. Jeremy was now matured, buff, cut, solid specimen of a man yet still had that boyish charm and twinkle in his eye. We all knew HE was it! He would be our lead! The character will start off in a bad place, so there will be an arch and Jeremy's acting abilities will be tested but the team has the utmost confidence in Jeremy. The production quickly gained momentum and was able to acquire many seasoned, talented actors known to many around the world. The production soon was bombarded by fans to know when was the series to start. Feeling the  pressure the production team had to develop a plan to raise the funds for a proof concept trailer for $50K. We can shoot the pilot if we reach $100K or full season if we reach $500K. We know that the series subjects are universal from all over the globe.

 

The series will take you on a terrifying roller coaster ride through government cover-ups, secret societies, paranormal phenomenon and issues the world faces daily. Our protagonist, a psychic medium, William Kane, will be played by Jeremy Miller (Growing Pains) and will navigate the treacherous waters of the aforementioned issues and more as he exhausts all avenues on finding the serial killer who brutally murdered his wife.

The character of William Kane is based on real-life psychic medium, William Constantine, who is a writer, producer and an adviser for the series offer insights on the struggle of life as a psychic medium may bring and his vast knowledge and experience with the paranormal.

Unlike other shows that have featured psychic mediums as the main character “3rd Eye” will be as scary as it is riveting and will keep viewers on the edge of their seats and may even give rise to people thinking twice about turning off the lights at night. The series will chronicle the life of William Kane but will also introduce you to the macro plot of what has happened to human existence in the past present and future.

We are inspired by sci-fi movies, books and magazine of the early 20th Century, as well as magazines in the 70s and 80s like Omni with concepts of the strange beings, disappearances, government conspiracies, human origin, MIBs, monsters, alternate realities, alien encounters, human super abilities and more.

We will have the style of Person of Interest meets, Stranger Things, meets Millennium. We have amazing sci-fi and horror writers, graphic artist, SPFX people, stunt team and known actors to help us create this world of 3rd Eye and show you many of the stories you may have read in the newspapers, seen on TV or read in books on strange events and we will provide you with a climactic explanation of why the events are happening in the world and what is going to happen.

This series is inspired from the life of a real medium, William Constantine. This series will not be the campy, comical series many are used to, rather this will be a very serious, plausible styled heavy drama.

 

William Kane, a fall from grace psychic medium -- a man gifted with the ability to perceive and speak with Angels, Demons and “other” inter-dimensional beings -- has spent all his money searching for his wife’s killer. With all his abilities, he can’t get a spiritual reading on her nor can he see her killer. He must work with the NSA as a medium and remote viewer to track down and stop threats to the U.S. and its allies. In return, the NSA helps him track down the elusive killer of his heart and they will not shut down his orphanage. 

After the NSA agents pick him up, an organized Persian crime syndicate grabs him. They begin torturing him to uncover how he knew about a money laundering operation that was shut down due to him tipping off a local cop. Knowing they had no intention of letting him live he thinks fast enough to tip the crime boss of the infidelity involving his wife and one of his best friend (his right-hand man). Seeing an opportunity and usefulness to such insight the boss lets him live in exchange for him to use his medium abilities to assist and further his crime business whenever he needs and to keep the government off his back. Of course, the government wants to stop organized crime as it affects national security. The Persian crime leader’s right hand man escapes death to fight back another day.

Feeling abandoned by his psychic ability he gambled away most of his fortune and used what remained attempting to locate his wife’s murderer. 

One of the only things he has left is working to keep an orphanage he has founded running. 

He still performs stage shows and readings to help people to do all he can to keep the orphanage running – it’s the only thing he has that meant anything to his wife. 

Many of the kids at the orphanage are gifted in many areas and he helps them stay out of trouble and find their path.

The NSA Agent and the Persian crime lord know each other and have been at war in the past.

 

 

 

 

Originally from Houston, TX, Jerald first got his feet wet in the limelight at 17 years old, when he was doing some modeling jobs for department store ads. When he was 21 years old, he joined the United States Air Force. During his time in the military he received a college degree and went on to become a data communications engineer and consultant. While visiting Los Angeles one day he was invited by a producer to be a featured guest in a MTV-show. Acting and working for managers and producers in Hollywood, Jerald eventually became founder of Unseen Forces Productions. He has over 10 years of production and writing experience. He does not take no for an answer and if you believe it can be done then he will go the distance with you and make it happen!

 

With nearly two decades of experience of being a professional psychic medium with international acclaim he has been called in on; Animal Behavioral Issues, Jury selection, Families of Murdered or Missing Persons, Consultation with Law Enforcement, etc. His work as a Psychic Detective caught Nancy Grace’s attention which led to her featuring Constantine as an expert on her show. Currently, Constantine is an independent consultant for a Baron Investigative Group which has offices in both Indiana and Florida.

 

Robert has been shooting feature films and music videos for 15 years. Robert was singled out for his cinematography, with positive reviews from both Roger Ebert and Anthony Lane of the New Yorker: "Photographed in glorious black and white by Robert Murphy." --Roger Eber

 

From a young age Avery Bailey’s love for Character Design, Animation, and Film sent him on a journey of discovery about the importance of speed, accuracy, and versatility. Avery has mastered many different forms of art and is constantly searching for ways to bring his and others original content to life on the big and small screens. Avery’s main concern in this life is being a consummate professional and a beneficial part to the team.

 

 

Our fans are truly the best in the world. When we made the pre-production announcement that the possibility of “3rd Eye” was on the horizon we received lots of messages from fans around the world in anxious anticipation for the series wanting to know what they could do to help the series come to fruition. Driven by their desire to see the series this bumped up our initial production timeline and we wanted a way to pay back our fans with incentives and perks for their contribution to the launch of the 3rd Eye Series. 

 

 

  

Jeremy Miller, starred in the hit TV series Growing Pains, plays the lead role of William Kane; a psychic medium that’s caught between organized crime and the NSA as he seeks to find the killer of his wife. 

 

 

Alexandra Paul has appeared in 100 feature films and television programs – mostly as the first or second female lead. She is internationally recognized for her 5-year starring role as Lt. Stephanie Holden in the TV series BAYWATCH. She plays Agent Merrill Dawson, a tough as nails NSA agent that is the head of her team. William helps her and the NSA find international criminals and helps with counter terrorism.   

 

 

Ken Davitian was born on June 19, 1953 in Los Angeles, California, USA as Kenneth Davitian. He is an actor and producer, known for Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan (2006), The Artist (2011) and Meet the Spartans (2008).  His teenage idol was Burt Reynolds, who greatly influenced his choice of becoming an actor.  Davitian would go on to play in a film which also featured Reynolds, titled Pocket Listing!

 

 

Larry Thomas was born as Larry Tomashoff, is an American actor and director, known for Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery (1997), Postal (2007) and Paranormal Calamity (2010), but he is best known for his guest role as Yev Kassem, the Soup Nazi, on Seinfeld, for which he was nominated for an Emmy Award. In addition to making personal appearances as the Soup Nazi. He is asked to make numerous autograph-signing shows across the country.

 

 

Marion Ramsey in is an American actress and singer. She was a regular on the series Cos but is best known for her role as the timid Officer Laverne Hooks in the Police Academy movies. Recently she has also appeared in the films Recipe for Disaster and Return to Babylon, and in the television films for SyFy, such as Lavalantula and 2 Lava 2 Lantula!. In 3rd Eye she plays Lisa Hartley, assistant to William Kane and helps with the kids at the orphanage as they cope with their special gifts. Unknown to William she is a special scientist who has been targeted for death if she continues her beneficial research to help mankind.

 

 

Patrick Kilpatrick’s entertainment career has also spanned more than 125 films and television shows as lead actor, producer, screen writer, director, film fund raiser, on camera host, global entertainment teacher and journalist – from Steven Spielberg’s Minority Report with Tom Cruise to Titanic’s James Cameron’s Dark Angel to Public Broadcasting, from Broadway and the West End of London to global streaming TV/radio.  Patrick plays police Captain Sean Quinn who works to keep his police department together as the world of crime is getting more dangerous and stranger.

 

 

Martin Klebba has acted in various productions, most notably the Pirates of the Caribbean series as "Marty", one of Captain Jack Sparrow's Black Pearl crew, in films one through three, and five. In 2003, he played the ring announcer in the Cradle 2 the Grave. In 2009, Klebba played the role of "Count Le Petite" in All's Faire in Love, a romantic comedy set at a Renaissance fair. He has also been in low budget horror/comedy films Feast 2: Sloppy Seconds & Feast III: The Happy Finish as "Thunder." He has numerous stunt credits as well including Hancock, Zombieland, Bedtime Stories, Evan Almighty, Meet the Spartans, Epic Movie, and Van Helsing. Wearing motion capture pajamas, "Marty" stood in for the Dimorphodon who grapples with Chris Pratt in Jurassic World.

 

 

Kelly Perine was born and raised in Pennsylvania. After middle school, Perine attended Lake Forest Academy, near Chicago, and acted in the film Lucas and other plays. Perine went on to study at UC Irvine and Pomona. Perine has appeared in numerous commercials, television shows, films, and in stand-up clubs. Kelly will play Carlito Rodriguez, an awarded NSA agent and Agent Merrill Dawson’s right hand.

 

 

José Pérez was born in 1940 in New York City, New York, USA. He is an actor, known for The Mask of Zorro (1998), The Way of the Gun (2000) and Miami Blues (1990). In 3rd Eye he will play Cardinal Franco Copello, where he has served the Vatican for over 40 years. His unwavering faith and steadfast honesty has made him one of the top in line to be considered the next Pope. He is tasked with protecting the church and the Pope at all cost.

 

Martial arts legend and quintessential action movie villain Mel Novak has battled a who's who of legendary Hollywood heroes and is best known as the iconic Stick the Assassin in Bruce Lee's Game of Death. He has also starred in Black Belt Jones opposite Jim Kelly, The Ultimate Warrior opposite Yul Brenner, Eye for an Eye opposite Chuck Norris, Christopher Lee and Richard Roundtree, Tom Horn opposite Steve McQueen and more recently in Gregory Hatanaka's Samurai Cop 2: Deadly Vengeance opposite Bai Ling. Mel also stars in the ensemble cast of Thomas J. Churchill's upcoming film Checkpoint opposite William Forsythe, Bill Goldberg, Fred "The Hammer" Williamson and Kenny Johnson. Mel has also acted in Garry Marshall's films such as Exit to Eden opposite Dan Aykroyd and Rosie O'Donnell and Dear God opposite Greg Kinnear and Tim Conway. Ever the noted martial arts movie villain, Mel has had the opportunity to be directed by legendary filmmaker Robert Clouse (Enter the Dragon) several times.

 

 

After three years of college football, Byron Cherry decided to pursue acting. He enrolled in film school at Georgia State University, Atlanta. One day while walking by the student center he was approached by a casting agent working on a TV commercial. She approached him and asked him to audition for the commercial. He was told that he had "the look" that she needed for this scene and all he needed to do was to look for the beautiful blonde, sit next to her and kiss her. Byron thought the casting director had to be kidding. It was that easy. He got the part! After college auditioned for the Hit TV Series The Dukes of Hazzard got the lead part as Coy Duke.

The Dukes of Hazzard has become one of the most popular TV shows in the world and still has a worldwide following to this day. This was the break Byron had been dreaming of. Under contract a three-year contract with Warner Brothers, Byron went on to do numerous shows such as Murder She Wrote, In The Heat Of The Night, Vietnam WAR stories (A Mini Series) and various TV commercials and guest spots on numerous talk shows, and was the spokesperson for the American Cancer Society.

 

Danny Arroyo is a series regular on the TV series SANGRE NEGRA, for which he won the “Best Actor” award at the 2015 Vive Latino American Awards Show for playing Detective Christian Santos. SANGRE NEGRA stars veteran actors Erik Estrada and Eric Roberts. Danny plays Roberto Soto, a priest in a self-imposed exile after encountering an artifact on human origin hidden away by the church and encountering his own visions.

 

 

Our dream is to create a world rich is story and characters that you will love and some you'll love to hate -- as you adventure with them down the proverbial rabbit hole. We want to bring you, our fans, a quality series that you'll watch from the edge of your seats and love every pulse-pounding minute of it! And that is why we have chosen crowdfunding. Here’s a bit more detail.

 

When we announced the concept of the 3rd Eye Series we were immediately flooded with inquiries from a worldwide fan base that wanted to know how they could help bring the series to life. So, after some investigation, we saw that several shows started with crowdfunding. It also gave us an opportunity to give back to our supporters by offering various perks. 

THE BUDGET

We are wanting to raise $200,000 to cover production, marketing, salaries, etc. 

$1     Level 1: Show Me

 

 

$5     Level 1: Believer

Items included:

•          3rd EYE Bumper Sticker

•          Personalized thank you email from the director.

•          Your Name on our official website

 

 

 

$10     Level 2: Scholar of the Hidden

Items included:

• Personalized thank you email from the director.

• YOUR NAME on the website

• Access to donors-only group

 

 

 

$15     Level 2: Doctorate

Items included:

• Personalized thank you email from the director.

• YOUR NAME on the website

• Access to donors-only group

• Official 3rd EYE All Purpose Water-Proof Cell Phone Carry Case

 

 

 

$25 Level 3: The Awakend

Items included:

• Official 3rd Eye Cap

• Personalized thank you email from the director.

• YOUR NAME on the website

• Access to donors-only group

 

$35 Level 4: Practicer

Items included:

• Official 3rd EYE Knit Bennie Cap

• Personalized thank you email from the director.

• YOUR NAME on the website

• Access to donors-only group

 

 

$50 Level 4: Transcendental

Items included:

• 3rd Eye T-Shirt

• Official 3rd Eye Cap

• Personalized thank you email from the director.

• YOUR NAME on the website

• Access to donors-only group

 

 

$75 Level 4: Clairvoyant

• Thank You email from Director

• Website Acknowledgement

• Access to "Donors Only Group"

• Official 3rd EYE Cap, Official 3rd Eye T-Shirt

• Official 3rd EYE Coffee Mug

• Official 3rd EYE Keck Warmer with Ninja Hood

• 1 Cast Signed 3rd EYE Poster (Signed by Jeremy Miller!)

 

 

 

$100 Level 5: Matter Mover

Items included:

• 1 cast member signed series posters

• 3rd Eye T-Shirt

• Official 3rd Eye Cap

• Official 3rd Eye Coffee mug

• Personalized thank you email from the director.

• YOUR NAME on the website

• Access to donors-only group

 

 

 

$150 Level 6: Time Master

Items included:

• Autographed Script Copy 

• Signed Series poster

• 3rd Eye T-Shirt

• Official 3rd Eye Cap

• Personalized thank you email from the director.

• YOUR NAME on the website

• Access to donors-only group

 

 

 

$250 Level 7: Ascended

Items included:

3rd eye Time Lord Pack- Your name, along with the names of other contributors, will be prominently displayed on a large stone located at the center’s entrance of the UNSEEN FORCES PRODUCTIONS corporate office. So basically: immortality. For $250. Can't beat it.

• Name in stone at HQ (Immortality) 

• 3rd Eye T-Shirt

• Official 3rd Eye Cap

• Personalized thank you email from the director.

• YOUR NAME on the website

• Access to donors-only group

 

 

 

$500 Level 8: Guardian

Items included:

• 2-VIP Passes for the screening

• Special Thanks in Credits

• Plus the Ascended Package

 

 

 

$1000 Level 9: Deity

Items included:

• VIP Email Contact, Cap, T-shirt, Special Thanks in Credits

• Walk on role in pilot and credit, dinner with a cast member and director.

• Name in stone at HQ (Immortality)

 

 

 

Creating a TV Series is never easy; however, we believe 3rd Eye will appeal to a large audience spanning several genres.  We have done extensive due diligence by studying popular shows of Today and older shows - we've dissected every aspect from story to budgets, analyzed what our target networks require in to pitch them, etc. We have taken what we've learned about "new media" and combined it with all other factors when we were conceptualizing 3rd Eye.  Crowdfunding is a very important aspect of our plan because it allows those interested in participating in bringing this series to life and into homes around the globe.

 

 

When will the perks be delivered?

-  We will start delivering perks and give more information and details on the delivery after the campaign is ended. (approximately October 2017) For now, you can see some of the estimated delivery times from the perk descriptions.

 

Email Address - I put the wrong email address on Indiegogo and am afraid I won’t receive my perk. How do I fix that?

- Please send an email to 3rdeyetvseries@gmail.com and we will update your new email address in our files.

 

Shipping Address - How do I update my address if it changes?

- Send your new address to 3rdeyetvseries@gmail.com and we will update your new address in our files.

 

Why are you asking my shipping address also in the digital perks?

-  Because of tax law. That’s why we are asking it in all the perks, even if they will are digital and won't require a physical shipment. 

Support Information - How will the funders be kept informed during and after the campaign?

- We will be sending all supporters updates trough our Indiegogo page and via email to the email address you have provided when signing up to the Indiegogo site. We will also post updates on our Facebook-pages https://www.facebook.com/3rdEYEseries/

 

When will the series be made?

- It depends on how soon we can raise the capital to shoot the PILOT episode. We are gearing up to start shooting in the spring of 2018 to be edited and ready for Fall of 2018.

 

When will the series be released?

- We are shooting for a 2018 release date. 

 

I posted a question to the site. When will I get a response?

- We’ve got quite a lot of questions coming in and we are trying our best to answer them all asap. If you have something urgent in mind, please contact us at 3rdeyeseries@gmail.com

 

Can the perks be shipped to an address that isn't our billing address?

- Yes. We will send your perks where ever you'll want them to be shipped when they're ready to go. Doesn’t have to be the same address. If you change your address during or after the campaign, please remember to let us know at 3rdeyeseries@gmail.com

 

How do you know what size T-shirt I want? 

- We will start asking sizes via email after the campaign.

 

Will there be more perks offered?

Yes, as we go along and hit certain milestones there will more perks offered. However, what these perks are and their associated costs will remain a secret - at least for now. We will update you on the perks via Indiegogo updates and on our Facebook pages www.facebook.com/3rdEYEseries/ .

 

Will the signatures in Script Copy perk be real?

All signatures will be 100% authentic.

 

For any questions regarding the campaign or your perks, please contact 3rdeyeseries@gmail.com
