The series will chronicle the life of William Kane but will also introduce you to the macro plot of what has happened to human existence in the past present and future.We are inspired by sci-fi movies, books and magazine of the early 20th Century, as well as magazines in the 70s and 80s like Omni with concepts of the strange beings, disappearances, government conspiracies, human origin, MIBs, monsters, alternate realities, alien encounters, human super abilities and more.We will have the style of Person of Interest meets, Stranger Things, meets Millennium. We have amazing sci-fi and horror writers, graphic artist, SPFX people, stunt team and known actors to help us create this world of 3rd Eye and show you many of the stories you may have read in the newspapers, seen on TV or read in books on strange events and we will provide you with a climactic explanation of why the events are happening in the world and what is going to happen.This series is inspired from the life of a real medium, William Constantine. This series will not be the campy, comical series many are used to, rather this will be a very serious, plausible styled heavy drama. William Kane, a fall from grace psychic medium -- a man gifted with the ability to perceive and speak with Angels, Demons and “other” inter-dimensional beings -- has spent all his money searching for his wife’s killer. With all his abilities, he can’t get a spiritual reading on her nor can he see her killer. He must work with the NSA as a medium and remote viewer to track down and stop threats to the U.S. and its allies. In return, the NSA helps him track down the elusive killer of his heart and they will not shut down his orphanage. After the NSA agents pick him up, an organized Persian crime syndicate grabs him. They begin torturing him to uncover how he knew about a money laundering operation that was shut down due to him tipping off a local cop. Knowing they had no intention of letting him live he thinks fast enough to tip the crime boss of the infidelity involving his wife and one of his best friend (his right-hand man). Seeing an opportunity and usefulness to such insight the boss lets him live in exchange for him to use his medium abilities to assist and further his crime business whenever he needs and to keep the government off his back. Of course, the government wants to stop organized crime as it affects national security. The Persian crime leader’s right hand man escapes death to fight back another day.Feeling abandoned by his psychic ability he gambled away most of his fortune and used what remained attempting to locate his wife’s murderer. One of the only things he has left is working to keep an orphanage he has founded running. He still performs stage shows and readings to help people to do all he can to keep the orphanage running – it’s the only thing he has that meant anything to his wife. Many of the kids at the orphanage are gifted in many areas and he helps them stay out of trouble and find their path.The NSA Agent and the Persian crime lord know each other and have been at war in the past.    Originally from Houston, TX, Jerald first got his feet wet in the limelight at 17 years old, when he was doing some modeling jobs for department store ads. When he was 21 years old, he joined the United States Air Force. During his time in the military he received a college degree and went on to become a data communications engineer and consultant. While visiting Los Angeles one day he was invited by a producer to be a featured guest in a MTV-show. Acting and working for managers and producers in Hollywood, Jerald eventually became founder of Unseen Forces Productions. He has over 10 years of production and writing experience. He does not take no for an answer and if you believe it can be done then he will go the distance with you and make it happen! With nearly two decades of experience of being a professional psychic medium with international acclaim he has been called in on; Animal Behavioral Issues, Jury selection, Families of Murdered or Missing Persons, Consultation with Law Enforcement, etc. His work as a Psychic Detective caught Nancy Grace’s attention which led to her featuring Constantine as an expert on her show. Currently, Constantine is an independent consultant for a Baron Investigative Group which has offices in both Indiana and Florida. Robert has been shooting feature films and music videos for 15 years. Robert was singled out for his cinematography, with positive reviews from both Roger Ebert and Anthony Lane of the New Yorker: "Photographed in glorious black and white by Robert Murphy." --Roger Eber From a young age Avery Bailey’s love for Character Design, Animation, and Film sent him on a journey of discovery about the importance of speed, accuracy, and versatility. Avery has mastered many different forms of art and is constantly searching for ways to bring his and others original content to life on the big and small screens. Avery’s main concern in this life is being a consummate professional and a beneficial part to the team.  Our fans are truly the best in the world. When we made the pre-production announcement that the possibility of “3rd Eye” was on the horizon we received lots of messages from fans around the world in anxious anticipation for the series wanting to know what they could do to help the series come to fruition. Driven by their desire to see the series this bumped up our initial production timeline and we wanted a way to pay back our fans with incentives and perks for their contribution to the launch of the 3rd Eye Series.     Jeremy Miller, starred in the hit TV series Growing Pains, plays the lead role of William Kane; a psychic medium that’s caught between organized crime and the NSA as he seeks to find the killer of his wife.   Alexandra Paul has appeared in 100 feature films and television programs – mostly as the first or second female lead. She is internationally recognized for her 5-year starring role as Lt. Stephanie Holden in the TV series BAYWATCH. She plays Agent Merrill Dawson, a tough as nails NSA agent that is the head of her team. William helps her and the NSA find international criminals and helps with counter terrorism.     Ken Davitian was born on June 19, 1953 in Los Angeles, California, USA as Kenneth Davitian. He is an actor and producer, known for Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan (2006), The Artist (2011) and Meet the Spartans (2008).  His teenage idol was Burt Reynolds, who greatly influenced his choice of becoming an actor.  Davitian would go on to play in a film which also featured Reynolds, titled Pocket Listing!  Larry Thomas was born as Larry Tomashoff, is an American actor and director, known for Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery (1997), Postal (2007) and Paranormal Calamity (2010), but he is best known for his guest role as Yev Kassem, the Soup Nazi, on Seinfeld, for which he was nominated for an Emmy Award. In addition to making personal appearances as the Soup Nazi. He is asked to make numerous autograph-signing shows across the country.  Marion Ramsey in is an American actress and singer. She was a regular on the series Cos but is best known for her role as the timid Officer Laverne Hooks in the Police Academy movies. Recently she has also appeared in the films Recipe for Disaster and Return to Babylon, and in the television films for SyFy, such as Lavalantula and 2 Lava 2 Lantula!. In 3rd Eye she plays Lisa Hartley, assistant to William Kane and helps with the kids at the orphanage as they cope with their special gifts. Unknown to William she is a special scientist who has been targeted for death if she continues her beneficial research to help mankind.  Patrick Kilpatrick’s entertainment career has also spanned more than 125 films and television shows as lead actor, producer, screen writer, director, film fund raiser, on camera host, global entertainment teacher and journalist – from Steven Spielberg’s Minority Report with Tom Cruise to Titanic’s James Cameron’s Dark Angel to Public Broadcasting, from Broadway and the West End of London to global streaming TV/radio.  Patrick plays police Captain Sean Quinn who works to keep his police department together as the world of crime is getting more dangerous and stranger.  Martin Klebba has acted in various productions, most notably the Pirates of the Caribbean series as "Marty", one of Captain Jack Sparrow's Black Pearl crew, in films one through three, and five. In 2003, he played the ring announcer in the Cradle 2 the Grave. In 2009, Klebba played the role of "Count Le Petite" in All's Faire in Love, a romantic comedy set at a Renaissance fair. He has also been in low budget horror/comedy films Feast 2: Sloppy Seconds & Feast III: The Happy Finish as "Thunder." He has numerous stunt credits as well including Hancock, Zombieland, Bedtime Stories, Evan Almighty, Meet the Spartans, Epic Movie, and Van Helsing. Wearing motion capture pajamas, "Marty" stood in for the Dimorphodon who grapples with Chris Pratt in Jurassic World.  Kelly Perine was born and raised in Pennsylvania. After middle school, Perine attended Lake Forest Academy, near Chicago, and acted in the film Lucas and other plays. Perine went on to study at UC Irvine and Pomona. Perine has appeared in numerous commercials, television shows, films, and in stand-up clubs. Kelly will play Carlito Rodriguez, an awarded NSA agent and Agent Merrill Dawson’s right hand.  José Pérez was born in 1940 in New York City, New York, USA. He is an actor, known for The Mask of Zorro (1998), The Way of the Gun (2000) and Miami Blues (1990). In 3rd Eye he will play Cardinal Franco Copello, where he has served the Vatican for over 40 years. His unwavering faith and steadfast honesty has made him one of the top in line to be considered the next Pope. He is tasked with protecting the church and the Pope at all cost. Martial arts legend and quintessential action movie villain Mel Novak has battled a who's who of legendary Hollywood heroes and is best known as the iconic Stick the Assassin in Bruce Lee's Game of Death. He has also starred in Black Belt Jones opposite Jim Kelly, The Ultimate Warrior opposite Yul Brenner, Eye for an Eye opposite Chuck Norris, Christopher Lee and Richard Roundtree, Tom Horn opposite Steve McQueen and more recently in Gregory Hatanaka's Samurai Cop 2: Deadly Vengeance opposite Bai Ling. Mel also stars in the ensemble cast of Thomas J. Churchill's upcoming film Checkpoint opposite William Forsythe, Bill Goldberg, Fred "The Hammer" Williamson and Kenny Johnson. Mel has also acted in Garry Marshall's films such as Exit to Eden opposite Dan Aykroyd and Rosie O'Donnell and Dear God opposite Greg Kinnear and Tim Conway. Ever the noted martial arts movie villain, Mel has had the opportunity to be directed by legendary filmmaker Robert Clouse (Enter the Dragon) several times.  After three years of college football, Byron Cherry decided to pursue acting. He enrolled in film school at Georgia State University, Atlanta. One day while walking by the student center he was approached by a casting agent working on a TV commercial. She approached him and asked him to audition for the commercial. He was told that he had "the look" that she needed for this scene and all he needed to do was to look for the beautiful blonde, sit next to her and kiss her. Byron thought the casting director had to be kidding. It was that easy. He got the part! After college auditioned for the Hit TV Series The Dukes of Hazzard got the lead part as Coy Duke.The Dukes of Hazzard has become one of the most popular TV shows in the world and still has a worldwide following to this day. This was the break Byron had been dreaming of. Under contract a three-year contract with Warner Brothers, Byron went on to do numerous shows such as Murder She Wrote, In The Heat Of The Night, Vietnam WAR stories (A Mini Series) and various TV commercials and guest spots on numerous talk shows, and was the spokesperson for the American Cancer Society. Danny Arroyo is a series regular on the TV series SANGRE NEGRA, for which he won the “Best Actor” award at the 2015 Vive Latino American Awards Show for playing Detective Christian Santos. SANGRE NEGRA stars veteran actors Erik Estrada and Eric Roberts. Danny plays Roberto Soto, a priest in a self-imposed exile after encountering an artifact on human origin hidden away by the church and encountering his own visions.  Our dream is to create a world rich is story and characters that you will love and some you'll love to hate -- as you adventure with them down the proverbial rabbit hole. We want to bring you, our fans, a quality series that you'll watch from the edge of your seats and love every pulse-pounding minute of it! And that is why we have chosen crowdfunding. Here’s a bit more detail. When we announced the concept of the 3rd Eye Series we were immediately flooded with inquiries from a worldwide fan base that wanted to know how they could help bring the series to life. So, after some investigation, we saw that several shows started with crowdfunding. It also gave us an opportunity to give back to our supporters by offering various perks. THE BUDGETWe are wanting to raise $200,000 to cover production, marketing, salaries, etc. $1     Level 1: Show Me  $5     Level 1: BelieverItems included:•          3rd EYE Bumper Sticker•          Personalized thank you email from the director.•          Your Name on our official website   $10     Level 2: Scholar of the HiddenItems included:• Personalized thank you email from the director.• YOUR NAME on the website• Access to donors-only group   $15     Level 2: DoctorateItems included:• Personalized thank you email from the director.• YOUR NAME on the website• Access to donors-only group• Official 3rd EYE All Purpose Water-Proof Cell Phone Carry Case   $25 Level 3: The AwakendItems included:• Official 3rd Eye Cap• Personalized thank you email from the director.• YOUR NAME on the website• Access to donors-only group $35 Level 4: PracticerItems included:• Official 3rd EYE Knit Bennie Cap• Personalized thank you email from the director.• YOUR NAME on the website• Access to donors-only group  $50 Level 4: TranscendentalItems included:• 3rd Eye T-Shirt• Official 3rd Eye Cap• Personalized thank you email from the director.• YOUR NAME on the website• Access to donors-only group  $75 Level 4: Clairvoyant• Thank You email from Director• Website Acknowledgement• Access to "Donors Only Group"• Official 3rd EYE Cap, Official 3rd Eye T-Shirt• Official 3rd EYE Coffee Mug• Official 3rd EYE Keck Warmer with Ninja Hood• 1 Cast Signed 3rd EYE Poster (Signed by Jeremy Miller!)   $100 Level 5: Matter MoverItems included:• 1 cast member signed series posters• 3rd Eye T-Shirt• Official 3rd Eye Cap• Official 3rd Eye Coffee mug• Personalized thank you email from the director.• YOUR NAME on the website• Access to donors-only group   $150 Level 6: Time MasterItems included:• Autographed Script Copy • Signed Series poster• 3rd Eye T-Shirt• Official 3rd Eye Cap• Personalized thank you email from the director.• YOUR NAME on the website• Access to donors-only group   $250 Level 7: AscendedItems included:3rd eye Time Lord Pack- Your name, along with the names of other contributors, will be prominently displayed on a large stone located at the center’s entrance of the UNSEEN FORCES PRODUCTIONS corporate office. So basically: immortality. For $250. Can't beat it.• Name in stone at HQ (Immortality) • 3rd Eye T-Shirt• Official 3rd Eye Cap• Personalized thank you email from the director.• YOUR NAME on the website• Access to donors-only group   $500 Level 8: GuardianItems included:• 2-VIP Passes for the screening• Special Thanks in Credits• Plus the Ascended Package   $1000 Level 9: DeityItems included:• VIP Email Contact, Cap, T-shirt, Special Thanks in Credits• Walk on role in pilot and credit, dinner with a cast member and director.• Name in stone at HQ (Immortality)   Creating a TV Series is never easy; however, we believe 3rd Eye will appeal to a large audience spanning several genres.  We have done extensive due diligence by studying popular shows of Today and older shows - we've dissected every aspect from story to budgets, analyzed what our target networks require in to pitch them, etc. We have taken what we've learned about "new media" and combined it with all other factors when we were conceptualizing 3rd Eye.  Crowdfunding is a very important aspect of our plan because it allows those interested in participating in bringing this series to life and into homes around the globe.  When will the perks be delivered?-  We will start delivering perks and give more information and details on the delivery after the campaign is ended. (approximately October 2017) For now, you can see some of the estimated delivery times from the perk descriptions. Email Address - I put the wrong email address on Indiegogo and am afraid I won’t receive my perk. How do I fix that?- Please send an email to 3rdeyetvseries@gmail.com and we will update your new email address in our files. Shipping Address - How do I update my address if it changes?- Send your new address to 3rdeyetvseries@gmail.com and we will update your new address in our files. Why are you asking my shipping address also in the digital perks?-  Because of tax law. That’s why we are asking it in all the perks, even if they will are digital and won't require a physical shipment. Support Information - How will the funders be kept informed during and after the campaign?- We will be sending all supporters updates trough our Indiegogo page and via email to the email address you have provided when signing up to the Indiegogo site. We will also post updates on our Facebook-pages https://www.facebook.com/3rdEYEseries/ When will the series be made?- It depends on how soon we can raise the capital to shoot the PILOT episode. We are gearing up to start shooting in the spring of 2018 to be edited and ready for Fall of 2018. When will the series be released?- We are shooting for a 2018 release date.  I posted a question to the site. When will I get a response?- We’ve got quite a lot of questions coming in and we are trying our best to answer them all asap. If you have something urgent in mind, please contact us at 3rdeyeseries@gmail.com Can the perks be shipped to an address that isn't our billing address?- Yes. We will send your perks where ever you'll want them to be shipped when they're ready to go. Doesn’t have to be the same address. If you change your address during or after the campaign, please remember to let us know at 3rdeyeseries@gmail.com How do you know what size T-shirt I want? - We will start asking sizes via email after the campaign. Will there be more perks offered?Yes, as we go along and hit certain milestones there will more perks offered. However, what these perks are and their associated costs will remain a secret - at least for now. We will update you on the perks via Indiegogo updates and on our Facebook pages www.facebook.com/3rdEYEseries/ . Will the signatures in Script Copy perk be real?All signatures will be 100% authentic. For any questions regarding the campaign or your perks, please contact 3rdeyeseries@gmail.com

story:
Uh, who are you?

We are Matthew Segal and Robin Blanchard. 

Two filmmakers and cinema lovers from Toronto. Oh, and also the creators of the Modica Project. We aim to answer all our questions and curiosities about the tools available, techniques, story structure, and the intricacies of visual storytelling. 

Think of us as the Mythbusters of cinema. 

Cool! But how does it work?

The Modica Project is inspired by the "One Word Story" game, where each person in a circle says a single word to continue the story. For our project,  a different writer is going to submit a single scene to us each week.  Then, over the next week, we are going to prep and shoot it. We’ll cut it together then post the scenes, one by one,  every week.

For every scene, our team is taking risks, attempting something bizarre, or breaking the “rules” of filmmaking. Whether it’s designing the set around an unorthodox colour scheme, or drilling a hole in a lens just to see what it looks like, we are open to trying everything. We’re willing to bet that some amazing modica of cinema will come out of it, even if some scenes are downright awful. It's all part of the process!

You can come along for the journey by watching our weekly Scene Study videos, similar to a "roundtable" segment,  where we discuss what worked, what didn’t, how we achieved (or flubbed) different aspects, and share everything that we’ve learned.

I dig it. But that sounds like it's gonna be tough...

We are up for the Challenge! In fact, we are beyond excited to explore filmmaking in a way that we've never been able to before. We're itching to see the story as it unfolds each week, and buzzing about the experiments that our awesome team will come up with. Putting restrictions on ourselves is going to help us grow, so it's worth it. 

If you say so. But what's the money for?

Making movies ain't cheap! We are looking for a budget of around $1100 - $1300 each week. This is going to feed our crew, get people in and out on time, and keep things going smoothly. We are aiming to for this season to go for around 8 weeks. We crunched them numbers and our micro budget came to $10,000. We'd love your help with that.

The budget breaks down like this:

30% Art Dept. (Props, Set Dec, Wardrobe)

10% Camera

20% Craft (Gotta Eat!)

17% Locations 

15% Contingency

8% Indiegogo Fees

And if you don't reach your goal?

We are making this project anyways! Each contribution gives us more freedom to explore and attempt more ambitious challenges/endeavours. So, every little bit you can give lets us share more valuable lessons. It's a win/win.

Nice. But what to I get?

While each episode is going to be free to watch on our Youtube Channel, We have some great perks that gives you some intimate looks into the project, so you can be an even larger part of the process!

General Admission: This gets you your own, shiny (digital) copy of the final product; all the scenes edited into a short film!

A Hearty Chuckle: You like a good laugh. Maybe the occasional Schadenfreude. Lucky for you, with this perk, you'll get access to our exclusive blooper reel, reserved for close friends, family, and anyone who claims this perk.

Spoiler Alert!: Get your reading glasses, cause there's screenplays afoot. With this perk you'll be getting all of our script drafts as they are submitted to us, you story junkie. 

The Whole Kit and Kaboodle: Here's everything we got. Digital copy of the final product, access to the blooper reel, all our scripts as they are submitted AND special behind the scene's commentary. You earned it!

Guest Star: You the real MVP. This perk includes an invitation to set and the opportunity to participate in one of our "Scene Study" segments. It's your time to shine, and your opinions matter!

Adopt an Episode: You've just funded a full episode. You know what that means? You're the producer of it! Come on to set and make your mark, then explain the awesome experiments you tried during a Scene Study!

You are the Director Now: Like the title says, you direct this whole series. Welcome to the team, let's make some amazing cinema!

Tarl Will Cut Off his Toe: Tarl has offered a toe to whomever feels like dropping a cool mil' on us. Don't worry, he's entitled to a hefty portion as "severance" pay.

I like it, but I can't give any contributions right now...

No problem, we get it. If you'd still like to help us out, please spread the word about our project and follow along with the progress! Share our IndieGoGo campaign, subscribe to our Youtube channel, "like" all our instagram photos, and come along for the ride. 

Ok, yeah, I'll help you out.

Amazing! Thank you so much for your interest and support for this project. You're the best.

story:
IF YOU MISSED THE DEADLINE YOU CAN STILL DONATE ON www.ShadesTheDMV.com 

Nadia Marie is a brand curator, digital storyteller and social entrepreneur. Also embodying a trifecta, Love Nafi is a producer, performer, and personality. Both women are 1st generation Americans that use writing and film as powerful communicative tools to reach audiences in different continents and keenly highlight different cultures. They strive to educate and speak on relatable issues and topics that challenge one’s way of thinking. They have collaborated as co-producers to birth Shades: The DMV, a docuseries about first generation Americans of African born immigrants living in the DC metropolitan and following their creative dreams. The project is reflective for both producers as it is an expression of their own self-consciousness and personal narratives through their "shades".

Nafi and Nadia aim to use Shades: The DMV  as a film to explore the crevices of cultures on identity, politics, and social justice and in turn spur honest discussions.  In this challenging and bold new venture Shades: The DMV displays the multifaceted African and American experiences within macro and micro communities. 

However, being budding independent creatives funding can be an obstacle. And so with that, allow us to introduce to the cast, the team, and share with you all why we need your support! 

 

Executive Producers: Love Nafi and Nadia Marie 

Cinematography: Nuday Films and Jnkyard Cinema

Editor: Jnkyard Cinema

Public Relations: Modupe Ariel

Stylist: Tialiejah 

Make-Up Artists: Beat Face Mommy & Picaso Designz 

Show Development: Salieu Sidique 

Brand Advisor: Sarran Lan Jabbie

We have come so far and are almost at the finish line!  We've spent the past 9 months in research,casting, pre-production, and partial production. The entire production, up to this point, has been funded completely by the series producers Love Nafi and Nadia Marie. We're now ready to complete production and post-production (editing) and need help with finishing costs. Once we raise the funds, we'll be able to complete the series and release it to the world by spring 2018.

Aside from backing the campaign, the most valuable thing you can do for this project is share it on your social media. That’s where most people find out about Indiegogo campaigns! You can directly share this campaign to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other platforms with the icons at the bottom of this page.

Thank you for your support!

They have collaborated as co-producers to birth Shades: The DMV, a docuseries about first generation Americans of African born immigrants living in the DC metropolitan and following their creative dreams. The project is reflective for both producers as it is an expression of their own self-consciousness and personal narratives through their "shades".Nafi and Nadia aim to use Shades: The DMV  as a film to explore the crevices of cultures on identity, politics, and social justice and in turn spur honest discussions.  In this challenging and bold new venture Shades: The DMV displays the multifaceted African and American experiences within macro and micro communities. However, being budding independent creatives funding can be an obstacle. And so with that, allow us to introduce to the cast, the team, and share with you all why we need your support!  Executive Producers: Love Nafi and Nadia Marie Cinematography: Nuday Films and Jnkyard CinemaEditor: Jnkyard CinemaPublic Relations: Modupe ArielStylist: Tialiejah Make-Up Artists: Beat Face Mommy & Picaso Designz Show Development: Salieu Sidique Brand Advisor: Sarran Lan JabbieWe have come so far and are almost at the finish line!  We've spent the past 9 months in research,casting, pre-production, and partial production. The entire production, up to this point, has been funded completely by the series producers Love Nafi and Nadia Marie. We're now ready to complete production and post-production (editing) and need help with finishing costs. Once we raise the funds, we'll be able to complete the series and release it to the world by spring 2018.Aside from backing the campaign, the most valuable thing you can do for this project is share it on your social media. That’s where most people find out about Indiegogo campaigns! You can directly share this campaign to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other platforms with the icons at the bottom of this page.Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Hello. 
My name is Ross K. Foad. I am a writer/director and actor best known for the creation of Sherlock Holmes web drama comedy, “No Place Like Holmes.” And web sketch show “The Faction of Farce.” In addition to this I have also written for independent feature films, shorts, comic strips, magazine columns, and print novels. 

25-years ago, a Role Playing Video Game came out for the Super Nintendo called The Secret of Mana. Created by Squaresoft (known now as Square-Enix) it is set in a high-fantasy world that revolves around the concept of Mana. Mana is a Polynesian concept of power, often in a supernatural context. A comparable thing would be “the force” in Star Wars, but also just the very essence of creation in the universe. 

The creator admits the influences for the game is a mix of Alice in Wonderland, Lord of the Rings, Japanese folklore,  and the Finnish cartoon, The Moomins (!)

To date, it remains my favourite game ever that I still play, but more importantly, the impression it had on me as a child was immense. 

I remember getting it as part of a random selection of games when I bought the console 2ndhand from a Newspaper ad, because that’s how you bought stuff back then, and I had no idea what is was. Never heard of it. But boy did it change my life. 

That might sound really dumb, but its story, music, concept, and characters shaped so much of who I became. Concepts of loss, friendship, and an interest in spirituality were all imparted on me through this. Even throughout a lot of my creative work, elements of it has often been inspired in some way by it, and I know that I am not alone.

To date, orchestrates still perform the soundtrack at special video game events, deviant art is filled with beautiful pieces of artwork dedicated to it, and a mass collab effort from fans worldwide resulted in a cover audio cd of the music entitled “The Spectrum of Mana


It was the very definition of an adventure, and I wanted so much for it to be real. So, I decided that I would make it so. 

Now, I normally have a  tendency to express and share my love for something through writing and film making. I am not a great artist, I am not a musician, so I can’t express stuff that way, but I admire people who do greatly. I wish I could! But I can write, and I can direct, I can produce, and I have an ability to make things work that really probably shouldn’t.  I also have a very strong and diverse reserve of actors, that for some reason, enjoy helping me execute my inane mind on screen. 

So, it is for these reasons that I have decided that I want to make this game as a fantasy adventure web-series entitled “The Series of Mana.” It will be a combination of a mass cosplaying fantasy adventure web series, mixed with a bit of in-game (voiced over) footage, for certain parts where budgets will likely not allow, but trust me, I have a lot of creative work arounds for this series planned. 

 

So, basically it’s part cos play, it is part Let’s play, but also a fully-fledged fantasy adventure series.  

This game has a good fan dedication following in England and Germany and I believe that people would be interested in seeing this happen.

I have confidence that it could be a good little hit if done right. The synchronicity of timing also seems right as well, as the game is due to be included in Nintendo’s “Mini Snes,” plus has also been rereleased as part of The Seiken Densetsu collection for the Nintendo Switch (Japan only.)

Now, this will obviously not be the cheapest thing to make, which is why I am running an indigogo campaign for the first series.

This will be primarily for costume expenses,  actor expenses, weaponry, props,  – because Secret of Mana needs them! At the moment, because I have no idea how much this might raise or not,

In addition, the more money there is, the more characters, and exploration can be taken. For instance, why just restrict it to The Secret of Mana? I would love for this to maybe incorporate other Square or RPG series characters cropping up if we can. 

So, if you like the sound of seeing this happen, then any donation to the campaign, no matter how small, will be a massive help.

 But if you can’t donate, but still want to show your support you can share the video on Social Media or give the Facebook page a like. It goes a long way. 

Thanks so much again for reading and I will hopefully speak to you all again soon!


CAN I BE INVOLVED?
If you wanted to be involved in some way as a crew or cast…especially if you are a cosplayer actor based in London – then I would love to hear from you. As the wonderful setup of the world means many different cosplaying costumes could fit into this world. Steampunk, fairy, LOTR, Game of Thrones, Medieval, wonderful exotic and eastern…anything like that…chances are a role may exist for you. 
So, by all means get in touch and let me know.

WHEN CAN WE EXPECT IT?
Series 1 in Late 2017/Early 2018,

I am working on the idea of the first series being the first 6 episodes that I had written, running on a weekly basis (each episode being around 10-12 mins,) but should the campaign be more successful, then I may extend it for a few more episodes than this. I have no idea of how many people may submit to this, hence keeping the first series within a reasonable amount. 

I believe that as the series grows in awareness, and (hopefully) popularity, lengthier series runs can be afforded. 
Can we trust you to deliver and not run away with our money?
10+ years writing/directing/producing and acting.  Please view my Starnow Page to read over 130 recommendations from casting directors/producers/directors/actor to gather a better idea about my character and abilities.  I am largely regarded as one of the kinder directors out there, capable of making all projects fun and efficient and getting the best out my actors. 

https://www.starnow.co.uk/profile/feedback.aspx...

story:
What we are doing: 

Hi, this is Gene. Today I want to tell you about Rasputin Project and why we need your support. Recently, Alexey Navalny, Kremlin's most fierce critic was sentenced to 2.5 years in jail. Just before his trial, his team of investigative journalists released, 'Putin’s Palace: The story of the biggest bribe in history.

In August 2020, Navalny was poisoned on a domestic flight. After falling into a coma, he was transferred to a hospital in Germany in order to save his life. Navalny was under surveillance by a group of operatives from the unit for 3 years and there may have been earlier attempts to poison Navalny. Upon his return to Russia in January 2021, Navalny was immediately imprisoned upon charges of “Violating Probation”, based on previous fraudulent charges of embezzlement for his brother’s involvement in Yves Rocher.

 

With your contributions and support, our team of independent creators and activists around the world and on the ground will create engaging media to support the fight against corruption, including the production and distribution of investigative videos across the globe raising awareness and building alliances. 

 

What We Need & What Will You Get 

The funding we are raising is what is required to complete four episodes of the Rasputin Project investigative docu-series within two months of the launch of this campaign. In addition, we need funds to finish creating our interactive website and help support creators. Up until now, creators have donated their time shooting, writing, translating, editing, and doing deep-dive research. We are not beholden to corporate advertising dollars which allows us to maintain our journalistic integrity. 

We are looking to coordinate with Navalny's FBK Team to support the important work they are doing in the community. We aim to partner with FBK for future episodes of the RASPUTIN PROJECT.

 

The Community 

We plan to make RasputinProject.com a comprehensive supplement to the series. Visitors will be able to review research materials and extended investigations. In addition to these resources, those moved to take action will have various ways to donate their time or make financial contributions. 

 

 

The Team

With mass repressions and arrests of anyone that opposes the current dictatorship regime, we must keep the anonymity of our team. It's dangerous to run a business, advocate for social progress, or be free from the threat of physical harm from the government. Thankfully, because of mass media and technology, a new generation of young, socially aware dissidents have sprung up ready to fight for liberty and justice. Hundreds of thousands of people came out in -20 degree weather to protests Navalny’s arrest from Moscow to Siberia. Millions more make up the silent majority. These people need our help.
 
 

 

The Impact

"Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world." - Nelson Mandela

State corruption and violence towards citizens and reporters is an epidemic that needs to be shared with the world.  Popular news stations and newspapers have largely failed to report on these issues adequately and spread awareness. Our project is a social contribution initiative - one that aims to encourage change through positive examples and success stories, with a global reach. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's okay! It's been a tough year, to say the least. If you want to continue supporting creators — here are some ways you can support us:

Watch us here!

Follow us on Twitter

Spread the word and share the campaign

Thank you again for taking the time to read our story — we look forward to your support!

It takes a world to fight for justice.

story:
In 2016, I embarked on a wildly ambitious voyage: visit vintage stores in NYC and create a reality show about them. A vintage voyage, if you will.
I remember the first cold calls I made to some of my favorite shops.
‘Hi, my name is Allison, and I have this idea for a new show…’
I had no body of work to present, no fancy press kit, not even a super well thought out pitch, but I had a lot of heart and passion to back up my idea (not to mention my extensive, if not obsessive, knowledge on vintage clothing). I knew that if I played my cards right, the show would be unique and entertaining. To my delight, my vision translated well over the phone and within a matter of weeks my videographer, Nikhil, and I were filming all across Manhattan.

Now, over two years later, it’s incredible to look back at the fantastic voyage this project has taken me on. In two seasons I’ve covered 17 stores, traveling out of New York to visit shops all over America. The show has been nominated for multiple awards, including Best Unscripted in the NYC Web Fest, featured on fashion blogs, and even given me the surreal opportunity to walk in NYFW’s first vintage fashion show. However, the greatest thing this project has brought into my life has been the store owners, entrepreneurs, and creatives that have provided wonderful lessons on and off camera, making the show what it is today. It's also inspired countless viewers to get out and shop their local vintage stores and find their own personal style through fashions of the past.

But now I'm ready to take it to the next level with SEASON 3! That's right! You guys have asked for it, and I am so ready to bring you new and exciting shopping adventures. This season, I want to cover more vintage stores in America (and some across the pond as well). I want to expand our knowledge of the vintage community to not just cover vintage clothing, but vintage furniture, cars and events. I want to continue to bring you guys the things you love like Vintage 101's and fashion history lessons, but bring in new aspects to the show, such as featuring other vintage enthusiasts so you can see how other people style their vintage. And finally, I want to show you how things are made and how to repair your beloved vintage items.

To bring these dreams to life I need more minds and more hands to help. Up to this point the show has been self-produced, with the majority of pre and post production being done on my own. With a growing following, it is time to refine and elevate the content of this show and I can’t do it alone. That's why I am asking for your help to raise $30,000! This is money that will go straight into production and help with equipment costs, permits, travel, lodging, advertisements, and will allow me to bring on industry professionals to help make the show the best it can be. 

And of course the more you donate, the more fun prizes you'll receive, including discounts to stores, behind the scenes footage while we're on the road, one on one skype fashion consultations, and for very generous givers, you're own personal vintage voyage with me!

This is a project that is so near and dear to my heart. To this day, it is the ONLY series highlighting the incredible vintage selling community, which is predominantly woman run, and kicking ass as it's growing at a massive rate (projected to be worth $41 BILLION by 2022 according to ThredUp.com). It also brings to light the advantages of shopping small business and shopping sustainably in a time when fast fashion is having a drastic and negative impact on our environment.

If you're ready for more vintage voyages, press that 'Back It' button and give what you can!

Also, SHARE with a friend. If there's anything I've learned from the vintage community, it's all about collaboration. When we come together, amazing things happen!


So what are we waiting for?Let’s get shopping, and go on an adventure!’

story: It is just wrong. They've had to leave their home due to missing rent. 3.3 million subs and 6 zillion views. They should have been paid.

story:
Terronia the Television Series. 

** An Update: A BRITISH TELEVISION PRODUCER HAS COME ON BOARD AND WE ARE STARTING A PRODUCTION COMPANY TOGETHER FOR THIS AND FUTURE PROJECTS. 

*It's not incidental that we're launching this project during the national COVID-19 quarantine here in Italy. We had intended to self-finance this series but we recently had to cancel nine months of food and wine classes and refund all the tution. A school with no students is no longer a school, at least for the time being. Once the COVID- 19 quarantine is lifted we can begin production (the short video above is intended as something of a placeholder and was edited together from existing footage, as no one is allowed outside to film).

If you value what we do as a school please consider joining us in the project that follows.

I’m Silvestro Silvestori here in Italy. 

For the last 17 years we've been teaching the food and wine of Puglia to students from 59 different countries. To stay stimulated as a teacher, I've taken a yearly sabbatical to travel southern Italy, almost always by bicycle. I study the wine. 

 Wine is like art. You could talk at length about a 16th century Dutch painting without ever mentioning that it's yellow. That's because you'd be using the painting as a starting point to discuss all the sociological, anthropological, historical elements of its era. Yes, wine is a beverage but it's also a litmus of a region's geography,  culture, history, cuisine, climate and the deeply-woven sense of cultural patrimony. 

 

The Short Summary

 

*Told in 10, 22 minute episodes- a pilot and then 9, unique historical growing zones- Terronia is the story of southern Italian wine as taught by an interdisciplinary school teacher

*Rather than the blackboard of the classroom I use chalk on the side of abandoned farm houses to explain fermentation, the effects of the Ottoman invasions, why baroque could only follow the protestant reformation, why grapes need foxes, birds and wolves, how we almost lost all of wine to disease, etc. 

*Told in a creative non-fiction format, each episode has a strong narrative arc, the 4-act structure reveals the inherent story conflicts in the world of wine, both internal and external. These human and nature-based conflicts climax at act breaks, pulling along the viewer to stay fully engaged in each story

*Ours is the first generation that ‘prosumer’ technology now allows for one person to write, direct, shoot, edit and promote an entire television series, with all the gear in pannier bags aboard a single bicycle. Cameras, lenses, drone, audio recorders, fast computer for editing, my loaded bicycle is an entire 4k film crew on two wheels

* While many may see this guerilla- filmmaking as only novelty, it does offer unparalleled Intimacy: a single human presence, small cameras, cell-phone sized audio recorders, intimate relationships that often go back 15 years. The one-man film crew’s small footprint can tease out intimate moments in ways large film crews cannot

Background 

 

Southern Italy is so different than the rest of Italy that it should probably be a different country. 

Glance at a map, you'll see that Sicily, Calabria, Basilicata and Puglia are all islands and peninsulas, their individual histories cobbled together from thousands of years of countless invasions. 

The four regions have always been seen as bases- the conceptual equivalent of today’s aircraft carriers and pontoon bridges.  Even the name ‘Mediterranean’- Med Terra- or 'Middle of the earth’,  spells out their agreed-upon historical importance. 

Any culture that needed to feed, water and quarter troops, sailors, economic or theological invaders sooner or later came and took everything.

Over time this caused a resilience in the people and cultures, and a tendency to isolate and trust only those from the same village (literally, the origins of nepotism). 

While these invasions were catastrophic for human beings they ended up being great for wine, individual varietals and growing zones  developed over hundreds and even thousands of years, with little or no communication between regions. 

These are wines of.a place and that relationship is what this series is about. 

 

Few inside or outside of Italy know that: 

*There are 75 isolated communities in the south that do not speak Italian as their first language. They arrived between 400 to 2,700 years, maintaining their language, culture, cuisine and even autochthonous strains of religion the entire time

*For the last 120 years, a forced and ongoing exodus out of Italy has largely depopulated large parts of the south. The people that you know of Italian descent in your country are paradoxically 1) of southern extraction and 2) Statistically unlikely to ever visit from where their ancestors actually departed

*That recently humanity has learned that grapes and wine making arrived up from Africa rather than over the Alps, making the south, Italy’s oldest wine culture

*That producers are reexamining old techniques, such as fermenting in concrete, of training grape vines into free standing trees, of refining with egg whites and to using the yeasts in the bark of the vine rather than the bloom of the fruit. These are not new experimental techniques but head-scratching and eventual acceptance that ancient wine makers knew much more than we often think

 

What we need and what you get

This series is a partnership between you and me, and only you can decide if you want to wave from the shore or dive into the deep-end. All is appreciated. And I can’t do this all alone. 

 

What you get

To learn intimately about a profoundly-compelling part of the world largely unchanged by International tourism. 

The ability to help craft the ten episodes, based on your level of desired participation. Help in research. Proof.a script for punctuation. Just watch the dailies with a glass of the same wine in your hand (yes, I'll tell you which to drink with which episodes). 

Find your new favourite wine. Or nine of them. Likely, even more. 

Use all the information as the foundation of Italian trips for years to come. 

 

What we seek

 

1) Funding for the production

2) Beta-testers, on a variety of levels 

3)That you email forward this campaign and updates to your friends that love Italy and Italian wine

4)That you share this campaign on your Social Media and to any mailing list you may have

5) That you help in the conservation of heritage wines of the South

6) That when you visit Italy, you continue to seek new, lesser known regions, where your money aids in preserving the culture

7) That you someday come take one of our classes here in Puglia. (Anyone interested can book any class now, including the word 'open-ended', in regards to the actual date you'd like to attend. This fixes the price of the course, even after this series debuts) 

8) That you put us in contact with any industry people that you might know that would be interested in this project

9) That you order our extra virgin sent to your home. It's our only form of income at the moment . We made it. And it's excellent. 

 

How the money will be spent. 

So while this year just freed up a lot of time for production, it also had the financial rug pulled out from under it. 

For the last 20 years I’ve lived within an hour’s drive of 3 of the growing zones. And 2 hour’s drive from 2 more. Most of what we need is the non-glamourous expenses for picnic lunches, family-owned bed and breakfasts in the 4 regions that are out of the range of a day's drive. Plus, fuel, tolls, permits and miscellaneous expenses when I can’t return home at night. 

 

                                                                      13,000 USD

 

Then some post production help. 

 

Colour grading of final drafts.            4.000 USD

Final sound mix.                                      7,000 USD

Final edit consultant                              5,000 USD

_________________________________________________________

 

                                                      Total    28,000 USD

 

*I've opened an American bank account just for this campaign, as Italian taxation is 28% higher than in the States. 

 

About me

 

I’m a nationally-trained sommelier here in Italy. The president of the republic of Italy actually signed my diploma. 

Our classrooms here in Italy are small enough that I continually study eye contact so that most of the content has been already 'field' tested for years.

Since 2010, I’ve been a professional, English-language wine magazine journalist, covering only Southern Italian wine.  

Throughout my life I’ve made short films, both analog and digital.

I’m bilingual, earning multiple university degrees in humanities, both in Italy and in the US. 

 

Distribution

The goal is to sell this series while still in production to an international streaming service. If successful sold, all perk fulfillment will be negotiated into the sales agreement. 

 

Netflix

Amazon

BBC

AppleTv

Travel Channel

ABC.AU

 

If I fail to place this during production, we’ll stream it for individual downloads on Amazon as a series and as individual episodes. All perk fulfillment will be maintained, no matter what.
story_txt:
Terronia the Television Series. ** An Update: A BRITISH TELEVISION PRODUCER HAS COME ON BOARD AND WE ARE STARTING A PRODUCTION COMPANY TOGETHER FOR THIS AND FUTURE PROJECTS. 
*It's not incidental that we're launching this project during the national COVID-19 quarantine here in Italy. We had intended to self-finance this series but we recently had to cancel nine months of food and wine classes and refund all the tution. A school with no students is no longer a school, at least for the time being. Once the COVID- 19 quarantine is lifted we can begin production (the short video above is intended as something of a placeholder and was edited together from existing footage, as no one is allowed outside to film). If you value what we do as a school please consider joining us in the project that follows.I’m Silvestro Silvestori here in Italy. For the last 17 years we've been teaching the food and wine of Puglia to students from 59 different countries. To stay stimulated as a teacher, I've taken a yearly sabbatical to travel southern Italy, almost always by bicycle. I study the wine.  Wine is like art. You could talk at length about a 16th century Dutch painting without ever mentioning that it's yellow. That's because you'd be using the painting as a starting point to discuss all the sociological, anthropological, historical elements of its era. Yes, wine is a beverage but it's also a litmus of a region's geography,  culture, history, cuisine, climate and the deeply-woven sense of cultural patrimony.  The Short Summary *Told in 10, 22 minute episodes- a pilot and then 9, unique historical growing zones- Terronia is the story of southern Italian wine as taught by an interdisciplinary school teacher*Rather than the blackboard of the classroom I use chalk on the side of abandoned farm houses to explain fermentation, the effects of the Ottoman invasions, why baroque could only follow the protestant reformation, why grapes need foxes, birds and wolves, how we almost lost all of wine to disease, etc. *Told in a creative non-fiction format, each episode has a strong narrative arc, the 4-act structure reveals the inherent story conflicts in the world of wine, both internal and external. These human and nature-based conflicts climax at act breaks, pulling along the viewer to stay fully engaged in each story*Ours is the first generation that ‘prosumer’ technology now allows for one person to write, direct, shoot, edit and promote an entire television series, with all the gear in pannier bags aboard a single bicycle. Cameras, lenses, drone, audio recorders, fast computer for editing, my loaded bicycle is an entire 4k film crew on two wheels* While many may see this guerilla- filmmaking as only novelty, it does offer unparalleled Intimacy: a single human presence, small cameras, cell-phone sized audio recorders, intimate relationships that often go back 15 years. The one-man film crew’s small footprint can tease out intimate moments in ways large film crews cannotBackground  Southern Italy is so different than the rest of Italy that it should probably be a different country. Glance at a map, you'll see that Sicily, Calabria, Basilicata and Puglia are all islands and peninsulas, their individual histories cobbled together from thousands of years of countless invasions. The four regions have always been seen as bases- the conceptual equivalent of today’s aircraft carriers and pontoon bridges.  Even the name ‘Mediterranean’- Med Terra- or 'Middle of the earth’,  spells out their agreed-upon historical importance. Any culture that needed to feed, water and quarter troops, sailors, economic or theological invaders sooner or later came and took everything.Over time this caused a resilience in the people and cultures, and a tendency to isolate and trust only those from the same village (literally, the origins of nepotism). While these invasions were catastrophic for human beings they ended up being great for wine, individual varietals and growing zones  developed over hundreds and even thousands of years, with little or no communication between regions. These are wines of.a place and that relationship is what this series is about.  Few inside or outside of Italy know that: *There are 75 isolated communities in the south that do not speak Italian as their first language. They arrived between 400 to 2,700 years, maintaining their language, culture, cuisine and even autochthonous strains of religion the entire time*For the last 120 years, a forced and ongoing exodus out of Italy has largely depopulated large parts of the south. The people that you know of Italian descent in your country are paradoxically 1) of southern extraction and 2) Statistically unlikely to ever visit from where their ancestors actually departed*That recently humanity has learned that grapes and wine making arrived up from Africa rather than over the Alps, making the south, Italy’s oldest wine culture*That producers are reexamining old techniques, such as fermenting in concrete, of training grape vines into free standing trees, of refining with egg whites and to using the yeasts in the bark of the vine rather than the bloom of the fruit. These are not new experimental techniques but head-scratching and eventual acceptance that ancient wine makers knew much more than we often think What we need and what you getThis series is a partnership between you and me, and only you can decide if you want to wave from the shore or dive into the deep-end. All is appreciated. And I can’t do this all alone.  What you getTo learn intimately about a profoundly-compelling part of the world largely unchanged by International tourism. The ability to help craft the ten episodes, based on your level of desired participation. Help in research. Proof.a script for punctuation. Just watch the dailies with a glass of the same wine in your hand (yes, I'll tell you which to drink with which episodes). Find your new favourite wine. Or nine of them. Likely, even more. Use all the information as the foundation of Italian trips for years to come.  What we seek 1) Funding for the production2) Beta-testers, on a variety of levels 3)That you email forward this campaign and updates to your friends that love Italy and Italian wine4)That you share this campaign on your Social Media and to any mailing list you may have5) That you help in the conservation of heritage wines of the South6) That when you visit Italy, you continue to seek new, lesser known regions, where your money aids in preserving the culture7) That you someday come take one of our classes here in Puglia. (Anyone interested can book any class now, including the word 'open-ended', in regards to the actual date you'd like to attend. This fixes the price of the course, even after this series debuts) 8) That you put us in contact with any industry people that you might know that would be interested in this project9) That you order our extra virgin sent to your home. It's our only form of income at the moment . We made it. And it's excellent.  How the money will be spent. So while this year just freed up a lot of time for production, it also had the financial rug pulled out from under it. For the last 20 years I’ve lived within an hour’s drive of 3 of the growing zones. And 2 hour’s drive from 2 more. Most of what we need is the non-glamourous expenses for picnic lunches, family-owned bed and breakfasts in the 4 regions that are out of the range of a day's drive. Plus, fuel, tolls, permits and miscellaneous expenses when I can’t return home at night.                                                                        13,000 USD Then some post production help.  Colour grading of final drafts.            4.000 USDFinal sound mix.                                      7,000 USDFinal edit consultant                              5,000 USD_________________________________________________________                                                       Total    28,000 USD *I've opened an American bank account just for this campaign, as Italian taxation is 28% higher than in the States.  About me I’m a nationally-trained sommelier here in Italy. story:
What We Need

We are looking to raise $10,000 to help fund Season 1. All funds raised will go directly to production and post-production expenses.

Expenses:

·     Crew: Director of Photography, Assistant Camera, Grip, Sound, Assistant Director, Production Assistant, Hair & Make-Up.

·     Production: Locations, Permits, Meals, Equipment.

·     Travel: Driving and/or flying to different cities (potentially international cities); lodging in different cities (potentially international cities).

·     Post-Production: Sound Design, Music Licensing, Special Effects

·     Marketing

Perks include:

- Pure support

- Social media shout outs

- "How to Deal: Tarot for Everyday Life" by Sami Main

- 1 hr 1-on-1 with host/creator Camile Sardina

- Curated Media List for your project or self

- Choice of episode topic for Season 1

- Free PR

- Executive Producer Title

 

The Impact

The world is becoming more aware and open to surreal-like experiences and practices...

We see it in the news…

·     Nearly half of Americans believe in aliens: https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/new-survey...

·     Every three of five people have seen a ghost: https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news...

·     There is a rise in mystic-like businesses: https://www.theguardian.com/small-business-netw...

·     According to a 2017 Pew Research Study, millennials are turning away from religion faster than any other group, yet still strongly identify as spiritual: http://www.pewresearch.org/fact-tank/2017/09/06...

We see it in pop-culture…

·      2017 was the biggest year in horror history: https://variety.com/2016/film/news/horror-movie...

·      Witchy shows like "Chilling Adventures of Sabrina" and "Charmed" are returning.

With that, ‘Surreal Camile’ is a timely web series that will feed curiosities and continue to open minds about surreal-like people, places, experiences, culture and pop-culture.  

 

ABOUT HOST/CREATOR, CAMILE SARDINA

Host/Creator, Camile Sardina, is a self-proclaimed believer in the unbelievable. With a psychic/medium great grandma, palmist grandma and psychic/medium aunt, she’s been rooted in the mystic. Camile has had psychic visions herself, but never deeply explored or expanded upon her abilities (call it imposter syndrome). But now, with the “Surreal Camile” show, Camile hopes to not only open the third eye of others, but her own. Camile is an empath and Pisces/Aquarius cusp, yet she identifies more as a Pisces.

Camile Sardina is a NYC media maven who writes, publicizes, broadcasts and performs. She has a certification in broadcasting from New York Film Academy; and a Bachelor’s of Science in Public Relations with a concentration in theater/dance from The University of Florida. Her work has been published by Airbnb, Teen Vogue, Elite Daily, BUST, LADYGUNN and more. Her interview and photo series “Change Makers” received national attention by Ashton Kutcher and his news site A Plus, along with BUST Magazine.And her publicity expertise has showcased across The Wendy Williams Show, The Doctors, The Washington Post and much more. You might have even caught her acting in commercials such as Sauza’s ‘Fun is Calling’ ads.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’d like to help in ways other than donating, you can:

•   Spread the news: Please share our campaign across your social media! Tell all your people!

•   Fit for the show? Are you someone with a uniquely surreal-like story, skill or way of life that could be good for the show? Or know someone who would be good? Let us know!

•   Donate Music: Do you make music that could fit the surreal-like content of the show? We’d love to listen!

•   Donate Graphic Design Skills: Are your web design skills out of this world? Let's chat!

•   Donate Art or Photos: We’d love to spotlight different artists and photographers with surreal-like work on our social media! And we’d love to partner with artists and photographers to create original ‘Surreal Camile’ material.

•   Social Media Intern: Are you obsessed with the gram AND the type of content in this show? We’d love to have you as an intern!  

CONTACT & FOLLOW US!

Email: surrealcamile@gmail.com

Instagram: @surrealcamile: https://www.instagram.com/surrealcamile/

Facebook: @surrealcamile: https://www.facebook.com/SurrealCamile/

YouTube: @surrealcamile: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaAxP8ww0i9Opc...

Twitter: @surrealcamile: https://twitter.com/SurrealCamile
