story:
We are raising funds so that we can get our comedic pilot episode, Tia Maria's Cafe, about a Portuguese Canadian family running a coffee shop to TV screens across Canada as a sitcom series! Audiences at our initial screening love Tia Maria's Cafe and want more episodes! We have completely funded this on our own but now we need your support! Your support will enable us to create an awesome pitch package to present to networks! Let's get funny, women driven stories onto screens everywhere!

Keep reading to learn more about us and this awesome project!

We, Maria and Sandra, became friends when we attended high school together at Sir Charles Tupper in East Vancouver, sharing a love for theatre, fashion and crazy schemes. Over the years, we have been big supporters of each other's theatrical pursuits and with decades of theatre, film and TV experience between us, we partnered in 2016 to create Portuguese Buns Productions. 

Through this dynamic partnership, we created FESTA!, the hilarious immersive play where we played ALL the members of a typical Portuguese familia! FESTA! was such a hit at the 2016 Vancouver Fringe Festival that we remounted it as an even bigger FESTA! the following year!

We could see how our funny, endearing stories resonated with all people. Everyone could relate to the stories and characters that were brought to life and they wanted more. That is how Tia Maria's Cafe was born!

Tia Maria's Cafe is an inter-generational story of a Portuguese-Canadian family running a coffee shop. When Momma Maria hands over the family coffee shop to her daughter Claudia and daughter-in-law Maria, they try to put their own contemporary stamp on it. But they have to deal with Momma Maria who wants them to keep the cafe old school! Rounding out the quirky family is Manuel, Maria's hardworking (when he wants to be!) husband and their sassy tween daughter Meaghan. Of course, there are always some colourful characters who stop by for a coffee or pastry!

 

​

With your help, we can bring these heartwarming, hilarious stories to the screen, to be enjoyed by all people who appreciate an honest take on what it means to be a family. We know that people all around world will be able to relate to the stories we have to tell, about straddling a world of keeping old traditions and creating new ones.

Come be a member of our familia!

They say it takes a village to raise a family and it certainly will take a village to create Tia Maria's Cafe! We can't wait for you to be part of our village and we've got some great Portuguese perks for you!

We want to share Tia Maria's Cafe with all of Canada and our goal is to have our story told on TV in a sitcom style, like CBC's Kim's Convenience. This is going to take a lot of work, time and funds....this is why we need your help!

We have created our proof of concept pilot for Tia Maria's Cafe and to take it to the next level, we need to raise $7000. 

 

  • Create a professional pitch package so that we can confidently present our project to TV Producers and Executives
  • Produce a 3-5 minute pitch video
  • Set up meetings with producers/executives
  • Create more episode outlines and scripts

We have some great perks that you will love!

  • Signed posters and yummy Portuguese treats
  • Portuguese-style organization and tidying up for your place!!
  • Ever wanted to learn Portuguese before your big trip? We have you covered.

The world right now is eager for interesting, heartwarming, culture-specific stories told from a unique perspective and we are here to deliver! 

  • Tia Maria's Cafe is a comedy written from a female perspective, which is still rare in the comedy world and the world is ready for us!
  • We offer that unique viewpoint of Portuguese-Canadian culture and we know it's relatable to all cultures based on the feedback we received with our play FESTA!
  • We have a lot of confidence in our project based on the success of FESTA!

 

"If you are Portuguese, don't miss this show. If you're not Portuguese, this is a fun chance to peek inside someone else's culture and experience the amazing thing that happens when an audience has the rare opportunity to see themselves reflected."

"Laugh out loud the entire time!! Really really funny! It's a must see!"

"Loved the Portuguese traditions bumping up against Canadian life, told from a female perspective."

Portuguese Buns Productions recently had a private screening of Tia Maria's Cafe to show our pitch project to our cast, crew, volunteers and families.

"Looking forward to seeing "Tia Maria´s Café" in the small screen!"

"I still want to watch it again and again!!!"

"Loved it last night...very proud of all of you!!"

"It was funny and sure hits home as to how we were all brought up...I look forward to seeing more."

There are always challenges with any project. However, Portuguese Buns Productions are comprised of two determined Portuguese women who are not afraid of hard work! We have an excellent track record - we had a very successful, near sold-out run at the Vancouver International Fringe Festival with FESTA! and when we remounted the show the following year, we made it even bigger and had local groups eager to join us on FESTA! 2.0, such as  the Portuguese Filaharmonic Band of Vancouver, Rancho Folclorico Cruz de Cristo as well as BC authors and accordian players.  Also, when we filmed Tia Maria's Cafe, we were able to secure a local Bell Media TV celebrity!

We are determined that Tia Maria's Cafe is a real success. We have been working on it for the past two years and we are very excited about our proof of concept pilot - it's funny,  endearing and will appeal to a wide audience. We have a phenomenal team in place who have helped create this project and we have many wonderful allies in the community who we can lean on through this journey. Portuguese Buns are resourceful, creative and resilient and we are extremely committed to the success of Tia Maria's Cafe!

We understand if you are not able to contribute right now! But you can still help us and we will be extremely grateful!!

  • Tell your family and friends about our campaign!
  • Show your support by liking and commenting on our posts!
  • Share on social media!

 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/portuguesebuns

Instagram: @portuguese_buns_productions

Twitter: @PortugueseBuns

 

Maria J. Cruz - Director/Producer/Writer/Actor

Maria has worked in the performing arts since the late 90s (BA, Theatre, UBC). Maria’s experience includes acting, writing and producing for both film and theatre and most recently taking on first-time directing duties for TIA MARIA’S CAFÉ - our pilot pitch project for television. In recent years she has written a lot of her own work, much of it exploring her identity as a Portuguese-Canadian. Specifically, two one-woman shows – The Castro Project, part of Portuguese Heritage Month in 2008, and The Kilometres to 40, chosen for the Azores International Fringe Festival in Pico, Portugal in 2014. Other favourite theatre credits include anything where she can wear a corset and sass people: Toinette in Moliere’s The Imaginary Invalid, Sylvia in The Soldier’s Fortune and Lady Politic Would-Be in Volpone - all for United Players. In 2016 she partnered with fellow Portuguese-Canadian actor and old friend, Sandra Medeiros to form Portuguese Buns Productions. They had the near sold-out run of FESTA! An immersive intergenerational theatrical experience at the Vancouver Fringe Festival and a successful remount the following year. Maria’s first love is and always will be acting. Recent television credits include the collaborative female-led independent film project The Parties, along with cult favourites Riverdale, iZombie and DC Legends of Tomorrow. Watch her this month in a guest-starring role on Disney’s kids show Gabby Duran & the Unsittables and voicing the wonderfully warm character of “Abuelita Howler” on Netflix’s SuperMonsters.

Sandra Medeiros, Writer/Producer/Actor

Sandra has been so thrilled to partner up with her fellow Portuguese-Canadian friend Maria in the creation of Portuguese Buns Productions and embarking on this fun adventure of telling stories about their families and culture.  FESTA! was a huge hit at the Vancouver Fringe Festival, as was its remount, and Sandra had the best time playing multiple characters, such as Pai (Dad) and Madrinha (godmother).  The pitch pilot project Tia Maria's Cafe has been just as great a journey and she's excited for the next step. Sandra is a theatre director and producer and is also co-artistic director of the award-winning theatre company Naked Goddess Productions.

Maryth Gilroy, Writer/Script Supervisor

Maryth is a producer, director and actor who enjoys bringing tales of the human experience to vivid life and helping others manifest their ideas. Maryth delighted in her experience with the Portuguese Buns gals conceiving the original script, directing the site-specific theatre experience FESTA! then reviving these characters for the screen with Tia Maria’s Cafe. Maryth attended The Banff Centre School of Fine Arts and holds an Advanced Certificate in Directing from Capilano University. She takes great pleasure in all aspects of bringing stories to life and finds it especially rewarding to work with writers on original pieces. 

Laurel K. Brown, Director of Photography

Laurel possesses an enthusiasm for experimentation and learning new things PLUS a positive working energy on set. High fives all around! Laurel has been DOP'ing most recently with low budget shorts and web series segments and have a plethora of experience on a wide range of set sizes as 1st and 2nd Assistant Camera. She is proficient with professional, semi-pro, and consumer-grade digital and film cameras. Laurel has also founded and runs Cinema Spectacular, a local film festival that focuses on Canadian content. She holds a BFA in film production from Simon Fraser University and grew up in Canmore, AB. Ask her about her vast accumulation of facts about sea creatures.

Trevor Meyer, First Assistant Director/Editor

Trevor is extremely passionate about film making and has produced many short films. He has worked in many capacities in film - from writing to camera operator to editing. He currently has his own show on YouTube called WTF where he posts funny movie reviews.

AND....

We have an extremely talented, diverse and hard-working cast and crew who have worked on Tia Maria's Cafe and made it the fabulous project that it is. We are grateful to have them on our team!

Cast:

Yasmin Luisa Tayob, Paulo Ribeiro, Andrew Coghlan, Amelie Love, Madeline Angel, Mike McCardell, Sandy Medeiros, Brent Clark, Clay St. Thomas

Crew:

Slava Kapelushnyy, Bernardo Six Costa, Ethan Ribeiro, Yandy Liu, Irene Karas Loeper, Ariana McGregor, Marc Gelmon, Gianni Ceraldi, Alison Jeffreys

Post Production:

Trevor Meyer, Dave Chick - Hatched Productions, Devan Scott - Moving Image Agency
story_txt:
We are raising funds so that we can get our comedic pilot episode, Tia Maria's Cafe, about a Portuguese Canadian family running a coffee shop to TV screens across Canada as a sitcom series! Audiences at our initial screening love Tia Maria's Cafe and want more episodes! We have completely funded this on our own but now we need your support! Your support will enable us to create an awesome pitch package to present to networks! Let's get funny, women driven stories onto screens everywhere!
Keep reading to learn more about us and this awesome project!
We, Maria and Sandra, became friends when we attended high school together at Sir Charles Tupper in East Vancouver, sharing a love for theatre, fashion and crazy schemes. Over the years, we have been big supporters of each other's theatrical pursuits and with decades of theatre, film and TV experience between us, we partnered in 2016 to create Portuguese Buns Productions. 
Through this dynamic partnership, we created FESTA!, the hilarious immersive play where we played ALL the members of a typical Portuguese familia! FESTA! was such a hit at the 2016 Vancouver Fringe Festival that we remounted it as an even bigger FESTA! the following year!
We could see how our funny, endearing stories resonated with all people. Everyone could relate to the stories and characters that were brought to life and they wanted more. That is how Tia Maria's Cafe was born!
Tia Maria's Cafe is an inter-generational story of a Portuguese-Canadian family running a coffee shop. When Momma Maria hands over the family coffee shop to her daughter Claudia and daughter-in-law Maria, they try to put their own contemporary stamp on it. But they have to deal with Momma Maria who wants them to keep the cafe old school! Rounding out the quirky family is Manuel, Maria's hardworking (when he wants to be!) husband and their sassy tween daughter Meaghan. Of course, there are always some colourful characters who stop by for a coffee or pastry!
 

​
With your help, we can bring these heartwarming, hilarious stories to the screen, to be enjoyed by all people who appreciate an honest take on what it means to be a family. We know that people all around world will be able to relate to the stories we have to tell, about straddling a world of keeping old traditions and creating new ones.
Come be a member of our familia!


They say it takes a village to raise a family and it certainly will take a village to create Tia Maria's Cafe! We can't wait for you to be part of our village and we've got some great Portuguese perks for you!
We want to share Tia Maria's Cafe with all of Canada and our goal is to have our story told on TV in a sitcom style, like CBC's Kim's Convenience. This is going to take a lot of work, time and funds....this is why we need your help!
We have created our proof of concept pilot for Tia Maria's Cafe and to take it to the next level, we need to raise $7000. 
 



Create a professional pitch package so that we can confidently present our project to TV Producers and Executives
Produce a 3-5 minute pitch video
Set up meetings with producers/executives
Create more episode outlines and scripts

We have some great perks that you will love!

Signed posters and yummy Portuguese treats
Portuguese-style organization and tidying up for your place!!
Ever wanted to learn Portuguese before your big trip? We have you covered.



The world right now is eager for interesting, heartwarming, culture-specific stories told from a unique perspective and we are here to deliver! 

Tia Maria's Cafe is a comedy written from a female perspective, which is still rare in the comedy world and the world is ready for us!
We offer that unique viewpoint of Portuguese-Canadian culture and we know it's relatable to all cultures based on the feedback we received with our play FESTA!
We have a lot of confidence in our project based on the success of FESTA!

 


"If you are Portuguese, don't miss this show. If you're not Portuguese, this is a fun chance to peek inside someone else's culture and experience the amazing thing that happens when an audience has the rare opportunity to see themselves reflected."
"Laugh out loud the entire time!! Really really funny! It's a must see!"
"Loved the Portuguese traditions bumping up against Canadian life, told from a female perspective."


Portuguese Buns Productions recently had a private screening of Tia Maria's Cafe to show our pitch project to our cast, crew, volunteers and families.
"Looking forward to seeing "Tia Maria´s Café" in the small screen!"
"I still want to watch it again and again!!!"
"Loved it last night...very proud of all of you!!"
"It was funny and sure hits home as to how we were all brought up...I look forward to seeing more."


There are always challenges with any project. However, Portuguese Buns Productions are comprised of two determined Portuguese women who are not afraid of hard work! We have an excellent track record - we had a very successful, near sold-out run at the Vancouver International Fringe Festival with FESTA! and when we remounted the show the following year, we made it even bigger and had local groups eager to join us on FESTA! 2.0, such as  the Portuguese Filaharmonic Band of Vancouver, Rancho Folclorico Cruz de Cristo as well as BC authors and accordian players.  Also, when we filmed Tia Maria's Cafe, we were able to secure a local Bell Media TV celebrity!
We are determined that Tia Maria's Cafe is a real success. We have been working on it for the past two years and we are very excited about our proof of concept pilot - it's funny,  endearing and will appeal to a wide audience. We have a phenomenal team in place who have helped create this project and we have many wonderful allies in the community who we can lean on through this journey. Portuguese Buns are resourceful, creative and resilient and we are extremely committed to the success of Tia Maria's Cafe!


We understand if you are not able to contribute right now! But you can still help us and we will be extremely grateful!!

Tell your family and friends about our campaign!
Show your support by liking and commenting on our posts!
Share on social media!

 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/portuguesebuns
Instagram: @portuguese_buns_productions
Twitter: @PortugueseBuns
 


Maria J. Cruz - Director/Producer/Writer/Actor
Maria has worked in the performing arts since the late 90s (BA, Theatre, UBC). Maria’s experience includes acting, writing and producing for both film and theatre and most recently taking on first-time directing duties for TIA MARIA’S CAFÉ - our pilot pitch project for television. In recent years she has written a lot of her own work, much of it exploring her identity as a Portuguese-Canadian. Specifically, two one-woman shows – The Castro Project, part of Portuguese Heritage Month in 2008, and The Kilometres to 40, chosen for the Azores International Fringe Festival in Pico, Portugal in 2014. Other favourite theatre credits include anything where she can wear a corset and sass people: Toinette in Moliere’s The Imaginary Invalid, Sylvia in The Soldier’s Fortune and Lady Politic Would-Be in Volpone - all for United Players. In 2016 she partnered with fellow Portuguese-Canadian actor and old friend, Sandra Medeiros to form Portuguese Buns Productions. They had the near sold-out run of FESTA! An immersive intergenerational theatrical experience at the Vancouver Fringe Festival and a successful remount the following year. Maria’s first love is and always will be acting. Recent television credits include the collaborative female-led independent film project The Parties, along with cult favourites Riverdale, iZombie and DC Legends of Tomorrow. Watch her this month in a guest-starring role on Disney’s kids show Gabby Duran & the Unsittables and voicing the wonderfully warm character of “Abuelita Howler” on Netflix’s SuperMonsters.

Sandra Medeiros, Writer/Producer/Actor
Sandra has been so thrilled to partner up with her fellow Portuguese-Canadian friend Maria in the creation of Portuguese Buns Productions and embarking on this fun adventure of telling stories about their families and culture.  FESTA! was a huge hit at the Vancouver Fringe Festival, as was its remount, and Sandra had the best time playing multiple characters, such as Pai (Dad) and Madrinha (godmother).  The pitch pilot project Tia Maria's Cafe has been just as great a journey and she's excited for the next step. Sandra is a theatre director and producer and is also co-artistic director of the award-winning theatre company Naked Goddess Productions.

Maryth Gilroy, Writer/Script Supervisor
Maryth is a producer, director and actor who enjoys bringing tales of the human experience to vivid life and helping others manifest their ideas. Maryth delighted in her experience with the Portuguese Buns gals conceiving the original script, directing the site-specific theatre experience FESTA! then reviving these characters for the screen with Tia Maria’s Cafe. Maryth attended The Banff Centre School of Fine Arts and holds an Advanced Certificate in Directing from Capilano University. She takes great pleasure in all aspects of bringing stories to life and finds it especially rewarding to work with writers on original pieces. 

Laurel K. Brown, Director of Photography
Laurel possesses an enthusiasm for experimentation and learning new things PLUS a positive working energy on set. High fives all around! Laurel has been DOP'ing most recently with low budget shorts and web series segments and have a plethora of experience on a wide range of set sizes as 1st and 2nd Assistant Camera. She is proficient with professional, semi-pro, and consumer-grade digital and film cameras. Laurel has also founded and runs Cinema Spectacular, a local film festival that focuses on Canadian content. She holds a BFA in film production from Simon Fraser University and grew up in Canmore, AB. Ask her about her vast accumulation of facts about sea creatures.

Trevor Meyer, First Assistant Director/Editor
Trevor is extremely passionate about film making and has produced many short films. He has worked in many capacities in film - from writing to camera operator to editing. He currently has his own show on YouTube called WTF where he posts funny movie reviews.
AND....
We have an extremely talented, diverse and hard-working cast and crew who have worked on Tia Maria's Cafe and made it the fabulous project that it is. We are grateful to have them on our team!
Cast:
Yasmin Luisa Tayob, Paulo Ribeiro, Andrew Coghlan, Amelie Love, Madeline Angel, Mike McCardell, Sandy Medeiros, Brent Clark, Clay St. Thomas
Crew:
Slava Kapelushnyy, Bernardo Six Costa, Ethan Ribeiro, Yandy Liu, Irene Karas Loeper, Ariana McGregor, Marc Gelmon, Gianni Ceraldi, Alison Jeffreys
Post Production:
Trevor Meyer, Dave Chick - Hatched Productions, Devan Scott - Moving Image Agency

story:
Short Summary

I'm sure your dying to know what the series is about? Well, let me tell you.

Abby is a detective who is investigating the disappearance of her father. During her investigation, she runs into Luther and gains special abilities that help her slowly learn the truth as to why her father disappeared 20 years ago.

Filmmaking, to us, is the ultimate medium to tell a story of triumph, heartbreak, and so much more. With the Trace pilot, I want to utilize the series as a creative outlet for everyone involved to break off a piece of themselves and express it visually and acoustically. And that, in part, is how I want to utilize this campaign.
Another way (quite frankly, most important, IMO) is you, the audience! Not only do we want to create something meaningful for us, but our main focus is to create something meaningful, epic, and engaging for YOU! Yes, you! Filmmaking is such a wonderful experience to be a part of and we want you to be absolutely proud to be a part of that wonderful experience! I mean, how cool would it be to say, "Yea, I was a part of that!" Pretty badass, right?
I truly know I have a great story to tell and share when the characters in the story are in the driver's seat, writing and building their world that they live in and reacting to it.
 

What We Need & What You Get

I want this campaign and us as filmmakers, actors, and actresses to be the ship, the vessel, and you are the fuel! Trace has a dedicated and talented group of people who all strive and are ready to make this the very best series it can possibly be! We want this to be exclusive and an overall fun opportunity for everyone including you (teamwork makes the dreamwork)!
We as a team, want you to join us on our epic journey and relish in the sweet contributions from us to you when you select a certain perk(s). All of them will allow you to dive into the pilot and be fully engaged with the process from start to finish (dang, that sounds good)!
But how will the funds raised be used? Well, we have this colorful graph to explain just that!

The Impact

The Trace family values everyone's time so we want to respectfully compensate and recognize everyone involved for their hard work and talent. But most importantly being able to allow those involved to proudly have an important place among the project as a whole!

Risks & Challenges

What project doesn't have its fair share of risks and challenges? We will undoubtedly run into some along the way but that what makes it worth fighting for! Here some we may face:


1. Securing locations pertaining to the story
2. Creating Abby's special abilities visually on screen
3. Using practical effects vs. special FX / CGI
4. Overall production scheduling including talent and crew
5. Managing all the moving parts of the pilot from pre-production to post-production
6. Not securing everything we need for the pilot (locations, props, talent)
7. Not reaching the right audience/demographic for the pilot and series as a whole


Despite those possible challenges and risks, I am very confident in the Trace team to tackle them head-on and find creative solutions to them so that we can share a story worth telling.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone can help and support Trace in the biggest and smallest ways! We need love and support not only through contributions but through joining our mailing list! We want to keep you updated on our campaign and overall progress (because, after all, this a collaborative team effort)! You can also help by tracking and sharing our journey through our website (www.tracewebseries.com) and social media Platforms like Instagram: @tracewebseries Twitter: @tracewebseries Facebook: Trace Web Series and spreading the word with your family, friends and whoever else you can think of! The more people, the better!


From the entire Trace team, we want to thank you for your support! Check back frequently for more updates!

story:
Summary

  • Scripted comedy with actors that teaches tennis fundamentals
  • 14 outrageous scripts are written including the script for the Trailer
  • Next step is to film a world-class Trailer that will be pitched networks and sponsors
  • Created by Eric Tate, an experienced writer/performer/producer and tennis coach
  • Has never been anything like this in sports or tennis instruction
  • Designed for today's media consumer - short episodes, entertainment-based
  • The greater purpose and possibility of this show and your contribution is reaching kids around the world and inspiring them to play tennis, develop friendships and lead healthier lives

Crowdfunding Goal

  • Our crowd-funding goal is a minimum of $30,000 though at least $50,000 would be better - filmmaking is expensive and there are always unforeseen marketing expenses
  • The funds will be used to produce a world-class Trailer, with complex scenes from two episodes requiring full crew, multiple actors, and special effects. This includes a dramatic airplane scene and a scene as a Spanish Torero in a bull fighting arena with an actual live bull!
  • Roughly 15% of the funds will also be used for travel expenses to meet with companies around the U.S. and possibly outside the U.S.

Perks for Contributing

  • As you can see listed, we are offering a number of exciting Perks - these are meant to deliver to you value that is rewarding, fun and in some cases highly profitable as the show succeeds

Challenges

  • There is no guarantee, of course, that even with a world-class Trailer filmed that it will succeed in persuading companies to distribute and sponsor it. However, these plots and characters are so unique and compelling that we think the chances are solid. More and more, companies are using story-based content to market their products and services. 'Whatever It Takes' is replete with product placement opportunities.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this idea and campaign with others - including tennis coaches, players, and club owners. Share it with people who love comedy. Finally, share it with those who care deeply about investing in the well being of kids

Thank you, Eric

Eric Tate

Amarsi Media

941-685-6891

amarsimedia@gmail.com

story:
Camisado is a suspenseful drama about loss, the struggle for vengeance, and how one woman rises from the ashes of unspeakable tragedy to become an unlikely force to be reckoned with.

My name is Thomas Gidlow and I am the co-founder of SkyPhire Entertainment. Along with my wife Samantha and my brother Daniel (aka Danz Newz), we have created this campaign to put our debut production - Camisado: The Event Series - in the best possible position to succeed.

The series will run six episodes for Season 1 and will be available for free on the Danz Newz YouTube channel in September of 2020. While heavy with timely action, high drama and dynamic characters, “Camisado” is unique in how it presents its characters.
 

We are fortunate to have an embarrassment of riches with our cast. These amazing actors and actresses went through a rigorous process and excelled to earn their positions on this project.
 

You can check out the entire cast on our Camisado: The Event Series IMDb page linked here.
 

Thomas Gidlow (Director, Producer, Writer): Thomas has been writing and producing since 2009. After a five-year hiatus, he is back to take the entertainment world by storm.

Samantha Gidlow (Executive Producer): Samantha has been writing professionally for over a decade. She holds an MBA with a concentration in Business Intelligence and is also writing her first novel.

Daniel Gidlow (Director of Photography): Better known online as DanzNewz, Daniel has grown his social presence to more than 500,000 followers with his quick wit, hard work, and entertaining personality.

Michelle Lewis (Associate Producer): Michelle is a multi-talented actress who has been vital to the development of the Camisado story. She will take on the supporting role of "Kaplan" along with her producer duties.

Morgan Monnig (Associate Producer): Morgan has been involved in over a dozen films as an actress and producer. She is a steadying presence who will be in charge of script continuity during our production.


 

We are seeking $6,000 to help our self-financed budget in these critical areas:

We are allocating the majority of funds from our self-financed budget to compensate and lodge our actors and crew. We also have a 4k BlackMagic Production camera, access to quality lighting equipment, and a top-notch sound designer to make Camisado look and sound as good as possible.

If we do not reach our $6,000 goal, we will still use all funds contributed along similar percentages. Principal photography will begin in January 2020 and conclude in March. Launch of the series online is slated for next September.

Our unique perks are designed to give our gratitude for your contributions. Along with a digital thanks and a special credit in our series, you can also get a sneak peek at Camisado nearly three weeks before everyone else.

Other perks include access to a live stream from the set during filming (actual scenes!), movie-size posters, framed production stills, a live screening with the cast and crew, on the set access, and more. You can even write a line of dialog or join our cast for Season 2!
 

Your contribution goes beyond dollars and production costs. Our goals are big because our drive to succeed is equally as big. Whenever we have shared our script and project materials, we've been told that this story has serious potential. With your help, we can turn that potential into reality.

Once we finish production, our plan is threefold:

  • Package the six episodes into an on-demand series hosted on the Danz Newz YouTube channel, which has more than 350,000 subscribers.
  • Engage and grow an audience to be able to support future seasons.
  • Network with influencers, distributors, and aggregators in the film business to reach major streaming services (Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, and others).


The underlying goal of our company is to feature stories where everyone, from any walk of life, can be shown as strong, determined, fierce, and proud of who they are. Emily Kent is married to a woman, Avery Kent, and they have an adopted daughter. This is never referred to in any way except as normal - no stereotypes, mischaracterizations, malice, or prejudice exists with our characters. All of us together can bring true change and begin a new trend toward normalizing representation in film and TV.

Infinite diversity in infinite combinations, to steal a Star Trek parlance.
 

Our risks are mitigated due to our low overhead, self-financing the budget, and relatively low costs for our debut season of Camisado. A successful crowdfunding campaign will put us in great shape to bring this compelling and entertaining story to life.

If we fall short of our $6,000 goal, we will regroup and stretch our budget as far as possible. We are confident in our abilities and drive to succeed no matter what happens.
 

Whether you contribute monetarily, share or discuss our campaign, or simply visit and move on, we cannot thank you enough for taking the time to check us out.

If you decide to contribute, we pledge to you that we will do everything possible to make Camisado: The Event Series worthy of your support.

From all of us associated with SkyPhire Entertainment, thank you!
 

            

Official Camisado Website: www.SkyPhire.biz

Infinite diversity in infinite combinations, to steal a Star Trek parlance. 


Our risks are mitigated due to our low overhead, self-financing the budget, and relatively low costs for our debut season of Camisado. A successful crowdfunding campaign will put us in great shape to bring this compelling and entertaining story to life.
If we fall short of our $6,000 goal, we will regroup and stretch our budget as far as possible. We are confident in our abilities and drive to succeed no matter what happens. 


Whether you contribute monetarily, share or discuss our campaign, or simply visit and move on, we cannot thank you enough for taking the time to check us out.
If you decide to contribute, we pledge to you that we will do everything possible to make Camisado: The Event Series worthy of your support.
From all of us associated with SkyPhire Entertainment, thank you! 
            
Official Camisado Website: www.SkyPhire.biz

story:
Gurlz Comedy Series Produced by FragileWildflower Productions is a provocative,fun, sexy series, telling the story of 4 Women living in the city.

An aspiring comedian, an up and coming actress, a social media influencer, and a talented speech writer all evolving into who they truly are and exploring the dynamics of being minority women in the world today. Reflecting on their career choices, doubts, fears, beliefs and sexuality. They are tasked with having to believe in themselves,and to define themselves outside of the men they are connected to.

 

        

What We Need & What You Get

With your help, we need to raise $5,000 to create the Gurlz Comedy Series. As We're making a high quality product for you, this is a modest amount that will go towards:

  • production costs (i.e. director, cinematographers, line producer, crew)
  • provisions for actors and crew (i.e. FOOD!)
  • lights, sound, camera equipment, editing
  • marketing, PR, festival entry fees, and distribution

                                                         

 Your HUGELY appreciated contributions will not only help us, but YOU as well! Perks      offered include ,Custom videos, V.I.P DAYS ON SET, along with many others offers

Check them out!

 

       

Your support of this production allows artists to tell their stories, providing the world with original and unique content from diverse backgrounds helping to spark conversation that is impactful and culture shifting.

 

  

Courtni Saizon - Creator/ Writer / Executive Producer

Originally hailing from New Orleans,Louisiana, Courtni has been a creative all her life. She started out in front of the camera as an actress and then transitioned behind the camera as a director. When not reading voraciously, eating out, or Netflix and chilling, you can find Courtni writing, directing, or producing content for her inclusive production company FragileWildflower Poridcutions     

 

Brittany Heyward Co-Executive Producer

A queen hailing from Queens, NY, Brittany Heyward has always had her finger on what’s trending which is no surprise that she would discover the world of web series. She makes up one half of Series-ly Podcast which she produces along with producing for various digital series.

Brianna Graham - Co-Producer 

Born and Raised in the boogie down Bronx, the N.Y. native caught the creative bug when she was in high school and never looked back. She started directing film projects at school and once she graduated, started finding gigs as a Production assistant on various short film projects. She is currently Co-Executive Producer of the award winning Comedy series Working Out the Kinks.

Victoria Wallace Co-Producer/ Actress

Born and raised in Washington, DC, Victoria studied Theatre at Duke Ellington School of the Arts and BFA Acting & Hispanic Studies at Marymount Manhattan College. She's explored Meisner technique at William Esper Studios , Actuár en Español (Acting in Spanish) at HB Studios, Audition Techniques with Ulysses Terrero, and most recently, Advanced Scene Study with Wynn Handman. 

Recent credits include: Gabourey Sidibe's "The Tale of Four" as Quincy , Natalie in “The Dirty Kind” (Amazon Prime), and Flora in George Pelecanos’s “DC Noir” anthology.

 

Nedge Victome as Simone

Haitian- born and Brooklyn bred, model and actress Nedge Victome made her stage debut performance in
What Happened That Night, presented at T. Schreiber Studios and is currently working on a new web-series called Juju. Nedge loves exploring stories that are not only relatable but that are nuanced and sometimes may deviate from normal narratives.
A natural lover of the social sciences, Nedge studied Sociology in Undergrad and was inspired to pursue acting upon graduation. She went on to train at Stella Adler and T. Schreiber Studios in New York. Her deep curiosity of human social relationships, interactions, and culture encourage and challenge her to continuously find the humanity in all of her stories.

Tianna Mendez as Regina

Tianna Mendez, a native of Charlotte, North Carolina and has appeared in several film and print productions. After graduating from the University of North Carolina at Charlotte, Tianna began studying acting at Film Actors’ Studio Charlotte. Upon moving to New York City, Tianna has studied with Brad Fleischer and at the Upright Citizen’s Brigade Theater. You can currently see her in the IGTV webseries, Besties: The Ultra Mini Series, and in the short film, PRIMARY.

Victoria Wallace as Quinn

Born and raised in Washington, DC, Victoria studied Theatre at Duke Ellington School of the Arts and BFA Acting & Hispanic Studies at Marymount Manhattan College. She's explored Meisner technique at William Esper Studios , Actuár en Español (Acting in Spanish) at HB Studios, Audition Techniques with Ulysses Terrero, and most recently, Advanced Scene Study with Wynn Handman. 

Recent credits include: Gabourey Sidibe's "The Tale of Four" as Quincy , Natalie in “The Dirty Kind” (Amazon Prime), and Flora in George Pelecanos’s “DC Noir” anthology.

Malikah McHerrin-Cobb as Shannon 

Making her television debut in GURLZ. Malikah, a graduate of SCAD, the University for Creative Careers, is an actor who performs predominantly in theatre throughout the regional theatre circuit. She is extremely grateful to God, her family, and friends for the love and support. She would love to thank all of the cast and production team involved in GURLZ for taking a chance and giving her the opportunity to bring this story to life.

Steven St. Pierre as Mitch

Actor/director/writer/comedian born in Brooklyn and raised in Queens by hardworking Haitian immigrant parents. He had a career working with the special needs population until he discovered his passion for acting. Steven honed his skills at The Barrow Group then HB Studio. He then transitioned to On-Camera at MN Studio and continues to sharpen the craft at Susan Batson Studios.

Steven's recent work can be seen in roles played on Emmy Nominated web series "Tough Love" on Youtube and TV One, Discovery ID's "The Perfect Murder", Londyn Series, indie feature films "Convicted" and "Serial Killer in Harlem", as well as actor/writer/director on his award-winning short film"Corey" currently ripping through the festival circuit.

Steven performs sketch comedy at UCB and PIT where he also writes and directs sketch shows. Trivia: Steven shares his birthday with Spike Lee, which obviously means he's destined for greatness. Not up for debate Lol.
Follow his journey on Instagram @iStevenStPierre and Facebook @officialStevenStPierre.

Malik Rashad as John

Brooklyn, NY native son Malik Rashad is a gifted storyteller and the definition of a modern day renaissance man. With a foundation in music, he has stretched beyond limits as an actor, voice-over artist, songwriter, and entrepreneur.
Malik starred in the Emmy-nominated hit digital series Tough Love as Jason which has been picked up by and currently airing on network channel TVOne. That role carried him to Pillow Talk another break out digital series. He has also starred in other projects including the Discovery ID series Frenemies, short films Death of A Prince, A Kid From Southside and most recently The Booth.
Additionally, Malik's voice-over work includes projects for the NCAA, YouTube, Samsung, Lipton Brisk, Under Armour and many more. Also a versatile and gifted songwriter he has curated and written soundtracks, theme songs and songs for other artists, and his own music has been featured in numerous series and films. A tireless worker and ever growing artist, the best is yet to come for Malik!

Lance Liverpool as Shane

a realistic actor whose evocative performances leave viewers both hating and loving his characters, but mostly loving, afterall he hails from New York’s best borough, and it’s the Brooklyn way. Most recently, his fans have loved him in the web series “Terms and Conditions May Apply,” as Daniel Hodge, the unrelenting husband who is willing to do the unheard of to keep his marriage alive. Also, his following loved to hate him in the web series, “Foster Sin,” as Mr. Brown, the High School Teacher who trades grades for personal favors, and as Darrius, the promiscuous player who never plays it safe, in “2 Wrongz”. Lance is also recognized for his comedic role in B.E.T.’s series “Situationships” as an overbearing mama's boy.

Lance began his acting career in 2010. Soon after he was cast in his first feature film, “Sugar Plumb Daniels” as the leading man and love interest. To hone his craft, Lance attended Barbizon School of Acting and Modeling, and as a result landed a few gigs as a live model on “The Harry Show”.

Patrick Brancato as Eric

Born in Bayridge, Brooklyn and currently resides in Manhattan, he graduated from Manhattan School of Music with a BM in Classical Voice. Patrick was nominated for an Arty Award for Best Supporting Actor for his portrayal of Biff Loman in Death of a Salesman. You can catch him in Courtni’s other series Prospect Park. Earlier this year, Patrick was asked to be a series regular on the webseries Mafia War Chronicles. Off Broadway: God and My Gay Ass (God), Stone Soup, the Musical (Soldier 1) and A Christmas Carol (Fred/Mr. Fezziwig/John) Regional: She Hates Coffee (Tony), Les Miserable (Joly/Pimp/Convict 3), which was a special engagement with members of the Broadway cast and Nat’l Tour Cast, Into the Woods (Cinderella’s Prince), Dead Man Walking (Guard 2/Anthony DeRocher), Smokey Joe’s Café (Victor) and Crazy for You (Mingo). TV/Film: SNL, Bum Rush the Series, Stuck on Single, Dominican York and the Award Winning Dramedy #LoveMyRoomie. You can also find him filming sketches on the streets of NYC with IdrissTV. In January, Patrick will begin rehearsals for the new musical Circle of Eyes which will premiere at the New York Theater Festival in February. When he isn’t Acting, he can be found singing country tunes with his guitar. His music can be found on Spotify and iTunes under the name Pat Michaels. Phil 4:13 patrickbrancato.com

ALPHONSO WALKER JR.as David

An American equity actor for the stage, television and film, a Buffalo native - currently residing in New York City. His latest stage credits include NATIVE SON, producing and starring in DUTCHMAN by Amiri Baraka, The MAAFA Suite: A Healing Journey, The EXONERATED, and WATER, a play telling the multi-generational story of water and its tumultuous relationship within the African American community. Alphonso starred in Buffalo Niagara’s Film Festival award winning feature length “The Glass Floor”. He can be found on Instagram at: AWALKERJR

Duke Williams as Trevor

Born and raised on Long Island he attended Buffalo State University where he received a Bachelors in Economics & Finance with a minor in Theater Arts.
Duke trains at The Acting Studio New York. Some of his theatre credits include: Romeo & Juliet (Romeo), The Brothers Size (Elegba) & The Dumb Waiter (Ben).
Some of his film credits include: The Dirty Kind (Raymond Caine), Santa Maria (Emmet), and Pillow Talk (Marcus).

Jonathan Tyler Peck as Dean

A  New York-based actor and a graduate from the William Esper Studio class of 2017. He’s produced 3 theater productions within the last year always striving to create meaningful content for the artistic community. Before attending Willam Esper, he attended SUNY University at Albany; attaining his BFA in Philosophy and Theatre. Previous theater credits are Orpheus in Eurydice, Pool boy in Legally Blonde the Musical, Otto in the musical Spring Awakening, Tolbert Lee in an original play, An American Tree, Val Johnson in Split Second, and most recently, Kent in Reasons to be Pretty . He co-founded his film production company Para Noir Pictures LLC.

 

Your donation is appreciated and we thank you in advance for giving. If you're not able to donate financially, we can still really use your help! Please TELL YOUR FRIENDS about this series! Post, update, email and share this campaign with as many people as you're willing. You never know who might be in the position to help bring this story to life!. Indiegogo has some awesome sharing tools at the top of this page, and you can subscribe to our social media platforms Instagram: @GURLZCOMEDYSERIES, and Facebook: GURLZ COMEDY SERIES , and repost to all of your friends!

The more shares, likes, and tweets, the higher our Indiegogo "gogofactor" increases, leading to global exposure and even mentions in the press!

Money can be powerful- but so can word of mouth!

story:
Mimsy and Dusty

2D Animated Series

 

Hello everyone, and thank you for checking out our "Mimsy and Dusty" campaign.

My name is Brian Finlay and I am the founder of "Finlay Studios", I am also the creator of "Mimsy and Dusty".

We are asking for a lot, animation is expensive. Most 22 min series shows cost roughly $500,000 per episode, some a lot more and some for less. We will be producing 65 mins of animation for a fraction of what a full season budget would be for other animated shows. This will be thanks to carefully designing each episode to be cost effective allowing us to pull off this feat while paying our artists fair wages with fair quota's! Mimsy and Dusty will be easily accessible online through our YouTube channel and other online platforms. Anyone with access to the internet will be able to follow along with Mimsy and Dusty's adventures!

My experience involves creating or directing animation content for film, games, TV and mobile entertainment. I was fortunate to work for Disney Interactive on their marketing team from 2011 to 2014. My role was as an animator, story artist and I even got to direct TVC spots! It was here where I learned that the impossible dream can become a very rich and fulfilling reality, you just have to go for it!

The "Mimsy and Dusty" property is about combining learning, laughing and fun! Using song and dance, these short animated episodes will help deliver fundamental lessons to the pre-school demographic. Lessons like the ABC's and 123"s, the importance of sharing, exploring the wonders of the world around you in a safe way!! My wife and I have a large family and very curious kids. I use their curiosity and amazing questions as my inspiration. 

 

The Narrator!

Mimsy and Dusty are guided through their adventures with the friendly encouragement of the narrator, played by John Frank! 

John started his performance career in 1960 at aged seven, singing “White Christmas” on the Montreal-based radio show, Call Me Uncle. After moving to the Maritimes in his teens, John became involved in the music and theatre scene there on radio, TV and in the recording studio. Recent musical theatre performances include featured roles in The Addams Family (Uncle Fester), Annie (“Daddy” Warbucks), and Jesus Christ Superstar (Pilate). John was a member of the twice ECMA-nominated concert performing group Kids at Heart, with whom he traveled throughout the Maritime provinces and recorded four CD’s. He has performed as vocalist in various bands, showing an eclectic range of styles, from jazz to folk to pop to swing. He has also provided back-up vocals on a few indie recordings.

He is currently working in the comedy-music theatre troupe, the Water Street Dinner Theatre, with whom he started in 2003. John remains amazed that all this was done while raising a family of four, and working for 25 years as an educator in the New Brunswick school system. Besides his involvement with the WSDT, John’s most recent and exciting project is providing voice talent for Finlay Studios Inc., a collaboration that combines his background in education as a teacher and as an administrator, with acting and music.

Your support will mean a full time focus to complete season 001 and get it out to the kids sooner than if it is worked on in as funds are available. And we will offer some very fun things along the way, exclusive to only you as a supporter!

 

​What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $280,000 to fund 26 x 2.5 min animated episodes of Mimsy and Dusty.

After reward costs this will be used to finance animators/artists, music and sound, voice recording etc. Our top tier supporters will receive a co-producer credit and have access to Mimsy and Dusty production updates and invite only webinars which will provide complete transparency on where we are in the production! The daily book keeping will be managed and monitored by a third party accounting firm.

Should we only receive partial funding we will produce the amount of episodes that the amount raised will allow for and use that momentum to complete a second round of fundraising. If we are fortunate enough to raise well beyond our initial goal we will use the extra funding for marketing and or season 002 pre-production.

 

The Rewards?

$10 Amazing Supporter Level

- Downloadable and printable "Mimsy and Dusty" coloring book.

- Access to supporter blog which will chronicle the production process of season 001, updated   weekly!

 

$50 Super Amazing Supporter Level

- Downloadable and printable "Mimsy and Dusty" coloring book.

- Access to supporter blog which will chronicle the production process of season 001, updated   weekly.

- Limited edition colored poster of Mimsy and Dusty!

 

$100 Super Duper Supporter Level


- Downloadable and printable coloring book
- Access to supporters blog which chronicles the production process of Season 001 of Mimsy   and Dusty, updated weekly.
- Exclusive limited edition color poster of "Mimsy and Dusty" 
- Toddler sized Mimsy and Dusty t-shirt

 

$500 Epic Supporter Level

- Downloadable and printable coloring book
- Access to supporters blog which chronicles the production process of Season 001 of Mimsy        and Dusty, updated weekly.
- Exclusive limited edition color poster of "Mimsy and Dusty" 

-  Toddler sized Mimsy and Dusty t-shirt
- Mimsy and Dusty stuffed toys (one of each character)

 

Physical rewards will be distributed after the campaign ends.

 

Our Dream

Watching our children soaking up the content provided on YouTube is like watching ourselves glued to the television for Saturday morning cartoons when we were little. These same Saturday morning cartoons were what inspired my career in animation. My children over the years have often asked me "Daddy, why don't you make your own cartoon?". Today's methods of distribution such as YouTube has opened the door to be able to pursue that for my children and myself much more easily than in years past.

My career world is changing into a very family oriented business. Our whole family acts as sounding boards, contributors and artists. Taking time to work for clients is great and certainly pays the bills but being able to create and produce a property that our whole family has helped dream up is uniquely fulfilling and creates a better impact and legacy for our family.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

These days every single dollar counts and as a business owner and a family man I completely appreciate that. If financial support is not for you, we hope you will share our campaign with your social network.  Helping to spread the word is just as valuable and appreciated!

Please visit http://www.mimsyanddusty.com and http://www.finlaystudios.com to see all the creativity in the works!

And Thank You!

 

If you have backed and have questions about your rewards or questions about the over all campaign please email Kris Ann at mimsyanddusty@gmail.com
story_txt:
Mimsy and Dusty
2D Animated Series

 
Hello everyone, and thank you for checking out our "Mimsy and Dusty" campaign.
My name is Brian Finlay and I am the founder of "Finlay Studios", I am also the creator of "Mimsy and Dusty".

We are asking for a lot, animation is expensive. Most 22 min series shows cost roughly $500,000 per episode, some a lot more and some for less. We will be producing 65 mins of animation for a fraction of what a full season budget would be for other animated shows. This will be thanks to carefully designing each episode to be cost effective allowing us to pull off this feat while paying our artists fair wages with fair quota's! Mimsy and Dusty will be easily accessible online through our YouTube channel and other online platforms. Anyone with access to the internet will be able to follow along with Mimsy and Dusty's adventures!
My experience involves creating or directing animation content for film, games, TV and mobile entertainment. I was fortunate to work for Disney Interactive on their marketing team from 2011 to 2014. My role was as an animator, story artist and I even got to direct TVC spots! It was here where I learned that the impossible dream can become a very rich and fulfilling reality, you just have to go for it!
The "Mimsy and Dusty" property is about combining learning, laughing and fun! Using song and dance, these short animated episodes will help deliver fundamental lessons to the pre-school demographic. Lessons like the ABC's and 123"s, the importance of sharing, exploring the wonders of the world around you in a safe way!! My wife and I have a large family and very curious kids. I use their curiosity and amazing questions as my inspiration. 
 
The Narrator!
Mimsy and Dusty are guided through their adventures with the friendly encouragement of the narrator, played by John Frank! 

John started his performance career in 1960 at aged seven, singing “White Christmas” on the Montreal-based radio show, Call Me Uncle. After moving to the Maritimes in his teens, John became involved in the music and theatre scene there on radio, TV and in the recording studio. Recent musical theatre performances include featured roles in The Addams Family (Uncle Fester), Annie (“Daddy” Warbucks), and Jesus Christ Superstar (Pilate). John was a member of the twice ECMA-nominated concert performing group Kids at Heart, with whom he traveled throughout the Maritime provinces and recorded four CD’s. He has performed as vocalist in various bands, showing an eclectic range of styles, from jazz to folk to pop to swing. He has also provided back-up vocals on a few indie recordings.
He is currently working in the comedy-music theatre troupe, the Water Street Dinner Theatre, with whom he started in 2003. John remains amazed that all this was done while raising a family of four, and working for 25 years as an educator in the New Brunswick school system. Besides his involvement with the WSDT, John’s most recent and exciting project is providing voice talent for Finlay Studios Inc., a collaboration that combines his background in education as a teacher and as an administrator, with acting and music.
Your support will mean a full time focus to complete season 001 and get it out to the kids sooner than if it is worked on in as funds are available. And we will offer some very fun things along the way, exclusive to only you as a supporter!
 
​What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $280,000 to fund 26 x 2.5 min animated episodes of Mimsy and Dusty.
After reward costs this will be used to finance animators/artists, music and sound, voice recording etc. Our top tier supporters will receive a co-producer credit and have access to Mimsy and Dusty production updates and invite only webinars which will provide complete transparency on where we are in the production! The daily book keeping will be managed and monitored by a third party accounting firm.
Should we only receive partial funding we will produce the amount of episodes that the amount raised will allow for and use that momentum to complete a second round of fundraising. If we are fortunate enough to raise well beyond our initial goal we will use the extra funding for marketing and or season 002 pre-production.
 
The Rewards?
$10 Amazing Supporter Level
- Downloadable and printable "Mimsy and Dusty" coloring book.
- Access to supporter blog which will chronicle the production process of season 001, updated   weekly!
 
$50 Super Amazing Supporter Level
- Downloadable and printable "Mimsy and Dusty" coloring book.
- Access to supporter blog which will chronicle the production process of season 001, updated   weekly.
- Limited edition colored poster of Mimsy and Dusty!
 
$100 Super Duper Supporter Level
- Downloadable and printable coloring book- Access to supporters blog which chronicles the production process of Season 001 of Mimsy   and Dusty, updated weekly.- Exclusive limited edition color poster of "Mimsy and Dusty" - Toddler sized Mimsy and Dusty t-shirt
 
$500 Epic Supporter Level
- Downloadable and printable coloring book- Access to supporters blog which chronicles the production process of Season 001 of Mimsy        and Dusty, updated weekly.- Exclusive limited edition color poster of "Mimsy and Dusty" 
-  Toddler sized Mimsy and Dusty t-shirt- Mimsy and Dusty stuffed toys (one of each character)
 
Physical rewards will be distributed after the campaign ends.
 

Our Dream
Watching our children soaking up the content provided on YouTube is like watching ourselves glued to the television for Saturday morning cartoons when we were little. These same Saturday morning cartoons were what inspired my career in animation. My children over the years have often asked me "Daddy, why don't you make your own cartoon?". Today's methods of distribution such as YouTube has opened the door to be able to pursue that for my children and myself much more easily than in years past.
My career world is changing into a very family oriented business. Our whole family acts as sounding boards, contributors and artists. Taking time to work for clients is great and certainly pays the bills but being able to create and produce a property that our whole family has helped dream up is uniquely fulfilling and creates a better impact and legacy for our family.

 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
These days every single dollar counts and as a business owner and a family man I completely appreciate that. If financial support is not for you, we hope you will share our campaign with your social network.  Helping to spread the word is just as valuable and appreciated!
Please visit http://www.mimsyanddusty.com and http://www.finlaystudios.com to see all the creativity in the works!
And Thank You!
 
If you have backed and have questions about your rewards or questions about the over all campaign please email Kris Ann at mimsyanddusty@gmail.com

story:
The big difference is that Manna Street will not promote a Liberal Agenda of Secular Humanism and Atheism.  Manna Street will, on the other hand, teach Christian and Biblical principals based on the New and Old Testament and most importantly the words of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.

 

The Money we raise here will be used to acquire several custom puppets, better film equipment and post production software so we can produce a broadcast quality “Pilot Episode” which will be for sale and used as a marketing tool to raise funds for more episodes. 

 

 

In conjunction with being available for purchase online, we will seek commercial retail outlets that would be willing to sell DVD’s of Manna Street.

Manna Street will develop original characters and music that will inspire children spiritually as well as teach them the “Be Attitudes” and how to live their lives with intention according to Christian Values. 

Presently Manna Street is working on very limited resources.  Hopefully this will change as more people get involved.

 

Manna Street Creator's Testimony...

Former U.S. Army SGT Stephen Crowley, Member of Veterans in Film and Television (VFT)

Stephen J. Crowley was born in 1963, the son of Edward J. Crowley Jr. V.P. of Marketing for the American Pamcor Company (NYSE: AMP). Tragically, Edward Crowley died in 1969 in a boating accident on the Delaware Canal during a summer vacation on the family boat, the Cindy Lou, a 31 foot Chris Craft.

 

Then in 1977, Stephen's Mother, Jo Ann Crowley died in a single-engine plane crash along with her fiancee, Dr. William Davis.

One year later, Stephen was sent away to an all boys Episcopal boarding school just outside of Asheville, North Carolina.  At seventeen years old Stephen Accepted Jesus Christ as his Personal Savior.



After leaving boarding school in 1982, Stephen held an assortment of occupations from Beach Club Attendant to Ski-Lift Operator. In 1986 Stephen enlisted in the US Army as an Armor Crewman where he served in the 2nd Armored Division, "Hell on Wheels" in Texas and then the 3rd Armored Division "Spearhead" in Germany. He also served a rotation with the illustrious "Black Horse", 11th Armored Cavalry Division on the border where the Free World met the Iron Curtain! Stephen was also there when the Berlin Wall fell.


In a ten-year break between Service to his Country, Stephen moved to Hollywood, CA, where he worked as an IATSE Scenic Artist for Walt Disney Imagineering, ABC Studios and NBC. After September 11th, 2001, Stephen re-enlisted in the US Army, California Army National Guard and re-classed as a Parachute Rigger.
 
In a twenty-five year span, Stephen reached the rank of Sergeant and accumulated sixteen years of Time and Service, Including one tour in Iraq, where he was awarded a Combat Action Badge for being engaged by hostile fire. He has an 80% Disability Rating from the VA, mostly for PTSD. Upon his discharge from service, Stephen studied Screen Writing and Film Production on the GI-BILL, at Scottsdale Community College, in Scottsdale, Arizona, where he won 3rd place in the Maricopa County Creative Writing Competition’s Non-Fiction Essay Category.

Stephen presently resides in Phoenix with his lovely Fiancee, Carol (and three cats). They both attend Impact Church, an AWESOME Christian Church in Scottsdale AZ!


Stephen is presently living on his Service Connected Disability and although he struggles with PTSD he stays busy working on his ideas and screenplays

story:
What is 'us on the road'?

"Hey Maritza, where are we?"
"I don't know, Ang, but it's really, really great here."
Hi y'all! We’re ’us on the road’ and we have just one question for you. Don't worry, it's easy!

After living and traveling overseas we returned to the US to explore what makes America great.

Our vision for this project started when we reconnected at our friend's wedding in Ojai, California. It was right after the presidential elections and we felt an overwhelming desire to explore the country asking the people what they think is great about America. What we discovered captures the magical and often hilarious moments that happen on the road. We've spent months on this project dreaming about creating something meaningful. Now it's our time to do something about it!

 

Who is 'us on the road'?

Maritza Exarchos is an actress, singer, and artist from the San Francisco Bay Area who'd been living in Greece for the past 6 years during one of the worst financial and immigration crises. She experienced first-hand the beauty of a country coming together during critical times. She came back to LA for creative reasons when she met up with Angie.

Angie Daily is a natural adventurer with a deep curiosity about what makes the world turn. She's studied photography, video production, new media. She's worked in film marketing for a decade. She's lived in Seattle, New York, Los Angeles. And while she spent the last year traveling... she's just getting started.​ 

 

'us on the road' & YOU

We've got travel expenses covered but need support with production and equipment costs. We truly believe in the potential of this project. We know how important this conversation is that we're putting everything on it. And truth is, at this point we can't see ourselves doing anything else. We'd love for you to join us on the journey!

 

Why We're Doing It

This past winter we took our first road trip across the southern United States gathering hours of footage and speaking with numerous people. We quickly realized how universal this topic is and how many people want to engage with each other. Our journey is about both the external exchanges with the people and the internal process of navigating our own lives as working artists.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

No cash to share? No worries!

You can still help by spreading the word:

  • Tweet our Indiegogo link
  • Share on Instagram, Facebook from our Indiegogo page
  • Private message or email a friend from our Indiegogo page

Follow us on Facebook & Instagram! Go to our website for updates. Have questions? Ask us here.

However you can help, we're so grateful!! THANK YOU!

- Angie & Maritza

story:
Detox is a dark comedy digital series about a group of friends whose lives are spinning out of control. Harmony has a million followers online, but her life is a straight up mess. Becca thinks motherhood is her calling, but her uterus just doesn't agree. Delia's positive she's has the formula for the perfect relationship, but the dude isn't calling her back. What's a girl to do when she's not the one in control? Go on a cleanse, of course!

 

We've noticed that GOOPY ideas about health and beauty make the answer to all your problems sound simple.

Not happy with your life? Purge some toxins with a cleanse!

From blogs to billboards, we're being told that quick, easy fixes to our environment or behavior can yield dramatic life-changing results.

Feeling depressed & heavy ? Time to cut out gluten!

Body detoxes and juice cleanses, backed by the glamour of celebrity endorsements, grant us the illusion of control over our lives. 

I drank only juice for 3 days straight and I’VE NEVER FELT BETTER. 

But real life doesn’t work that way...

Real life is messy. And complicated. And sometimes even toxic. (What's a toxin? We don't know for sure. But we know it's bad.) Real life includes eating solid food and making mistakes and apologizing when we've been an asshole (sorry, Mom!)

We've noticed that our idea of detoxing in various forms from juice cleanses to cleaning out our closets is serving a larger purpose than losing weight or having less junk--we've been using it as spiritual purification. Simplify. Cleanse. Start Over. 

Like most people, Harmony, Becca, and Delia are the hardest on themselves. Living up to these unattainable ideas of health, beauty, and an instagram-worthy life is an immense amount of pressure. They're bound to crack at some point...

This is the story of DETOX.

 

When we first set out to create this project, our prompt was for each of us to write and develop a character that we'd never had the opportunity to play.

We realized that most of the female characters we've played have had to be "likeable."

That got us thinking: some of our favorite male characters (Tony Soprano, Jesse Pinkman, Don Draper) are grotesque and unlikeable, yet given a lot of leeway to be the flawed complicated characters we love to see.

Why can't female characters be the same way? So we created three women who are a bit offensive and gross, but dynamic, fascinating, bold, and heart-breakingly human. We're telling stories that speak deeply to us as individuals, and hopefully our audience will feel the same.

Harmony

Harmony is on day three of her juice cleanse, sharing the positive results she’s experienced thus far on her YouTube channel. In a flash of Instagram photography, we see what Harmony’s hard-partying reckless life has really involved: dancing on bars, snorting coke in bathrooms, brunching with friends, and passing out at strangers’ houses. Despite not being a writer, she’s landed a book deal based on her growing YouTube subscriber base. She clearly has no idea how to begin writing a book, much less complete one. On a bad day, Harmony is a low-functioning, wanna-be celebrity with a serious drinking problem. On a good day, she’s a fucking riot. Harmony, while being a complete and total mess, brightens up any room she enters with her energy and amazing sense of humor.

 

Becca: Betsy Lippitt

Harmony’s perfectionist sister-in-law, Becca, has always done everything right. Everything she’s wanted, she’s gotten on her timeline: acceptance to a top law school, a great job, a loving marriage. Next up on her timeline is a baby, but she can’t seem to bring a pregnancy to term. Becca avoids expressing her pain to her sister Delia, husband Wes, and even to herself. She opts to distract herself with the master cleanse - a subconscious revenge on her body for its failure to perform. With her sarcastic, dry wit, Becca is often the voice of reason for others, but rarely for herself.

 

Delia: Annie Howard

After completing forty days and nights of celibacy, Delia has manipulated a master plan to get a man to commit to her. She finds solace in positive affirmations, determined to change her mind in order to change her life. But she still can’t get the men she desires to commit to her, to escape men she knows are no good for her, or get the support she wants from her sister, Becca. While Delia is never satisfied with her own life, she's the number one champion of the people she loves.

 

Hi!! We're ​Annie & Betsy - childhood friends, writing partners, and twin souls (according to a local psychic!)

​From the time we were small, we've been fascinated by creating stories together. Our most notable childhood oeuvre was created using the Windows 1995 program 3D Movie Maker. We also loved making DIY spa treatments that grossed everyone out:

We've been kicking around Hollywood the last couple of years, writing projects, acting on tv and workin' day jobs for the man.

We bring the same creative liberation to our collaboration together as filmmakers, writers and actors, as only people who created together as children can.

DETOX is a female-driven narrative that is raw, vulnerable, funny, touching and most importantly, completely relatable. It's vital for us as women writers to continue creating content that is not singularly for women, but for everyone.

By contributing to our campaign you'll be casting your vote for us and for the kind of content that you want to see. With all the WTF?! going on in the world right now, we're pumped with the democracy of crowdfunding. We're looking to you as our collaborators, cheerleaders, and peers. 

 

GOAL: 25K for 3 TEN-MINUTE EPISODES

We have a team of talented, dedicated producers who have helped us to craft a budget that is practical and feasible. We're raising $25,000 to be able to pay for all the equipment rentals, locations, cast & crew members, and production costs. Our snazzy pie chart breaks it all down for you:

The real truth is: making a web series is EXPEN$IVE. As you can see from the chart, the major costs we're facing are paying our crew a fair wage, post-production expenses, & renting equipment.  We personally are forgoing our salaries in service of the bottom line. This is our passion project.

Your contribution, regardless of the amount, will be stretched down to the dime. We've got our eagle-eyed producers slashing the budget left and right. Like the hardy New Englanders we are, we'll "Waste Not, Want Not" while riding backwards in our banana yellow 1986 Volvo station wagon. 

Once we reach our goal of $25,000, we'll start production!

 

We decided when we began this project that we would create DETOX by any means necessary, so we're gonna scrimp and save and push to make DETOX a reality. To make that happen, we just need the funds hahahahah blah blah blah blha

Whoa. We just had a moment there. It's vulnerable to be sharing this with you.

The real challenge that we're facing is making this happen! That doesn't mean we don't know what we're doing. Annie has professionally produced dozens of digital videos and Betsy has loads of on-set experience. We're confident in our ability to just "shoot the damn thing."

Plus, we have the creative involvement of some brilliant and talented friends...

Director: Anna Jones

 

Wes: Wade Allain-Marcus of HBO's Insecure

 

Mateo: Raúl S. Juliá​

 

Doctor Hayashi: Sachiyo K

 

Yoga Girl: Lauren Blumenfeld

 

Director of Photography: Stas Bondarenko

 

Music by: Benjamin Juliá​

With a team like this behind us, we're confident that DETOX is gonna pull through.

 

Even $5 goes a long way to contributing to our goal, but if you can't participate financially, you can still help us create!

Live in LA and have equipment or a service to donate? We'll take it! We are reaching out to our community to make this project happen. Have a little cousin who wants film experience and would like to PA? Let us know!

Another way you can help? Share us on your social meeds, plz. Get the word out to your own friends and family about DETOX using the Indiegogo share tools up & to the right. 

Thanks for doing what you can to make art happen!
