We have a team of talented, dedicated producers who have helped us to craft a budget that is practical and feasible. We're raising $25,000 to be able to pay for all the equipment rentals, locations, cast & crew members, and production costs. Our snazzy pie chart breaks it all down for you:

The real truth is: making a web series is EXPEN$IVE. As you can see from the chart, the major costs we're facing are paying our crew a fair wage, post-production expenses, & renting equipment.  We personally are forgoing our salaries in service of the bottom line. This is our passion project.
Your contribution, regardless of the amount, will be stretched down to the dime. We've got our eagle-eyed producers slashing the budget left and right. Like the hardy New Englanders we are, we'll "Waste Not, Want Not" while riding backwards in our banana yellow 1986 Volvo station wagon. 
Once we reach our goal of $25,000, we'll start production!
 


We decided when we began this project that we would create DETOX by any means necessary, so we're gonna scrimp and save and push to make DETOX a reality. To make that happen, we just need the funds hahahahah blah blah blah blha
Whoa. We just had a moment there. It's vulnerable to be sharing this with you.
The real challenge that we're facing is making this happen! That doesn't mean we don't know what we're doing. Annie has professionally produced dozens of digital videos and Betsy has loads of on-set experience. We're confident in our ability to just "shoot the damn thing."
Plus, we have the creative involvement of some brilliant and talented friends...
Director: Anna Jones


 
Wes: Wade Allain-Marcus of HBO's Insecure


 
Mateo: Raúl S. Juliá​


 
Doctor Hayashi: Sachiyo K


 
Yoga Girl: Lauren Blumenfeld


 
Director of Photography: Stas Bondarenko


 
Music by: Benjamin Juliá​


With a team like this behind us, we're confident that DETOX is gonna pull through.
 


Even $5 goes a long way to contributing to our goal, but if you can't participate financially, you can still help us create!
Live in LA and have equipment or a service to donate? We'll take it! We are reaching out to our community to make this project happen. Have a little cousin who wants film experience and would like to PA? Let us know!
Another way you can help? Share us on your social meeds, plz. Get the word out to your own friends and family about DETOX using the Indiegogo share tools up & to the right. 
Thanks for doing what you can to make art happen!

story:
Short Summary:

My name is Kimberly Smith and I am the creator of Heaven’s Adventures. I love the ability to craft a story that inspires my audience to: see, hear, touch, taste and feel God’s love.  

Heaven’s Adventures is a ‘God idea’ that came to me back in 2007, while attending a church service in Arizona. The purpose of the show is to teach young people to be bold about their faith that inspires them to be leaders.

Cartoons are an effective way to grab the attention of children. Our story lines are carefully crafted that engage and inspire action. My team of animators, voice-over talent and others are confident that we will inspire the next generation of young people to reach their God given destinies.

Our mission is to create tomorrow’s leaders. Your contribution will help us accomplish this mission.

 

What We Need & What You Get:

Plot: Heaven finds herself in the depths of despair as she is forced to make a decision with life altering consequences. It’s swashbuckling fun for all!

To create this episode and to move the project along in its entirety – We are hoping to raise no less than $30,180

For animation, there is a standard estimation rate of $1000 per minute. This includes: Director, writer(s), voice-over talent, sound designer, character designer(s), rigging artist and the other key people for the animation piece to come together.

 

Therefore, the following budget is listed:

Pilot episode -                                   $11,000

Outstanding balance -                    $2550 (animators, composer, editors, & miscellaneous expenses)

Marketing campaign -                    $8000

Business & Legal fees –                 $2000 - (Business Start-up expenses, Website and other)

Focus Group/Test market -         $1500 (supplies/ food/ door prizes)

Product creation-                             $2500 (T-shirts; CD’s; posters, adventure pack, DVD's)

Administrative/Studio fees -       $1630

Miscellaneous expenses -            $1000

Total expenses:                                $30,180

 

Support this project: (Of course, no donation is too small, so THANK YOU!!!!)

A pledge of $5 or more – A digital THANK YOU!!!

A pledge of $25 or more – My team and I will pray for any specific needs you may have, in addition, you will get a digital THANK YOU!!!

A pledge of $50 or more – You will get an autographed poster of the logo for Heaven’s Adventures; Prayer and a digital THANK YOU!!!

A pledge of $100 or more -  A CD of inspirational scriptures read by Kylie Phillips, the voice behind Heaven. Hearing and quoting the Word has never been more exciting than hearing it from Heaven’s voice. Your youngsters will be encouraged to quote the Word alongside Heaven to build up their faith.

Prayer and a digital THANK YOU!!!

A pledge of $300 or more – An Adventure Pack that includes: an 8 week activity journal complete with games and activities; the CD, a T-shirt, prayer and a digital THANK YOU!!!

A pledge of $500 or more – All the of the above along with a DVD copy of episode one: Where’s Your Treasure?

Your contribution will go towards the items listed on the budget sheet. If we don’t raise all of our funding – we will revise until we are able to make it happen – But this work is going forward!

The Impact – A global message

There is an overwhelming response and anticipation for this project! Especially when shared among parents with school age children. “When, when, when, when”….they all ask.

As a project leader, my formal training includes orchestrating regional conferences, as well as orchestrating my own theatrical productions just to name a few. To further my creative insight and filmmaking skill sets – I have attended several courses held at the Austin School of Film – including Screenwriting and Pre-production management. In addition, I forge relationships with talented people with skill sets beyond my ability that can help me bring about the best product. I operate in fairness and honestly which is why my people trust me as a leader.

Risks and Challenges

People who know me know that:  a) I’m a risk taken and b) I don’t give up easily. In fact, when I encounter obstacles, I work tirelessly to find ways around those obstacles until I am able to complete the task at hand.

 Experience has taught me to seek out people who are passionate about they do and then allow them the space and means to do what they do best. Yet at the same time – set a precedence for high quality work and watch them deliver.

The project was finally birthed in July 2016, as I started meeting various animators. By September, I had various composites done, along with Heaven, her best friend Carlos and several of the other characters for episode one. I also had the theme song completed, but the project has been stalled since October of 2016 until February 2017. Without these characters moving and talking – I have been unable to successfully raise the needed capital to move the project along.

Early February, my team and I held a Table Read and conducted a Video Shoot to capture the sound needed for the animators to draw out the sketches, as well as the video shoot so people can associate a name with a face. These events were needed to help forge the project ahead. We are close to having an animatic trailer of episode one.

Other Ways You Can Help:

There are several things you can do to assist in this work –

If you are not able to contribute financially towards any of the pledge amounts listed – then ask your social network to help us get the word out by sharing it on your page and then liking us. Please use the Indiegogo share tools so that it can go to as many people as possible.

Thank you for your time and assistance!

story:
We’re a husband and wife team grateful for the opportunity to work with an extremely talented and devoted cast and crew drawn exclusively from the DC/MD/VA market.    With two episodes already "in the can" as they say, we plan to begin shooting the rest of the season by late August or early September.   Each episode will explore Adam’s hilarious struggles as he returns to the Baltimore acting scene after twenty-five years away.   But it's not just his story.  As the season progresses you'll meet other characters whose complex, damaged and, in some cases, desperate lives intertwine  with Adam's in a fully realized story arc that, hopefully, will have you anxiously anticipating the release of season two.  In the nearly three decades since Adam left for New York, Baltimore theater has evolved from a handful of small theaters producing revivals of popular works to a vibrant, eclectic community filled with acting companies producing original work written and performed by extremely gifted artists.  One of our goals is to showcase our much- maligned city as a place where dynamic theater thrives.

 

 

         

Marc's been a comedian, actor, writer and filmmaker for over 25 years.  His credits include several appearances on Comedy Central, guest starring roles on the HBO hit comedy "Veep", NBC "Friends" and tons of stage and short film work.  Over his long tenure he's been blessed to work with many notable actors including Emmy winner Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Academy Award nominee John Hawkes, Emmy nominee Paul Dooley and Pulitzer Prize winning playwright Stephen Adly Guirgis.

 

A former star athlete at the University of Tennessee, Nikki has quickly moved up the ranks to become a much sought after actor in the DMV region as well as nationally. Her credits include NBC's  "Law and Order- Special Unit" and the hit Netflix series "House of Cards".

Matthew was a cast member of the Off Broadway hit "Awesome 80s Prom" and an original member of the Md. company.  His many film and television credits include "Veep", "House of Cards", "The Night Watchmen" and "One Penny." As a writer, he received an Emmy for Best Educational Short. 

Sasha's a seasoned stage actress and has appeared in several films including "Worth", "Forfeit of Grace", "Mr. Hopewell's Remedy" and the soon to be released "Prodigal". 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Bart's work includes several Shakespeare productions as well as the National Geographic Channel's "Killing Kennedy" and "The World Wars" on the History Channel.

 

We hope that after you watch the trailer you'll see that the work we've done so far- even given the limitations of low budget, guerilla filmmaking- is of high quality.  We're operating under a SAG new media agreement so we have access to some really talented actors and the crew is made up of incredibly passionate and hard working people who have been working mostly for pizza.  We'd like to do a full 8 to 10 episode season and could really use your help to get there.  Our hope is to sell the series to an online platform like Netflix or Amazon Prime but if what we end up with is a really cool series that people like you enjoy, share and get excited for the next episode then we know we've done our job. 

WHERE WILL  YOUR MONEY GO?

The $16,000 figure we've come up with is based on what we've learned from the first two episodes as well as other projects we've worked on over the years.  Yes, filmmaking (or technically, digital filmmaking) has gotten much less expensive in the last few years but still there are costs that can't be avoided and each episode costs a minimum of $2000 to make but the more we can raise, the better!   As creators, we'll take ZERO money and every penny we raise will go directly into making THESPIAN season one the best it can possibly be.   We didn't want to bore you with some arbitrary pie chart thing but here's EXACTLY where your contribution will go:

EQUIPMENT RENTAL.... Luckily, we have great friends who have contributed not only their time but the really expensive equipment they own. However, sometimes we need to rent things like a shot gun mic, or the right camera for night shoots or an extra lavalier.  The more we raise, the better quality gear we can use to make the series really look and sound great!

LOCATIONS... Again, we've been fortunate to have the support of friends and family who own a bar or the bookstore we used to shoot the acting class scene in the second episode (thanks Normals Bookstore!) but as we move through the season we're sure someone's gonna want a few bucks to let us use their space.

FOOD... Probably should've put this one first as it's SO FREAKIN' IMPORTANT!  Our amazing cast and crew work for little or no money but they definitely don't want to starve on set. We've been eating mostly pizzas thus far and that's okay but it would be nice to be able to reward everyone after a tough day of shooting with something besides Dominos or Papa Johns. We don't need lobsters but we just want to make sure everyone has enough snacks and at least one meal for every shoot day.  A happy crew is a productive crew!

POST PRODUCTION SOUND WORK... While Maria and I do all the editing, titles and color grading, neither one of us can do post sound mix work.  That requires someone who really has the expertise and the ear to make everything sound great.   We know some incredible sound people but it takes many hours to get it right and we want to be able to throw a few bucks their way for the effort.

CREW and CAST PAYROLL... All the actors have agreed to work for deferred pay, meaning they make money if the project does.  And they're cool with that because as actors we really just want to work and if we believe in the project and the potential rewards, we're happy to climb aboard.  Still, some of the actors come from pretty far away and we'd like to be able to offer some travel money under certain situations.  As for crew, they do the HARD WORK. Actors wait, then someone calls "action" and they talk (okay, it's tougher than that but you get the point) while the crew arrives on set way before the actors, work non stop and then break down and load out afterwards.  It's grueling.  They do it because they love it but they definitely deserve something for the back breaking hours they put in.  Your contribution will help us attract the best camera operators, sound recordists, makeup artists, gaffers, etc that Baltimore and the surrounding areas have to offer.

MARKETING- Hey, if we sell it to Netflix or Amazon Prime or Hulu or even Bob's COOL NEW STREAMING SITE, we may not need to worry about this but odds are, we're going to have spend money getting the word out that we exist.  The cost of a website, marketing materials, festival submission fees, traveling to meetings all fall under this category and we're gonna need it.

 

Even if you're not able to make a financial contribution there are still many ways you can help!  Let your family and friends know about the project and send them this campaign using the Indiegogo share option.  Post it on Facebook, Twitter and anywhere else you can think of.  Or if you have access to an interesting, unique location maybe it's a place we can shoot.  Or maybe you just want to work as a production assistant on the project.  Whatever help you can offer would be immensely appreciated. 

 

 

You worked your way through a lot to get here and we just want to say thanks so much for taking the time to look over our project.  We can't tell you that Thespian is going to be bought by Netflix and we're gonna become huge players in the industry with offers flying in from everywhere and you get to say "hey, I helped launch their careers!" Wish we could but can't.   We can tell you this though-  Thespian is being developed and shot by a group of passionate, experienced, extremely talented and driven artists and when we release the episodes we KNOW you'll be entertained and looking forward to season two...

story:
Our New York based production company is developing Psychosis, a 12 episode web-series (25 minutes each) to be shot in New York City.

Psychosis is a psychological thriller that plays on our perception of reality.  Eight diverse characters see their storylines intertwine through a series of twists and turns. In the end, they may be forced to question their own identities.

Each character has made a life choice that put them at odds with their family or community. They have to confront bias against sexual orientation, race, gender identification, or social backgrounds. When a providential inventor presents a time altering opportunity, will they choose to take it… and will it come at a price?

New York is a competitive city where people come from all over the world to find out what they’re made of and fulfill their dreams. By attracting the most diverse people, New York continues to be at the forefront in accepting those who are perceived to be different from society's norm - showing them that they can be accepted, even when their home communities have rejected them.  We want to film this diversity and the bias these characters face as openly as possible and without compromise. A network would require us to stay within their "family friendly" guidelines. This is why we want to distribute Psychosis directly online via Amazon Prime Video and other platforms in Europe, Latin America and Asia.

We are asking your help to finance this production.

To produce a full 12 episode season, in New York City, and under the SAG New Media Agreement, we have figured our total budget to be $260,000. It may look like a lot, but it's actually a lot cheaper than the production of a network TV series.

We have gathered an amazing cast of experienced actors who share our enthusiasm for the story and a talented crew to get the polished image and sound we need. They have appeared in many television series, films and Broadway shows that you’re probably already familiar with: Rock of Ages, Motown, The Blacklist, Too Close to Home, The Knick, Divorce, Mozart in the Jungle, The Young and the Restless, Days of Our Lives, Broken at Love, This Just In & DTLA, ...

Meet our Cast

  • Jason Vendryes (Too Close to Home, Blindspot, The Mysteries of Laura)
  • Tony Nominated actor Constantine Maroulis (Rock of Ages on Broadway, American Idol and Rock of Ages “2012”)
  • Ylfa Edelstein (The Knick, The Black list)
  • Ricardo Abarca (Silvana Sin Lana, Cumbia Ninja)
  • Daniel Sobieray (Days of Our Lives, Mistresses, The Client List)
  • Cameron Moir (Legends & Lies, Englishman in L.A., Non-Stop)
  • Bryant Wood (This Just In)
  • Aly Mang (Making a Scene with James Franco, The Get Down)
  • Malone Thomas (The Perfect Murder, Bloodlands)
  • Sal Rendino (Billions, ER, Frasier)
  • Lena Gora (Dalston Superstars, Fail)
  • Amr El-Bayoumi (House of Cards, Madam Secretary, The Blacklist)
  • Deborah Dominguez (I'm Not Afraid of Shia LaBeouf, C'est la vie, Bitches)
  • Julian Alexander (My Haunted House, Fantasy Life)
  • Renan Kanbay (Quantico, The Mysteries of Laura, Law & Order: Special Victims Unit)
  • Denisa Juhos (The Blacklist: Redemption, Quantico, Blindspot)
  • N'Kenge (Motown)
  • Gary Wales (Game of Thrones, Love Bites)
  • Justin Stiver (The Late Show with Stephen Colbert, Brklyn)

With: 

  • Yasmine Gharib
  • Justin Stiver
  • Marilyn Swick
  • Lou Morey
  • Josh Samson
  • Amgad Mostafa
  • Chelsea Durkalec
  • Audrey Grace Marshall
  • Sid O'Connell
  • Titoo Mentor
  • Matthew Stephen Herrick
  • Billy Brannigan
  • Trinity Rose
  • Chris Worley
  • Christopher Cimperman

Meet our Creative team

  • Hisham Abdel Khalek, director and producer
  • Amgad Mostafa, creator and writer
  • Olivier Delesse, producer

story_txt:
Our New York based production company is developing Psychosis, a 12 episode web-series (25 minutes each) to be shot in New York City.Psychosis is a psychological thriller that plays on our perception of reality.  Eight diverse characters see their storylines intertwine through a series of twists and turns. In the end, they may be forced to question their own identities.Each character has made a life choice that put them at odds with their family or community. They have to confront bias against sexual orientation, race, gender identification, or social backgrounds. When a providential inventor presents a time altering opportunity, will they choose to take it… and will it come at a price?New York is a competitive city where people come from all over the world to find out what they’re made of and fulfill their dreams. By attracting the most diverse people, New York continues to be at the forefront in accepting those who are perceived to be different from society's norm - showing them that they can be accepted, even when their home communities have rejected them.  We want to film this diversity and the bias these characters face as openly as possible and without compromise. A network would require us to stay within their "family friendly" guidelines. This is why we want to distribute Psychosis directly online via Amazon Prime Video and other platforms in Europe, Latin America and Asia.We are asking your help to finance this production.To produce a full 12 episode season, in New York City, and under the SAG New Media Agreement, we have figured our total budget to be $260,000. It may look like a lot, but it's actually a lot cheaper than the production of a network TV series.We have gathered an amazing cast of experienced actors who share our enthusiasm for the story and a talented crew to get the polished image and sound we need. They have appeared in many television series, films and Broadway shows that you’re probably already familiar with: Rock of Ages, Motown, The Blacklist, Too Close to Home, The Knick, Divorce, Mozart in the Jungle, The Young and the Restless, Days of Our Lives, Broken at Love, This Just In & DTLA, ...Meet our Cast

story:
THE STORY

The Three Brothers is a family oriented animated series based on a folktale set in a fictional African nation of the adventures of three magical brothers, Bala, Mamoun and Saiya Mansaray. Each one is gifted with strange and wondrous abilities. But as we know, being siblings is an adventure on its own right, and each one of the boys must decide how their powers will help them shape their lives.  We follow the brothers as they spend one last summer together learning valuable lessons that will affect not only them but the people and world around them.

One leaves. One stays. One dreams. These themes are the paths that The Three Brothers take.

In this magical brotherhood story, Bala, Mamoun and Saiya confront the tangible and intangible – the seen and the unseen, as well as, increasingly global habits, expectations and innovations. Each can choose the old, the new or the best of both. How will each survive and thrive separately and together?

 

THE BROTHERS

Bala Mansaray at 18 is the oldest. He wants to follow in his father’s footsteps planting and harvesting the most bountiful farm in their community. Bala's ability to control plant growth allows him to increase crop yield and maintain the farm even in the toughest seasons. His commitment to maintaining the family farm and starting his own family is challenged by the rigors of traditional farming, his father’s failing health, Mamoun leaving the family farm, and Saiya’s lack of focus on the tangible farm requirements.

Bala represents “contented traditional present.” He is gifted with the ability to make crops grow with great speed and strength. But when it comes to his brothers, Bala is the constant mediator keeping the peace and supporting their views. He tends to worry a lot. He worries about his parents and his brothers. Although he is eager to marry Sartan Koroma, his betrothed, he is anxious that he will never raise the dowry.

Mamoun Mansaray is 15-years-old.  He has a lot of energy and a very short temper, especially with his younger brother. Mamoun is certain that his football/soccer skills are his ticket to a better life, and he knows that their isolated home village can never satisfy his desires. He is so confident that he is often arrogant and impatient. He can’t wait to escape the village traditions and humble lifestyle. His abilities of enhanced speed and coordination, visual acuity and spatial awareness make him a star player on the soccer field and a great natural hunter, but make village life a dull daily annoyance.

Mamoun is a typical middle child. He can never get enough attention from his father because Bala is the best farmer. And he can’t stand that Saiya is always following him around and acting weird. Mamoun often convinces his brothers to do what he wants: this means he frequently gets the three of them into trouble. This last summer together is no exception.

Saiya Mansaray is the youngest boy in his family. He is 12 and one-half going on 13 years old. He is an awkward, distracted and physically frail young boy, but has incredible mystical powers. At the time of his birth, the village elders foresaw that Saiya would achieve miraculous feats because of his close spiritual connection with their ancestors.

Saiya’s supernatural abilities are derived from this close connection with the village’s incorporeal ancestors who always "have his back." He can transmute living things, see the past and future, and communicate with humans, animals, and the spirit ancestors. Saiya’s abilities include astral projection, shape shifting, alchemy, and super alchemy. 

Saiya adores his father, mother, and two older brothers. He wants to create a better place in the world for his village. As he nears puberty, Saiya learns to better use his powers. He explores the best ways for him to improve life for his family and community, but his brother’s lives always seem to distract him.

 

THE PATH

We are making a pilot episode that is the first step in a bigger plan to have a three-year television series. The best way to jumpstart the series is to send our pilot to festivals and present it in pitch meetings. We need your financial support to help us cross the finish line and bring this amazing story to audiences around the world.

"The Three Brothers" takes place in a fictional version of Africa yet reflects much of the unspoken, perhaps ignored, sensibilities of people of African descent around the world while showcasing brotherhood and family values. These values of ancestry, family and brotherhood are questioned and undermined on a daily basis in a world of media, technology and in our communities. "The Three Brothers" team wants to encourage young men and women to be brave and use their unique talents to make the world a better place. We want to recognize African folklore in popular culture to help support identity in all youth of today.

We decided to share our journey on Indiegogo because we want to partner with progressive, forward thinking people who want to invest in projects that are fun, creative, but also make a difference. It doesn’t hurt that the Indiegogo system allows our campaign to helps finance our pilot even if our it doesn’t make our full monetary goal. It also let's us surpass our target!

 

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

We need to raise $85,000 to complete production and distribute this short film in domestic and international film festivals.

Production: 70% -the bulk of funds raised will be used for the actual production of the film’s animation (time & labor intensive).

Post-Production:  15% - voice talent, music and licensing rights, editorial/post, composting and sweetening.

PR & Distribution: 10% - legal fees, press kits, marketing materials, festival fees and travel.

Perk Fulfillment:  5% - Thank You gifts for all of our generous friends and supporters!

The crowdfunding campaign for The Three Brothers is a flexible funding campaign, which means that every dollar raised will go towards the production of the pilot! 

STRETCH GOALS

$150,000

At the $150,000 mark, we will be able to finance additional project development including taking the design team to the actual village the story originated in.

$250,000

At the $250,000 mark, we will be able to enhance production values of the entire show.

 

WHO ARE WE?

THE THREE BROTHERS TEAM

ROBERT PENN

Robert E. Penn’s cinematography appears in the film “In Search of Finah Misa Kulé” directed by Kewulay Kamara that premièred in May 2016 at New York’s African Film Festival. His nonfiction films, “Stepping Out on Faith” and “Art from Adversity” premièred in May 2014 and June 2011, respectively. Robert’s writing has recently appeared in the anthologies Black Gay Genius, 2014, For Colored Boys Who’ve Considered Suicide When the Rainbow Is Still Not Enough, 2012 and Voices Rising, 2007.

Since 1970, Robert has traveled extensively in Africa. He has visited small villages in North, East, Central and West Africa. He loves the way storytellers weave family histories with major national events to instruct their audiences and how much they respect their listeners. Robert believes that America can never have diversity without including the lore of all the different ethnicities, races, orientations, and origins living and represented here. In order to achieve greater inclusion, Robert was inspired to start with the basics - ghost stories, fables, the campfire tale, parables, and riddles - that teach people critical thinking and how to live peaceably with one another in mutual respect and acceptance. These lessons inform children's actions before formal education begins, and continue to influence adults long after test scores have been forgotten.

Robert created "The Three Brothers" with the thought that America’s television audience and those of other continents will embrace a character-driven animated story of universal significance though the setting and specifics may be unfamiliar.

LIGHTNING YUMEKU

Lightning Yumeku founded 3 Degrees Films "3 Degrees," an animation production company in New York that creates children’s animation, music videos, and shorts. He is a graduate of the School of Visual Arts. Lightning’s vision and spirit aim to bring nothing less than a revolution to the American and New York animation communities and to revitalize and galvanize the immensely talented animation community in NYC. 3 Degrees aims to make animation production, once a staple of the New York film community, a force that bringing jobs, money, and prestige to the city. Lightning Yumeku encourages ways for New Yorkers to co-operate, share ideas and raise awareness of the vibrant cultures around the world through animation. 

3 DEGREES FILMS

3 Degrees Films is a New York production company using animation techniques to create animated shorts, music videos and children's books. We are building new ways for animation to be interactive, informative, and entertaining. We go above and think beyond.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Creating a series is a long journey, and must be taken one step at a time. This pilot, like any new venture, faces the challenge of raising sufficient capital to ensure that we can achieve a high standard of excellence. That’s why we need your help. With your financial support, we will complete what we have started and get it into the hands of people who will bring it to you.

IN ADDITION TO PLEDGING NOW, HERE ARE A FEW OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP….

  • Log in to your Indiegogo account
  • Go to our crowdfund page
  • Share the campaign directly using the buttons on the left or copy the direct URL https://igg.me/at/TheThreeBrothers
  • Refer our Indiegogo campaign with anyone you think would be interested in supporting this project.

OR

  • Log into your FACEBOOK account
  • Go to https://www.facebook.com/3DegreesFilms/
  • And hit the share button on our campaign story and share it with your friends and family.

MORE WAYS YOU CAN HELP….

Even if you can’t donate, the biggest way you can help is to spread the word about our crowdfunding campaign and encourage everyone you know to give…give often...and give generously!  Each person who donates increases our chances of reaching our goals.

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
The Story:  About REPRESENT

Ellie and Tess are young, struggling actresses and feminists who regularly face challenges as women in the film industry.  From the pay gap, to nudity in film, to body shaming, to a string of female characters who are defined by their relationship to the male protagonists, they regularly have to choose between accepting roles that misrepresent women, or not working at all.  After a day of particularly trying auditions, Ellie and Tess decide to write and produce their own film:  a multi-genre movie that takes the stereotypes that face each gender in the industry, and flips them around.  

There is a horror scene in which a scantily-clad guy runs through the woods screaming from a masked female killer; a sci-fi romance scene in which a vampire girl tells her human boyfriend that she shouldn't be with him because he's too fragile and breakable; a rom-com bit that includes a "manic pixie dream dude".  Tess and Ellie have a lifetime of archetypes to draw from, but there is a problem:  they have never made a movie themselves and have no idea how to do it.

REPRESENT follows Ellie and Tess as they recruit a cast and crew on a shoestring budget, juggle their day jobs, face resistance, overcome limitations, try to get the male actors to understand the finer points of the feminist content, and do their best to make a difference, no matter how small.

The Crew:  About Us

Emily Scott - Creator | Writer | Director | Producer | "Ellie"

Emily Scott is a stage and film actress, screenwriter, and filmmaker currently based in the Bay Area.  She earned a degree in Theatre and Drama from Indiana University and worked as an Acting Intern at Ensemble Theatre Cincinnati.  As an actress she has worked on many films, appearing alongside Patrick Wilson and Jessica Biel in A Kind of Murder and in Budding Prospects, a new Amazon pilot from director Terry Zwigoff (Ghost World, Bad Santa).  In addition to her work as an actress, she has written, directed, produced, and starred in several of her own short films, including "After," a 20-minute story-driven thriller that is currently being submitted to festivals.  Emily's work always focuses on the complexity of women, and REPRESENT is a culmination of her experiences as a woman in the film industry.
http://emily--scott.weebly.com

Marissa Vonn - Director

Marissa Vonn is a writer, director, and producer born and raised in the Midwest. She attended Full Sail University before relocating to the Bay Area to pursue film. Since then, Marissa has worked on many films and television shows across the country. Her short film "ASL" premiered in Orlando at the Enzian Theater’s FilmSlam and advanced to the Brouhaha Film and Video Showcase. In 2015, Marissa began producing the hit HGTV show "Good Bones" in her second home, Indianapolis.  During production of the show, Marissa wrote and directed her short film "Lunation" with an incredible local crew. After wrapping season 2 of "Good Bones", she went on to direct an LGBTQ+ web-series entitled "Outed". The series is currently in post production. Marissa is currently finishing her second feature screenplay "Lake Darling" and plans to direct another short film later this year.

Jackelyn Perez - Director | Director of Photography | Editor

Jackelyn Perez is a filmmaker from San Francisco Bay Area.  She received her B.A. in film production from San Francisco State University and a Motion Graphics certificate from TechSF.  Jackelyn works consistently shooting and editing video content for commercial companies as well as individuals.  In addition to directing and shooting her own films, she is currently the Media Engagement Specialist at the  Bay Area Video Coalition (BAVC).  Most recently she worked with Emily Scott on the short film "After," which is currently making its way through the festival circuit.

For information about other members of our AMAZING all-female crew, please visit the REPRESENT website!

What We Need & What You Get

To produce the entire series of REPRESENT, we are asking for $5,000.  This money will go to:

  • Equipment Rental - $1,500
    Many of our crew have their own equipment, but there are a few things we are looking to rent, like a boom mic and some additional lighting.
  • Craft Services - $1,300
    Food!  Our amazing cast and crew are working on deferred pay, meaning that they only get paid if the series itself makes money.  This is such a major help and we want to repay them with the finest muffins and bagels in all the land.
  • Sound - $1,000
    Sound recording and editing are two of the most underrated parts of a film's production.  They take a high level of skill, and we want to be able to hire the best.
  • Location Fees - $200
    There are a few locations, like coffee shops and stores, that we will need to ask to film scenes at.  Sometimes the owners allow us free of charge, and sometimes they charge a fee.  We're putting aside some money to allow for that possibility.
  • Props - $200
    Most of the costumes will come from the cast's own closets!  But we have a few specialty props we need to purchase, like fake blood (for the fake movie) and some skimpy superhero costumes (for the men, obviously).
  • Music - $300
    Some money will go to hiring a composer to create some background music (and possibly a theme song)!
  • Incidentals - $500
    In the event that things cost more than we expect - and let's be honest, they usually do - we want to have something set aside for emergencies.

Any excess funds we may receive will be funneled into the "Incidentals" section, which means we will be using them for whatever is needed.  And if you really blow us away and give us more than we need to produce the series, everything else will go towards marketing, festival entry fees, and actually paying the amazing people who are working on this project!

But we'd never let you walk away empty-handed!  Everyone who donates at least $5 will get some kind of perk!  Our perks include things like exclusive video content (blooper reels, virtual set tours), signed thank-you notes, REPRESENT stickers and T-shirts, invites to the premiere party, Skype sessions with the creator, and even a chance to be IN the webseries!

The Impact:  Why You Should Support Us

The struggle is so real for women in film and television, both onscreen and off.  A Geena Davis Institute study of film in 11 countries reports that only about 31% of all speaking characters in films are female, and only 23% of films have a female protagonist.  Women are twice as likely to be sexualized as men and five times as likely to be referenced as attractive.  Only about 23% of women are portrayed as having a job of any kind.  Not only that, but off-screen, across the world, women make up only about 20% of filmmaking roles, including directing, writing, and producing.

That.  Is.  Bananas.

Supporting REPRESENT is supporting a change in the status quo.  This series follows a diverse group of filmmakers led by diverse, empowered, and complex women.  Each episode faces women's representation in the film industry head on - many based on the real experiences of the cast and crew.

The way women are shown in the media contributes to the way women are treated in real life.  If TV and movies constantly treat women as objects, how can we be surprised when boys do the same?  If girls grow up never seeing the full potential of women onscreen, how can they ever reach theirs?  The goal of REPRESENT is to turn all of that on its head.  In this series, women will be at the forefront, questioning everything they've been taught - both in front of and behind the camera.

At the same time, supporting REPRESENT means supporting women filmmakers.  Women make up the entire creative team and every major crew position on this series.  In an industry where female hires make up about 23% of the crew, our majority female crew is both an anomaly and necessary.  Your financial support for REPRESENT will allow us more time to work on the project and more opportunities to make it amazing, both of which will elevate our work and allow us the ability to create more.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges involved in filmmaking.  We've all been on sets where things have gone awry - an actor doesn't show up, a crew member oversleeps, the shots take longer than expected, the location you wanted to use won't let you film there.  And, of course, running out of money is the biggest challenge.  While our cast and crew is phenomenal and we don't anticipate many issues, there's always the chance.

But the truth is, we'll make the series regardless.  The commitment of everyone on the team to make this project on deferred pay proves how much this project means to everyone involved.  If we are fully funded, we will be able to make an incredible, high-quality, funny, empowering, women-led series.  And if we don't get fully funded, we'll take what we do have and make the best series we can.  We hope you'll contribute so that we can make it as great as it can be.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are a million ways you can help REPRESENT!

  • First and foremost, TELL YOUR FRIENDS!  Share this campaign on your social media, like our Facebook page, and tell everyone you know about us!
  • If you are a writer/blogger/vlogger/general online person and want to interview or feature us, please get in contact on our website!  We'd love to talk to you!
  • If you have a skill you want to contribute to the series, let us know!  Whether you're good at marketing, editing, graphics, photography, or just want to volunteer somehow, we'd love to chat!
  • If you have resources we could use - if you've got film/sound/lighting equipment, do catering and want to bring us food, own a coffee shop you can volunteer as a shooting location, etc. - give us a shout!

Please visit the REPRESENT website to contact us or learn more!  And THANK YOU!
story_txt:
The Story:  About REPRESENT

Ellie and Tess are young, struggling actresses and feminists who regularly face challenges as women in the film industry.  From the pay gap, to nudity in film, to body shaming, to a string of female characters who are defined by their relationship to the male protagonists, they regularly have to choose between accepting roles that misrepresent women, or not working at all.  After a day of particularly trying auditions, Ellie and Tess decide to write and produce their own film:  a multi-genre movie that takes the stereotypes that face each gender in the industry, and flips them around.  There is a horror scene in which a scantily-clad guy runs through the woods screaming from a masked female killer; a sci-fi romance scene in which a vampire girl tells her human boyfriend that she shouldn't be with him because he's too fragile and breakable; a rom-com bit that includes a "manic pixie dream dude".  Tess and Ellie have a lifetime of archetypes to draw from, but there is a problem:  they have never made a movie themselves and have no idea how to do it.
REPRESENT follows Ellie and Tess as they recruit a cast and crew on a shoestring budget, juggle their day jobs, face resistance, overcome limitations, try to get the male actors to understand the finer points of the feminist content, and do their best to make a difference, no matter how small.
The Crew:  About Us

Emily Scott - Creator | Writer | Director | Producer | "Ellie"
Emily Scott is a stage and film actress, screenwriter, and filmmaker currently based in the Bay Area.  She earned a degree in Theatre and Drama from Indiana University and worked as an Acting Intern at Ensemble Theatre Cincinnati.  As an actress she has worked on many films, appearing alongside Patrick Wilson and Jessica Biel in A Kind of Murder and in Budding Prospects, a new Amazon pilot from director Terry Zwigoff (Ghost World, Bad Santa).  In addition to her work as an actress, she has written, directed, produced, and starred in several of her own short films, including "After," a 20-minute story-driven thriller that is currently being submitted to festivals.  Emily's work always focuses on the complexity of women, and REPRESENT is a culmination of her experiences as a woman in the film industry.http://emily--scott.weebly.com

Marissa Vonn - Director
Marissa Vonn is a writer, director, and producer born and raised in the Midwest. She attended Full Sail University before relocating to the Bay Area to pursue film. Since then, Marissa has worked on many films and television shows across the country. Her short film "ASL" premiered in Orlando at the Enzian Theater’s FilmSlam and advanced to the Brouhaha Film and Video Showcase. In 2015, Marissa began producing the hit HGTV show "Good Bones" in her second home, Indianapolis.  During production of the show, Marissa wrote and directed her short film "Lunation" with an incredible local crew. After wrapping season 2 of "Good Bones", she went on to direct an LGBTQ+ web-series entitled "Outed". The series is currently in post production. Marissa is currently finishing her second feature screenplay "Lake Darling" and plans to direct another short film later this year.

Jackelyn Perez - Director | Director of Photography | Editor
Jackelyn Perez is a filmmaker from San Francisco Bay Area.  She received her B.A. in film production from San Francisco State University and a Motion Graphics certificate from TechSF.  Jackelyn works consistently shooting and editing video content for commercial companies as well as individuals.  In addition to directing and shooting her own films, she is currently the Media Engagement Specialist at the  Bay Area Video Coalition (BAVC).  Most recently she worked with Emily Scott on the short film "After," which is currently making its way through the festival circuit.
For information about other members of our AMAZING all-female crew, please visit the REPRESENT website!

What We Need & What You Get
To produce the entire series of REPRESENT, we are asking for $5,000.  This money will go to:


Equipment Rental - $1,500Many of our crew have their own equipment, but there are a few things we are looking to rent, like a boom mic and some additional lighting.

Craft Services - $1,300Food!  Our amazing cast and crew are working on deferred pay, meaning that they only get paid if the series itself makes money.  This is such a major help and we want to repay them with the finest muffins and bagels in all the land.

Sound - $1,000Sound recording and editing are two of the most underrated parts of a film's production.  They take a high level of skill, and we want to be able to hire the best.

Location Fees - $200There are a few locations, like coffee shops and stores, that we will need to ask to film scenes at.  Sometimes the owners allow us free of charge, and sometimes they charge a fee.  We're putting aside some money to allow for that possibility.

Props - $200Most of the costumes will come from the cast's own closets!  But we have a few specialty props we need to purchase, like fake blood (for the fake movie) and some skimpy superhero costumes (for the men, obviously).

Music - $300Some money will go to hiring a composer to create some background music (and possibly a theme song)!

Incidentals - $500In the event that things cost more than we expect - and let's be honest, they usually do - we want to have something set aside for emergencies.

Any excess funds we may receive will be funneled into the "Incidentals" section, which means we will be using them for whatever is needed.  And if you really blow us away and give us more than we need to produce the series, everything else will go towards marketing, festival entry fees, and actually paying the amazing people who are working on this project!
But we'd never let you walk away empty-handed!  Everyone who donates at least $5 will get some kind of perk!  Our perks include things like exclusive video content (blooper reels, virtual set tours), signed thank-you notes, REPRESENT stickers and T-shirts, invites to the premiere party, Skype sessions with the creator, and even a chance to be IN the webseries!


The Impact:  Why You Should Support Us
The struggle is so real for women in film and television, both onscreen and off.  A Geena Davis Institute study of film in 11 countries reports that only about 31% of all speaking characters in films are female, and only 23% of films have a female protagonist.  Women are twice as likely to be sexualized as men and five times as likely to be referenced as attractive.  Only about 23% of women are portrayed as having a job of any kind.  Not only that, but off-screen, across the world, women make up only about 20% of filmmaking roles, including directing, writing, and producing.
That.  Is.  Bananas.
Supporting REPRESENT is supporting a change in the status quo.  This series follows a diverse group of filmmakers led by diverse, empowered, and complex women.  Each episode faces women's representation in the film industry head on - many based on the real experiences of the cast and crew.
The way women are shown in the media contributes to the way women are treated in real life.  If TV and movies constantly treat women as objects, how can we be surprised when boys do the same?  If girls grow up never seeing the full potential of women onscreen, how can they ever reach theirs?  The goal of REPRESENT is to turn all of that on its head.  In this series, women will be at the forefront, questioning everything they've been taught - both in front of and behind the camera.
At the same time, supporting REPRESENT means supporting women filmmakers.  Women make up the entire creative team and every major crew position on this series.  In an industry where female hires make up about 23% of the crew, our majority female crew is both an anomaly and necessary.  Your financial support for REPRESENT will allow us more time to work on the project and more opportunities to make it amazing, both of which will elevate our work and allow us the ability to create more.


Risks & Challenges
There are always risks and challenges involved in filmmaking.  We've all been on sets where things have gone awry - an actor doesn't show up, a crew member oversleeps, the shots take longer than expected, the location you wanted to use won't let you film there.  And, of course, running out of money is the biggest challenge.  While our cast and crew is phenomenal and we don't anticipate many issues, there's always the chance.
But the truth is, we'll make the series regardless.  The commitment of everyone on the team to make this project on deferred pay proves how much this project means to everyone involved.  If we are fully funded, we will be able to make an incredible, high-quality, funny, empowering, women-led series.  And if we don't get fully funded, we'll take what we do have and make the best series we can.  We hope you'll contribute so that we can make it as great as it can be.

Other Ways You Can Help
There are a million ways you can help REPRESENT!

First and foremost, TELL YOUR FRIENDS!  Share this campaign on your social media, like our Facebook page, and tell everyone you know about us!
If you are a writer/blogger/vlogger/general online person and want to interview or feature us, please get in contact on our website!  We'd love to talk to you!
If you have a skill you want to contribute to the series, let us know!  Whether you're good at marketing, editing, graphics, photography, or just want to volunteer somehow, we'd love to chat!
If you have resources we could use - if you've got film/sound/lighting equipment, do catering and want to bring us food, own a coffee shop you can volunteer as a shooting location, etc. - give us a shout!

Please visit the REPRESENT website to contact us or learn more!  And THANK YOU!

story:
"Alex Is Black" EP101 from PitLab Productions on Vimeo.

Short Summary

  • Alex Haynes is a Manhattan-born, Midwest-raised actor based in New York City.  He's also… black. Jordy Altman is a Kansan turned Los Angelino. They met in the sixth grade and have spent years on the coasts honing their acting, writing, and producing skills on stage on screen and beyond. They've come together to bring you "Alex is Black."
  •  "Alex Is Black" is important in the world right now because representation in film and TV matters more than ever. When the world wants to sort us into categories, how do we cope if we don't fit nicely into one specific box? "Alex is Black" takes aim at the inherent comedy of being more than one thing; being more than meets the eye in the world as it is today.
  • Your contribution will help tell these important stories that have not been told before and demonstrate how universally relatable they actually are. Our goal is to reach a wide audience and every contribution, no matter the size, helps nudge us closer to that goal.

What We Need & What You Get

Our production company, PitLab Production, is looking to raise enough support to cover the production costs for the first season of our web series, "Alex Is Black." Your support will help PitLab raise funds toward Pre-Production, Production, Post-Production, and Beyond Production costs, which we have broken down below. 

  • Pre: Writing, Revising, Location Scouting, Insurance
    Prod: Lighting, Audio, Set Dressing, Wardrobe, Location Services, Craft Services, Equipment Rentals, 
    Post: Editing, Color Correction, Sound Mixing
    Beyond: Festival Submissions

  • We have exciting perks to share, ranging from social shoutouts to inclusion in front and/or behind the camera! Take a look at our milestones and find the best fit. 

  • If we reach 50% of our goal ($5,000), we will release the 2nd episode of "Alex Is Black" for your viewing pleasure! We hope that encourages more of your support as we look to crowdsource the funds for our four remaining episodes. 

  • If we don't reach our goal, we will use whatever we have raised to bring to life as many episodes as we can. We are determined to bring season 1 of "Alex is Black" to life, and we will do as much as possible with what we've got. 

The Impact

  • Everyone has defining characteristics that aren't visible. Traits that make us who we are that are only apparent to the world when we make them so. It's important to come together over stories about our differences because those differences are what make us the same.
  • Jordy Altman, co-founder of PitLab Productions, is an Emmy-Award winning Producer on CBS' "The Talk." He is taking his talents from the live studio to the small studio with PitLab Productions. Before taking on "Alex Is Black," PitLab recently wrapped the first season of "Pillow Talk," a web series written and starring Aubree Bowen. 
  • Alex Haynes is an accomplished actor, performing in the record-breaking "Puffs…" Off-Broadway. Alex has also performed multiple roles at The Flea Theater including being directed by noted filmmaker Joel Schumacher. His voice can be heard as Talonflame (and many others) in Pokemon X, Y & Z currently streaming on Netflix. All this and more can be found at alex-haynes.com.

Risks & Challenges

Production can be daunting, but with your support we can overcome the fiscal and physical hurdles that await us.  

  • Combined, PitLab Production has been producing short-form content for over 10 years in the industry, from broadcast segments, commercials, online sketches, webseries, and much more… 
  • PitLab recently helped fundraise $2,000 for "Pillow Talk." 
  • Our budget has already been devised, and each episode will cost roughly $2,500 split between Pre-production, Production, and Post costs.
  • Each aspect of production is an item on a checklist. We work on each item until the list is complete. As challenges arise we pivot and problem-solve until the issue is resolved. Relying on each other and our extended network of talented artists for advice and guidance. We funded the first two episodes ourselves because we believed in our ability to rise above inevitable obstacles enough to risk our own resources.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Watch and like our available content. Multiple times even.
  • Share our videos with everyone you know using your favorite social media platforms.
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about our campaign (yes, with everyone you know).
  • Create office gossip about the show.
  • Call HBO, Netflix, or any other network and demand more episodes of "Alex is Black."

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi everyone! Thank you so much for stopping by and checking out the Indiegogo campaign for our first season of Between Friends!  We at Between Friends cannot thank you enough for your support and contributions to our project! 

This series was born out of need in our community. Queer and diverse content has been severely lacking, and it is up to us to make that change. Our creator was tired of all shows following the same tropes and stereotypes time and time again, so she took it upon herself to create this wonderful story that we are so proud of and hope you will be too! 

 

A quick synopsis of our show: In life we are all looking for the same thing, mostly.  Love.  We all need it and we all want it.  We fear and hate it.  It’s love, not money, that truly makes the world go around.  It is also the root of all evil.  It is the pot of gold at the end of every rainbow. It doesn’t matter if you’re an attorney, doctor, actress, police officer, business woman or a bartender.  We all need the same thing, and it’s how we find it that creates the amazing story.  Our story. Sometimes our stories are right in front of us; sometimes they have to be fought for and uncovered; sometimes a tragedy helps us recognize what our own eyes are too afraid to see.

 

Helping us spread the word of our campaign is so important! Every social media shoutout helps, and you will have our eternal thanks! 

Please  follow along with us in this romantic dramedy and watch as a group of friends grow up, overcome adversity, and share the best and worst parts of their lives and friendship!  The story of who they were, who they are and who they will become together, in life and in love.

story:
ABOUT US

3Queen Productions is a film collaborative dedicated to producing relatable, inspirational content for, by, and about women around the world. Started by Philadelphia-based filmmakers Aiko Brown, Zareefa Abdul-Adl, and Arraiyan DuBose, 3Queen strives to highlight stories that are often neglected in mainstream media. The trio of filmmakers first worked together on the short film, The After Math, directed by Zareefa. From here sprang the idea of a comedy drama series about women like themselves, who despite sexism and racism are determined to pursue their dreams while staying true to themselves. Thus Layered was born.

CAMPAIGN

Our Campaign will help us raise money to continue to our series Layered which brings awareness of racism, sexism and mental illness, tackling the landscape of what it is to be human and "Layered." Following the three main characters who struggles to be their true selves. 

Its important for us to create these complex and relatable stories about women from all around the world!

CAMPAIGN PURPOSE

Contributions will help us with finishing the remaining episodes of this unique series by showing a range of women from different religious backgrounds on television. You'll help us to tell a story thats rarely been told in mainstream television diversifying comedic content about black muslim and christian women living in Philadelphia pursuing a career in the entertainment industry.  

 

GOAL & WHAT FUNDS GO TOWARDS

$30,000

Pre-Production: Auditions/venue space, Actors, Crew, locations/permits, food, transportation.

Production: Permits, Head Departments- Camera Department, Lighting Department, Sound, Production Design, Wardrobe, Locations, Production Coordinator, Food/Meals, Transportation

Post-Production: Editing, Color Correction, Music/Soundtrack, Sound, Marketing/Ads, Festival fees 

PERKS

Level 1 - $10 - Thank You & Layered poster

Level 2 - $25 - Special Thanks/Shoutout & entered into drawing to be an EXTRA on set 

Level 3 -$100 - VIP ticket to episode screening & Layered poster

Level 5 - $500 - Name in credits as sponsor

Level 6: - $1,000 - Name in credits as sponsor & product in 1 episode

Level 7 - $3,000 - Your character's story told in 1 episode

Level 8 - $5,000 - Name in credits as sponsor & product in 2 episodes

Level 9 - $10,000 - Name in credits as sponsor & product in 3 episodes

Level 10 - $20,000 - Name in credits as sponsor as Executive Producer & product in 6 episodes, on set for a day

If we don't reach our entire goal, funds will be used for production in remaining episodes. 

IMPACT

In telling our story, we are also telling yours. By having your name and or product advertised in our series, you gain a valuable platform and audience. Our goal is to make sure that stories are told in the best and most entertaining way.

 

RISK AND CHALLENGES

We know that following your dreams is not always easy, but we're committed to making this series and our dreams come true. As women with a multitude of talents and skills we are dedicated to using our resources to "make it work" in spite of any challenges that may come our way.

OTHER WAYS TO CONTRIBUTE

We hope that if you can't contribute then you'll help us by sharing information about Layered and our campaign with others. We are grateful for this opportunity and appreciate your help on this journey. Click the share button on our campaign page and like and follow us on ours social media pages. Many thanks!

story:
I am a first time writer and director. THIS STORY PLAYED IN MY HEAD FOR A YEAR .  Soon after my son was born, I sat down to write and in BUT A FEW HOURS, the words bled across the page.  As a screen play, it has already been accepted into numerous festivals and the nominations are coming in.

This project separates itself from others in its attention to detail. The truth is in these details.  We have a boxing instructor as a fight choreographer and a Northern Irish filmmaker who has bee

 

n instrumental in assuring both language and history is on point.  Our actors are training with dialect coaches to get specifics just right. 

Having made these connections, our story line leads us forward and we have the foundation in place to take this pilot out of the US and into Ireland and the Irish market. 

In supporting this film, you are supporting WORKING WOMEN - MOTHERS who are keeping their families together and trying to create at the same time.  Dornalai Cailin highlights just that, the FIGHT FOR FAMILY and the choices we must make while trying to maintain our morals. This is the story of a woman who finds herself in the throws of the underworld...

Our cast and crew have won at Sundance (Jack Mulcahy: Brother’s McMullen), acted in Oscar nominated films (Emma Sara: Incendie), graced the Broadway Stage (Matty Oaks: "Angles in America", David Sitler Frost/Nixon), worked directly with ARNOLD (Brett Azar: Terminator Genysis) and appeared in blockbuster network shows such as Blue Bloods, Sex and the City, Law and Order, Black List, Girls, Gone, Veep, Evil Lives Here, and Homicide:Life on the Street. 

​

With this kind of experience and talent, there is no fight we will lose!

 

Given the talent and dedication to this project, everyone is getting paid for the work they put in.  As a struggling actor, I have participated in MANY projects where I was simply given a slice of pizza and a credit and spent my own money on any other expenses. I do not want to be that kind of project! Our actors are professional and will be PAID for their commitment and the work they put into every passing moment in front of the camera. We want the end product to be QUALITY. With that, gear rental and top notch editing is a necessity. 

We are making something big and we are not looking back.

story:
WHO WE ARE

We are Chioma NKachukwu (Nigerian)... and Ramata Doray (Angolan).

Coincidentally we both moved to the United States at the same year and at the same age of 15 years old.... However we did not meet until 4 years later in college.

What we are not: Avid travelers with all the answers, History buffs (Although chioma has a serious soft spot for history) and Know it all (We are just a little bit less clueless than the rest and a lot more passionate). 

Growing up, our history individually was marred by domination and hardly ever covered, touched or explored as if we had none. A brief recourse of the scramble and conquering of Africa, and we are always quickly ushered into our colonizers history. Hence, how most educated people know European history more than their own history (Ourselves included) and the none educated are generally clueless. So in away, we are all African Illiterates.... Educated or not.

CHIOMA'S PERSPECTIVE: 

I picked up a love for History from my father... We all did, and the little I know of Africa (more than most people) I learn't from my father who rather than read you a story book for bed, read us books like (Nkurumah the man).  

However, I still had no idea, that the information I had was just a word from pages of histories that no one has explored. You would think, that history in African Elite schools would cover even a chapter of the African history...

Moving here as a teenager did not make things better. On the contrary, I further got immersed into western and European history, where the History of Blackness was only describe in chapters dedicated to Slavery, as if that was where we began. 

Still... I did not realize something was missing. 

It is odd, that fellow native Africans like myself here in Diaspora and those back at home do not still realize we are missing large in the pages of prominent existence and history, or we do not care... May be I hadn't realized it was missing because everyone (majority) looked like me, and while I was inhaling European history I didn't realize that was the only one to indulge in. It was relocating to a difference country, that brought my awareness, that my representation is missing.

I was new in college when as classmate, burst through the doors, ecstatic and proudly announced (Egypt has a black Pharaoh) and an argument ensuing, on if Egypt was even a part of Africa, that one bolt loosened.  I was in High School when I got questions regarding living in huts and riding lions to school ( That was when the first awareness bolt got loose). I was in high school when my counselor a man of nearly 70 deemed it fit to ask me how we communicated and emigrated. (My answer... When we want to migrate, some of us, grown wings and fly, Some since we are archaic human being retained some use of Gills, so they swim and yes I had a pet lion named Simba).

Sarcasm... I know, but that was how I dealt with questions I felt deep down inside that people with information at the tip of their fingers should have.

We haven't made much progress, cause African History is only covered in phases of Egyptian history (And even at that, the representation is sometimes wrong). African existence is often covered in the genocidal striping of human resources (Slavery). And when ever something remotely authentic seems to be rearing its head The poverty state of the continent becomes a topic that covers our very existence and the lives of our ancestors as if they were never once here and prosperous. 

We haven't made much progress, because while people realize Africa has potential, or know that we don't all live in huts or own lions or are all poor and need a dollar to survive. [ Side Note: I do need your dollar this time around :) but I digress. ] They mostly know a prosperous Africa from the Safari end of it. There is absolutely no tangible knowledge about the continent. 

There is no exploration of our culture rather, there is exploitation. 

AND .... Africans ourselves are as oblivious of our own resources, history, diversity, similarities hence we keep allowing our destabilization. 

There is an old proverb (He who does not know where and when it started raining on him, will not know where and when it stops) . (If you are clueless of your own existence, then you are clueless you are being stolen from). 

If we do not know our own history how can we, right our future?  How can we know the value and Heritage we have? 

Our Goal, Is not to bore you, with boring history lessons

Our goal is to educate people, Africans and the world about Africa as it was, has been, is and will possibly be. To show Africa in its authentic voice, without bureaucracy, and assumptions.

This will be done through creating a Network for travelers to experience the people and its culture and learn History without even intending to.

Imagine yourself, sitting in a family compound with an old matriarch or patriarch, with children and grand children and yourself, surrounding a crackling fire, Traditional food served, as everyone eats and listen to folklores tied into history of each region being told by the old one. 

We are trying to create a circuit, where people experience authentic experiences, learn new things and meet the people as people. Rather than just the people as your nice tour guide. 

Could you imagine having a Night off season harvest, with burning palm fronds walking in farms at midnight with the villagers, can you imagine, being invited to a traditional wedding, to witness the traditional rites as its done to see the difference between that and the west and learn why it is done that way? 

Can you imagine your self, frolicking in the dance festivals just like a local or experiencing Christmas like you have never experienced before...?

 

RAMATA'S PERSPECTIVE

Just as mentioned above. I had childhood where my history was non existent. And the focus was mostly on the colonization of Angola by the Portuguese. 

Chioma likes to accuse that Angola took a little too much to its colonization. and while I partially disagree, It is not too far reaching and argument, considering we lost our hold on our native language. Myself included.

Another point of contention i had with chioma (As you will see, through our travel vlogs.. we tend to have a lot of point of contentions) was her absolute unwavering love for European History; while i curtailed my intake, on the revolting point that often I am not represented in those. I am not included in those pages or screens. 

We are hardly ever represented culturally on world stages, we have interesting, intriguing heroes and stories to tell  Example: Queen Nzinga Mbande  african queen who fought fearlessly and cleverly for the freedom and stature of her kingdom against the Portuguese, who were colonizing the remaining of Angola at the time.By her own determination and refusal to give in to the Portuguese without a flight she transformed her kingdom into a formidable commercial state on equal footing with the Portuguese colonies. I want to bring more of those stories to light. We are not just a history of being conquereed, of being exploited and we are not all a culture of one trick ponies.... there is much more to us, from the past to the present and that is why we want to show you African through rose colored glasses.

We Need & What You Get

Our general intention is not only to educate people about African history, but to promote exploration and enjoyment of African culture through travel and interaction. It is a lot of hard work and a serious labor of love, contacting village chiefs and stewards to discuss permissions and what is possible. He have barely scratched the surface as you can see from the Map below, that Africa is an incredibly complicated and Large landmark and diversity. But the little response we have received has been amazingly overwhelmingly exciting and we cant wait to fully get going . And you can definitely help us reach that goal.

  1. TRANSPORTATION FOR 2 :    40%
  • To five different countries: spanning Multiple regions, tribes, major ethnic  groups and sub groups in each country.
  • This included Flights, bus hopping, keke n'pepe, motorcycle hopping, etc 

LODGING FOR 2 :           22%

VILLAGE CREW IN EACH COUNTRY & REGION :  15%

  • Payment for those collecting the event data and inputting then in the system
  • Electronics for data input
  • Gifts for village chief's " you don't go empty handed into African homes
  • Translators

FOOD FOR 2 :                10%

EDITING :                        5%

INDIEGOGO FEE :         5 - 8%

 

Should we not reach our goal, We will be adding what is raised here to what we have personally raised from our own pockets to get started on this journey. 

 

The Perks:

In exchange for your contributions we're offering amazing perks, some of which are authentically made on the African continent!

Take a look on the Left side to see our perks   ------------->​

Note: The pictures are not the exact products you will be receiving. It is a representation.

This is the perks are authentic and will be made and handpicked in Africa. The fabrics will be picked and our donors will have options sent to them to pick from. Same as the style design. Also the accommodation Perk, is dependent on our location and what ever point in time a donor becomes ready to receive their perk.  

 

THE IMPACT

Your support will help us cover some regions and countries. it will also help cover Internet cost for updating the network data with vital information as well as upload videos that we have promised and ensure that everyone's hard work, and this fantastic project, will be seen by as many people as possible. We hope to encourage everyone who wants to venture on a self exploration and cultural exploration, to venture out and be their wonderful, unique selves! 

Any amount is more than appreciated, nothing is too small. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to donate at the moment? We understand. Our campaign will run for 60 days so come back if you can! 

If donating doesn't work for you right now, no worries! You can absolutely still support Gridy Queens. A like, comment, retweet, share, or post can really help us get the word out; and we welcome those additions to Team GQ!

Like us on Facebook: facebook.com/GridQueen

Follow us on Instagram: @Gridyqueens

Follow us on Twitter: @GridyQueens

Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our campaign

 

Want To Work With Us?

Interested in promoting your local business, donating miles, have connections/networks that might be helpful to us, donating  art etc Please email us: GridyQueens@gmail.com

Thank you so much for joining us on this adventure! Please let us know if we can answer any questions.

story:
Our Story

We're Kit & Rosie Volcano founders of The Little Volcano Coaching Company. Today we live in sunny San Diego and coach hundreds of clients a year while running a successful business and raising a child.

But it wasn’t always like this... 

Four years ago we owned a failing yoga studio and we were so broke we had to sleep on friends coaches. Around that time Kit decided to transition to become a man and we started using the principles of transformation that we now teach others.

Doing that we were able to pay off all our debts, and build a thriving community for people who never knew where they fit in before. 

 

Our Vision

The TV show will chronicle the step by step transformation of a number of coaching clients while intertwining those stories with the daily realities of running a successful coaching business.

We also hope to welcome on inspiring teachers (such as Abraham-Hicks or Joe Dispenza) to help with the transformation.

When we started lockdown we initially thought it was a terrible time to crowdfund for our TV show. Now we realize that we have an opportunity to stream hope and transformation right into people's homes.

Quarantine isn't the reason we can't do this, it is the reason we MUST do this! 

Our mission is to teach triumph despite adversity. What better way to do that then to merge the entertainment value of reality TV with personal development and transformation. 

 

Our Team

For the TV show, we're partnering with one of our lead coaches Nancy Goodell, a veteran TV producer. We also have our entire team of coaches who facilitate transformation inside The Little Volcano community.

 

Join the Community:

Our show will be more than just TV. We also have an inspiring community component. With our online community viewers can participate in the day to day discussions, access motivational content, and connect with other like-minded members. The Little Volcano community is loud, colorful, full of love, accepting to all people, and cares deeply about making an impact.

 

What We’re Asking For:

In order to make the dream of transformational entertainment a reality, we’re asking for $25,000.

This will give us the funds we need to complete production on a network quality sizzle reel, and pitch the idea to mainstream networks on a global scale. Now is the time for a show like this because audiences are hungry for empowering, uplifting content that entertains and inspires, and networks are ready for a reality TV show with rainbows, magic, & onesies!
