story:
During the early 1900's, Willie and Frank Macleod chose to ignore the legends of spirits and devils in order to seek the stories of gold, and ventured into an area of the Nahanni called Deadman's Valley never to return. A couple years later, the remains of the Macleods were found tied to a tree with their heads cut off (and never found). This along with numerous other mysterious experiences, disapearances and deaths, has led to the Nahanni's mysterious reputation. A remote region difficult to access and rarely explored in many areas.

"Secrets of Nahanni" seeks to further investigate the legends of the Nahanni Valley through a two-week river expedition. This documentary will journey deep into the river valleys and remote mountain ranges - venturing into areas often avoided, restricted to the public and rarely explored first hand - to unearth that unknown essence beneath the surface of the Nahanni that has fuelled for centuries the tales of “something else”, while giving a sense of the natural richness and beauty of this area that has made it such a sacred and special place.

Before the river expedition begins, we will first explore deeper beyond the European stories by capturing the folklore and oral histories of the Dene, Sahtu, Métis and Decho First Nation storytellers. These local legends predate the European tales by thousands of years and hold more clues, questions and mysteries of what secrets remain hidden along the river banks and valleys of the Nahanni. 

By capturing the local First Nations stories first hand, we will create a unique experience of the Nahanni's legends by presenting them with more depth and diversity than ever before. By sharing these stories in the words of local story tellers and elders, "Secrets of Nahanni" will offer a richer, deeper exploration of Nahanni's mysteries and legends, travelling further back in time to the source of these mysterious tales. 

REMOTE LOCATION: With no roads into Nahanni Valley, it is only accessible by air and water or a long overland journey on foot. Much of the area remains unexplored, despite being declared a National Park and World Heritage Site. Few people get the opportunity to explore this remote region first hand and we want to share this experience with a POV style documentary of our expedition. 

ACCESS TO RESTRICTED AREAS: We have been granted rare access to  Class-1 restricted areas, non-accessible to the public, including Deadman's Valley where many of the legends originate and the sacred Tuffa Mounds. 

COMPLETED 6 MONTH APPROVAL PROCESS & READY TO FILM:  We are one of the few to be awarded access to film in Nahanni National Park and the first given the opportunity to record local oral histories through a 6 month process by the NaHa Consensus Team (made up of the local Dene, Sahtu & Metis First Nations representatives and Parks Canada). 

We are seeking to raise $60K to help us complete our two phases of filming.

The FIRST PHASE of production (budgeted at around 10K) is to film and capture the local oral histories and stories of the Dene, Sahtu and Metis First Nations to capture the many legends and mysteries never before recorded. 

The SECOND PHASE of production (budgeted at around $50K) is to film our multi-week river expedition into the Nahanni. This includes our exploration along the South Nahanni River and surrounding areas like Deadman's Valley to seek out and unearth the areas related to these tales and legends. 

As a stretch goal, reaching $150K would further cover the editing (Post Production) and marketing aspects of the documentary along with additional film elements such as 360 VR content, night cameras as well as allow us to film more cinematic elements to better tell and recreate aspects of these oral histories and tales dating back centuries.

We are planning to begin our our first phase of production for Fall 2018 to capture all the legends and oral histories followed with filming the multi-week river expedition in 2019. 

Making a documentary film can be complicated and expensive. But we have a small team of filmmakers wearing many hats along with a lot of experience filming in remote locations. This allow us to stretch our budget further to explore more areas, share more mysteries & tales and give a higher production value in return (aka... a kick ass film).

Funds will be used for film production (including the 2 week river expedition to reach these legendary areas, aerial drone, night cameras and 360 VR footage), story producing, filming of the local oral histories, narration, editing, visual effects (titles, geographical maps of the journey and 3D motion graphics), sound mixing, music composition and recording of an original score (for the majority of the film), distribution, publicity, and legal costs.

The Impact

  • This project will for the first time explore the Nahanni Valley (Deadman's valley) beyond the main riverways using modern filmmaking tools such as, aerial drones, 360 cams, night cameras and other modern tech.
  • For the FIRST TIME,  local First Nations oral histories predating THOUSANDS OF YEARS will be recorded and shared to seek out the roots behind the mysteries experienced by European explorers and colonial Canadians during the 19th/20th Centuries. 

It's also important to note that our team has a successful track record filming in remote areas as well as capturing cultural histories and stories across Canada, the United States and the UK. Whether its photographing Polar Bears on the Hudson Bay Coast, filming the haunted underground habitats of Edinburgh or capturing the coast lines of Bermuda our crew has a depth of experience with different environments and cultures to capture these mysterious stories and the mind-blowing landscapes surrounding them.

Risks & Challenges

Waheela's, ghost tribes and evil spirits aside... our biggest challenge with this adventure documentary will be the risks associated with a river expedition in a remote region of the world. Wildlife such as bears, wolves, and moose will be one challenge along with white water rapids, rain, snow (it is northern Canada), sun exposure, hydration, keeping warm, and other charms of backwoods ventures will be our main challenges to manage.

To meet these challenges we have:

  • A world class film crew with experience filming in remote locations and extreme weather.
  • The best in the business guiding us with Nahanni Wild whose decades of river guiding experience in the Nahanni and wilderness first aid & swift-water rescue training will ensure we are safe.
  • Emergency communication & support for worst case scenarios such as med evacs or field rescues. 
  • Tried and tested film gear and equipment for rugged, wet and remote conditions.

We also commit to respecting the environment to protect the areas we travel through along with the local First Nations who care for this land. In our pursuit to share the Nahanni's natural wonders we commit to conserving wilderness to allow future generations to experience the wonders of intact ecosystems.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps so even a small donation can add up to a BIG difference and get this project in motion. However some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word! Please share our campaign on social media and email to other folks who you think will be interested.
  • Join our Secrets of Nahanni FB Page, Instagram & Twitter for expedition and story updates.
  • Like and share posts to help us get the word out. 

Every follower who joins us is another vote of support we can take to broadcasters and distributors to help make this documentary and expedition a reality. 

The Expedition & Filmmaking Team

There is something very primal that exploration and adventure feeds. With "Secrets of Nahanni", my hope is to capture the spirit of Nahanni, in its physical nature, reputation and through the stories of the people who first hand live the unique experiences, mysteries and natural wonders of Nahanni National Park.

  • 20+ Years International Experience: Canada, U.S., Spain & UK.
  • Certified Steadicam & Drone Operator.
  • Studied Intercultural Communications, Anthropology, Archeology & Exploration History.

  • Highlight Projects: Tartan TV (Scotland Culture TV Series), Ancient Peru Unearthed (Archeological discovery of the lost Sicán civilization) & Taste of Bermuda.

I relentlessly pursue experiences that make me feel alive. The best way to describe myself is as a Canadian Explorer, Adventure Photographer, Helly Hansen Ambassador, Contributor to Canadian Geographic, Designer and Speaker based in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. My body of photographic work spans outdoor adventure, landscapes, mountain lifestyle, and culture, yet always retains the human element. 

  • Canadian Explorer & Storyteller.
  • Adventure/Landscape Photographer, Author & TEDx Speaker.
  • Helly Hansen Ambassador.

  • Highlight Projects: Spirit Of The Badlands, Ted X Canmore, Trekking with Polar Bears & Haida Gwaii Ocean Conservation.

We are excited to have Chief Gerald Antoine on our team to share some of the Dene legends and oral histories as well as be our contact and guide with the many communities in the Nahanni region. 

  • Former Grand Cheif of Decho First Nations.
  • Dene Curator & Storyteller.
  • Worked with Parks Canada telling Nahanni Stories.

David composes original music for media, as well as for the concert hall.  His creative work ranges from computer-based synth scores, to full orchestral music.  Each of David’s scores are created in his home studio, which are either brought to life through an array of talented musicians, or through the best sounding synthesizers and samples available.

  • 20 years as a composer for film, TV & web, documentaries, theatre, and the concert hall. 
  • Associate Course Director within music production department at Full Sail University.
  • USC Graduate: Scoring For Motion Pictures & Television.
  • Highlight Projects: Annabelle Hooper and the Ghosts of Nantucket (feature film) currently on Netflix, Tales From Beyond (feature film), Haunting Villisca (feature film), Tall Ships: The Privateer Lynx (feature documentary), Reclaiming The Blade (feature documentary).

Having worked with such well known Network Broadcasters as CTV, Bravo Network, MuchMusic, TLN, CLT, Telus and others, Doug is poised to successfully produce and manage the video production and marketing involved to successfully produce and launch this documentary to an already established global audience.

  • 20+ Years Producer/Director.
  • Directed & Produced 300+ Productions for Television, Corporate & Non Profit Organizations.
  • Highlight Projects: Swingers Golf Show, Little Italys, Ted X Fort McMurray.

 

YOUR DONATION PERKS & REWARDS

FEATURED PERK

 

F.A.Q (Frequently Asked Questions)

Q. CAN I CONTRIBUTE WITHOUT SELECTING A REWARD? Yes, just click the red button located below the amount we have raised so far that says "Back It". This will take you to our list of perks, where at the top you can just enter your desired contribution amount and hit "Continue".  You can also select a perk and then when we email you to fulfill the perk selected, you can decline the perk at that time.

Q. CAN I GIVE MY CONTRIBUTION REWARDS AS A GIFT? Definitely, simply give us the alternate address you would like the gift to be sent to.

Q. CAN I CONTRIBUTE FROM OUTSIDE CANADA & USA? Yes! This is a global campaign and we will send rewards anywhere in the world. We have friends in numerous countries, so we are ready for you!
story_txt:
During the early 1900's, Willie and Frank Macleod chose to ignore the legends of spirits and devils in order to seek the stories of gold, and ventured into an area of the Nahanni called Deadman's Valley never to return. A couple years later, the remains of the Macleods were found tied to a tree with their heads cut off (and never found). This along with numerous other mysterious experiences, disapearances and deaths, has led to the Nahanni's mysterious reputation. A remote region difficult to access and rarely explored in many areas.
"Secrets of Nahanni" seeks to further investigate the legends of the Nahanni Valley through a two-week river expedition. This documentary will journey deep into the river valleys and remote mountain ranges - venturing into areas often avoided, restricted to the public and rarely explored first hand - to unearth that unknown essence beneath the surface of the Nahanni that has fuelled for centuries the tales of “something else”, while giving a sense of the natural richness and beauty of this area that has made it such a sacred and special place.
Before the river expedition begins, we will first explore deeper beyond the European stories by capturing the folklore and oral histories of the Dene, Sahtu, Métis and Decho First Nation storytellers. These local legends predate the European tales by thousands of years and hold more clues, questions and mysteries of what secrets remain hidden along the river banks and valleys of the Nahanni. 
By capturing the local First Nations stories first hand, we will create a unique experience of the Nahanni's legends by presenting them with more depth and diversity than ever before. By sharing these stories in the words of local story tellers and elders, "Secrets of Nahanni" will offer a richer, deeper exploration of Nahanni's mysteries and legends, travelling further back in time to the source of these mysterious tales. 


REMOTE LOCATION: With no roads into Nahanni Valley, it is only accessible by air and water or a long overland journey on foot. Much of the area remains unexplored, despite being declared a National Park and World Heritage Site. Few people get the opportunity to explore this remote region first hand and we want to share this experience with a POV style documentary of our expedition. 

ACCESS TO RESTRICTED AREAS: We have been granted rare access to  Class-1 restricted areas, non-accessible to the public, including Deadman's Valley where many of the legends originate and the sacred Tuffa Mounds. 
COMPLETED 6 MONTH APPROVAL PROCESS & READY TO FILM:  We are one of the few to be awarded access to film in Nahanni National Park and the first given the opportunity to record local oral histories through a 6 month process by the NaHa Consensus Team (made up of the local Dene, Sahtu & Metis First Nations representatives and Parks Canada). 

We are seeking to raise $60K to help us complete our two phases of filming. 
The FIRST PHASE of production (budgeted at around 10K) is to film and capture the local oral histories and stories of the Dene, Sahtu and Metis First Nations to capture the many legends and mysteries never before recorded. 
The SECOND PHASE of production (budgeted at around $50K) is to film our multi-week river expedition into the Nahanni. This includes our exploration along the South Nahanni River and surrounding areas like Deadman's Valley to seek out and unearth the areas related to these tales and legends. 
As a stretch goal, reaching $150K would further cover the editing (Post Production) and marketing aspects of the documentary along with additional film elements such as 360 VR content, night cameras as well as allow us to film more cinematic elements to better tell and recreate aspects of these oral histories and tales dating back centuries.
We are planning to begin our our first phase of production for Fall 2018 to capture all the legends and oral histories followed with filming the multi-week river expedition in 2019. 
Making a documentary film can be complicated and expensive. But we have a small team of filmmakers wearing many hats along with a lot of experience filming in remote locations. This allow us to stretch our budget further to explore more areas, share more mysteries & tales and give a higher production value in return (aka... a kick ass film).
Funds will be used for film production (including the 2 week river expedition to reach these legendary areas, aerial drone, night cameras and 360 VR footage), story producing, filming of the local oral histories, narration, editing, visual effects (titles, geographical maps of the journey and 3D motion graphics), sound mixing, music composition and recording of an original score (for the majority of the film), distribution, publicity, and legal costs.

The Impact

This project will for the first time explore the Nahanni Valley (Deadman's valley) beyond the main riverways using modern filmmaking tools such as, aerial drones, 360 cams, night cameras and other modern tech.
For the FIRST TIME,  local First Nations oral histories predating THOUSANDS OF YEARS will be recorded and shared to seek out the roots behind the mysteries experienced by European explorers and colonial Canadians during the 19th/20th Centuries. 

It's also important to note that our team has a successful track record filming in remote areas as well as capturing cultural histories and stories across Canada, the United States and the UK. Whether its photographing Polar Bears on the Hudson Bay Coast, filming the haunted underground habitats of Edinburgh or capturing the coast lines of Bermuda our crew has a depth of experience with different environments and cultures to capture these mysterious stories and the mind-blowing landscapes surrounding them.

Waheela's, ghost tribes and evil spirits aside... our biggest challenge with this adventure documentary will be the risks associated with a river expedition in a remote region of the world. Wildlife such as bears, wolves, and moose will be one challenge along with white water rapids, rain, snow (it is northern Canada), sun exposure, hydration, keeping warm, and other charms of backwoods ventures will be our main challenges to manage.
To meet these challenges we have:

A world class film crew with experience filming in remote locations and extreme weather.
The best in the business guiding us with Nahanni Wild whose decades of river guiding experience in the Nahanni and wilderness first aid & swift-water rescue training will ensure we are safe.
Emergency communication & support for worst case scenarios such as med evacs or field rescues. 
Tried and tested film gear and equipment for rugged, wet and remote conditions.

We also commit to respecting the environment to protect the areas we travel through along with the local First Nations who care for this land. In our pursuit to share the Nahanni's natural wonders we commit to conserving wilderness to allow future generations to experience the wonders of intact ecosystems.

Other Ways You Can Help
Every little bit helps so even a small donation can add up to a BIG difference and get this project in motion. However some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:


Spread the word! Please share our campaign on social media and email to other folks who you think will be interested.

Join our Secrets of Nahanni FB Page, Instagram & Twitter for expedition and story updates.

story:
Short Summary

I’m Mr.Sawbladehead, drummer, audio engineer, artist & fabricator. I create inspirational one of a kind functional works of art. Bold, beautiful, bad ass designs featured in homes, businesses & concert stages around the world by some of music’s biggest stars. From concept to conversation piece to “live in concert". Take a peak behind the curtain & witness the madness that is SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS. This show will be unlike anything you've ever seen before! Image American Pickers meets Counts Custom meets HGTV meets the Velocity Channel meets MTV and MTV cribs!! Help me make this reality show a reality!!                                                                                                                                                        Thank you - Mr.Sawbladehead     

                                     

What We Need & What You Get

LOOK AT THESE PERKS!!!!

$5  SAWBLADEHEAD SHOUT OUT!                                                                                                                       I’ll send a special SAWBLADEHEAD SHOUT OUT to those who contribute on my social media sites! 

$15  DVD  Mr.Sawbladehead                                                                                                                                                         This high intensity drumming promotional DVD is packed with many exciting live performances with several of the ultra talented artists I have had the pleasure of sharing the stage with! 

$20  SIGNED DRUMSTICKS & DVD   (package 1)                                                                                                           Autographed drumsticks and DVD! Let me know to whom or what you want me to write on them and I’ll do it! 

$30  SIGNED DRUMHEAD, DVD & PAIR of DRUMSTICKS   (package 2)                                                                                      Let me know to whom or what you want me to write on them and I’ll do it! Sizes may vary from 10”-16” drumhead. Includes my DVD and pair of autographed drumsticks!

$30  T-SHIRTS & DVD  (package 3)                                                                                                                      Take your pick between the retro logo in white t-shirt or lady tank or the industrial logo in black   (t-shirt only) SM-XXL

$50  "MFT" XL2                                                                                                                                                             My “Multifunctional Tool XL” and sometimes known as the “MF-ing” tool as this was my main hammering, pry bar, bending tool and back scratcher used on my LIFE TREE drum sculpture. I will personally weld your name or saying onto the MFT XL2!! Perfect gift for everyone!

$100  WALL ART (MUSIC NOTES pair)                                                                                                               “For the love of art, music & friendship” Beautifully designed steel wall art. A perfect for gift anyone’s room. Include (1) treble clef and (1) bass clef wall art. Pairs of the same note also available - please specify.

$125  AUTOGRAPHED CYMBAL                                                                                                                              Limited quantity! These are cymbals I have used and have the stage abuse to show! Autographed and perfect to hang anywhere!! Sizes vary

$250  COME HANG WITH ME IN THE SHOP FOR A DAY!                                                                               That’s right! Come on over and hang out with me in my shop. I can give you a private welding and fabricating lesson. Needed help on a project? Bring it over and let’s take of it! Wanna build something? Let’s get to it! And it includes lunch!! 

$295  “RAVEN” or  ”The Dove” custom guitar stands                                                                                    Bold, Elegant, modern designed custom guitar stand that includes 2 guitar holder mounts. One specifically for flying V guitars and the other is universal mount. Additional colors include: “The BlueJay” blue, “The Cardinal” red, “The Eagle” gold, “The Hawk” brushed metal,“The HummingBird” green or purple

$350  GUITAR STAND (single)                                                                                                                                       Get your very own custom one of kind guitar stand. Check out some of my previous designs for inspiration or let me create something unique just for YOU!

$350  BAR STOOLS                                                                                                                                                        One of my signature custom bar stools with hydraulic adjustment (with to without back rest)

$395  “TORQUE” collection  End Table                                                                                                                       Custom cut 3/8” glass on top of a beautifully composed transmission inspired base.

$400  “This on Goes to 11” Custom microphone stand                                                                                    Bold Gear-Head/Steampunk design sure to make an impact on any stage. Hide your mic cable by sliding it through the pipe or use your wireless in the custom mount! Includes a FREE SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS TEE 

$525  “Injection” Custom microphone stand                                                          Inject some BAD ASS-NESS into your stage show! Perfect for that singer who wants a killer stage prop but then can take off the mini boom arm to walk around the stage with!! Includes a FREE SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS TEE and $50 coupon off your next SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS.

$575  TRIPLE GUITAR STAND                                                                                                                                    Get your very own custom one of kind triple guitar stand. Check out some of my previous designs for inspiration or let me create something unique just for YOU! 

$775  “AUTO-TUNE” Custom Microphone stand                                                                                          “AUTO-TUNE” sturdy custom boom microphone stand that breaks down into 2 pieces for easy transport. One of kind and this screams it LOUD & PROUD! Includes a FREE SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS TEE and $75 coupon off your next SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS.

$995 “DEADLY” Custom microphone stand                                                                                                        This custom microphone stand is so strikingly beautiful it’s DEADLY! Hand sculpted and perfect for any vocalist. Definitely will stimulate your senses! Includes a FREE SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS TEE and $100 coupon off your next SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS.

$1000  BE IN AN EPISODE                                                                                                                                       That’s right! You signed up for it! You could be assisting me in the shop, digging through a scrap yard, pushing a broom wearing a super hero costume…who knows!! Includes special VIP package: DVD, tee shirt, signed drumsticks, drumhead, cymbal and a piece from the actual build of my LIFE TREE drum sculpture.

$3500.00  The “SPACESHIP” custom drum rack                                                                                                 My personal drum rack I used for years in numerous bands including the heavy progressive metal band,KURAI. The SPACESHIP has landed and is ready to conquer and devour! Disassembles into 10 pieces and my drum tech and I have set this monster up from offstage to onstage in 6 minutes!! Includes a FREE SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS TEE and $100 coupon off your next SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS.

$9995.00  “From NY to Paris” Dining room/conference set                                                                                     This was inspired by my travels to New York City and being surrounded by the ironwork landscape. This handcrafted steel dining room table disassembles into 3 main pieces and includes a tinted tempered glass top and (4) matching custom chairs with industrial casters. Your choice of fabrics: leather, suede, cotton blends. Ship anywhere within the US and I’ll be there help set it up and toast to your very own SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS! 

Please see the video link to check out the perk images or contact me for additional information.  

 

The Impact

  My show concept has been worked on, tweaked, revised and streamlined for the past 4 years and I am more than confident in its success due to the input I have been given by TV producers, production company executives, my TV production consultant and the numerous "A" list artists that want to be on an episode. My show is unlike anything as it is a combination of several hit TV reality shows like: American Pickers, Counts Customs,The Velocity Channel, HGTV, MTV and MTV Cribs as I take you on a journey through the process of inspiration, design, fabrication and finally how it becomes one with its owner. As a second generation skilled tradesman, it is vital to continue to pass along what my dad has taught me and I plan on doing this by bringing the show on the road to various stores such as Maynards, Home Depot, Lowes etc and set up welding and fabricating seminars to boost the skilled trades industry. I have some special surprises during these events as I plan on having some of my designs on hand as well as one of my many SAWBLADEHEAD artists to stop by for a musical performance. What I have created for myself and others is proof of what I can do and with the proper resources, I can continue to create bolder, more beautiful, empowering, inspiring and functional artwork that will be my legacy for generations. 

 

Risks & Challenges

 I have absolutely no doubt in my mind that come hell or high water I will complete this pilot. If I don't raise enough money, it will take me longer to complete the pilot as I will have to do all my own video production as well as create and fabricate a design specifically for the artist. I created my largest and internationally known creation, my LIFE TREE drum sculpture out of scrap metal with minimal tools and absolutely NO torches or forging, outside in my backyard in the intense Florida heat! I have numerous artist that want my designs from a custom microphone stand to a full drum sculpture or possibly an office desk to a full custom bar and bar stools. The funds raised will dictate how BIG my creation will be but whatever I create, it will be EPIC!!

  • Where the funds go if I don't reach the entire goal.
  • In the event that I do not reach my goal, I do have (2) back up plan options.                                    Depending on the amount of funds raised, the majority of the budget will go towards production expenses which includes but not limited to: video preproduction, location permits or rental if needed,filming, editing, post production, misc production expense and project material expense.
  • option (1) If I receive 60-90% of my goal, the majority of this budget will go towards video production and the remaining funds will have to cover the project materials.
  • option (2) If I receive less than 60% of my goal then I have the ability to barter with local video production companies and create something personal for them or possibly something for their company while the limited funds raised will go towards the project materials. Who knows, maybe they'll be featured on a episode!! But either way, it will take me longer to complete this pilot episode but IT WILL GET DONE!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 Spreading the word will have a major impact on the success of this series, so please share the indiegogo link and "like"and share the links below. However, the more money that is raised will not only assist in creating a one of a kind work of art, but will also give inspiration and empowerment to the artist and everyone that gazes upon it! So tell your friends, family, coworkers, band mates, and anyone that wishes to be apart of this journey with me!

  • https://www.facebook.com/Mr-Sawbladehead
  • https://www.youtube.com/mrsawbladehead
story_txt:
Short Summary
I’m Mr.Sawbladehead, drummer, audio engineer, artist & fabricator. I create inspirational one of a kind functional works of art. Bold, beautiful, bad ass designs featured in homes, businesses & concert stages around the world by some of music’s biggest stars. From concept to conversation piece to “live in concert". Take a peak behind the curtain & witness the madness that is SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS. This show will be unlike anything you've ever seen before! Image American Pickers meets Counts Custom meets HGTV meets the Velocity Channel meets MTV and MTV cribs!! Help me make this reality show a reality!!                                                                                                                                                        Thank you - Mr.Sawbladehead     
                                     

What We Need & What You Get
LOOK AT THESE PERKS!!!!
$5  SAWBLADEHEAD SHOUT OUT!                                                                                                                       I’ll send a special SAWBLADEHEAD SHOUT OUT to those who contribute on my social media sites! 
$15  DVD  Mr.Sawbladehead                                                                                                                                                         This high intensity drumming promotional DVD is packed with many exciting live performances with several of the ultra talented artists I have had the pleasure of sharing the stage with! 
$20  SIGNED DRUMSTICKS & DVD   (package 1)                                                                                                           Autographed drumsticks and DVD! Let me know to whom or what you want me to write on them and I’ll do it! 
$30  SIGNED DRUMHEAD, DVD & PAIR of DRUMSTICKS   (package 2)                                                                                      Let me know to whom or what you want me to write on them and I’ll do it! Sizes may vary from 10”-16” drumhead. Includes my DVD and pair of autographed drumsticks!
$30  T-SHIRTS & DVD  (package 3)                                                                                                                      Take your pick between the retro logo in white t-shirt or lady tank or the industrial logo in black   (t-shirt only) SM-XXL
$50  "MFT" XL2                                                                                                                                                             My “Multifunctional Tool XL” and sometimes known as the “MF-ing” tool as this was my main hammering, pry bar, bending tool and back scratcher used on my LIFE TREE drum sculpture. I will personally weld your name or saying onto the MFT XL2!! Perfect gift for everyone!
$100  WALL ART (MUSIC NOTES pair)                                                                                                               “For the love of art, music & friendship” Beautifully designed steel wall art. A perfect for gift anyone’s room. Include (1) treble clef and (1) bass clef wall art. Pairs of the same note also available - please specify.
$125  AUTOGRAPHED CYMBAL                                                                                                                              Limited quantity! These are cymbals I have used and have the stage abuse to show! Autographed and perfect to hang anywhere!! Sizes vary
$250  COME HANG WITH ME IN THE SHOP FOR A DAY!                                                                               That’s right! Come on over and hang out with me in my shop. I can give you a private welding and fabricating lesson. Needed help on a project? Bring it over and let’s take of it! Wanna build something? Let’s get to it! And it includes lunch!! 
$295  “RAVEN” or  ”The Dove” custom guitar stands                                                                                    Bold, Elegant, modern designed custom guitar stand that includes 2 guitar holder mounts. One specifically for flying V guitars and the other is universal mount. Additional colors include: “The BlueJay” blue, “The Cardinal” red, “The Eagle” gold, “The Hawk” brushed metal,“The HummingBird” green or purple
$350  GUITAR STAND (single)                                                                                                                                       Get your very own custom one of kind guitar stand. Check out some of my previous designs for inspiration or let me create something unique just for YOU!
$350  BAR STOOLS                                                                                                                                                        One of my signature custom bar stools with hydraulic adjustment (with to without back rest)
$395  “TORQUE” collection  End Table                                                                                                                       Custom cut 3/8” glass on top of a beautifully composed transmission inspired base.
$400  “This on Goes to 11” Custom microphone stand                                                                                    Bold Gear-Head/Steampunk design sure to make an impact on any stage. Hide your mic cable by sliding it through the pipe or use your wireless in the custom mount! Includes a FREE SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS TEE 
$525  “Injection” Custom microphone stand                                                          Inject some BAD ASS-NESS into your stage show! Perfect for that singer who wants a killer stage prop but then can take off the mini boom arm to walk around the stage with!! Includes a FREE SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS TEE and $50 coupon off your next SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS.
$575  TRIPLE GUITAR STAND                                                                                                                                    Get your very own custom one of kind triple guitar stand. Check out some of my previous designs for inspiration or let me create something unique just for YOU! 
$775  “AUTO-TUNE” Custom Microphone stand                                                                                          “AUTO-TUNE” sturdy custom boom microphone stand that breaks down into 2 pieces for easy transport. One of kind and this screams it LOUD & PROUD! Includes a FREE SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS TEE and $75 coupon off your next SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS.
$995 “DEADLY” Custom microphone stand                                                                                                        This custom microphone stand is so strikingly beautiful it’s DEADLY! Hand sculpted and perfect for any vocalist. Definitely will stimulate your senses! Includes a FREE SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS TEE and $100 coupon off your next SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS.
$1000  BE IN AN EPISODE                                                                                                                                       That’s right! You signed up for it! You could be assisting me in the shop, digging through a scrap yard, pushing a broom wearing a super hero costume…who knows!! Includes special VIP package: DVD, tee shirt, signed drumsticks, drumhead, cymbal and a piece from the actual build of my LIFE TREE drum sculpture.
$3500.00  The “SPACESHIP” custom drum rack                                                                                                 My personal drum rack I used for years in numerous bands including the heavy progressive metal band,KURAI. The SPACESHIP has landed and is ready to conquer and devour! Disassembles into 10 pieces and my drum tech and I have set this monster up from offstage to onstage in 6 minutes!! Includes a FREE SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS TEE and $100 coupon off your next SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS.
$9995.00  “From NY to Paris” Dining room/conference set                                                                                     This was inspired by my travels to New York City and being surrounded by the ironwork landscape. This handcrafted steel dining room table disassembles into 3 main pieces and includes a tinted tempered glass top and (4) matching custom chairs with industrial casters. Your choice of fabrics: leather, suede, cotton blends. Ship anywhere within the US and I’ll be there help set it up and toast to your very own SAWBLADEHEAD DESIGNS! 
Please see the video link to check out the perk images or contact me for additional information.  

 
The Impact
  My show concept has been worked on, tweaked, revised and streamlined for the past 4 years and I am more than confident in its success due to the input I have been given by TV producers, production company executives, my TV production consultant and the numerous "A" list artists that want to be on an episode. My show is unlike anything as it is a combination of several hit TV reality shows like: American Pickers, Counts Customs,The Velocity Channel, HGTV, MTV and MTV Cribs as I take you on a journey through the process of inspiration, design, fabrication and finally how it becomes one with its owner. As a second generation skilled tradesman, it is vital to continue to pass along what my dad has taught me and I plan on doing this by bringing the show on the road to various stores such as Maynards, Home Depot, Lowes etc and set up welding and fabricating seminars to boost the skilled trades industry. I have some special surprises during these events as I plan on having some of my designs on hand as well as one of my many SAWBLADEHEAD artists to stop by for a musical performance. What I have created for myself and others is proof of what I can do and with the proper resources, I can continue to create bolder, more beautiful, empowering, inspiring and functional artwork that will be my legacy for generations.

story:
What’s It All About?

 

When Dining With Diplomats host Michael Astor was growing up, eating at friends’ houses usually involved strange foods and listening in on family chatter in languages he didn’t understand. A UN school student, he was the kind of kid who would use his subway pass to check out different ethnic enclaves around town just to sample the city’s different cultures _ mostly in the form of food. This is just one of the many things that makes him the perfect ambassador to an off-the-beaten path New York that few know and fewer visit.

A former-foreign correspondent and editor with the Associated Press, Astor’s last assignment had him covering the United Nations where he found himself more interested in the dining habits of diplomats than in the often-dry workings of international diplomacy. With 193 nations represented at the UN, New York is home to more foreign cuisines than any other world capital. So, when he got caught up in a round of corporate downsizing, rather than look for another job in the rapidly shrinking field of print journalism, he thought he would try something a little more bold and take those diplomats out to eat.

Each episode of Dining with Diplomats begins by meeting the diplomat at their consulate or UN mission. We travel with them to the restaurant, where we meet the chef and enjoy a typical meal while discussing what’s unique and interesting about the country’s food as well as the challenges in achieving authentic flavors far from home. During the meal, we learn about more than just food, we learn about the diplomat’s country, the neighborhood around the restaurant and the people who live there. In this way, the show provides a taste of the international community that surrounds us and opens up the city’s neighborhoods as foreign destinations.

With a dash of humor and a sprinkling of fascinating insights, the show not only celebrates eating but also our interconnectedness as a city, country and planet.

Dining with Diplomats speaks to New York visitors, citizens, and food adventurers on the hunt for the real deal. The show provides a stamp of authenticity to local restaurants and opens up the city’s neighborhoods to viewers and urban explorers. 

We are seeking $50,000 to fund ten 7-1/2 minute episodes in order to create buzz, raise awareness of our brand and allow us to raise money for further episodes. One of the episodes will also be the basis of a pilot for a full 22-minute TV program to be pitch to cable channels.

 

Impact

 

When you support Dining With Diplomats, you’re joining in on much more than just a food adventure. The show promotes world peace without prodding or lecturing but rather by celebrating diversity and all the different cultures that contribute to the New York's rich mosaic. It also throws a rare spotlight on the local diplomatic community _ who at the end of the day are here to resolve problems through discussion. That celebrating these values could even vaguely be construed as political at the present moment, demonstrates why the show is more necessary than ever.

The Team

 

 

You couldn't hope for a nicer bunch of people.

 

Michael Astor

 

A native New Yorker and graduate of the United Nations International School, Michael studied theater at Vassar College and for a time produced and directed experimental theater Off-off Broadway. He later worked as a DJ and ran underground night clubs in Williamsburg and the East Village. In 1994, he moved to Rio de Janeiro where he worked as correspondent for Colors Magazine, Time, Dow Jones News Wires and the Associate Press. While living in Brazil, he founded the ACIE Premio de Cinema, Brazil’s version of the Golden Globe awards.

 

 

 

Andres Diaz - Editing, Animation and Camera

 

 

 Andres is a filmmaker and video editor from Medellin, Colombia. Before immigrating to New York in 2017, Diaz ran his own production company making music videos for local musicians. His background in editing and animation has strengthened the visual appeal of Dining with Diplomats with creative graphic sequences and explainers.

 

Catherine Warren, Camera

 

Cat is a griot for the social media era. She produces and stars in number of programs under The Kitty Rose Lifestyle brand. Cat’s inquisitive camera style gives the show an extra edge and she sometimes enters into the frame to ask questions, contributing an important African American voice to reflect on what New York a truly global city.

 

 

What We Need 

 

We have learned to make these episodes relatively cheaply, _mostly by calling in favors and barter. But it’s good to pay people and the money will also allow us to produce more professional looking video with better sound. 

We believe that $50,000 should be enough to wrap up the first 10 episodes. If we exceed our goal that money will be directed toward further improving production values and producing additional episodes. One of these episodes will also be expanded to serve as a full 22-minute pilot that we will use in an effort to attract additional funding for a more traditional TV series.

 

 

Our Strategy

 

We have already shot and are currently editing episodes with the Guatemalan Consul General Rosemary Arauz and Hungarian Consul General Ferenc Kumin. We have several more diplomats already lined-up for the coming weeks.

Our plan is to film all the episodes over the summer, releasing quirky 30 second to one-minute-long teasers on social media every few days, to build up anticipation for the show's release in Fall 2018 on the Internet and on local community cable.  

We will also devote a significant portion of funds raised to promoting the show on social media and growth hacking in an effort to attract the highly valued millennial foodie demographic. We also intend to target people interested in travel and international affairs. 

We expect to gain a large following in international markets as each country promotes its own appearance to the local community and abroad. We will work with the consulates to translate the programs for the home audience. We also plan to make use of our contacts at the UN and the diplomatic press corps to generate coverage of the show on traditional media and Twitter.

We plan to pitch Dining with Diplomats to TV channels like Food Network, Travel Channel, Netflix, Amazon and Al-Jazeera. While our ultimate goal would be to have a half-hour-long version on cable TV, we believe Dining With Diplomats has the potential to make money on the web as more and more viewers flee traditional media. We are also looking at less traditional forms of funding by trying to interest food delivery services like Seamless and other food related enterprises. We are also exploring funding possibilities with the countries featured on the program.

Dining with Diplomats has it’s own edgy style that blends elements of TV news reporting and YouTube vlogging with custom animation to appeal to shorter attention spans and younger viewers. The show is designed to be easily cut up into short bits that can be promoted on social media to build brand recognition among those who may not have the time to watch a full episode.

For more examples of our work check out (and please subscribe to) our YouTube channel at: https://bit.ly/2G5Dmjz 

 

Risks & Challenges

 

We’ve already begun shooting episodes and, so far, have five Consul Generals committed to participating but self-funding should run out around the time this campaign ends which could shelve the project indefinitely if we do not meet our goal. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You know the only thing harder than making great video is getting people to watch it. If you like our project or enjoyed any of our earlier webisodes let people know about it. Share it on all your social media, subscribe to our YouTube page and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Able Archer is a co-operative of actors, directors and filmmakers who embrace the silly and ridiculous aspects of the world and channel them into comedic films and projects. We endeavour to give people who haven't had the opportunity to make work to do so. This is the company’s first foray into an episodic series.

After Brexit and Trump, people were saying you can’t do satire anymore. That seemed really wrong to us, because we could all do with a laugh right now. Leaver or remainer, you have to admit the whole process is so farcical on a daily basis that it begs to be satirised.

The big challenge for us is referencing real events and keeping it current. When things change so fast, we have to write ahead of events and hope we were right after the fact. So far, we often have been!

In late 2017, we created three 20-minute episodes on a beg, borrow and steal budget to test the waters, and we’ve been blown away by the positive response and requests for more episodes. Now we need your support to make them.

Haven't seen Episodes 1-3? Watch them here:

 
 

We are asking for the budget for seven more episodes. Can Clive and his team save the country from "No Deal"? Will Hugo learn how to run the department? Will Brexit happen at all? We managed to make our first three episodes for about £500 each, but that was without paying the contributors. We want to pay our actors and crew a nominal fee. They have given their time and considerable skill, and they deserve to be paid.

The Numbers

(Unlike the Government, we have a financial impact report.)

Going forward, we have budgeted £1,500 per episode.  As before, we have allowed £500 for production costs. This breaks down as follows (per episode):

Actor Travel Expenses - 2.7%

Audition Costs - 0.7%

Catering - 1.7%

Equipment -  1.3%

Location Hire - 20.7%

Logistics (Transport of equipment) - 1.7%

Promotions (Twitter/Facebook) - 1.3%

Props - 2%

Set Dressing - 1.3%

Actor & Crew Fees - 66.7%*

*This is the lion's share of the budget, but bear in mind this works out as no more than £50 per shoot day for each person involved!

Those of you paying attention will note that £1,500 for 7 episodes only makes £10,500, so where does the other £1,500 go? Simple. To pay for the perks and Indiegogo's fee.

Meet The Team

 

The Impact

Able Archer and Negotiations have gone from strength to strength, but we cannot afford to keep funding Negotiations from our own pocket. Since we have a had such a great response to the first three episodes, we’re asking you to help. If everyone who watched an episode of Negotiations gave us £3, we would smash our target. That's the cost of a coffee.

Can we do it?

We have a fantastic team on board, both in front of and behind the camera. Coming from a background of short film-making, we cut our teeth on the unique challenges of a series by making three episodes with almost no resources.  We've proved we can do it, and we want to give you more. Our biggest challenge is current events. We don't know what will happen next, but with your help, we can finish the story. 

Other ways you can help

If you can’t contribute financially, there are other ways you can help us that would be equally amazing!

  • Share our Indiegogo campaign on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.
  • Retweet our posts about Negotiations from our @teamablearcher Twitter page
  • Tell 10 of your friends about the project. Get them to watch it and tell their friends.
  • Subscribe to our YouTube channel, follow us on social media, and share, share, share. Did we mention share? SHARE. You at the back there, thinking you can’t make a difference? You CAN.

Resources:

Coffee Picture, Courtesy of Navin (novemberkilo) https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0/
story_txt:
Able Archer is a co-operative of actors, directors and filmmakers who embrace the silly and ridiculous aspects of the world and channel them into comedic films and projects. We endeavour to give people who haven't had the opportunity to make work to do so. This is the company’s first foray into an episodic series.


After Brexit and Trump, people were saying you can’t do satire anymore. That seemed really wrong to us, because we could all do with a laugh right now. Leaver or remainer, you have to admit the whole process is so farcical on a daily basis that it begs to be satirised.
The big challenge for us is referencing real events and keeping it current. When things change so fast, we have to write ahead of events and hope we were right after the fact. So far, we often have been!
